Sense.DEF: the 20th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第二十个字母

Sense.DEF: perfectly or exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: That dress suits you to a T .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条连衣裙你穿正合身。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=tonne or 或 tonnes 公吨
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=ton or 或 tons 英吨﹔美吨

Sense.DEF: thank you

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=Territorial Army〔英国〕本土防卫义勇军
the abbreviation of 缩写=teaching assistant教师助理﹔助教

Sense.DEF:
a
tab key
an amount of money that you owe, or a record of an amount of money that you owe
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tab for the campaign was nearly $500 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活动的费用将近5亿美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll put it on your tab and you can pay tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把它记在你账上﹐你可以明天付钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran up a $4,000 tab in long-distance calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打了4,000美元的长途电话。

Sense.DEF: to pay for something, especially when it is not your responsibility to pay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taxpayers will pick up the tab for the stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税人将承担建造体育馆的费用。

Subsense.DEF: a small piece of metal that you pull to open a can of drink
a small piece of metal, plastic, or paper that you pull to open something
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于开启某物的金属﹑塑料或纸制的〕拉片﹐拉手

Sense.DEF: a small piece of paper, cloth, plastic etc that sticks out from the edge of something, so that you can find it more easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔凸出于某物边缘﹑方便查找的〕标签﹐检索凸舌
Sense.EXAMPLE: an index tab labeled ‘Expenses’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标着“支出”字样的检索标签

Sense.DEF:
a small piece of sticky plastic with a date on it that you put on your car’s
license plate
in the US to show that the car is legally allowed on the road
Sense.TRAN: 〔在美国允许车辆合法上路的〕车牌标贴

Sense.DEF: to watch someone or something carefully to check what they are doing
Sense.TRAN: 密切注意某人/某事物﹐监视某人的一举一动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have been keeping tabs on Rogers since he got out of prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从罗杰斯出狱以来﹐警察一直在严密监视他。

Sense.DEF:
a form of the illegal drug
lsd
or
ecstasy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tab of acid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片迷幻药

Sense.DEF: a cigarette

to press the
tab key
on a computer or
typewriter
a piece of clothing that covers your chest and back and has no sleeves, worn over a shirt or jacket
Sense.TRAN: 〔遮住胸背部﹐穿在衬衫或夹克外面的〕无袖外套

Sense.DEF:
a very spicy red sauce made from
chilli
peppers
a cat with light and dark lines on its fur
Sense.TRAN: （虎）斑猫〔毛皮上有深浅条纹的一种猫〕

Sense.DEF:
a church or other building used by some Christian groups as a place of
worship
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些基督教派的〕教堂﹐礼拜堂

Sense.DEF: a box in which holy bread and wine are kept in Catholic churches
Sense.TRAN: 〔天主堂里存放圣餐饼和葡萄酒的〕圣体柜

Sense.DEF: the small tent in which the ancient Jews kept their most holy objects
Sense.TRAN: 〔古代犹太人存放圣物的〕圣幕﹐会幕

Sense.DEF:
a button on a computer or
typewriter
that you press in order to move forward to a particular place on a line of writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机或打字机的〕制表键﹐跳格键

Sense.DEF: a pair of small drums that are played with the hands, and that are used especially in Indian music
Sense.TRAN: 塔不拉双鼓〔用手打击的一对成套的小手鼓﹐尤在印度音乐中使用〕

PIC.HEADING: TABLES 桌子，台子
PIC.PICCONTENT: desk 办公桌﹐书桌；dining table 餐桌；pool table〔落袋式〕台球桌；coffee table 咖啡桌；patio/garden table 户外桌；bedside table 床头柜；trestle table BrE【英】搁板桌；dressing table/vanity table AmE【美】梳妆台；workbench 工作台；picnic table 野餐桌

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture with a flat top supported by legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was served on long tables.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物放在长餐桌上供应。

Sense.DEF: a table for people to eat at in a restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve booked a table for two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我订好了一张两人桌。

Sense.DEF: a special table for playing a particular indoor sport or game on
Sense.TRAN: 斯诺克球桌/台球桌/乒乓球桌等

Sense.DEF: a list of numbers, facts, or information arranged in rows across and down a page

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a table of results
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成绩表
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the table of contents
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目录

Sense.DEF: an offer, idea etc that is on the table has been officially suggested and someone is considering it
Sense.TRAN: 〔提议﹑想法等〕正式提交考虑﹐被摆到桌面上
Sense.EXAMPLE: The offer on the table is a 10% wage increase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前提出的工资方案加薪10%。

Sense.DEF: to change a situation completely, so that someone loses an advantage and you gain one
Sense.TRAN: 转弱为强﹐反败为胜﹔扭转形势压倒（某人）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tables were turned in the second half, when Leeds United scored from the penalty spot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半场时利兹联队罚点球得分﹐场上局势发生了逆转。

Sense.DEF: money that is paid under the table is paid secretly and illegally
Sense.EXAMPLE: Payments were made under the table to local officials.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给当地官员偷偷塞了钱。

Sense.DEF: a list that young children learn, in which all the numbers between 1 and 12 are multiplied by each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s 12 years old and still doesn’t know his three times table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他12岁了﹐却还不会背3的乘法口诀。

Sense.DEF: the group of people sitting around a table
Sense.EXAMPLE: His stories kept the whole table amused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的故事把一桌子的人都逗乐了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: put knives, forks etc on a table before a meal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The table was set for fourteen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子上摆放了14人的餐具。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take plates etc off
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you want me to clear the table?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要我来收拾餐桌吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was sitting at a corner table.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在角落的一张桌子前。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 从餐桌边起身/离开餐桌

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a restaurant

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Will you clear the breakfast table?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你收拾一下早餐桌好吗？

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 床头柜/厨房餐桌/饭厅餐桌

Sense.DEF: to formally present a proposal etc for other people to discuss
Sense.TRAN: 提交议案/问题/动议等〔供讨论〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Clark tabled a motion for debate at next month’s committee meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉克博士提出一项动议﹐在次月的委员会会议上辩论。

Sense.DEF: to leave a bill etc to be discussed or dealt with in the future
Sense.TRAN: 搁置法案/措施/议案等〔留待日后处理〕

Sense.DEF: a group of people shown in a work of art
a group of people arranged on stage like a picture
Sense.TRAN: 舞台造型〔由一群人在舞台上塑造的静态画面〕

Sense.DEF: something you see that looks like a picture, especially a group of people who are not moving or speaking
Sense.TRAN: 静态画面﹐静态场景〔尤指人群静止或静默的场景〕

Sense.DEF: a cloth used for covering a table

dancing with sexy movements that is performed close to a customer’s table in a restaurant or
nightclub
Sense.TRAN: 桌边舞〔饭店或夜总会中在客人桌边表演的一种色情舞蹈〕

Sense.DEF: a meal served in a restaurant at a fixed price, with a limited number of dishes you can choose from

a game played on a special table by two players or teams. You score goals by moving rows of model football players from side to side so that they can kick the ball, using handles attached to the players.
a small electric lamp that you put on a table or other piece of furniture
a large area of high flat land

all the cloths used during a meal, such as
napkins
and tablecloths
Sense.TRAN: 餐桌用布〔如餐巾﹑台布等〕

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone eats their food – used when considering how socially acceptable it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their children have very good table manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的孩子进餐礼仪很好。

Sense.DEF: a small board or piece of cloth that you put under a hot dish or plate to protect the table
a large spoon used for serving food
the amount that a tablespoon can hold, used as a unit for measuring food or liquid in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 一汤匙之量﹐一大调羹之量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two tablespoons of flour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两汤匙面粉

Sense.DEF: a small round hard piece of medicine which you swallow
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took a couple of headache tablets .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃了几片头痛药。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 维生素片/安眠药片/消化片等

Sense.DEF:
a small hard piece of a substance, especially one that
dissolves
in water
Sense.EXAMPLE: water purification tablets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 净水丸

Sense.DEF:
a flat piece of stone or clay with words cut into it, for example above someone’s
grave

Sense.LEXUNIT: be written/set/cast in tablets of stone
Sense.DEF: used to say that something does not change
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme should not be set in tablets of stone, but improved continuously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此方案不应固定不变﹐而应不断改进。

Sense.DEF: a set of pieces of paper for writing on that are glued together at the top
an indoor game played on a table by two or four players who hit a small plastic ball to each other across a net

a small
experiment
which helps scientists to guess what might happen on a much larger scale
Sense.TRAN: 桌面实验﹐模拟实验〔帮助科学家推测大规模实验结果的小型实验〕

Sense.DEF: the plates, glasses, knives etc used when eating a meal
a fairly cheap wine
a newspaper that has small pages, a lot of photographs, and stories mainly about sex, famous people etc rather than serious news
a taboo subject, word, activity etc is one that people avoid because it is extremely offensive or embarrassing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rape is a taboo subject .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强奸是忌讳的话题。

Sense.DEF: not accepted as socially correct
Sense.TRAN: 忌讳的﹐为社会习俗所不容的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s taboo to date a man a lot younger than you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和一个比自己年轻许多的男人约会是社会禁忌。

Sense.DEF: too holy or evil to be touched or used
Sense.TRAN: 〔因太神圣或太邪恶而〕禁止接触的﹐禁止使用的

Sense.DEF: a custom that says you must avoid a particular activity or subject, either because it is considered offensive or because your religion does not allow it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are taboos against appearing naked in public places.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公共场所赤身露体是犯禁忌的。

Sense.DEF:
a small
drum
, played with one hand, used especially in the
middle ages
Sense.TRAN: 小鼓〔尤在中世纪使用的一种单手敲打的小鼓〕

Sense.DEF:
arranged in rows across and down a page, in the form of a
table
your mind in its original state, before you have learned anything
Sense.TRAN: 心灵白板〔未曾学习任何东西之前的心灵原始状态〕

Sense.DEF: to arrange figures or information together in a set or a list, so that they can be easily compared
Sense.TRAN: 把…制成表格﹔以表格形式排列〔数字﹑资料等〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment for recording the speed of a vehicle, the distance it has travelled etc
a piece of equipment used to measure the speed at which the engine of a vehicle turns
tacit agreement, approval, support etc is given without anything actually being said
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tacit agreement between the three big companies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三家大公司之间的默契

Sense.DEF: speaking very little, so that you seem unfriendly
Sense.TRAN: 沉默寡言的﹐不苟言笑的

Sense.DEF: a small nail with a sharp point and a flat top
a short pin with a large round flat top, for attaching notices to boards, walls etc
the way you deal with a particular situation or a method that you use to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If that doesn’t work, we’ll try a different tack .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果那样不行﹐我们将试试别的方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rudy changed tack , his tone suddenly becoming friendly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁迪改变策略﹐语气突然变得友好起来。

Subsense.DEF: the direction that a sailing boat moves, depending on the direction of the wind and the position of its sails
Subsense.TRAN: 〔船只由风向和帆的位置决定的〕航行方向

Subsense.DEF: the action of changing the direction of a sailing boat, or the distance it travels between these changes
Subsense.TRAN: 〔帆船的〕迎风转向﹐抢风调向﹔抢风航程
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a long tack into the bay
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢风进港的一长段航程

Sense.DEF:
the equipment you need for riding a horse, such as a
saddle
etc
a long loose stitch used for fastening pieces of cloth together before sewing them
ugly cheap objects sold as decorations
Sense.EXAMPLE: souvenir shops full of tack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全是劣质小饰品的纪念品商店

Sense.DEF: to attach something to a wall, board etc, using a tack

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A handwritten note was tacked to the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张手写便条钉在墙上。

Sense.DEF: to change the course of a sailing ship so that the wind blows against its sails from the opposite direction
to fasten pieces of cloth together with long loose stitches, before sewing them
to add something new to something that is already complete, especially in a way that looks wrong or spoils the original thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful old house with a hideous modern extension tacked on at the back
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面加建了一个丑陋的现代建筑物的漂亮老房子

Sense.DEF: to try to deal with a difficult problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took twelve fire engines to tackle the blaze .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出动了12辆消防车来扑救那场大火。

Subsense.DEF:
to try to take the ball away from an opponent in a game such as football or
hockey
Subsense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑曲棍球等〕抢断﹐抢截﹐铲断

Subsense.DEF:
to force someone to the ground so that they stop running, in a game such as American football or
rugby
Subsense.TRAN: 〔美式或英式橄榄球比赛中〕拦截﹐擒抱

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone in order to deal with a difficult problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了解决难题〕与…商谈﹐与…交涉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When I tackled Susan about it, she admitted she’d made a mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找苏珊谈了这事﹐她承认是她弄错了。

Sense.DEF: to start fighting someone, especially a criminal
Sense.EXAMPLE: I certainly couldn’t tackle both of them on my own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光我一个人当然对付不了他们两个。

Subsense.DEF: an attempt to take the ball from an opponent in a game such as football
Subsense.TRAN: 〔足球等中的〕抢断球﹐抢截得球

Subsense.DEF:
an attempt to stop an opponent by forcing them to the ground, especially in American football or
rugby
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指美式或英式橄榄球中的〕拦截﹐擒抱

Sense.DEF: a player in American football who stops other players by tackling them or preventing them from moving forward
the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

ropes and
pulleys wheels
used for lifting heavy things
a man’s sexual organs
if something is tacky, it looks cheap or badly made, and shows poor taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: tacky ornaments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗制滥造的饰品

Sense.DEF: showing that you do not have good judgment about what is socially acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s kind of tacky to give her a present that someone else gave you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把别人给你的礼物送给她﹐这有点不好。

Sense.DEF: slightly sticky
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paint’s still slightly tacky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆还有些黏。

Sense.DEF:
a type of Mexican food made from a corn
tortilla
that is folded in half and filled with meat, beans etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用肉﹑豆子等作馅的〕墨西哥玉米薄饼卷

Sense.DEF: the ability to be careful about what you say or do, so that you do not upset or embarrass other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: With great tact, Clive persuaded her to apologize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫十分巧妙地说服了她去道歉。

Sense.DEF: not likely to upset or embarrass other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no tactful way of phrasing what he wanted to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有办法婉转地表达他想说的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tactful man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个圆通的人

Sense.DEF: a method that you use to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tactic employed to speed up the peace process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为加速和平进程而采取的策略
Sense.EXAMPLE: Republicans accuse Democrats of using delaying tactics something you do in order to give yourself more time to prevent a final vote on the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党指责民主党采取拖延战术来阻止议案的最终票决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shock tactics are being used in an attempt to stop drink drivers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在采取“震慑策略”来制止司机酒后驾车。

Sense.DEF: the science of arranging and moving military forces in a battle
relating to what you do to achieve what you want, especially as part of a game or large plan
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two players were substituted for tactical reasons .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名球员因战术需要被替换下场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tactical decision to send in troops
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 派遣军队的战略决定

GramExa.GLOSS: a mistake that will harm your plans later

Sense.DEF:
a
missile
that is sent a short distance in military battle
relating to the way military forces are arranged in a battle
the practice of voting for a political party that you do not support in order to prevent another party from winning an election
Sense.TRAN: 策略性投票〔把票投给自己并不支持的政党以防止另一政党当选的做法〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who is very good at
tactics
relating to your sense of touch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 触觉

Sense.DEF: a tactile person likes to touch people, for example when talking to them
Sense.TRAN: 〔和人谈话等的时候〕爱碰触他人的

Sense.DEF: likely to upset or embarrass someone without intending to
Sense.TRAN: 不乖巧的﹐不圆通的﹐言行不得体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought it would be tactless to ask about her divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为问她离婚的事不太明智。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s one of the most tactless people I’ve ever met.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我见过的最不通世故的人之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tactless remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得体的话

Subsense.DEF: a small amount
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like some milk?’ ‘Just a tad.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要来点牛奶吗？”“就一点点。”

Subsense.DEF: slightly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s a tad expensive.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这有点贵。

Sense.DEF:
a small creature that has a long tail, lives in water, and grows into a
frog
or
toad
a style of fighting from Korea, and also a sport, in which you kick and hit but do not use weapons

a shiny stiff cloth made from silk or
nylon
an offensive word for someone from Wales
Sense.TRAN: 威尔士佬〔对威尔士人的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of soft
chewy
sweet
a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the staff wore name tags.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有员工都佩戴姓名牌。

Sense.DEF: a children’s game in which one player chases and tries to touch the others
a piece of equipment that you attach to an animal or person, especially someone who has just left prison, so that you always know where they are

a computer
code
attached to a word or phrase in a computer document in order to arrange the
data
in a particular way
a word or phrase which is used to describe a person, group, or thing, but which is often unfair or not correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speed earned him the tag of ‘the runner’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的速度使他赢得了“飞人”的称号。

Sense.DEF:
a
tag question
Sense.TRAN: 反意疑问句﹐附加疑问句

Sense.DEF: someone’s name that they paint illegally on a wall, vehicle etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在墙壁﹑汽车等上面〕违法涂写的名字

Subsense.DEF:
the
license plates
on a car

a small piece of sticky plastic with a date on it that you put on your car’s
license plate
to show that the car is legally allowed on the road in that year

Sense.DEF: to attach a tag to something
Sense.TRAN: 给…加上标签﹐给…挂上标牌
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each bird was tagged and released into the wild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每只鸟都被系上标牌放归了大自然。

Sense.DEF: to give someone or something a name or title, or describe them in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The country no longer wants to be tagged as a Third World nation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国不愿意再被称为第三世界国家。

Sense.DEF: to attach a tag in a computer program or document
Sense.TRAN: 给 〔计算机程序或文件〕加标记
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the words are tagged with their part of speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有单词都标上了词性。

Sense.DEF: to illegally paint your name on a wall, vehicle etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在墙壁﹑汽车等上面违法〕涂写〔名字〕

Sense.DEF: to touch someone you are chasing in a game, especially to touch someone with the ball in baseball
to go somewhere with someone, especially when they have not asked you to go with them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate tagged along with mum and Vicky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特跟着妈妈和维基。

Sense.DEF: to add something, especially something that was thought of later
Sense.TRAN: 附加﹐添加〔尤指后来想起的事情〕

Sense.DEF: to tag along
something that is attached to and pulled behind something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tagalong attaches to an adult’s bicycle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这拖车是挂在成人自行车后面的。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes somewhere with someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were tagalongs on my parents’ vacations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母去度假我们都跟着。

Sense.DEF: when someone illegally paints their name or symbol on a wall, vehicle etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在墙壁﹑汽车等上面非法的〕涂写名字﹐涂写符号

Sense.DEF:
a type of
pasta
that is cut into very long thin flat pieces
a question that is formed by adding a phrase such as ‘can’t we?’, ‘wouldn’t he?’, or ‘is it?’ to a sentence
Sense.TRAN: 反意疑问句﹐附加疑问句

Sense.DEF: a Chinese form of exercise that involves extremely slow movements, and that trains your mind and body

an
astronaut
from China
the part that sticks out at the back of an animal’s body, and that it can move
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog wagged its tail .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗摇了摇尾巴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a white-tailed eagle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白尾雕

Sense.DEF: the back part of an aircraft
the bottom part of your shirt at the back, that you put inside your trousers
the back or last part of something, especially something that is moving away from you
Sense.TRAN: 末尾部分﹐后部〔尤指离你而去的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We saw the tail of the procession disappearing round the corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到队伍的尾巴绕过拐角渐渐消失。

Subsense.DEF: a man’s jacket which is short at the front and divides into two long pieces at the back, worn to very formal events

said when you are
tossing
a coin throwing it up in the air to decide which of two things you will do or choose

Sense.DEF: the last part of an event, situation, or period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事件﹑形势或时期的〕尾声﹐末尾

Sense.DEF: to be following someone closely
someone who is employed to watch and follow someone, especially a criminal

GramExa.GLOSS: order someone to follow another person

Sense.DEF: to run away because you are too frightened to fight or attack
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不敢抵抗或攻击而〕逃跑﹐转身逃走

Sense.LEXUNIT: with your tail between your legs
Sense.DEF: embarrassed or unhappy because you have failed or been defeated
Sense.TRAN: 〔因失败或被打败而〕夹着尾巴﹐垂头丧气

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s (a case of) the tail wagging the dog
Sense.DEF: used to say that an unimportant thing is wrongly controlling a situation
Sense.TRAN: 这是主次颠倒﹐这是喧宾夺主

Sense.DEF: to try to get a woman to have sex with you
to follow someone and watch what they do, where they go etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have been tailing him for several months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察跟踪他已有几个月了。

Sense.DEF:
to
tail off
Sense.TRAN: 变得越来越少[小]﹔逐渐消失

Sense.DEF: if traffic tails back, a long line of cars forms, for example because the road is blocked
to become gradually less, smaller etc, and often stop or disappear completely
Sense.TRAN: 变得越来越少[小]﹔逐渐消失
Sense.EXAMPLE: Profits tailed off towards the end of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润到年底几乎减为零了。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s voice tails off, it becomes quieter and then stops
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音〕变得越来越小〔直至完全消失〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I didn’t mean...’ Her voice tailed off in embarrassment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不是说……”她很不好意思﹐声音变得越来越小。

Sense.DEF: a line of traffic that is moving very slowly or not moving at all
Sense.TRAN: 〔因交通堵塞而形成的〕车辆长龙
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-mile tailback on the M25
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 25号高速公路上长达五英里的塞车长龙

Sense.DEF: the player who is the furthest back from the front line in American football
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球中离对阵争球线最远的〕攻方尾后卫

Sense.DEF:
a
tailgate

the small bone at the bottom of your
spine
a man’s jacket which is short at the front and divided into two long pieces at the back, worn to very formal events
a door at the back of a truck or car that opens out and down
a tailgate party
to drive too closely to the vehicle in front of you
Sense.TRAN: 紧随〔前车〕行驶﹐紧跟…行驶

Sense.DEF:
a party before an American football game, where people eat and drink near their cars in the
car park
of the place where the game is played
Sense.TRAN: 车尾大聚餐〔指人们在美式橄榄球比赛地点的停车场就地吃喝的场面〕

Sense.DEF: one of the two red lights at the back of a vehicle
someone whose job is to make men’s clothes, that are measured to fit each customer perfectly
to make something so that it is exactly right for someone’s particular needs or for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 根据特定需要制作﹐定做

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Treatment is tailored to the needs of each patient.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗方案是针对各个病人的需要而制订的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: tailor sth to meet/suit sb’s needs/requirements
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The classes are tailored to suit learners’ needs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程根据学习者的需要而设计。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We tailored the part specifically for her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个角色是我们专门为她量身打造的。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing that is tailored is made to fit very well
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tailored suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定做的套装

Sense.DEF: made or done specially for someone’s particular need or situation
Sense.TRAN: 根据特别需要的﹐专门的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tailored financial advice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 量身定制的理财建议

Sense.DEF: the work of making men’s clothes, or the style in which they are made
Sense.TRAN: 〔制作男装的〕裁缝业﹔〔男装的〕裁剪式样

Sense.DEF: exactly right or suitable for someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 完全恰当的﹐正好适合的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job’s tailor-made for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作你干正合适。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: insurance tailor-made to each client’s requirements
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据每个顾客的需求量身定制的保险

Sense.DEF: a part that forms or is added to the end of something, especially a piece of writing
Sense.TRAN: 尾部﹔尾部附加物﹔〔尤指文章的〕补白

Sense.DEF: a pipe on a vehicle or machine through which gas or steam passes
in or into a bad situation that keeps getting worse in a way that you cannot control
Sense.TRAN: 陷入不断恶化的情况中
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raising interest rates could send the economy into a tailspin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高利率可能会使经济状况继续恶化。

Sense.DEF: when a plane falls through the air, with the front pointing downwards and the back spinning in a circle
a wind blowing in the same direction that something or someone is travelling
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆等行驶时从后面吹来的〕顺风

Sense.DEF: if something bad taints a situation or person, it makes the person or situation seem bad
Sense.TRAN: 使受负面影响﹔玷污﹐败坏 〔某人的名誉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Baker argues that his trial was tainted by negative publicity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克抗辩说他的审判受到了负面宣传的影响。

Sense.DEF: to damage something by adding an unwanted substance to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The water had been tainted with a deadly toxin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水被致命毒素污染。

Sense.DEF: the appearance of being related to something bad or morally wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city has suffered for many years under the taint of corruption.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市多年遭受腐败之苦。

Sense.DEF: a tainted substance, especially food or drink, is not safe because it is spoiled or contains a harmful substance or poison
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指食物或饮料〕受污染的﹐有毒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tainted blood supply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受污染的血源

Sense.DEF: affected or influenced by something illegal, dishonest, or morally wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于非法﹑不诚实或道德败坏而〕受到影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tainted witness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污点证人

Sense.DEF: to move or go with someone or something from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barney took us to the airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴尼把我们送到机场。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you mind taking Susie home ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你带苏茜回家好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he refused to give his name, he was taken into custody.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝说出自己的名字﹐于是就被拘留了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My job has taken me all over the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作让我走遍了世界各地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His wife went to Australia, taking the children with her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子带着孩子去了澳大利亚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have to take Steve the money tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今晚得把钱带给史蒂夫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took me to meet his parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带我去见他的父母。

Sense.DEF: used with a noun instead of using a verb to describe an action. For example, if you take a walk, you walk somewhere.
Sense.TRAN: 做〔某个动作﹔和名词连用代替某个动词〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like to take a look?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想看看吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike’s just taking a shower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克正在淋浴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sara took a deep breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉深深地吸了一口气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I waved, but he didn’t take any notice pretended not to notice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挥挥手﹐但他没有理会我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please take a seat sit down .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind taking a photo of us together?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我们拍张合影好吗？

Sense.DEF: to remove something from a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take your feet off the seats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的脚从座位上挪开。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone’s taken a pen from my desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人从我的书桌上拿走了一支钢笔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Police say money and jewellery were taken in the raid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说钱和珠宝都在这次抢劫中被抢走了。

Sense.DEF: if something takes a particular amount of time, money, effort etc, that amount of time etc is needed for it to happen or succeed
Sense.TRAN: 花费〔时间﹑金钱或努力等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long is this going to take ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这要花多长时间？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organizing a successful street party takes a lot of energy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功举办一次街头聚会要花费很多精力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Repairs take time to carry out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理要花时间。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It took a few minutes for his eyes to adjust to the dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了几分钟他的眼睛才适应了黑暗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took me ages to find a present for Dad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了很长时间才买到一样给爸爸的礼物。

GramExa.GLOSS: need a lot of time or effort
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 需要花费大量时间[努力]
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Catching up four goals will take some doing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 追上四分是要花大力气的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It takes courage to admit you are wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 承认错误需要勇气。

GramExa.GLOSS: to have the qualities that are needed for success
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Neil’s got what it takes to be a great footballer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内尔具备成为一名伟大足球运动员的潜质。

Sense.DEF: to accept or choose something that is offered, suggested, or given to you
Sense.TRAN: 接受〔某人给的东西﹑提议等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you take the job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你接受这份工作吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you take American Express?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们接受美国运通信用卡吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you take my advice , you’ll see a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你听我的意见﹐就去看医生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our helpline take s 3.5 million calls telephone calls a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的求助热线每年接听350万个电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some doctors are unwilling to take new patients without a referral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些医生不愿意接收没有转诊单的新病人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz found his criticisms hard to take .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹觉得他的批评很难接受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just can’t take any more can’t deal with a bad situation any longer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再也受不了了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff have agreed to take a 2% pay cut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工同意接受2%的降薪。

GramExa.GLOSS: be forced to accept defeat or a bad situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Small businesses took a hammering in the last recession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在上次的经济衰退中﹐小企业遭遇了困境。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you accept someone’s opinion

GramExa.PROPFORM: take sb’s word for it/take it from sb
GramExa.GLOSS: accept that what someone says is true
GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s the truth - take it from me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是事实——相信我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s the kind of man who makes things happen but lets others take the credit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是那种自己做事却让别人领功的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: assume that something is correct or certain, because you are sure that this is the case
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It isn’t official yet, but you can take it as read that you’ve got the contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这虽然还是非正式的﹐但你可以认为你已经得到这份合同了。

Sense.DEF: to get hold of something in your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me take your coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来帮你拿着外套吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you take this package while I get my wallet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我拿一下这个包裹好吗？我把钱包拿出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just wanted to take him in my arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好想把他拥在我的怀里。

Sense.DEF: to use a particular form of transport or a particular road in order to go somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 乘坐〔某种交通工具〕﹐走〔某条道路〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s take a cab.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐出租车吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I took the first plane out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搭乘第一班飞机走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the M6 to Junction 19.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走6号高速公路到第19号交叉口。

Sense.DEF: to study a particular subject in school or college for an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you taking French next year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你明年修法语吗？

Sense.DEF: to do an examination or test
Sense.EXAMPLE: Applicants are asked to take a written test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请者被要求参加一个笔试。

Sense.GRAM: T not in progressive or passive
Sense.DEF: to be the correct or suitable size, type etc for a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car that takes low sulphur fuel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用低硫燃油的汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: What size shoe do you take?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿多大尺码的鞋子？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The elevator takes a maximum of 32 people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这电梯最多可以乘32人。

Sense.DEF: to collect or gather something for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investigators will take samples of the wreckage to identify the cause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查人员将从残骸上取样以确定事故的起因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police took a statement from both witnesses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察给两名目击者都做了笔录。

Sense.DEF: to react to someone or something or consider them in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was joking, but he took me seriously.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在开玩笑﹐但他却当真了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben took the news very badly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本听了这个消息反应很强烈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She does not take kindly to criticism reacts badly to criticism .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不乐于接受批评。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll take that remark as a compliment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会把那句话当成夸奖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The presence of dust clouds has been taken as evidence of recent star formation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尘云的出现已被视为最近有恒星形成的证据。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I took her to be his daughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把她当成他的女儿了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Of course I won’t tell anyone! What do you take me for ? what sort of person do you think I am?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当然不会告诉任何人！你当我是什么人了？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I take it I assume you’ve heard that Rick’s resigned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你已经知道里克辞职了。

Sense.DEF: to have or experience a particular feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should take pride in your work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该对自己的工作感到自豪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At first, he took no interest in the baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初﹐他对宝宝一点兴趣也没有。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stood feeling lost until an elderly man took pity on her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知所措地站着﹐直到有个老人来向她表示同情。

GramExa.GLOSS: feel offended
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t take offence. Roger says things like that to everybody.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要见怪﹐罗杰跟谁都说那样的话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Investors can take comfort from the fact that the World Bank is underwriting the shares.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界银行正在认购这些股票﹐投资者可以放心。

Sense.DEF: to get possession or control of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enemy forces have taken the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌军已经占领了机场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both boys were taken prisoner .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男孩都被囚禁了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The communists took power in 1948.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共产党于1948年掌权。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Youngsters need to take control of their own lives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人应该自己掌握自己的生活。

GramExa.GLOSS: in a race, competition etc

Sense.DEF:
to swallow, breathe in,
inject
etc a drug or medicine
Sense.TRAN: 服〔药〕﹔吸食〔毒品〕﹔注射〔药物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor will ask whether you are taking any medication.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生会问你是否在使用什么药物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take two tablets before bedtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡前服用两片。

GramExa.GLOSS: take illegal drugs
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most teenagers start taking drugs through boredom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数青少年因为无聊而开始吸毒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She took an overdose after a row with her boyfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和男朋友吵架后服用了过量药物。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone whether they like to have sugar or milk in a drink such as tea or coffee
to make someone or something go to a higher level or position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The latest raise takes his salary into six figures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近一次加薪使他的薪水达到了六位数。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Even if you have the talent to take you to the top , there’s no guarantee you’ll get there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使你有出人头地的才能﹐你也未必就能做到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want to take it further , you should consult an attorney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想进一步行动﹐应该找个律师咨询一下。

Sense.DEF: to measure the amount, level, rate etc of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the patient’s pulse first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先测一下病人的脉搏。

Sense.DEF: to make a number smaller by a particular amount

GramExa.PROPFORM: take sth away/take sth (away) from sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Take four from nine and what do you get?’ ‘Five.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “9减4等于多少？”“等于5。”
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ten take away nine equals one.

Sense.DEF: if a shop, business etc takes a particular amount of money, it receives that amount of money from its customers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stall took £25 on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个摊位星期六收进25英镑。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can take it or leave it

Subsense.DEF: to neither like nor dislike something
Subsense.TRAN: 某人不喜欢也不讨厌某事物﹐某人对某事物无所谓
Subsense.EXAMPLE: To some people, smoking is addictive. Others can take it or leave it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人吸烟会上瘾﹐有些人却觉得可有可无。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not care whether someone accepts your offer or not

Sense.DEF: used to give an example of something you have just been talking about
Sense.TRAN: 举例说明﹔以某人/某事为例
Sense.EXAMPLE: People love British cars. Take the Mini. In Japan, it still sells more than all the other British cars put together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们喜欢英国车。就拿Mini汽车来说﹐在日本它的销量仍然超过其他所有英国汽车销量的总和。

Sense.DEF: to teach a particular group of students in a school or college
Sense.TRAN: 〔在学校或大学〕教授〔某个班级〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who takes you for English?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁教你们英语？

Sense.DEF: to write down information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me take your email address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我记下你的电子邮箱地址。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue offered to take notes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休提出她来记笔记。

Sense.DEF: to make someone forget their problems and feel more confident
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alf said joining the club would take me out of myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔夫说加入俱乐部会让我摆脱烦恼。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a lot out of you/take it out of you
Sense.DEF: to make you very tired
Sense.TRAN: 使筋疲力尽﹐使心力交瘁
Sense.EXAMPLE: Looking after a baby really takes it out of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照看婴儿会让人精疲力竭。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take it upon/on yourself to do sth
Sense.DEF: to decide to do something without getting someone’s permission or approval first
Sense.TRAN: 擅自做主做某事﹐自作主张做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reg took it upon himself to hand the press a list of names.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷吉自作主张给了媒体一份名单。

Sense.DEF: to separate something into its different parts
Sense.TRAN: 把某物拆开﹐把某物分解
Sense.EXAMPLE: how to take an engine to bits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何把发动机拆开

Sense.DEF: to be attracted by a particular idea, plan, or person
Sense.TRAN: 被某事物吸引住﹐被某事物迷住
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m quite taken by the idea of Christmas in Berlin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去柏林过圣诞节这个想法很吸引我。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become ill
if a man takes someone, he has sex with them
to try to get over or around something in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 转过弯道/越过栅栏/拐弯等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took the bend at over 60 and lost control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在拐弯时时速超过60﹐失去了控制。

Sense.TRAN: 〔治疗﹑染料﹑药物等〕开始起作用﹐开始见效

Exponent.DEF: to move or go with someone or something from one place to another
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to take your keys.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了带钥匙。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shall I take you home?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我送你回家好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I took Alice a cup of tea.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给艾丽斯拿了杯茶过去。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone or something to the place where you are now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve brought someone to see you!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们带了个人来看你！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Will you bring your photos with you when you come?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来的时候把照片一起带来好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to take large quantities of goods from one place to another in a plane, train, ship etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plane is used for transporting military equipment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这飞机用于运送军用装备。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The coal was transported by rail.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤由铁路运输。

Exponent.DEF: to take goods, letters, newspapers etc to someone’s home or office
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, the package was delivered to the wrong address.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 包裹不幸送错了地方。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone or something somewhere by plane
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bread is specially flown in from Paris.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这面包是专门从巴黎空运来的。

Exponent.DEF: to take goods from one place to another – this can be by ship, truck, plane, or train
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Half the whisky is shipped to Japan and the US.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一半威士忌运往日本和美国。

Exponent.DEF: to take people or goods somewhere – used especially when saying how many people or things, or what kind
Exponent.TRAN: 运送〔尤用于说明运载的人﹑物等的数量﹑类别时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new plane can carry up to 600 passengers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架新飞机可运送多达600名乘客。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ship was carrying a full cargo of oil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船装满了油。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone to a place by going in front of them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He led Julia through the house to his study.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他领着朱莉娅穿过屋子去他的书房。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Roland led the way back to the car in silence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗兰默默地走在前面回到车里。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone to a place and show them the way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Emily guided him through a side gate into a large garden.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉领着他穿过边门进了一个大花园。

Exponent.DEF: to take someone to a place and protect or guard them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The prisoner was escorted into the room by two police officers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人由两名警察押送到房间。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The singer was escorted by her assistant and her bodyguard.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名歌手由助理及保镖护送。

Sense.DEF: to be very surprised about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emma was somewhat taken aback by his directness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛对他的坦率感到有点吃惊。

Sense.DEF: to look or behave like an older relative
Sense.TRAN: 〔外貌或行为〕与〔某个长辈〕相像
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenni really takes after her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹妮真像她母亲。

Sense.DEF: to separate something into all its different parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom was always taking things apart in the garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆老是在车库里拆东西。

Sense.DEF: to search a place very thoroughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police took the house apart looking for clues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察彻底搜查了那所房子﹐寻找线索。

Sense.DEF: to beat someone very easily in a game, sport, fight etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛﹑打斗等中〕轻易打败〔某人〕

Sense.DEF: to show that someone is wrong or something is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tariq takes several gay myths apart in his book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔里克在他的书中指出了人们对同性恋的一些错误看法。

Sense.DEF: to begin to dislike someone or something, especially without a good reason
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指没有原因地〕开始不喜欢
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voters took against the relationship between the government and the unions in the 1970s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪70年代选民开始对政府和工会之间的关系产生不满。

Sense.DEF: to remove someone or something, or make something disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: She whisked the tray off the table and took it away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把桌上的盘子匆匆一收﹐拿走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was taken away to begin a prison sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被带走去服刑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This should take some of the pain away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这应该可以减轻一些疼痛。

Sense.DEF: if you buy food to take away, you buy cooked food from a restaurant and take it outside to eat it somewhere else
Sense.TRAN: 〔从餐馆买饭菜等〕带回食用﹔外卖带走
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fish and chips to take away, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸鱼和薯条﹐带走﹐谢谢。

Sense.DEF: to be very beautiful, exciting, or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 令人屏息﹐令人喘不过气来〔形容事物非常美丽﹑令人激动或令人吃惊〕

Sense.DEF: to spoil the good effect or success that something has
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disagreement between the two men should not take away from their accomplishments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两人之间的分歧应该无损于他们的成就。

Sense.DEF: to admit that you were wrong to say something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better take back that remark!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好收回那句话！

Sense.DEF: to take something you have bought back to a shop because it is not suitable
Sense.TRAN: 退回〔从商店里购买的货物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the shirt doesn’t fit, take it back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这件衬衣不合身﹐拿去退货吧。

Sense.DEF: to make you remember a time in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having the grandchildren around takes me back to the days when my own children were small.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孙儿绕膝的情景把我带回到了自己孩子还小的那些日子。

Sense.DEF: to move something that is fixed in a high position to a lower position
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made us take down all the posters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让我们把所有的招贴画都取下来。

Sense.DEF: to write down information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I just take some details down?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记一些细节﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: to pull a piece of clothing such as trousers part of the way down your legs
to be completely deceived by someone who lies to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be taken in by products claiming to help you lose weight in a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要相信那些声称能让你在一周内就减肥的产品。

Sense.DEF: to let someone stay in your house because they have nowhere else to stay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brett’s always taking in stray animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布雷特总是收养流浪的动物。

Sense.DEF: to understand and remember new facts and information
Sense.EXAMPLE: He watches the older kids, just taking it all in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仔细观察那些大孩子﹐全都记在心里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes quickly took in the elegance of her dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一眼就注意到她的连衣裙很雅致。

Sense.DEF: to collect or earn a particular amount of money
to visit a place while you are in the area
Sense.EXAMPLE: They continued a few miles further to take in Hinton House.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又走了几英里去参观辛顿堡。

Sense.DEF: if you take in a show, play etc, you go to see it
if the police take someone in, they take them to a police station to ask them questions about a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: All five teenagers were arrested and taken in for questioning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五个少年全部被抓获﹐并被带回受审。

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of clothing fit you by making it narrower
to remove a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat on the bed to take his boots off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐到床上脱靴子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlie was taking off his shirt when the phone rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利正在脱衬衫﹐突然电话铃响了。

Sense.DEF: if an aircraft takes off, it rises into the air from the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt quite excited as the plane took off from Heathrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当飞机从希思罗机场起飞时﹐我感到很兴奋。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start being successful
Sense.TRAN: 突然开始成功﹐开始走红
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mimi became jealous when Jack’s career started taking off .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克的事业开始起飞﹐米米就妒忌起来。

Sense.DEF: to have a holiday from work on a particular day, or for a particular length of time
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某日或某段时间〕休假

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I rang my boss and arranged to take some time off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给老板打了电话请假一段时间。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take a day/the afternoon etc off
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad took the day off to come with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸那天请了假陪我一起去。

Sense.DEF: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, in order to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了逗笑〕模仿〔某人的动作或说话的样子〕

Sense.DEF: to start to employ someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re taking on 50 new staff this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今年要招收50名新员工。

Sense.DEF: to agree to do some work or be responsible for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t take on too much work - the extra cash isn’t worth it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要太卖命了——多挣那点钱不值得。

Sense.DEF: to begin to have a particular quality or appearance
Sense.TRAN: 开始具有〔某种特征﹑面貌等〕﹔呈现﹔露出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her face took on a fierce expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上露出了凶相。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His life had taken on a new dimension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的生活出现了新的面貌。

Sense.DEF: to compete against someone or start a fight with someone, especially someone bigger or better than you
Sense.TRAN: 和某人〔尤指更大或更强的对手〕竞争[打斗﹐较量等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nigeria will take on Argentina in the first round of the World Cup on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六在世界杯第一轮的比赛中﹐尼 日利亚队将对阵阿根廷队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was prepared to take on anyone who laid a finger on us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁要是敢动我们一指头﹐他就会和他拼了。

Sense.DEF: if a plane or ship takes on people or things, they come onto it
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机或轮船〕接纳﹐装载〔乘客或东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped to take on fuel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们停下来加油。

Sense.DEF: to take someone as your guest to a restaurant, cinema, club etc
Sense.TRAN: 带〔某人〕出去〔到餐厅﹑电影院﹑俱乐部等地〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re taking my folks out for a meal next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周我们要带父母出去吃顿饭。

Sense.DEF: to make a financial or legal arrangement with a bank, company, law court etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔从银行﹑公司﹑法院等处〕获得﹐领到

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Before taking a loan out, calculate your monthly outgoings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请贷款之前﹐算一下你每月的支出。

Sense.DEF: to get money from your bank account
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much would you like to take out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想提多少钱？

Sense.DEF: to borrow books from a library
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can take out six books at a time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一次可以借六本书。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone or destroy something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was taken out by a bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座建筑被一枚炸弹摧毁了。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly when you are angry or upset, even though it is not their fault
Sense.TRAN: 向〔某人〕发泄〔不满等〕﹔拿〔某人〕出气
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t take it out on me just because you’ve had a bad day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要因为你一天过得不顺心就拿我来撒气。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take your anger/frustration etc out on sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Irritated with herself, she took her annoyance out on Bridget.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生自己的气﹐就把怒气发泄到布里奇特身上。

Sense.DEF: to take control of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His only reason for investing in the company was to take it over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他投资这家公司唯一的原因是想接管它。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ruth moved into our apartment and promptly took over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁思一搬进我们的公寓就开始指手画脚了。

Sense.DEF: to start to like someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra took to it straight away .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉立即就喜欢上它了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles was an odd character whom Kelly had never really taken to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯是个怪人﹐凯莉从没有真正喜欢过他。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something regularly
Sense.TRAN: 养成…的习惯﹐开始定期做

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dee’s taken to getting up at 6 and going jogging.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪伊养成了6点起床去慢跑的习惯。

Sense.DEF: to get into your bed and stay there
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was so depressed, he took to his bed for a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心情十分沮丧﹐在床上躺了一个星期。

Sense.DEF: to become interested in a new activity and to spend time doing it
Sense.TRAN: 对某事产生兴趣﹔开始花时间从事某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roger took painting up for a while, but soon lost interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰有段时间喜欢上了绘画﹐但很快就又没了兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to start a new job or have a new responsibility
Sense.TRAN: 开始从事〔新的工作〕﹔开始担当〔新的责任〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter will take up the management of the finance department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得将担任财务部的管理工作。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take up a post/a position/duties etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The headteacher takes her duties up in August.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长将于8月份上任。

Sense.DEF: if you take up a suggestion, problem, complaint etc, you start to do something about it
Sense.TRAN: 开始处理〔建议﹑问题﹑投诉等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now the papers have taken up the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在各报纸已经开始报道此事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital manager has promised to take the matter up with the member of staff involved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院主管答应和相关医务人员商量处理此事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am still very angry and will be taking it up with the authorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍然很生气﹐将和当局就此事进行交涉。

Sense.DEF: to fill a particular amount of time or space
Sense.TRAN: 占据〔一定的时间或空间〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The little time I had outside of school was taken up with work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课外的一点点时间我都用来工作了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: old books that were taking up space in the office
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 占去办公室很大空间的旧书

Sense.DEF: to accept a suggestion, offer, or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rob took up the invitation to visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布接受了访问的邀请。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rick took up the challenge and cycled the 250 mile route alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克接受挑战﹐独自骑行这条250英里的路线。

Sense.DEF: to move to the exact place where you should be, so that you are ready to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The runners are taking up their positions on the starting line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛跑选手们在起跑线上各就各位。

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of clothing shorter
to continue a story or activity that you or someone else had begun, after a short break
Sense.TRAN: 继续某事﹐把某事接着进行下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll take up the story where you left off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来接着你把故事讲下去。

Sense.DEF: to accept an invitation or suggestion

GramExa.PROPFORM: take sb up on an offer/a promise/a suggestion etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll take you up on that offer of a drink, if it still stands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接受你的邀请去喝一杯﹐如果你说的还算数的话。

Sense.DEF: to become friendly with someone, especially someone who may influence you badly
an occasion when a film scene, song, action etc is recorded
Sense.TRAN: 〔一个电影场景﹑一个动作等的〕一次拍摄﹔〔一首歌曲的〕一次录制
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to do six takes for this particular scene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一个镜头我们不得不拍了六次。

Sense.DEF: someone’s opinion about a situation or idea
Sense.TRAN: 某人（对某事）的观点[立场]
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your take on this issue?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对这个问题持什么观点？

Sense.DEF: to be willing to do something wrong in return for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it true that some of the generals are on the take?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真的有一些将军接受贿赂吗？

Sense.DEF: the amount of money earned by a shop or business in a particular period of time
a meal that you buy at a shop or restaurant to eat at home
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s have a takeaway tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今晚叫外卖吧。

Sense.DEF: a shop or restaurant that sells meals to be eaten somewhere else
the amount of money that you receive from your job after taxes etc have been taken out

the past participle of
take
the time when a plane leaves the ground and begins to fly
a humorous performance that copies the way someone behaves
the time when your feet leave the ground when you are jumping
a meal that you buy at a restaurant to eat at home

when one company takes control of another by buying more than half its
shares
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thornbury has announced a takeover bid of a regional TV company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索恩伯里已经宣布将出价收购一家地方电视公司。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He prevented a hostile takeover when the takeover is not wanted by the company being bought of the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他阻止了对公司的恶意收购。

Sense.DEF: an act of getting control of a country or political organization, using force
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过武力对某国或某政治组织的〕接管﹐夺取控制
Sense.EXAMPLE: a communist takeover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共产党的夺取政权

Sense.DEF: if there are no takers for something, no one accepts or wants what is being offered
Sense.TRAN: 没有/有很少/有不多的接受者

Sense.DEF: someone who accepts support and help from other people, but who is not willing to give them support or help
used with nouns to describe people who take or collect things
Sense.TRAN: 接受[收集]某物的人〔和名词连用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: senior decision-takers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高层决策者
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just a message-taker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是个带信的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ticket-taker at the recreation hall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 娱乐厅的收票员
Sense.EXAMPLE: the policy of not doing deals with hostage takers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不和劫持人质的人进行交易的政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: treatment for drug takers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对吸毒者的治疗

Sense.DEF: the rate at which people accept something that is offered to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take-up for college places has been slow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受学院录取的比例很低。

Sense.DEF: the money that a business, shop etc gets from selling its goods over a particular period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He counted the night’s takings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他算了算当晚的营业额。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cinema box-office takings in 2001 were £600m.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2001年电影的票房收入为6亿英镑。

Sense.DEF: talcum powder
a powder with a nice smell which you put on your skin after washing
a story about exciting imaginary events

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tales of adventure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 探险故事

Sense.EXAMPLE: a book of old Japanese folk tales traditional stories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本古老民间故事书
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安徒生的一则童话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cautionary tale one that is told to warn people about the dangers of something
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警示故事

Sense.DEF: a description of interesting or exciting things that happened to someone, often one which is not completely true about every detail
Sense.TRAN: 〔未必完全真实的〕陈述﹔传说﹐传闻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tales of her life in post-war Berlin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关她在战后柏林生活的传闻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was in the middle of telling me a long tale about how he once met the Redskins’ manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在和我絮絮叨叨地讲他有一次遇见红人队主教练的事。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone in authority about something wrong that someone else has done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t go telling tales to the teacher!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要向老师打小报告！

Subsense.DEF: a description of events that made you unhappy
a series of bad things that happened to someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The England team’s tale of woe continued, and they lost the next three games.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队的悲剧继续上演﹐接下去的三场比赛他们又输了。

Sense.DEF: a natural ability to do something well
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a lot of talent , and his work is fresh and interesting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很有天赋﹐作品新颖有趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a persuasive speaker with a natural talent for leadership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有领导天赋﹑颇有辩才的演说者
Sense.EXAMPLE: His latest book reveals hidden talents .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最新的一本书展现了他深藏不露的才能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sadly, she inherited none of her father’s musical talent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可惜的是﹐她一点都没有继承她父亲的音乐天赋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your brother is a man of many talents .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的弟弟是个多才多艺的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a wealth of talent in English football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰足球界人才济济。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She showed a talent for acting at an early age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在很小的时候就显示出了表演天赋。

Sense.DEF: a person or people with a natural ability or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s footballing talent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的足球天才

Sense.DEF: sexually attractive people
having a natural ability to do something well
Sense.EXAMPLE: a talented actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名很有天赋的演员

Sense.DEF: not having any special abilities or skills
Sense.EXAMPLE: a noisy, talentless band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个吵闹又平庸的乐队

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to find young people who are very good at sport, music etc
the work of finding young people who are good at sport, music etc
Sense.TRAN: 物色新秀﹐人才发掘〔物色体育运动﹑音乐等方面的人才〕

Sense.DEF: an object that is believed to have magic powers to protect the person who owns it
to say things to someone as part of a conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear Sarah and Andy talking in the next room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到萨拉和安迪在隔壁讲话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: English people love to talk about the weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰人喜欢谈论天气。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All through the afternoon, they sat and talked about their trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个下午他们都坐着谈论他们的旅程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She spent a long time talking to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和他谈了很长时间。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s very easy to talk to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很容易交流。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got the truth from talking with Elena.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和埃琳娜交谈后我知道了真相。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were talking together in the hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在大厅里相互交谈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue and Bob still aren’t talking are refusing to talk to each other .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休和鲍勃仍然互不理睬。

GramExa.PROPFORM: talk in a low voice/a whisper etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were talking in low voices, and I couldn’t catch what they were saying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在轻声交谈﹐我听不清楚他们在说些什么。

GramExa.GLOSS: used especially in formal or literary contexts
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We talked of old times.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈到了过去的时光。

Sense.DEF: to discuss something serious or important with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe, we need to talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔﹐我们得谈谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there somewhere we can talk in private?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么地方我们可以去私下谈谈吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should talk to a lawyer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该咨询律师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been talking about getting married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在谈结婚的事了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents should talk with their children about drug abuse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母应该和孩子谈论吸毒问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Let’s not talk politics now,’ said Hugh impatiently.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们现在别谈政治了。”休不耐烦地说。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually say that they are going to discuss , deal with , or address a subject rather than talk about it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐表示讨论一个话题时﹐人们一般用discuss﹐deal with或address﹐而不用talk about
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: In this essay I will discuss the problem of over-population.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 本文中﹐我将探讨人口过多的问题。

Sense.DEF: to produce words and express thoughts, opinions, ideas etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was talking so fast I could hardly understand her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说得太快﹐我几乎听不懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do babies learn to talk ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿是如何学说话的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some residents were frightened to talk publicly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些居民害怕在众目睽睽下开口说话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They started talking in Spanish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开始用西班牙语交谈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let Dad hear you talking like that expressing things in a particular way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让爸爸听到你这样说话。

Sense.DEF: to give a speech

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Professor Davis will talk about ‘Trends in Network Computing’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯教授将谈谈“网络信息技术的趋势”。

Sense.DEF: if someone who has secret information talks, they tell someone else about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even under torture, Maskell refused to talk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使在酷刑之下﹐马斯克尔还是拒不开口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to stop his ex-wife from talking on live TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图阻止他的前妻上电视直播节目去讲出内情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should stop meeting like this. People will talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们别再这样见面了﹐人们会说闲话的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think someone is saying something sensible, something stupid etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You do talk rubbish sometimes, Jules.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱尔斯﹐你确实有说废话的时候。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to behave sensibly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hoped Father McCormack would be able to talk some sense into her son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望麦科马克神父能够劝导她儿子。

Sense.DEF: to say your thoughts out loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Sorry, I was just talking to myself.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你说什么？”“对不起﹐我只是自言自语。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: know what you are talking about
Sense.DEF: to know a lot about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: I worked in hotels for years, so I know what I’m talking about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾在酒店工作多年﹐所以对这一行很了解。

Sense.LEXUNIT: talk the hind leg(s) off a donkey
Sense.DEF: to talk a lot, especially about unimportant things
used to emphasize that someone or something is very lazy, cheap, hungry etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talk about lucky. That’s the second time he’s won this week!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是运气好﹐这已经是他本周第二次赢了！

Sense.DEF: used to say more about a subject that someone has just mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 谈到﹐论及〔用于承接刚才的话题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talking of Venice, have you seen the masks I bought there last year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到威尼斯﹐你看到过我去年在那儿买的面具吗？

Sense.DEF: used when you think what someone has said is stupid or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 你（们）在说些什么？〔用来指对方说的话愚蠢或错误〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you talking about? We got there in plenty of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在说些什么？我们很早就到那儿了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are angry that the person you are talking to is not paying attention
Sense.TRAN: 我在和你说话呢！〔用来表示因对方未注意你说话而生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rob! I’m talking to you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布！我在和你说话呢！

Sense.LEXUNIT: be like talking to a brick wall
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is annoying to speak to someone because they do not pay attention to you
Sense.TRAN: 就像跟木头说话﹐好像在对牛弹琴

Sense.DEF: to talk too much to someone
to say rude or offensive things to or about someone, especially to opponents in a sports competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对体育比赛中的对手〕谩骂﹐侮辱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both teams were talking trash on the court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两队在球场上互相谩骂。

Sense.DEF: to say the things that people expect or think are necessary in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t talk the talk of feminism, but her career was the most important thing in her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并没有把女权主义挂在嘴上﹐但事业的确是她生命中最重要的事情。

Sense.DEF: used in conversation to emphasize a fact or remind someone of it
Sense.TRAN: 我/我们/你是在说…〔用于强调﹑提醒等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not talking about ancient history, I’m talking about last season’s performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不是在谈陈年旧事﹐我是在说上一个赛季的表现。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think someone’s suggestion is a good idea
Sense.TRAN: 这就对了﹐太对了﹐正合我意
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Fancy an ice cream?’ ‘Now you’re talking.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “想来一个冰激凌吗？”“正合我意！”

Sense.LEXUNIT: look who’s talking,you’re a fine one to talk,you can talk
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone they should not criticize someone else’s behaviour because their own behaviour is just as bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Peggy shouldn’t smoke so much.’ ‘Look who’s talking!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “佩姬不应该抽那么多烟。” “你倒好意思说！”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone how much something will cost, how long something will take to do etc
Sense.TRAN: 500英镑/三天等是必要的〔用来告知对方需要花多少钱﹑多少时间等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: To do a proper job, you’re talking £750 minimum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想把活儿干得像样一点﹐最少要花750英镑。

Sense.LEXUNIT: talk your way out of sth
Sense.DEF: to escape from a bad or embarrassing situation by giving explanations, excuses etc
Sense.TRAN: 依靠口才使自己摆脱〔困境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s good at talking her way out of trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她擅长凭着巧舌为自己开脱。

Sense.DEF: to talk very quickly without stopping
Sense.TRAN: 说话滔滔不绝﹐口若悬河

Sense.DEF: to deliberately talk in a strange and confusing way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop talking in riddles and explain what’s going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别打哑谜了﹐解释一下到底发生了什么。

Sense.DEF: to give people your opinions very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President is talking tough on crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统对犯罪活动态度强硬。

Sense.DEF: if people talk shop, they talk about their work when there are people present who are not interested or involved in it – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔在不感兴趣或无关的人面前〕谈工作〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you two going to talk shop all night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们两个人就准备整晚都谈工作吗？

Sense.DEF: to talk in a sexual way to someone in order to make them feel sexually excited
Sense.TRAN: （对某人）说下流话﹐说挑逗的话〔以使某人性兴奋〕

Sense.DEF: if someone is talking through their hat, they say stupid things about something that they do not understand
to criticize someone or something in an unpleasant way
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快地批评〔某人或某事〕

Sense.DEF:
used to tell someone rudely that you do not want to listen to anything he or she is going to say to you. When people use this expression, they also usually turn their face away from the other person and hold the
palm
of their hand out towards them.
Sense.TRAN: 我不想听﹐别再说了〔粗鲁地告诉别人你不想再听他或她说话﹐这么说时通常把脸转向一边﹐把手心朝向对方〕

Exponent.DEF: to use words to communicate with someone about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I need to talk to you about your work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得跟你谈谈你的工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She always enjoyed talking to Jim.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是喜欢跟吉姆交谈。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can we talk?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈谈行吗？

Exponent.DEF: to talk. Speak is a little more formal than talk . You often use it when saying that someone speaks in a particular way, or that you will speak to someone in order to try to get something done. You only use speak when saying that someone speaks a language.
Exponent.TRAN: 交谈（较talk稍正式。常用于指某人的说话方式﹐或表示为了做成某事和某人谈谈。表示“说某种语言”只用speak〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He spoke with confidence and authority.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话时带着自信和威严。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d like to speak to the manager.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想跟经理谈谈。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you speak German?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会说德语吗？

Exponent.DEF: to talk too much or for too long about something, in a way that makes people bored
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He went on about how great the team was.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不停地唠叨那支球队多么了不起。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d better stop rambling and let you get on with your work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不啰嗦了﹐让你继续干活。

Exponent.DEF: to talk using a lot of words but without saying anything important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wish he would stop waffling and get to the point!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他不要胡扯下去﹐直接说要点！

Exponent.DEF: to talk continuously about silly and unimportant things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She prattled on about her boyfriend for the entire journey.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个旅程中﹐她尽闲扯她男友的事。

Section.SECHEADING: TO TALK ABOUT EVERYDAY THINGS 谈论日常事务

Exponent.DEF: to talk to someone for a long time about everyday things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was having a conversation with one of her friends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在同一个朋友说话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I arrived, Joe and Jane were deep in conversation very involved in a conversation .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到的时候﹐乔和简正聊得起劲。

Exponent.DEF: to have a friendly informal conversation about things that are not very important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The girls were chatting outside the house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们在屋外聊天。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s been nice having a chat with you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟你聊天真开心。

Exponent.DEF: to talk about other people’s private lives when they are not there, especially about things that you have heard, which are not completely true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What are you two gossiping about?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们俩在闲聊什么？

Exponent.DEF: to have a conversation with someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I visited with him last week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 上星期我跟他聊了会儿。

Exponent.DEF: to have a conversation with someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We met once and conversed briefly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们见过一次﹐并有过简短交谈。

Section.SECHEADING: TO TALK SERIOUSLY 严肃地谈论

Exponent.DEF: to talk seriously about problems, ideas, or plans
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They met to discuss how the building should be designed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们见面讨论如何设计大楼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She refuses to discuss the matter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝讨论此事。

Exponent.DEF: to discuss something with someone because it will affect them, especially someone close to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Before you accept the job, talk it over with your family.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受那份工作之前与家人商量一下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You two need to sit down and talk things over.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们俩需要坐下来谈谈。

Exponent.DEF: to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or solve a problem
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为作出决定或解决问题而〕辩论﹐讨论
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题将在周二讨论。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The UN Security Council debated whether to impose sanctions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国安理会商讨是否实行制裁。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to change their opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave Betty to me. I’ll soon talk her round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把贝蒂交给我吧。我会很快让她改变主意的。

Sense.DEF: to discuss a problem without really dealing with the important parts of it
Sense.TRAN: 不着边际[不得要领]地谈某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had spent half the night talking round the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们大半个晚上都在不着边际地谈论这个话题。

Sense.DEF: to answer someone in authority such as a teacher or parent in a rude or impolite way
to make something seem less successful, interesting, good etc than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pessimists who are talking down Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贬低英国的悲观主义者

Sense.DEF:
to help a
pilot
land an aircraft by giving them instructions from the ground by radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过无线电〕引导〔飞行员〕安全着陆﹐引降

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone as if they are stupid, although they are not
Sense.TRAN: 以高人一等的口气对〔某人〕说话
Sense.EXAMPLE: The students felt that they were talked down to as though they were children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些学生感到他们在接受训话﹐好像他们是小孩一样。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My husband talked me into going skiing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的丈夫说服我去滑雪。

Sense.DEF: to discuss a problem thoroughly in order to solve it
Sense.TRAN: 透彻地讨论﹐通过商谈解决〔问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to spend a little time talking this out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要花点时间谈谈﹐把这件事解决了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It might help if you talked it out with Dad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你和爸爸好好谈谈这件事﹐可能会有用。

Sense.DEF: if politicians talk out a proposal, they talk about it for a long time deliberately so that there will not be enough time to vote on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Land Protection Bill was talked out by MPs from rural areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土地保护议案被来自乡村的议员故意拖延而搁置了。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone not to do something

GramExa.PROPFORM: talk sb out of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can’t you talk them out of selling the house?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难道你不能说服他们不要卖掉房子吗？

Sense.DEF: to discuss a problem with someone before deciding what to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔在作出决定前与某人〕商量﹐讨论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Talk over any worries with your GP.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的担心和全科医生谈一谈。

Sense.DEF: to discuss something thoroughly so that you are sure you understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allow time to talk through any areas of difficulty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢来﹐把困难的地方都讨论清楚。

Sense.DEF: to help someone understand a process, method etc by explaining it to them carefully before they use it
Sense.TRAN: 向某人详细解释某事﹐使某人理解某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trevor talked me through loading the software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特雷弗向我仔细讲解了如何安装这个软件。

Sense.DEF: to make something appear more important, interesting, successful etc than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones talked up the idea at the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯在会议上大肆吹捧了这个想法。

Sense.DEF: a conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a long talk , we decided on divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过一次长谈后﹐我们决定离婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John, I’d like to have a talk with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰﹐我想和你谈谈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must have a talk about money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须谈谈钱的问题。

Sense.DEF: formal discussions between governments, organizations etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府﹑机构等之间的〕正式会谈﹐谈判

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The peace talks look promising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和谈看起来形势乐观。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The president held talks with Chinese officials.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统与中国官员举行了会谈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Talks with the rebels have failed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和叛乱分子的谈判破裂了。

Sense.DEF: a speech
Sense.EXAMPLE: an entertaining talk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妙趣横生的演讲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a talk on local history
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关当地历史的演讲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dr. Howard will give a talk on herbal medicine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍华德医生将作一个关于草药的报告。

Sense.DEF: information or news that people talk about and hear about a lot, but that is not official
Sense.TRAN: 小道消息﹐流言蜚语﹐传言

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tickets sold so quickly there’s talk of a second concert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 票卖得很快﹐有传言说音乐会还会举办一场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the administration’s talk of reducing weapons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府有关削减武器的传闻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s talk that she’s difficult to work with.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据传她这个人很难共事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s just talk. He’ll never do it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是传言﹐他决不会这么做的。

Sense.DEF: type of conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s enough of that kind of talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 够了﹐别再说那种话了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: persuasive sales talk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有说服力的推销套话
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s fighting talk brave and confident words from Italy’s manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是意大利队主教练的豪言壮语。

Sense.DEF: someone who is all talk talks a lot about what they intend to do, but never actually does it

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the talk of the town/Paris etc
Sense.DEF: someone who is the talk of the town has done something bad, shocking, exciting etc and everyone is talking about them
Sense.TRAN: 成了镇上/巴黎等街谈巷议的话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s the talk of London’s theatre-goers since her last performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自从上次演出后就成了伦敦戏迷津津乐道的对象。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not believe someone will do what they say
someone who is talkative talks a lot

an electronic system used in a film or television
studio
, so that someone can talk to someone else without other people hearing them
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影摄影棚或电视演播室内使用的〕内部联络系统

Sense.DEF: a website, or part of a website, where people can write their opinions, ask questions etc
someone who talks a lot or talks in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 健谈的人﹔以某种方式说话的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Media people need to be good talkers and skilled negotiators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体人应该健谈﹐并善于谈判。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom thinks he’s a smooth talker someone who is polite and pleasant but who you do not trust .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈认为他是一个说话油滑的人。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when people have long conversations or discussions
Sense.EXAMPLE: His radio show has always been an enjoyable talkfest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的电台节目一直是人们喜闻乐见的清谈节目。

Sense.DEF: a film made using sound
a book that has been recorded onto tape for blind people
someone on television who talks directly to the camera, especially to give their opinions
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视上面对摄像机讲话者的〕头部特写

Sense.DEF: a subject that a lot of people want to talk about
a committee, group etc whose job is to discuss and solve problems, but who do not achieve any action
Sense.TRAN: 清谈俱乐部〔指只说不做的委员会﹑团体等〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you talk to someone angrily, especially a child or someone who is below you in rank
a type of radio programme in which people call the radio station to give their opinions or discuss a subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台的〕热线节目〔听众可以打电话表达意见或参与讨论〕

Sense.DEF: a television show in which famous people answer questions about themselves
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视上的〕名人访谈节目﹐脱口秀
Sense.EXAMPLE: a talk show host
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱口秀节目主持人

Sense.DEF:
the amount of time a
mobile phone
can be used to make or receive calls or messages
Sense.EXAMPLE: The battery allows approximately 135 minutes of talk time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块电池大约能维持135分钟的通话时间。

Sense.DEF: a person, building, tree etc that is tall is a greater height than normal
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑建筑物﹑树木等〕高的﹐高大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was young and tall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻﹐身材高大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house surrounded by tall trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大树环绕的房子
Sense.EXAMPLE: This bush grows tall very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种灌木很快就能长高。

Sense.DEF: you use ‘tall’ to say or ask what the height of something or someone is
Sense.TRAN: 有…高的﹔身高…的〔用于表示或询问高度〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s only 5 feet tall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只有5英尺高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How tall is that building?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那栋楼有多高？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a little taller than her sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比她姐姐略高一些。

Sense.DEF: a tall drink contains a small amount of alcohol mixed with a large amount of a non-alcoholic drink
a request or piece of work that is almost impossible
Sense.TRAN: 很难实现的要求﹐奢求﹔很难完成的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finding a replacement is going to be a tall order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找个替代者绝非易事。

Sense.DEF: a story that is so unlikely that it is difficult to believe
Sense.TRAN: 荒诞的故事﹔难以置信的事

Sense.DEF: a tall piece of wooden furniture with several drawers

hard animal fat used to make
candles
the practice of criticizing people who are very successful
Sense.TRAN: 高大罂粟花综合征﹐枪打出头鸟〔对成功人士进行批评的做法〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of ship with square sails and very tall
masts
, used especially in the past
a record of how much you have spent, won etc by a particular point in time
Sense.TRAN: 账目﹔〔比赛等活动中赢得的〕积分﹐得分
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final tally was $465,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的支出是46.5万美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the two goals that took his tally for Scotland to 15
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使他在苏格兰队的总进球数达到15个的两粒进球
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep a tally of write down the number of cars that pass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记下经过车辆的数目。

Sense.DEF: if numbers or statements tally, they match exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the records held by the accounts departments did not tally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会计部门的一些账目有出入。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number of ballot papers did not tally with the number of voters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选票数和投票人数不吻合。

Sense.DEF: to calculate a total number
the writings that make up Jewish law about religious and non-religious life
Sense.TRAN: 《塔木德经》〔规范犹太人宗教及世俗生活的法典〕

Sense.DEF: a sharp powerful curved nail on the feet of some birds that catch animals for food
a tropical tree, or the fruit of this tree
a circular musical instrument consisting of a frame covered with skin or plastic and small pieces of metal that hang around the edge. You shake it or hit it with your hand.
a tame animal or bird is not wild any longer, because it has been trained to live with people
Sense.EXAMPLE: tame elephants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驯养的大象

Sense.DEF: dull and disappointing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 评论的大部分内容很乏味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最终认为教书对我来说太枯燥。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a person who is willing to do what other people ask, even if it is slightly dishonest
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you have a tame doctor, he might give you a sick note.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你的医生好说话﹐他可能会给你开个病假条。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister managed to tame the trade unions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相设法把工会掌控住了。

Sense.DEF: to train a wild animal to obey you and not to attack people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Asian elephant can be tamed and trained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚洲象可以被驯服并加以训练。

Sense.DEF:
a drug that is used to treat breast
cancer
Sense.TRAN: 枸橼他莫昔芬﹐三苯氧胺〔用于治疗乳腺癌的一种药物〕
