Sense.DEF: to press or push something down by lightly hitting it several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old man tamped down the tobacco with his thumb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人用大拇指把烟叶压实。

Sense.DEF:
the name of a very common type of
tampon
Sense.TRAN: 丹碧丝〔一种常用的卫生棉条〕

Sense.DEF: to touch something or make changes to it without permission, especially in order to deliberately damage it
Sense.TRAN: 胡乱摆弄﹔擅自改动〔尤指为了故意损坏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He noticed that the instruments had been tampered with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他注意到仪器被人动过了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t see the point in tampering with a system that’s worked fine so far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白一个系统运行得好好的﹐改它干吗。

Sense.DEF: a package or container that is tamper-evident is made so that you can see if someone has opened it before it is sold in the shops
Sense.TRAN: 〔包装或容器〕拆封后易于识别的

Sense.DEF: a package or container that is tamper-proof is made in a way that prevents someone from opening it before it is sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔包装或容器〕防拆封的﹐有防撕扯封条的
〔包装或容器〕拆封后易于识别的

Sense.DEF:
a tube-shaped mass of cotton or similar material that a woman puts inside her
vagina
during her
period monthly flow of blood
Sense.TRAN: 〔妇女用的〕月经棉塞﹐卫生棉条

Sense.DEF: if you tan, or if the sun tans you, your skin becomes darker because you spend time in the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a pale skin which doesn’t tan easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的肤色很白﹐不容易被晒黑。

Sense.DEF:
to make animal skin into leather by treating it with
tannin a kind of acid
the attractive brown colour that someone with pale skin gets after they have been in the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I could get a tan like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿我也能晒成那样的棕褐色肤色。

Sense.DEF: a light yellowish-brown colour
having a light yellowish-brown colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: tan shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棕黄色的鞋子

Sense.DEF: having darker skin after spending time in the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: She arrived home tan and rested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她回到家时皮肤晒黑了﹐人也精神了。

Sense.DEF: a bicycle built for two riders sitting one behind the other
doing something together or at the same time as someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two companies often work in tandem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家公司经常合作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group operated in tandem with local criminals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体和当地的犯罪分子勾结在一起。

Sense.DEF:
tandoori dishes are Indian meat dishes cooked in a clay
oven
Sense.TRAN: 唐杜里烹饪法烧的〔印度用泥炉烹调的一种方法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tandoori restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐杜里饭店
Sense.EXAMPLE: tandoori chicken
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐杜里鸡

Sense.DEF: a taste or smell that is pleasantly strong or sharp
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beer had a sharp, bitter tang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种啤酒有一股强烈的苦味。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the salty tang of the sea
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大海的咸味
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the tang of fresh lemons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜柠檬的香浓味道

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start thinking or talking about a subject that is only slightly related, or not related at all, to the original subject
Sense.TRAN: 突然离开原来的思路﹔突然离题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s stay with the topic and not go off at a tangent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还是继续讨论正题吧﹐不要离题。

Sense.DEF: a straight line that touches the outside of a curve but does not cut across it
tangential information, remarks etc are only related to a particular subject in an indirect way
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况﹑评论等〕不直接相关的﹐关系间接的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The matter you raise is rather tangential to this discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你提出的问题和这次讨论没有多大关系。

Sense.DEF: a small sweet fruit like an orange with a skin that comes off easily
a bright orange colour
clear enough or definite enough to be easily seen or noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme must have tangible benefits for the unemployed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划一定要对失业者有实实在在的好处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has no tangible evidence of John’s guilt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有确凿的证据证明约翰有罪。

Sense.DEF: property such as buildings, equipment etc
if something is tangible, you can touch or feel it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The silence of the countryside was almost tangible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村的寂静几乎能感觉得到。

Sense.DEF: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass
Sense.EXAMPLE: My hair tangles easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的头发很容易打结。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的降落伞缠在了飞机的轮子上。

Sense.DEF: to argue or fight with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was not an animal you’d care to tangle with.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种动物你是不会想和它缠打的。

Sense.DEF: a twisted mass of something such as hair or thread
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was full of tangles after being out in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在外面吹了风之后﹐她的头发变得乱糟糟的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John was sitting on the floor in a tangle of blankets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰坐在地板上一堆乱糟糟的毯子中间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She followed him, pushing through the dense tangle of bushes and branches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跟着他﹐在密密麻麻交缠在一起的灌木和树枝间奋力穿行。

Sense.DEF: a confused state or situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her brain was teeming with a whole tangle of emotions .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脑子里思绪纷乱。

Sense.DEF: a quarrel or fight

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She got into a tangle with the staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和员工争吵起来。

Sense.DEF: twisted together in an untidy mass
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your bedclothes are all tangled up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的床褥乱糟糟的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had hair like tangled string.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头发就像一团乱麻。

Sense.DEF: complicated or not easy to understand
Sense.TRAN: 复杂的﹔混乱的﹔乱糟糟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tangled web of local politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方政坛错综复杂的关系网
Sense.EXAMPLE: tangled emotions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混乱的情绪

Sense.DEF: a fast dance from South America, or a piece of music for this dance
to dance the tango
used to say that if a problem involves two people, then both people are equally responsible
Sense.TRAN: 探戈舞得两个人跳﹔一个巴掌拍不响﹔双方都有责任

Sense.DEF: a large container for storing liquid or gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water tank is leaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水箱在漏水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somehow the chemical got from a storage tank into water supplies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知怎么的﹐这种化学物从储存箱进入了供水系统。

GramExa.GLOSS: for keeping or breeding fish in

Sense.EXAMPLE: the plane’s fuel tank
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的油箱

Sense.DEF: the amount of liquid or gas held in a tank
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体或气体〕满满一箱的容量
Sense.EXAMPLE: We set off next day on a full tank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天我们加满油箱﹐动身离开了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tankful of petrol
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一箱汽油

Sense.DEF: a heavy military vehicle that has a large gun and runs on two metal belts fitted over its wheels
a large artificial pool for storing water
failing and losing money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sales can’t keep going up, but that doesn’t mean the industry is going in the tank.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售额不能持续增长﹐但那并不是说这个行业不景气。

Sense.DEF: to decrease quickly or be very unsuccessful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not long after the chairman resigned, shares in the company tanked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事长辞职后不久﹐该公司的股票就暴跌了。

Sense.DEF: to travel very fast in a car or vehicle
to fail badly and be very unsuccessful
Sense.EXAMPLE: His last film tanked in the States, but did well in the UK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最新的电影在美国一败涂地﹐但在英国却很成功。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately lose a sports game that you could have won
to put petrol in your car so that the tank is full
a large metal cup, usually with a handle, which you can drink beer from
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常有柄、金属制的〕大啤酒杯

Sense.DEF: drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went down the pub and got tanked up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去酒馆喝了个酩酊大醉。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle or ship specially built to carry large quantities of gas or liquid, especially oil
a set of clothes worn by women for swimming. The top piece of clothing covers the body but not the arms.
Sense.TRAN: 坦基尼泳装〔一种两件套女式泳装〕

Sense.DEF:
a piece of clothing like a
sweater
, but with no
sleeves

a piece of clothing like a
t-shirt
but with no
sleeves
having a darker skin colour because you have been in the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a tough tanned face and clear eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他粗犷的脸庞晒得黝黑﹐双眸明亮有神。

Sense.DEF:
someone whose job is to make animal skin into leather by
tanning

a place where animal skin is made into leather by
tanning
a reddish acid used in preparing leather, making ink etc
Sense.TRAN: 单宁（酸）﹐鞣酸〔用于制革﹑制造墨水等〕

Sense.DEF:
a system for giving out information in public places using
loudspeakers
Sense.TRAN: 天朗扩音系统〔一种以扩音器向公众发布消息的播音设备〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The train’s approach was announced over the tannoy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 广播里通知火车就要进站了。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is tanorexic likes spending a lot of time in the sun or using
sunbeds
so that their skin becomes brown, even though they know it is bad for the health of their skin
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢把皮肤晒黑的﹐喜欢晒日光浴的

Sense.DEF: to show or promise something that someone really wants, but then not allow them to have it
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人想要某物却得不到而〕干着急﹔逗引﹔撩拨

Sense.DEF: making you feel a desire to have or do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tantalizing smell of fried bacon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诱人的煎熏猪肉的味道

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She was tantalizingly out of reach.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可望而不可即﹐撩人心怀。

Sense.DEF: if an action, suggestion, plan etc is tantamount to something bad, it has the same effect or is almost as bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔行动﹑建议﹑计划等〕（几乎）等于某（坏）事﹐无异于某（坏）事
Sense.EXAMPLE: To leave a dog home alone is tantamount to cruelty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把狗独自留在家里等于虐待。

Sense.DEF: a sudden short period when someone, especially a child, behaves very angrily and unreasonably
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指孩子突然无理的〕脾气发作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She throws a tantrum when she can’t have the toy she wants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得不到想要的玩具就会大发脾气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: children’s temper tantrums
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子的脾气发作

Sense.DEF: the natural force that unites all things in the universe, according to Taoism
a way of thought developed in ancient China, based on the writings of Lao Tzu, emphasizing a natural and simple way of life
a piece of equipment for controlling the flow of water, gas etc from a pipe or container
Sense.TRAN: 〔水﹑煤气等管道或容器的〕龙头﹐阀门
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tap water water that comes out of a tap is usually heavily treated with chemicals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自来水一般都用化学品严格处理过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went into the bathroom and turned on the taps .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走进浴室﹐打开水龙头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I washed my hands under the kitchen tap.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在厨房水龙头下洗了手。

GramExa.GLOSS: the tap that cold or hot water comes from

Sense.DEF: an act of hitting something lightly, especially to get someone’s attention
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为了引起某人注意〕轻轻敲击﹐轻叩﹐轻拍

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a tap on her shoulder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得有人轻轻拍了拍她的肩膀。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a tap at the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人轻轻地敲了一下门。

Subsense.DEF:
beer that is on tap comes from a
barrel
something that is on tap is ready to use when you need it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got all the information on tap.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有各种信息随时可以利用。

Sense.DEF: dancing in which you wear special shoes with pieces of metal on the bottom which make a loud sharp sound on the floor
an act of secretly listening to someone’s telephone, using electronic equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police had put a tap on his phone line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在他的电话线路上安装了窃听器。

Sense.DEF:
a specially shaped object used for letting liquid out of a
barrel
, especially beer

a song or tune played on the
bugle
at night in an army camp, and at military funerals
Sense.TRAN: 〔军营里晚上的〕熄灯号﹔〔军队的〕葬礼号

Sense.DEF: to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

GramExa.PROPFORM: tap sb on the shoulder/arm/chest etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned as someone tapped him on the shoulder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人轻轻拍了拍他的肩膀﹐他转过身来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went up and tapped on the window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走上去轻轻敲敲窗户。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark tapped his fingers on the tabletop impatiently.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克不耐烦地用手指轻叩桌面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tapped ash from her cigarette.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻弹掉香烟上的灰。

Sense.DEF: to make a regular pattern of sounds with your fingers or feet, especially when you are listening to music
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指听音乐时〕用〔手指或脚〕打节拍
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tapped her feet in time to the music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和着音乐用脚打着节拍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a toe-tapping tune
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢快的曲调

Sense.DEF: to use or take what is needed from something such as an energy supply or an amount of money
Sense.TRAN: 利用﹔发掘﹐开发〔能源﹑资金来源等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People are tapping into the power supply illegally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在非法取电。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope that additional sources of funding can be tapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望还有其他资金来源可以利用。

Sense.DEF: to make as much use as possible of the ideas, experience, knowledge etc that a group of people has
Sense.TRAN: 利用﹐采用〔思想﹑经验﹑知识等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your adviser’s experience is there to be tapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以利用你顾问的经验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: helping people tap into training opportunities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助人们利用培训机会

Sense.DEF: to listen secretly to someone’s telephone by using a special piece of electronic equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Murray’s phone calls to Australia were tapped .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 默里打往澳大利亚的电话被窃听了。

Sense.DEF:
to get liquid from the
trunk
of a tree by making a hole in it
if a football club taps a player from another team, it illegally tries to persuade that player to join its team
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球俱乐部等试图从其他球队〕非法挖〔队员〕

Sense.DEF: to put information, numbers etc into a computer, telephone etc by pressing buttons or keys
Sense.TRAN: 把〔信息﹑数字等〕敲入 [键入﹐输入]〔计算机﹑电话等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tap in your password before you log on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登录前请先输入密码。

Sense.DEF: to hit something lightly, especially with your fingers or foot, in order to make a pattern of sounds
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用手指或脚〕轻敲出〔声音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He whistled the tune and tapped out the rhythm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一边吹着曲子﹐一边打着拍子。

Sense.DEF: to write something with a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian tapped out a name on his small electronic organizer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩在他的小电子记事本上打出一个名字。

Sense.DEF: small dishes of food eaten as part of the first course of a Spanish meal
Sense.TRAN: 〔西班牙菜肴的〕餐前小吃﹐开胃菜

Sense.DEF: dancing in which you wear shoes with pieces of metal on the bottom, which make a sound as you move

Subsense.DEF:
narrow plastic material covered with a special
magnetic
substance, on which you can record sounds, pictures, or computer information
Subsense.TRAN: 〔可以录音﹑录像或刻录计算机信息的〕磁带﹐带子

GramExa.GLOSS: recorded on tape
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve got the film on tape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本片有录像带。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hate hearing my voice on tape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢听我录在磁带上的声音。

Subsense.DEF: a special plastic box containing a length of tape that you can record sound on
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll listen to the tape tomorrow.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天听这盘磁带。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: William lent me some of his Beatles tapes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉把他的披头士磁带借了一些给我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We played a tape of African music and began dancing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们播放了一盘非洲音乐磁带﹐跳起舞来。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bring me a blank tape and I’ll record it for you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带一盘空白磁带给我﹐我帮你录。

Subsense.DEF: a special plastic box containing a length of tape that you can record sound and pictures on

Sense.DEF: a narrow length of plastic that is sticky on one side and is used to stick things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a photo stuck to the wall with tape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用胶布贴在墙上的照片

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of plastic or cloth used for purposes such as marking out an area of ground or tying things together
Sense.TRAN: 〔划分地界或捆扎东西等用的〕带子﹐线带
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crime-scene tape marked out the position of the murdered man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪现场隔离带标出了遇害男子的位置。

Sense.DEF: a string stretched out across the finishing line in a race and broken by the winner

a
tape measure
to record sound or pictures onto a tape
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you mind if I taped this conversation?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你介意我把这次谈话录下来吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quiet – the machine’s still taping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静——机器还在录音。

Sense.DEF: to stick something onto something else using tape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were two pictures taped to the side of the fridge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱一侧贴着两张照片。

Sense.DEF: to fasten a package, box etc with sticky tape
Sense.TRAN: 用胶带把〔包裹﹑箱子等〕缚紧

Sense.DEF:
to tie a
bandage
firmly around an injured part of someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: His ankle had been taped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脚踝已经裹了绷带。

Sense.DEF: to understand someone or something completely and know how to deal with them
Sense.TRAN: 彻底了解某事/某人﹐摸清某事/某人的底细
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t fool Liz – she’s got you taped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你骗不了利兹——她太了解你了。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a
tape recorder
that winds the tape, and records and plays back sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔录音机的〕走带装置﹐磁带卡座

Sense.DEF: a long narrow band of cloth or steel, marked with centimetres, feet etc, used for measuring something
to become gradually narrower towards one end, or to make something become narrower at one end

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His wide chest tapers to a small waist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他胸膛宽阔﹐到腰部逐渐收细。

Sense.DEF: to decrease gradually
Sense.EXAMPLE: Profits may be tapering off in the near future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在不久的将来利润可能会逐渐减少。

Sense.DEF:
a very thin
candle
Sense.EXAMPLE: small boys holding lighted tapers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿着点燃的细蜡烛的小男孩

Sense.DEF:
a piece of string covered in
wax
, used for lighting lamps,
candles
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔点灯﹑点蜡烛等用的〕点火蜡线﹐火媒
Sense.EXAMPLE: The box contained a taper to light each firework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盒子里装了根火媒﹐用来点燃每一个烟花。

Sense.DEF: to record sound using a tape recorder
a piece of electrical equipment that can record sound on tape and play it back
something that has been recorded with a tape recorder

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court heard tape recordings of the meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭听取了会议录音。

Sense.DEF: having a shape that gets narrower towards one end
Sense.TRAN: 一端逐渐变得尖细的﹔锥形的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tapered trousers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锥形裤

Sense.DEF: a large piece of heavy cloth on which coloured threads are woven to produce a picture, pattern etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colourful tapestry depicting a hunting scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 描绘狩猎场面的彩色壁毯

Sense.DEF: something that is made up of many different people and things
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was all new to her – part of life’s rich tapestry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是七彩生活的一部分——一切对她来说是那么新奇。

Sense.DEF:
a long flat
worm
that lives in the
bowels
of humans and other animals and can make them ill
Sense.TRAN: 绦虫〔肠内的一种寄生虫〕

Sense.DEF:
small hard white grains made from the crushed dried roots of
cassava
, or a
dessert
made from cooking this
Sense.TRAN: 〔木薯粉制成的〕西米﹔西米甜点

Sense.DEF: an animal like a pig with thick legs, a short tail, and a long nose, that lives in tropical America and Southeast Asia
Sense.TRAN: 貘〔一种像猪的动物﹐腿粗 尾短﹐鼻长﹐生活于热带美洲和东南亚〕

Sense.DEF: the large main root of a plant, from which smaller roots grow

water that comes out of a
tap
rather than a bottle
a black substance, thick and sticky when hot but hard when cold, used especially for making road surfaces
a sticky substance that forms when tobacco burns, and that gets into the lungs of people who smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: high tar cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高焦香烟

Sense.DEF: to cover a surface with tar
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tarred roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涂过沥青的屋顶

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/get tarred with the same brush
Sense.DEF: if someone is tarred with the same brush as someone else, people think they have the same faults or have committed the same crimes, even if they have not
Sense.TRAN: 被认为有同样缺点﹐被看成一路货色
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve made it very clear that you think I’m tarred with the same brush as William.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经十分明确地表示﹐你认为我和威廉是一丘之貉。

Sense.DEF: to cover someone in tar and feathers as a cruel unofficial punishment
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某人〕涂柏油粘羽毛〔一种残酷的私刑〕

Sense.DEF: a Greek food consisting of a pink creamy mixture made from fish eggs
a fast Italian dance, or the music for this dance
Sense.TRAN: 塔兰台拉舞〔一种意大利快步舞〕﹔塔兰台拉舞曲

Sense.DEF:
a large poisonous
spider
from Southern Europe and tropical America
Sense.TRAN: 塔兰托毒蛛〔见于南欧及热带美洲的一种有毒大蜘蛛〕

Sense.DEF: arriving or done late
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do please forgive this tardy reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟复为歉﹐敬请原谅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been tardy three times this semester.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这学期他已经迟到三次了。

Sense.DEF: doing something too slowly or late

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people who are tardy in paying their bills
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 付账单拖拉的人

Sense.DEF: the weight of the materials in which goods are packed
the weight of an unloaded vehicle, used to calculate the actual weight of the goods in it
something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: demanding financial targets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高的财务指标

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the target of a one-third reduction in road accidents
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路交通事故减少三分之一的目标

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Higher degrees in English are a target for foreign students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得英语高等学位是外国学生的目标。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no target date for completion of the new project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government may fail to meet achieve its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

GramExa.GLOSS: likely to achieve a target
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company says that growth of 10% is on target.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司声称10%的增长目标可望实现。

Sense.DEF: an object, person, or place that is deliberately chosen to be attacked

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Railway stations are prime targets very likely targets for bombs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车站是炸弹袭击的主要目标。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cars without security devices are an easy target for the thief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有防盗装置的汽车很容易成为小偷下手的目标。

Sense.DEF: the person or place that is most directly affected by an action, especially a bad one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The area has become a prime target for supermarket development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区成了发展超市的首选之地。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The country is a target of criticism for its human rights record.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国因其人权记录而成为批评的对象。

Sense.DEF: something that you practise shooting at, especially a round board with circles on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is used by the army for target practice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地方被军队用来练习打靶。

Sense.DEF: a limited group, area etc that a plan, idea etc is aimed at
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our target audience is men aged between 18 and 35.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标受众是18到35岁之间的男性。

Sense.DEF: the language that you are learning or that you are translating into
Sense.TRAN: 目标语言﹐目的语﹔译入语

Sense.DEF: to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The advertisement was designed to target a mass audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个广告是针对大众的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new benefit targeted on low-income families
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项针对低收入家庭的新的福利
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The programme is targeted at improving the health of women of all ages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划的目的是提高各年龄层妇女的健康水平。

Sense.DEF: to aim something at a target

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The missiles are targeted at several key military sites.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些导弹瞄准了几个主要的军事地点。

Sense.DEF: to choose a particular person or place to do something to, especially to attack them or criticize them
Sense.TRAN: 把…选为目标〔尤为了攻击或批评〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s clear that smaller, more vulnerable banks have been targeted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很明显﹐规模较小﹑实力较弱的银行已被确定为目标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was targeted by terrorists for a second time last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他昨晚第二次成为恐怖分子的袭击目标。

Sense.DEF: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of a country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government may impose tariffs on imports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府可能要对进口货物征收关税。

Sense.DEF: a list of fixed prices charged by a hotel or restaurant, for example for the cost of meals or rooms
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐厅或宾馆的〕收费表﹐价目表

Sense.DEF:
a list or system of prices which
mobile phone
companies charge for the services they provide
Sense.TRAN: 〔移动电话的〕资费表﹔资费机制

Sense.DEF:
a mixture of
tar
and very small stones, used for making the surface of roads
an area covered with tarmac outside airport buildings
Sense.TRAN: 铺有柏油碎石的飞机跑道[停机坪]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Journalists waited on the tarmac to question him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者们在停机坪上等候着向他提问。

Sense.DEF: to cover a road’s surface with tarmac
a small lake among mountains

if an event or fact tarnishes someone’s
reputation
, record, image etc, it makes it worse
Sense.TRAN: 玷污﹐败坏﹐损害〔名誉﹑形象等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His regime was tarnished by human rights abuses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的政权因践踏人权而形象受损。

Sense.DEF:
if metals such as silver,
copper
, or
brass
tarnish, or if something tarnishes them, they become dull and lose their colour
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔银﹑铜等金属〕失去光泽﹐变暗淡
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gold does not tarnish easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金色泽不容易变暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: tarnished silver spoons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发乌的银勺

Sense.DEF: dullness of colour, or loss of brightness
a tropical plant grown for its thick root, which is boiled and eaten
a set of 78 cards, used for telling what will happen to someone in the future
Sense.TRAN: 塔罗牌〔一套用于占卜的纸牌﹐共78张〕

Sense.DEF: a large heavy cloth or piece of thick plastic that water will not pass through, used to keep rain off things
the leaves of a small European plant, used in cooking to give food a special taste
Sense.TRAN: 龙蒿叶〔一种欧洲植物﹐烹调时用于调味〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken with tarragon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙蒿叶煮鸡肉

Sense.DEF: to stay in a place, especially when you should leave
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指应离开时〕逗留﹐停留﹔徘徊

Sense.DEF: to delay or be slow in going somewhere

covered with
tar a thick black liquid
Sense.TRAN: 涂了柏油的﹐以柏油覆盖的

Sense.DEF:
your
ankle
, or one of the seven small bones in your ankle
Sense.TRAN: 脚踝﹔跗骨〔踝部的七块小骨头之一〕

Sense.DEF:
a
pie
without a top on it, containing something sweet
Sense.TRAN: 〔顶部不用面皮密封的〕甜馅饼

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果馅/糖浆馅/果酱馅等甜馅饼

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for a woman who you think is too willing to have sex

a
prostitute
food that is tart has a sharp sour taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tart apple
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸苹果

Sense.DEF: a reply, remark etc that is sharp and unkind

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不这么认为！”她尖刻地回答道。

Sense.DEF: to try to make something more attractive by decorating it, often in a way that other people think is cheap or ugly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll need to tart the place up a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要把这里稍稍装饰一下。

Sense.TRAN: 〔女性〕打扮自己〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got all tarted up for the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打扮得花枝招展﹐准备去参加聚会。

Sense.DEF: a traditional Scottish pattern of coloured squares and crossed lines, or cloth, especially wool cloth, with this pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: the MacGregor tartan the special pattern worn by the MacGregor family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦格雷戈家族的格子图案

Sense.DEF: a hard substance that forms on your teeth
someone who has a violent temper
Sense.TRAN: 凶悍的人﹐脾气暴戾的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a real tartar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她真是一个悍妇。

Sense.DEF:
a cold white sauce often eaten with fish, made from egg, oil,
gherkins
and
capers
Sense.TRAN: 鞑靼酱﹐蛋黄调味汁〔吃鱼时常用的一种调味酱〕

Sense.DEF: a strong acid that comes from a plant and is used in preparing some foods and medicines
Sense.TRAN: 酒石酸〔用于制作某些食品和药品〕

Sense.DEF: a woman who looks tarty looks like she is too willing for sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think this dress looks too tarty?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得这条裙子看起来是不是太妖艳了？

Sense.DEF:
the main character in books by Edgar Rice Burroughs, which were later made into many films, about a baby who is left in the African forest and is cared for by
apes
until he becomes a man
Sense.TRAN: 泰山〔埃德加•赖斯•巴勒斯所著系列小说中的主人公﹐小说后来被改编成多部影片〕

Sense.DEF: a type of gun used by the police, which produces a strong electric current. It makes someone unable to move for a short time, by giving them a small electric shock.
Sense.TRAN: 泰瑟枪〔能产生强大电流的警用武器〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指困难的﹑令人不快的或必须定期做的〕工作﹐任务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The task of the union representative is to fight on behalf of the members.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会代表的任务就是为工会成员争取利益。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was given the task of building a fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我分配到生火的任务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the skills required to carry out these tasks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执行这些任务所需要的技能
Sense.EXAMPLE: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our first task is to gather information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有个令人头疼的工作﹐就是管理国家最危险的监狱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单﹐吃力不讨好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say job rather than task .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说job﹐不说task
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I was given the job of building the fire.

Sense.DEF: to strongly criticize somebody for something they have done
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某人所做之事〕严厉批评某人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was taken to task for not reporting the problem earlier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为没有早点报告问题而受到了严厉批评。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the responsibility for doing something
Sense.TRAN: 交给〔某人〕任务﹔派给〔某人〕工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were tasked with completing the job by the end of 2006.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们接到任务﹐要在2006年年底之前完成这项工作。

Sense.DEF: a narrow area across the bottom of a computer screen, that shows which documents or programs are open
a group formed for a short time to deal with a particular problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔为处理某一特定问题而暂时组成的〕工作组

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a task force on health care reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健改革工作组

Sense.DEF: a military force sent to a place for a special purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队的〕特别行动小组﹐特遣部队

Sense.DEF: to force people to work very hard
threads tied together at one end and hung as a decoration on clothes, curtains etc

Subsense.DEF: the feeling that is produced by a particular food or drink when you put it in your mouth
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The medicine had a slightly bitter taste.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这药略带苦味。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t really like the taste of meat any more.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经不太喜欢肉的味道了。

Subsense.DEF: the sense by which you know one food from another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Some birds have a highly developed sense of taste .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些鸟的味觉很发达。

Subsense.DEF: if you have a taste of some food or drink, you put a small amount in your mouth to try it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You must have a taste of the fruitcake.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定得尝尝这水果蛋糕。

Sense.DEF: the kind of things that someone likes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He asked about my taste in music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他问我喜欢什么音乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: While she was in France she developed a taste for fine wines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在法国的时候喜欢上了美酒。

Sense.DEF: someone’s judgment when they choose clothes, decorations etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对衣服﹑饰品等的〕鉴赏力﹐品位﹐趣味

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has such good taste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的品位很高雅。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people have really bad taste in clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人的衣着品位实在太糟糕。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 可以接受的/不会得罪人的东西
Sense.DEF: the quality of being acceptable and not offensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: All television companies accept the need to maintain standards of taste and decency .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有电视公司都认同﹐电视节目需要保持一定的情趣和格调。

GramExa.GLOSS: likely to offend people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She acknowledged her remark had been in bad taste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她承认她的话很不得体。

Sense.DEF: a short experience of something that shows you what it is like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Schoolchildren can get a taste of the countryside first-hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学童可以亲身体验一下乡村生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It gave him his first taste of acting for the big screen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让他有了拍电影的初次体验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The autumn storms gave us a taste of what was to come showed what would happen later .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几场秋天的暴风雨让我们体会到接下来还会有什么。

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you have after an experience, especially a bad experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经历不好的事情之后的〕感受﹐感觉﹐滋味
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way he spoke to those children left a nasty taste in my mouth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对那些孩子的说话方式让我觉得很不是滋味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bitter taste of failure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失败的苦涩滋味
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sweet taste of victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜利的甜美滋味

Sense.DEF: if you add salt, spices etc to taste, you add as much as you think makes it taste right – used in instructions in cook books
Sense.TRAN: 按照个人的口味﹐适量地〔用于烹饪书中的说明〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add salt to taste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依个人口味加盐。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: give sb a taste of their own medicine

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have similar musical tastes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有相似的音乐品位。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their tastes in movies were very different.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在电影方面的喜好大不相同。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was a man of expensive tastes he liked expensive things.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个喜欢昂贵东西的人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: he liked simple things
liking a wide variety of different things
something that people do not like at first

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Josh and I have the same tastes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和乔什的喜好相同。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: like something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She certainly has a taste for adventure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的确喜欢冒险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to start to like something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: At university she developed a taste for performing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 读大学时她喜欢上了表演。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have the same taste as someone else
provide what someone likes
be something that someone likes
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If her books are not to your taste, there are plenty of books by other writers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是她的书不合你意﹐还有许多其他作者的书。

Collocate.COLLOC: be too bright/modern etc for sb’s taste
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 太鲜艳/摩登等而不合某人口味
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The building was too modern for my taste.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这建筑太现代﹐我不喜欢。

Collocate.COLLOC: sth is a matter of taste
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: different people have different opinions about what is good or right
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某事物是个人喜好问题

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used humorously to say that you do not understand why someone likes something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 各有所爱〔幽默地表示无法理解某人的喜好〕

Section.SECHEADING: DESCRIBING THE TASTE OF SOMETHING 描述某物的味道

Exponent.DEF: having a very good taste
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This cake is delicious!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这蛋糕很好吃！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a delicious meal
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美味的一餐

Exponent.DEF: having a very bad taste
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The medicine tasted disgusting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这药真难吃。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They had to eat revolting things, like fish eyes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不得不吃令人作呕的东西﹐譬如鱼眼睛之类。

Exponent.DEF: tasting full of sugar
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The oranges were very sweet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 橙子很甜。

Exponent.DEF: tasting good and with plenty of flavour
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She cooked us a simple but tasty meal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为我们做了一顿简单而可口的饭。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That was really tasty!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真的很好吃！

Exponent.DEF: having a taste that stings your tongue slightly, like lemon does – used especially when this is rather unpleasant
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The apples were a little sour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些苹果有点酸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The wine has rather a tart taste, which not everyone will like.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这酒很酸﹐不是所有人都喜欢喝。

Exponent.DEF: having a taste that stings your tongue slightly, like lemon does, in a way that seems good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dressing was nice and tangy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 调料好吃且开胃。

Exponent.DEF: having a strong taste which is not sweet and is sometimes rather unpleasant – used for example about black coffee, or chocolate without sugar
Exponent.TRAN: 〔清咖啡或无糖巧克力等〕苦的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: bitter chocolate
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 带苦味的巧克力
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The medicine had rather a bitter taste.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这药很苦。

Exponent.DEF: containing a lot of salt
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Danish salami has a salty flavour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹麦萨拉米香肠很咸。

Exponent.DEF: having a burning taste because it contains strong spices
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I love hot curries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢辣的咖喱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a spicy tomato sauce
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 辣味番茄酱

Exponent.DEF: a little spicy – used especially by people who write about food. This word can sound rather pretentious in everyday conversation.
Exponent.TRAN: 微辣的〔尤为美食评论家所用﹐日常会话中听上去较为做作〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: cooked vegetables in a piquant sauce
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用微辣酱汁烹制的蔬菜

Exponent.DEF: not having a strong or hot taste – usually used about foods that can sometimes be spicy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a mild curry
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 微辣咖喱

Exponent.DEF: not having an interesting taste
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I found the sauce rather bland.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这酱汁淡而无味。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular kind of taste

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mmm! This tastes good!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 呣！好吃！

Sense.EXAMPLE: The food tasted better than it looked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这食物吃起来味道比看上去要好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coffee tasted awful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡很难喝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This yoghurt tastes of strawberries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这酸奶是草莓味的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It didn’t taste much of ginger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有多少姜的味道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It tastes just like champagne to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐它的味道就像香槟酒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What does pumpkin taste like how would you describe its taste ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南瓜是什么味道？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sweet-tasting soup
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 甜味的汤

Sense.DEF: to experience or recognize the taste of food or drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could taste blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尝到了血的味道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you taste the difference?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能吃出有什么不同吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was like nothing I’d ever tasted before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的味道和我以前吃过的东西都不一样。

Sense.DEF: to eat or drink a small amount of something to see what it is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s always best to keep tasting the food while you’re cooking it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做菜的时候最好是边做边尝。

Sense.DEF: to have a short experience of something that you want more of
Sense.TRAN: 尝到成功/自由/胜利等的滋味
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a lot of hard work before we first tasted success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们经过非常艰苦的努力﹐总算初次尝到了成功的滋味。

Sense.DEF: one of the small parts of the surface of your tongue with which you can taste things
made, decorated, or chosen with good taste
Sense.TRAN: 有品位的﹐有鉴赏力的﹐趣味高雅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tasteful furnishings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 趣味高雅的家具陈设
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with tasty. Use tasty to describe food that tastes good. 不要与tasty混淆。tasty用于形容食物美味: This food is really tasty. 这食物真的很美味。

Sense.DEF: food or drink that is tasteless is unpleasant because it has no particular taste
slightly offensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tasteless remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得体的话语

Sense.DEF: made, decorated, or chosen with bad taste
Sense.TRAN: 没有品位的﹐格调很低的﹐庸俗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tasteless outfit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套没有品位的衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: ugly and tasteless housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑陋﹑无品位的住宅

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to test the quality of foods, teas, wines etc by tasting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wine taster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 品酒师

Sense.DEF: a small example of something that is provided so that you can see if you like it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here’s a taster of what will be in print next month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿有一份下个月刊载内容的小样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a taster from her next album
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下一张专辑的小样

Sense.DEF: used after a noun to describe something as being or involving something very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can win tickets for this rocktastic show show with very good rock songs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来赢取此次摇滚表演的入场券吧。

Sense.DEF: an event that is organized so that you can try different foods or drinks to see if you like them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wine and cheese tasting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次葡萄酒和奶酪品尝会

Sense.DEF: food that is tasty has a good taste, but is not sweet
Sense.TRAN: 好吃的﹐味道好的﹐味美可口的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a simple but tasty meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单而可口的饭菜

Sense.DEF:
tasty news,
gossip
etc is especially interesting and often connected with sex or surprising behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔新闻﹑传闻等〕特别有趣的﹐与奇闻趣事有关的

Sense.DEF: sexually attractive
things that are cheap and badly made
Sense.TRAN: 不值钱的东西﹔质量低劣的东西

Sense.DEF:
an informal American word for
tattoo
goodbye
a potato
clothes, books etc that are tattered are old and torn
Sense.EXAMPLE: He produced a tattered envelope from his pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从口袋里掏出一个破烂的信封。

Subsense.DEF:
if a plan or someone’s
reputation
is in tatters, it is ruined
Subsense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑声誉等〕千疮百孔的﹐被毁的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tonight, the peace agreement lies in tatters.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚﹐和平协议被彻底撕毁了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His credibility is in tatters after a series of defeats and failures.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过多次失败后他信誉扫地。

Subsense.DEF: clothes that are in tatters are old and torn

Sense.DEF: clothing that is old and torn
a potato - used in Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 马铃薯﹐土豆〔用于苏格兰〕

Sense.DEF:
a kind of
lace
that you make by hand, or the process of making it
Sense.TRAN: 手工梭织花边﹔手工梭织花边工艺

Sense.DEF: to talk about other people’s private lives
if a child tattles, they tell a parent or teacher that another child has done something bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Robert is always tattling on me for things I didn’t do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特总是乱打我的小报告。

Sense.DEF: a word meaning someone who tattles - used by or to children
Sense.TRAN: 打小报告者﹐搬弄是非者〔儿语〕

Sense.DEF: a picture or writing that is permanently marked on your skin using a needle and ink
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a tattoo of a snake on his left arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的左臂上刺了一条蛇。

Sense.DEF: an outdoor military show with music, usually at night
Sense.TRAN: 〔常在夜间举行的﹑有音乐伴奏的〕军操表演

Sense.DEF: a fast continuous beating of a drum, or a sound like this
Sense.TRAN: 快速的击鼓﹔快速的敲击声

Sense.DEF: to mark a permanent picture or writing on someone’s skin with a needle and ink
Sense.TRAN: 在〔皮肤〕上刺花纹﹐给…文身
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got a heart tattooed on her right shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她右肩上刺了一个心形图案。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is tattooing
Sense.TRAN: 专门替人文身的人﹐文身师

Sense.DEF: a place where you can go to get a tattoo
in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: tatty jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破旧的牛仔裤
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few tatty old chairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几把破旧的椅子

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
teach
to try to make someone angry or upset by saying unkind things to them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other children taunted him about his weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别的孩子嘲笑他长得胖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They taunted him with the nickname ‘Fatso’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们嘲弄他﹐给他起个绰号叫“胖子”。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘And he’ll believe you, will he?’ Maria taunted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他会相信你的﹐对吧？”玛丽亚嘲讽道。

Sense.DEF: a remark or joke intended to make someone angry or upset
Sense.TRAN: 言语挑衅﹔侮辱﹔嘲弄﹐讥笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: racist taunts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族主义嘲讽言论

Sense.DEF: a brownish-grey colour

the second sign of the
zodiac
, represented by a
bull
, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between April 21 and May 21
someone who was born between April 21 and May 21
Sense.TRAN: 属金牛座的人〔即在4月21日至5月21日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF: stretched tight
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rope was stretched taut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绳子绷紧了。

Sense.DEF: showing signs of worry, anger etc and not relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a taut smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忧虑的笑容
Sense.EXAMPLE: Catherine looked upset, her face taut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳显得心绪不宁﹐脸色紧张。

Sense.DEF: having firm muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: her taut brown body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那黝黑结实的身体

Sense.DEF: a taut book, film, or play is exciting and does not have any unnecessary parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影﹑戏剧〕结构严谨的﹐紧凑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a taut thriller
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情节紧凑的惊悚小说

Sense.DEF: to make something stretch tight, or to become stretched tight
a statement in which you say the same thing twice using different words in a way which is not necessary, for example, ‘He sat alone by himself.’

a
pub
where you can also stay the night
a word for a bar, often used in the name of a bar
Sense.TRAN: 酒馆﹐酒吧〔常用于酒吧名〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Murphy’s Tavern
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨菲酒馆

Sense.DEF: cheaply and badly made
Sense.TRAN: 廉价的﹐不值钱的﹔制作粗糙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tawdry jewellery and fake furs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 廉价珠宝和人造裘皮

Sense.DEF: showing low moral standards
Sense.TRAN: 粗俗的﹔下流的﹔卑鄙的﹔卑污的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tawdry tale of lies and deception
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满谎言和欺骗的无耻鬼话

Sense.DEF: brownish-yellow in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lion’s tawny fur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狮子的黄褐色毛皮

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you must pay to the government according to your income, property, goods etc and that is used to pay for public services

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tax on fuel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃油税
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He already pays 40% tax on his income.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的收入已经要缴40%的税了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: profits before tax of £85.9 m
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 8,590万英镑的税前利润

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many people feel they are paying too much tax.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人觉得税负太重。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He claimed the Labour Party would put up taxes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称工党将增税。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Higher taxes will slow down consumer spending.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高税收会降低消费支出。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Republican voters say they want lower taxes and sensible spending cuts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党选民称他们需要更低的税赋以及合理的开支削减。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: （tax paid on money that you earn）
a tax on things you buy
tax paid on money, property etc that you receive from someone when they die

Collocate.COLLOC: the tax rate/the rate of tax
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government reduced the basic rate of tax to 25p in the pound.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府将基础税率调低至每镑25便士。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He believes that big tax cuts will encourage economic growth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相信﹐大幅度减税会刺激经济增长。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He accused the president of planning the biggest tax increases in U.S. history.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责总统策划了美国历史上最大的一次增税。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: lower taxes that encourage people to do something
an amount you can earn without paying tax on it

Sense.DEF: to charge a tax on something

GramExa.PROPFORM: tax sth at 10%/a higher rate etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They may be taxed at a higher rate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能会以更高税率对他们征税。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The individual is taxed on the amount of dividend received.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人的红利所得要纳税。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Cigarettes are heavily taxed in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国﹐香烟被课以重税。

Sense.DEF: to pay the sum of money charged each year for using a vehicle on British roads
Sense.TRAN: 缴纳〔车辆〕的道路使用税

Sense.DEF: to make someone have to work hard or make an effort
Sense.TRAN: 使负重担﹔使费力气﹔使伤脑筋

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids are really taxing my patience today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们今天真是考验我的耐心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It shouldn’t tax your brain too much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个应该不会太费脑筋。

Sense.DEF: to complain to someone they have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 因…而责备〔某人〕﹐为…而谴责〔某人〕

Sense.DEF: if money that you receive is taxable, you have to pay tax on it

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 应纳税的收入/利润/收益等

Sense.DEF: the system of charging taxes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s economic and taxation policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的经济和税收政策

GramExa.GLOSS: tax on income
tax on things you buy
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 间接税〔即商品或货物税〕

Sense.DEF: money collected from taxes
Sense.EXAMPLE: higher levels of taxation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 较高的税率

Sense.DEF: the practice of trying to pay less tax in legal ways
a particular range of income levels on which the same rate of tax is paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may put you in a higher tax bracket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样可能会把你归入更高的税率级别。

Sense.DEF: a special reduction in taxes
Sense.EXAMPLE: tax breaks for small businesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给小企业的减税优惠

Sense.DEF: someone who works for the government and makes sure that people pay their taxes
tax-deductible costs can be taken off your total income before it is taxed
Sense.TRAN: 〔在课税前〕可从个人总收入中扣除的﹔课税减免的
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re self-employed, your travel expenses are tax-deductible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你是自由职业者﹐你的差旅开支可在计税前从总收入中扣除。

Sense.DEF: not taxed until a later time
Sense.EXAMPLE: tax-deferred savings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 延后扣税的存款

Sense.DEF:
a small round piece of paper on a car
windscreen
in Britain that shows the driver has paid
road tax
Sense.TRAN: 圆形纳税证〔英国贴于汽车挡风玻璃上的圆形小纸片﹐表示路税已付〕

Sense.DEF: a way of paying less tax
the crime of paying too little tax

if
savings
, income etc are tax exempt, you do not have to pay tax on them
someone who lives abroad in order to avoid paying high taxes in their own country
Sense.TRAN: 税收流亡者﹐出国避税者〔指为逃避国内高额税款而移居国外的人〕

Sense.DEF: not taxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was paid a tax-free cash sum as compensation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给了他一笔免税的现金作为补偿。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: You can earn up to £65 per week tax-free.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的每周收入最多有65英镑可以免税。

Sense.DEF: a place where people go to live to avoid paying high taxes in their own country
Sense.TRAN: 避税者乐园﹐避税天堂〔指税率低的地方﹐许多人为躲避国内高额税赋而移居此地〕

Sense.DEF: a car and driver that you pay to take you somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sent me home in a taxi.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用出租车把我送回家。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We took a taxi to the hotel.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乘出租车去酒店。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I went back home by taxi.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐出租车回了家。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: wave or call to a taxi to stop for you to get in
telephone for a taxi to come
telephone for a taxi to come for someone else

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The centre of town is a five minute taxi ride away.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇中心离这儿乘出租车五分钟。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t afford the £18 taxi fare.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她付不起18英镑的出租车费。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a place where taxis wait for customers
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 出租车站﹐出租车候客点

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘get on a taxi’. Say 而要说 get in a taxi .

Sense.DEF: if a plane taxis, it moves along the ground before taking off or after landing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane taxied to a halt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机滑行一段距离后停下来。

Sense.DEF: a taxi
someone whose job is taxidermy
the art of filling the skins of dead animals, birds, or fish with a special material so that they look as though they are alive
needing a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job turned out to be more taxing than I’d expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来发觉这个工作比我原来想的要辛苦。

Sense.DEF: someone who works for the government, deciding how much tax a person or company should pay
a place where taxis wait for customers
Sense.TRAN: 出租车候客点﹐出租车站﹐的士站

Sense.DEF:
the surface which an aircraft drives on to get to and from the
runway
the government department that collects taxes
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the money will go straight to the taxman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱中很大一部分将直接上交税务部门。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is collecting taxes
the process or a system of organizing things into different groups that show their natural relationships, especially plants or animals
a person that pays tax
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal could cost the taxpayer all ordinary people who pay tax another £18m a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个提议也许又要让纳税人一年多花1,800万英镑。

Sense.DEF: when you do not have to pay tax on part of what you earn, especially because you use the money for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can get tax relief on private health insurance premiums.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交私人医疗保险费可以享受税款减免。

Sense.DEF: the form on which you have to give information so that your tax can be calculated
a plan or method that allows you to legally avoid paying tax
the period of 12 months in which income is calculated for paying taxes. The tax year begins on April 6th in Britain, and January 1st in the US.
a serious infectious disease that affects the lungs and other body parts
used in writing to show that a time, place etc will be given or decided later
Sense.TRAN: 待宣布﹐待决定〔用于书面语〕

Sense.DEF:
an easy form of
baseball
for young children
used in writing to show that the time, place etc of a future event is not yet definite
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert will be in Harrogate (venue tbc) on the 29th.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会将于29日在哈罗盖特（场地待定）举行。

Sense.DEF:
a thinly cut piece of
beef
that has a T-shaped bone in it

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= tablespoon or 或 tablespoons 一汤匙之量
Sense.EXAMPLE: 1 tbsp sugar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一汤匙糖

Sense.DEF:
a type of
white blood cell
that helps the body fight disease
Sense.TRAN: T细胞〔一种帮助人体抵御疾病的白细胞〕

Subsense.DEF: a hot brown drink made by pouring boiling water onto the dried leaves from a particular Asian bush, or a cup of this drink
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a cup of tea or coffee?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想来一杯茶还是咖啡？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you take milk and sugar in your tea?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的茶里面要放牛奶和糖吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like two teas and a piece of chocolate cake, please.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要两杯茶和一块巧克力蛋糕。

Subsense.DEF: dried, finely cut leaves that are used to make tea
bushes whose leaves are used to make tea
Subsense.EXAMPLE: tea plantations
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茶叶种植园

Sense.DEF: a hot drink made by pouring boiling water onto leaves or flowers, sometimes used as a medicine
Sense.TRAN: 薄荷茶/甘菊茶等〔用某些叶子或花泡的饮料﹐有时作药用〕

Subsense.DEF:
a small meal of cake or
biscuits
eaten in the afternoon with a cup of tea
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We serve lunch and afternoon tea .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提供午餐和下午茶。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We stopped for a cream tea on the way home tea and cream cakes .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家的路上我们停下来喝了茶吃了奶油蛋糕。

Subsense.DEF: used in some parts of Britain to mean a large meal that is eaten early in the evening
Subsense.TRAN: 〔英国某些地方傍晚时分吃的〕晚餐

Sense.DEF: kindness and attention that you give someone when they are upset

Crossrefto.REFLEX: not be your cup of tea

Sense.DEF: a small paper bag with tea leaves inside, used for making tea
a short pause from work in the middle of the morning or afternoon for a drink, a rest etc
Sense.TRAN: 茶歇时间〔上午或下午工作中间的短暂休息〕

Sense.DEF: a small metal box that you keep tea in

a small flat round amount of bread with
raisins
or
currants
in it
Sense.TRAN: 茶点心〔一种含葡萄干的扁平圆形小面包〕

Sense.DEF: to give lessons in a school, college, or university, or to help someone learn about something by giving them information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Neil teaches at the Guildhall School of Music in London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔在伦敦吉尔德霍尔音乐学校教书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He taught geography at the local secondary school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在当地中学教授地理。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were never taught anything about other religions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从未接受过其他宗教的教育。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m teaching English to Italian students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在给意大利学生上英语课。

GramExa.GLOSS: teach in a school etc

Sense.DEF: to show someone how to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father taught me to swim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲教我游泳。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: different methods of teaching children how to read
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教儿童识字的不同方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you teach me one of your card tricks?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能教我一种纸牌戏法吗？

Sense.DEF: to show or tell someone how they should behave or what they should think

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When I was young, we were taught to treat older people with respect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小的时候﹐我们受的教育是要尊敬老人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one ever taught him the difference between right and wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从未有人教过他分辨是非。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He taught me that the easy option isn’t always the best one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让我明白了简便的选择并非总是最好。

Sense.DEF: if an experience or situation teaches you something, it helps you to understand something about life

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Experience has taught me to avoid certain areas of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经验告诉我要避开城里的某些区域。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s certainly taught me that work and money aren’t the most important things in life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事无疑告诉我工作和金钱不是生活中最重要的东西。

Sense.DEF: used when something unpleasant has just happened to someone because they acted stupidly
Sense.TRAN: 这是（做某事）给你的教训
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’ll teach you to be late!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫你迟到！

Sense.DEF: if someone or something teaches you a lesson, you are punished for something you have done, so that you will not want to do it again

Sense.LEXUNIT: you can’t teach an old dog new tricks
Sense.DEF: used to say that older people often do not want to change the way they do things
Sense.TRAN: 老狗学不会新把戏﹐老人很难接受新事物

Sense.DEF: to give someone advice about something that they already know
Sense.TRAN: 班门弄斧﹐在行家面前卖弄

Exponent.DEF: to give lessons in a school, college, or university
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I taught for a year in France.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在法国教了一年书。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He teaches physics at York University.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在约克大学教授物理。

Exponent.DEF: to teach in a college or university by giving talks to groups of students on a subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lectures in engineering at a local college.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一所地方大学教工程学。

Exponent.DEF: to teach someone how to do something, especially a particular practical skill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was instructing them how to use the computer system.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在教他们如何使用这套电脑系统。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Staff are instructed in how to respond in the event of a fire.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工学习遇到火情时如何应对。

Exponent.DEF: to teach one student or a small group
Exponent.TRAN: 教授〔一个或一小组学生〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I found work tutoring Mexican students in English.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找了份教墨西哥学生英语的工作。

Exponent.DEF: to give private lessons, especially so that someone can pass an important test
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为使某人通过重要考试〕私人辅导
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He coaches students for their university entrance exams.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他辅导学生准备大学入学考试。

Exponent.DEF: to teach a person or group of people in the particular skills or knowledge they need to do a job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It will take at least a month to train the new assistant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 培训新助理至少要一个月。

Exponent.DEF: to teach someone over a long period, usually at school or university
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was educated in England.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是在英格兰受的教育。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her parents want to educate her at home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母想在家教她。

Exponent.DEF: to show someone how to do a job or task that they have just started doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Miss McGinley will show you the ropes and answer any questions you may have.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦金利小姐会教你怎么做﹐并解答你的任何问题。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to teach, especially in a school
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primary school teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学教师

GramExa.GLOSS: professional training to become a teacher

Exponent.DEF: someone who teaches as their job, especially in a school
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a high school teacher
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中学教师

Exponent.DEF: the teacher who is in charge of a school or college
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The teacher sent him to the principal’s office.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位老师叫他去校长办公室。

Exponent.DEF: someone who gives private lessons to one student or a small group of students. In Britain, a tutor is also a teacher in a university.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔教授单个或一小组学生的〕私人教师〔在英国tutor也指大学教师〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They hired a tutor to help him with his English.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们请了一位家教来教他英语。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your tutor will help you find a subject for your essay.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师会指导你的论文选题。

Exponent.DEF: someone who teaches in a university or college
Exponent.EXAMPLE: University lecturers aren’t very well paid.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学讲师薪水不是很高。

Exponent.DEF: a teacher in a college or university. In Britain, a professor is a high-ranking university teacher, especially one who is head of a department.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was professor of linguistics at Cambridge University.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是剑桥大学的语言学教授。

Exponent.DEF: someone who teaches a sport or a practical skill such as swimming or driving
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He works as a ski instructor in the winter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在冬季﹐他是滑雪教练。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a driving instructor
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶教练

Exponent.DEF: someone who helps a person or team improve in a sport
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a professional tennis coach
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业网球教练

Exponent.DEF: someone whose job involves teaching people, or someone who is an expert on education
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most educators agree that class sizes are still too big.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数教育工作者都认为班级人数还是太多。

Exponent.DEF: someone who teaches people particular skills, especially the skills they need to do a job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a teacher trainer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 师资培训员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many companies pay outside trainers to teach management skills to their staff.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司请外面的培训师给员工培训管理技巧。

Exponent.DEF: a woman who lived with a family and taught their children in past times
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As a governess, Charlotte Brontë received twenty pounds a year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏洛特•勃朗特当家庭教师一年收入20英镑。

Sense.DEF: a child who everyone thinks is the teacher’s favourite student and is therefore disliked by the other students
Sense.TRAN: 老师的宠儿﹐老师宠爱的学生

Sense.DEF: a large wooden box that used to have tea in it, often used afterwards for moving and storing things
Sense.TRAN: 茶叶箱〔一种大木箱﹐最初用于装运茶叶﹐后常用来装运﹑储存物资〕

Sense.DEF: an informal meeting of people who are interested in a particular subject, where they have the opportunity to learn more about it
the work or profession of a teacher
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Ward had many years of experience in teaching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃德太太拥有多年教学经验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s thinking of going into teaching becoming a teacher .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在考虑当老师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: extra funding for English teaching in schools
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于学校英语教学的额外经费

GramExa.GLOSS: a period of teaching done by someone who is training to be a teacher

Sense.DEF: the moral, religious, or political ideas of a particular person or group which are taught to other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔道德﹑宗教﹑政治等方面的〕教义﹐学说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the teachings of Gandhi
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 甘地的学说

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 宗教/基督教/佛教等教义

Sense.DEF: a person who is not a trained teacher who helps a school teacher in classes

a
graduate
student at a university who teaches classes
a hospital where medical students receive practical training from experienced doctors

a
tea towel

a thick cover that you put over a
teapot
to keep the tea hot
a cup that you serve tea in
a large area of land used for growing tea
a special house in China or Japan where tea is served, often as part of a ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔中国或日本的〕茶馆﹐茶楼﹐茶室

Sense.DEF: a hard yellowish-brown wood that is used for making ships and good quality furniture
a small wild duck
a greenish-blue colour
the small pieces of leaves used to make tea. People sometimes look at the leaves left at the bottom of a cup to find out what will happen in the future.

a small short
candle
in a metal container
a group of people who play a game or sport together against another group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which team do you support?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你支持哪个队？
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our team are winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是我们队赢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bobby Charlton was in the team that won the World Cup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 博比•查尔顿曾经是世界杯冠军队成员。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who have been chosen to work together to do a particular job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a team of experts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个专家小组

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a senior member of the design team
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计团队中的一名资深成员

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our success lies in working together as a team .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的成功靠的是团队合作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a tremendous team effort .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是很棒的团队合作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to choose a team leader .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们需要选出一名组长。

Sense.DEF: two or more animals that are used to pull a vehicle

Collocate.EXAMPLE: China’s football team failed to qualify for the World Cup.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国足球队未能取得世界杯参赛资格。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I played for my school cricket team.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在校板球队打球。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He coached the Italian national team.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他执教意大利国家队。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the team whose sports field a game is being played on
the team who have travelled to their opponents’ sports field
the team with the best players in a school, club etc

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He wants to play for a better team.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想效力于更好的球队。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘Which team do you support?’ ‘Chelsea.’
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “你支持哪支球队？”“切尔西队。”

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be the captain of a team
be chosen as a member of a team
decide that someone should not play for a team

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The cup was presented to the team captain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 奖杯交到了队长手上。

Collocate.COLLOC: a team member/a member of a team
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s the eldest team member.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是年龄最大的队员。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Who do you think will be the next England team manager?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得谁会是英格兰队的下一任主教练？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is played by teams

Collocate.EXAMPLE: One reason for the 49ers’ success is that they play as a team.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 49人队取胜的原因之一是他们团结协作。

Sense.DEF: to put two things or people together, because they will look good or work well together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: black trousers teamed with a bright shirt
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 配亮色衬衫的黑裤子

Sense.DEF: to join with someone in order to work on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can team up with one other class member if you want.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你愿意的话﹐可以找一个同学组成一组。

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to the same team as you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finished just ahead of his Ferrari team-mate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他略微领先于他的法拉利队友到达终点。

Sense.DEF: someone who works well as a member of a team, especially in business
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指生意场上〕良好的合作伙伴﹐有团队精神的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a good businessman, but never a team player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个优秀的商人﹐但绝不是一个好的合作伙伴。

Sense.DEF: willingness to work as part of a team
someone whose job is to drive a truck
when a group of people work effectively together
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to encourage good teamwork and communication.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要鼓励良好的团队合作和沟通。

Sense.DEF: a small party in the afternoon at which tea, cake etc is served
to be very difficult or unpleasant to do
Sense.TRAN: 不是容易的事﹔不是愉快的事

Sense.DEF:
a container for making and serving tea, which has a handle and a
spout 1 1
a drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were all in tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们全都哭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came home in floods of tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她泪流满面地回到家里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see that Sam was close to tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到萨姆都快哭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bridget suddenly burst into tears and ran out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里奇特突然大哭着跑了出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fighting back tears as he spoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一边说﹐一边拼命忍住泪水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people were moved to tears by his story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人都被他的故事感动得落泪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kissed her cheek, a gesture that brought tears to her eyes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他亲了亲她的脸﹐这个举动让她热泪盈眶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must admit I shed a few tears when the school closed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须承认﹐学校关闭时我掉过几滴眼泪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw grown men reduced to tears that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天我看到成年男子都流下了眼泪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Please don’t talk like that,’ Ellen implored him, her eyes filling with tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “请别那么说。”埃伦恳求道﹐眼里噙满泪水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By this time, tears were streaming down my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此时﹐我已泪流满面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tears he shed were tears of joy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他淌下的是喜悦的泪水。

Sense.DEF: used to warn someone that something they are doing will cause problems or arguments between people
Sense.TRAN: 不会有好结果的﹐不会有好下场的〔用于警告〕

Subsense.DEF: to damage something such as paper or cloth by pulling it hard or letting it touch something sharp
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Be careful not to tear the paper.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心不要把纸撕破了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His clothes were old and torn.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衣服又旧又破。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She realized she had torn her jacket on a nail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她意识到自己的夹克衫被钉子钩破了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tear off the slip at the bottom of this page and send it back to us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 撕下本页下部的回执寄回给我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tore a page out of his notebook and handed it to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从自己的笔记本上撕了一页递给她。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The dog had torn a huge hole in the tent.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗把帐篷咬出一个大洞来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He picked up the envelope and tore it open .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿起信封﹐把它撕开了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She tore the letter to pieces and threw it in the bin.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把信撕成碎片扔到垃圾桶里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most of her clothes had been torn to shreds .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身上的衣服大部分地方已经被扯得稀烂。

Subsense.DEF: if paper or cloth tears, it splits and a hole appears, because it has been pulled too hard or has touched something sharp
Subsense.TRAN: 纸或布〕破裂﹐被撕裂﹐被扯破
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The paper is old and tears easily.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这纸很旧了﹐很容易撕破。

Sense.DEF: to run or drive somewhere very quickly, especially in a dangerous or careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tore back into the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她飞奔回屋内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tore down to the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们狂奔到医院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tore off into town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他急匆匆赶往城里。

Sense.DEF: to pull something violently from a person or place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tore the letter from my hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一把夺过我手里的信。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A bridge was torn from the bank by the floodwaters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一座桥被洪水从堤岸上冲走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: High winds nearly tore the roof off the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风差点把房顶都掀掉了。

Subsense.DEF: if you are torn, you are unable to decide what to do because you have different feelings or different things that you want
Subsense.TRAN: 左右为难﹐难以取舍﹔〔心理或情感上〕被折磨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was torn between her love of dancing and her fear of performing in public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她内心充满矛盾﹐既热爱舞蹈又害怕公开表演。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was torn two ways.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他左右为难。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jess was torn by anger and worry.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰斯的内心被愤怒和忧虑撕扯着。

Subsense.DEF: if a country or group is torn, it is divided because people in it have very different ideas and are arguing or fighting with each other
Subsense.TRAN: 〔国家或团体〕饱受〔内部不和﹑争斗的〕痛苦
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The country was torn by civil war.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国饱受内战之苦。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She spent two months in the war-torn city.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在这个饱受战争之苦的城市里待了两个月。

Sense.DEF:
to damage a muscle or
ligament
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had torn a muscle in her leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她腿部一处肌肉拉伤了。

Sense.DEF: to move violently and no longer be attached to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: One end had torn loose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一端脱开了。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something very severely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tore her arguments to shreds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她的论点驳得一无是处。

Sense.LEXUNIT: tear sb off a strip/tear a strip off sb
Sense.DEF: to talk to someone very angrily because they have done something wrong
to attack someone in a very violent way
Sense.TRAN: 痛打某人﹔猛烈攻击某人

Sense.DEF: to feel anxious and upset because you are worried, or because you have to deal with something that is very difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been tearing my hair out trying to get done in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了能及时完成我都快疯掉了。

Sense.DEF: to be doing something very quickly because you are late

Sense.LEXUNIT: tear sb’s heart (out)/tear at sb’s heart
Sense.DEF: to make someone feel extremely upset
Sense.TRAN: 使某人心碎﹐使某人极其难受
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of her out there alone tore at my heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到她独自一人在那里﹐我的心都碎了。

Sense.DEF: used when something bad has happened that stops you from doing what you intended to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, no, that’s torn it! I’ve left my keys in the car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐不好﹐这下完了！我把钥匙落在车里了！

Exponent.DEF: to damage paper or cloth by pulling it too hard, or letting it touch something sharp
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She unwrapped the present carefully, trying not to tear the paper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心地打开礼物﹐尽量不撕破包装纸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tore a hole in my jacket, climbing over the fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爬围栏的时候把外套钩了个洞。

Exponent.DEF: to tear something quickly or violently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Beth excitedly ripped open the package.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝激动地撕开包装盒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stop pulling my dress! You’ll rip it!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别拉我的连衣裙！会扯破的！

Exponent.DEF: to tear your trousers or shirt when you put them on, because they are too tight for you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He bent down and split his trousers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他弯下腰﹐撑破了裤子。

Exponent.DEF: if a woman ladders her tights or stockings, she tears them so that a long thin line appears in them
Exponent.TRAN: 使〔紧身裤袜或长筒袜〕抽丝
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Damn! I’ve laddered my tights!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真该死！我把裤袜弄抽丝了！

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately destroy letters, documents etc by cutting them into thin pieces, often by using a special machine
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In order to prevent fraud, it’s best to shred your bank statements.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 为预防欺诈﹐最好将银行对账单粉碎销毁。

Exponent.DEF: torn a little along the edges – used about clothes, carpets etc that have been used a lot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was wearing an old pair of frayed jeans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿了一条毛边旧牛仔裤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rug was a little frayed around the edges.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小地毯四边有点磨损了。

Sense.DEF: to cause serious arguments in a group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scandal is tearing the government apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻把政府搞得四分五裂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a row that tore the family apart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致家庭分裂的一场争吵

Sense.DEF: to separate people who are in a close relationship with each other
Sense.TRAN: 使〔关系密切的人〕分离﹐分开
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing can tear us apart!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么能使我们分开！

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel extremely unhappy or upset
Sense.TRAN: 使心里不快﹔使极其难受
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seeing her so upset really tore him apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到她那么伤心﹐他感到很难受。

Sense.DEF: to break something violently into a lot of small pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body had been torn apart by wolves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的身体被狼群撕成了碎片。

Sense.DEF: to pull violently at someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were screaming and tearing at each other’s hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们尖叫着﹐互相抓扯着对方的头发。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself or someone else leave a place when you or they do not want to leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was enjoying the fun and couldn’t tear himself away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在兴头上﹐舍不得离开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We finally managed to tear him away from the TV.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于把他从电视前拉走了。

Sense.DEF: to destroy a building deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the old tower blocks have been torn down to make way for new housing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多老旧的高层建筑被拆除﹐腾出地方来建造新住宅。

Sense.DEF: to attack someone by hitting them very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two boys tore into each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男孩相互撕打。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone very strongly and angrily
Sense.EXAMPLE: From time to time she would really tear into her staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经常斥责员工。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something quickly, with a lot of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was amazed at the way she tore into her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对工作的投入让我惊讶。

Sense.DEF: to remove your clothes as quickly as you can
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tore off his clothes and dived into the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扒下衣服就跳进水里。

Sense.DEF: to tear a piece of paper or cloth into small pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tore up his letter and threw it away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把他的信撕碎扔掉了。

Sense.DEF: to remove something from the ground by pulling or pushing it violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: the remains of trees that had been torn up by the storm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木被狂风刮倒后留下的残桩

Sense.LEXUNIT: tear up an agreement/a contract etc
Sense.DEF: to say that you no longer accept an agreement or contract
Sense.EXAMPLE: threats to tear up the peace agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要撕毁和平协议的威胁

Sense.DEF: a hole in a piece of cloth or paper where it has been torn

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a huge tear in his shirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衬衫上有一个大裂口。

Sense.DEF: a young person who behaves badly and often gets into trouble
Sense.TRAN: 小流氓﹐小混混﹔不良青年
Sense.EXAMPLE: His car was wrecked by a couple of young tearaways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的车被几个小流氓弄得一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF: a single drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large teardrop ran down her cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗大大的泪珠从她的脸颊上淌下来。

Sense.DEF: someone who is tearful is crying a little, or almost crying
Sense.TRAN: 哭泣的﹔含泪的﹐快要哭的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tearful farewell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含泪的告别

Sense.DEF: a gas that stings your eyes, used by the police to control crowds
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police used tear gas to break up the demonstration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察用催泪弹驱散游行示威队伍。

Sense.DEF: a film, book, or story that is very sad and makes you cry
Sense.TRAN: 催人泪下的电影[图书﹐故事]

Sense.DEF: a restaurant where tea and small meals are served

Sense.TRAN: 哭泣的﹔含泪的﹐快要哭的

Sense.DEF: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way
Sense.TRAN: 戏弄﹐逗弄﹔拿…取笑[开玩笑]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别生气﹐我只是在逗你玩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to tease her mercilessly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She used to tease me about my hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她过去总是取笑我的头发。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say make fun of rather than tease .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说make fun of﹐而不说tease
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Stop making fun of me!

Sense.DEF: to deliberately annoy an animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop teasing the cat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再招惹那只猫了！

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make someone sexually excited without intending to have sex with them, in a way that seems unkind
Sense.TRAN: 挑逗﹐撩拨〔使某人性兴奋〕

Sense.DEF: to comb your hair in the opposite direction to which it grows, so that it looks thicker
Sense.TRAN: 回梳﹐逆梳〔以使头发显得浓密〕

Sense.DEF: to succeed in learning information that is hidden, or that someone does not want to tell you
Sense.TRAN: 找出〔隐藏的信息〕﹔〔从某人嘴里〕哄出〔秘密〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finally managed to tease the truth out of her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于哄她说出了真相。

Sense.DEF: to gently move hairs or threads that are stuck together so that they become loose or straight again
Sense.EXAMPLE: She combed her hair, gently teasing out the knots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梳理着头发﹐轻轻地把结梳开。

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way
Sense.TRAN: 爱开玩笑的人﹐爱戏弄别人的人〔尤指无恶意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t take any notice of Joe – he’s a big tease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要搭理乔——他特别爱戏弄人。

Sense.DEF: something that you say or do as a joke, to tease someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, it was only a tease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐只是开个玩笑。

Sense.DEF: someone who deliberately makes you sexually excited, but has no intention of having sex with you
a plant with leaves and flowers that feel sharp when you touch them
a very difficult question that you have to answer as part of a game or competition
a short advertisement which appears a few days or weeks before a full advertisement for a product
an advertisement that is used to make people interested in a product, but that does not give very much information about the product, so that people will pay attention to more advertisements later
Sense.TRAN: 前导广告﹐预热广告〔引起人们对产品的兴趣﹐但不会给予过多信息的广告﹐以此吸引人们注意其后推出的更多广告〕

Sense.DEF: a matching set with a teapot, cups, and plates, which you use for serving tea
Sense.TRAN: 〔包括茶壶﹑茶杯和茶碟在内的〕一套茶具

Sense.DEF:
a
tearoom
in a way that shows you are joking and trying to have fun by embarrassing someone in a friendly way
a small spoon that you use for mixing sugar into tea and coffee
Sense.TRAN: 〔在茶﹑咖啡等中拌糖用的〕茶匙

Sense.DEF: the amount that a teaspoon can hold, used as a unit for measuring food or liquid in cooking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add a teaspoon of salt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一茶匙盐。

Sense.DEF: the rubber part on a baby’s bottle that the baby sucks milk from
Sense.TRAN: 〔婴儿奶瓶上的〕橡皮奶头﹐奶嘴

Sense.DEF: one of the small parts on a female animal’s body that her babies suck milk from
