a time in the late afternoon or early evening when people have a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: John won’t be back until teatime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰要到下午茶时间才会回来。

Sense.DEF: a small cloth that you use for drying cups, plates etc after you have washed them
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来擦干洗过的杯盘等的〕拭布﹐茶巾

Sense.DEF: oil from an Australian tree, that is used to treat skin problems
a large metal container that you use for heating water to make a lot of cups of tea

another spelling of
teasel

a
technical college
someone who knows a lot about computers and electronic equipment
Sense.TRAN: 精通计算机和电子设备的〕技术人员

Sense.DEF: connected with knowledge of how machines work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our staff will be available to give you technical support .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有我们的员工向你提供技术支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no technical knowledge at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点技术知识都没有。
技术培训

Sense.DEF: a problem involving the way a machine or system works
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been having some technical problems with the new hardware.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新硬件我们遇到了一些技术问题。

Sense.DEF: technical language is language that is difficult for most people to understand because it is connected with one particular subject or used in one particular job
Sense.TRAN: 技术性的﹐与技术[专业]相关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t understand all the technical terms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是对所有术语都了解。

Sense.DEF: relating to small exact details or rules that say how a system should work
Sense.EXAMPLE: He called for the legislation to be delayed on a technical point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为某个技术性原因﹐他要求暂缓这项立法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a technical violation of the treaty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是技术性违约。

Sense.DEF: technical ability is the ability to do the difficult things that you have to do in order to play music, do a sport etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐﹑体育运动等方面〕技巧的﹐技艺的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young player with a lot of technical ability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术出色的年轻选手

Sense.DEF: a college in Britain where, in the past, students could study to take examinations in practical subjects
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去英国实用科目方面的〕工学院

Sense.DEF: the small details of how to do something or how a system or process works

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t really want to get into discussing the technicalities of laser printing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想讨论激光打印的技术细节。

Sense.DEF: a small detail in a law or a set of rules, especially one that forces you to make a decision that seems unfair
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律或规则上的〕技术性细则〔尤指迫使人作出看似不公平决定的细则〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case against him had to be dropped because of a legal technicality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于法律上的一个技术细节﹐对他的起诉不得不撤回。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposal was rejected on a technicality because of a technicality .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个提议因技术细节的原因被否决了。

Sense.DEF: according to the exact details of a rule or law
Sense.TRAN: 严格根据法律地﹔严格遵循规则地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Technically, the two countries are still at war, as a peace treaty was never signed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格说来﹐两国仍然处于交战状态﹐因为和平协议一直未签订。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What you have done is technically illegal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你做的事严格地说是违法的。

Sense.DEF: concerning the special skills that are needed to play music, do a sport etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a technically brilliant pianist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位技巧卓越的钢琴家
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dance looks simple, but is technically very difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这舞蹈看起来简单﹐但在技巧上难度很大。

Sense.DEF: concerning the way machines are used to do work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Agriculture is becoming more and more technically advanced .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业在技术上越来越先进。

Sense.DEF: possible, difficult etc using the scientific knowledge that is available now
Sense.TRAN: 技术上可能/困难/行得通等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It could soon be technically possible to produce a human being by cloning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克隆人类在技术上很快会成为可能。

Sense.DEF: help or information that you receive to improve a computer program or system, make it continue working, or use it correctly
the department of a company that provides help with using computers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe you’d better try calling tech support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许你最好给技术支持部门打电话试试。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to check equipment or machines and make sure that they are working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a laboratory technician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验室技术人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hospital technician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院技术人员

Sense.DEF: someone who is very good at the skills of a particular sport, music, art etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动﹑音乐﹑艺术等领域的〕精于技巧者﹔巧匠
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whether he was a great artist or not, Dali was a superb technician.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管达利是不是一位伟大的艺术家﹐他肯定是一个卓越的技巧大师。

Sense.DEF: a way of producing the colour in films, used for the cinema
Sense.TRAN: 特艺彩色〔彩色电影的一种制作方法〕

Sense.DEF: if you see something in glorious technicolour, you see it clearly on a screen, with lots of bright colours
Sense.TRAN: 〔在屏幕上〕色彩斑斓地清楚显示

Sense.DEF: a special way of doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are various techniques for dealing with industrial pollution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 处理工业污染有很多不同的技术。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在数学中﹐我们会使用多种方法解题。

Sense.DEF: the special way in which you move your body when you are playing music, doing a sport etc, which is difficult to learn and needs a lot of skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个伟大的球员﹐球技十分精湛。

Sense.DEF: a type of popular electronic dance music with a fast strong beat
Sense.TRAN: 泰克诺音乐﹐高科技舞曲〔一种节奏快而强劲的电子舞蹈音乐〕

Sense.DEF: concerning machines and electronic equipment such as computers
Sense.EXAMPLE: technophobia dislike of computers, machines etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术恐惧[症]
Sense.EXAMPLE: techno-literacy skill in using computers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会用[通晓]计算机

Sense.DEF: a social system in which people with a lot of knowledge about science, machines, and computers have a lot of power
Sense.TRAN: 技术官僚政治﹐技术专家统治〔一种科学技术人才掌握大量权力的社会制度〕

Sense.DEF: a skilled scientist who has a lot of power in industry or government
Sense.TRAN: 技术官僚﹐技术专家官员〔在产业界或政府内有很大权力的技术专家〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose main interest is electronic equipment, especially equipment connected with computers and the Internet, and who spends too much time buying this equipment and using it - often used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: techno-geeks on the hunt for new tools
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断寻找新工具的技术怪杰

Sense.DEF: related to technology
Sense.EXAMPLE: The steam engine was the greatest technological advance of the 19th century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒸汽机是19世纪最伟大的技术进步。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the most technologically advanced factory in Europe
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲技术最先进的工厂

Sense.DEF: someone who has special knowledge of technology
new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.

another spelling of

full of people, animals etc that are all moving around

Sense.DEF: teeming rain is very heavy rain

Sense.DEF: relating to teenagers or used by teenagers

your teens is the period of your life when you are between 13 and 19 years old

Sense.DEF: aged between 13 and 19

Sense.DEF: relating to or affecting people aged between 13 and 19

Sense.DEF: someone who is between 13 and 19 years old

Sense.EXAMPLE: a TV sex education series aimed at teenagers

Sense.DEF: very small

Sense.DEF: a girl between the ages of about 9 and 14, who is very interested in popular music, teenage fashions etc

Sense.DEF: a word meaning very small - used especially by children or when speaking to children

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of

another spelling of

to stand or walk moving from side to side, as if you are going to fall

Sense.EXAMPLE: She teetered along in her high-heeled shoes.

Sense.LEXUNIT: be teetering on the brink/edge of sth

Sense.DEF: a large toy like a board on which two children sit, one at each end

the plural of
tooth
if a baby is teething, its first teeth are growing
small problems that you have when you first start doing a new job or using a new system
Sense.TRAN: 〔做新工作﹑使用新系统等〕开始阶段的困难

Sense.DEF: someone who is teetotal never drinks alcohol
someone who never drinks alcohol
the teaching of English as a foreign language
a plastic that stops things from sticking to it, used on the inside of pans to stop food sticking to the pan

the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=telephone number电话号码

Sense.DEF: at or over a long distance

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电信﹐远程通信

Sense.DEF: for television or broadcast on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: a teleplay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视剧

Sense.DEF: using a telephone

GramExa.GLOSS: selling products to people by telephone

Sense.DEF: something that is broadcast on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game will be telecast live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛将进行电视直播。

Sense.DEF: the sending and receiving of messages by telephone, radio, television etc
Sense.TRAN: 电信﹐电讯〔指使用电话﹑无线电﹑电视等发送和接收信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new telecommunications system

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电信业

Sense.DEF: someone who works at home using a computer connected to a company’s main office
Sense.TRAN: 远程办公者〔指在家里通过使用与公司办公室相连接的计算机工作的人〕

Sense.DEF: a discussion in which people in different places talk to each other using telephones or video equipment
Sense.TRAN: 远程会议﹔电话[电视]会议

Sense.DEF: to have a meeting in which people in different places talk to each other using telephones or video equipment
someone who is telegenic looks nice on television
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕适于上电视镜头的﹐上镜的

Sense.DEF: a message sent by telegraph
an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
a piece of equipment that receives or sends messages in this way
to send a message by telegraph
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once he knew where we were, Lewis telegraphed every few hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一知道我们在哪里﹐刘易斯就每隔几小时发一份电报来。

Sense.DEF: to let people know what you intend to do without saying anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: A slight movement of the hand telegraphed his intention to shoot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手微微一动就暴露了他想要开枪的意图。

Sense.DEF: a telegraphist
someone in the past whose job was to send and receive messages by telegraph
a tall wooden pole for supporting telephone wires
a way of selling products to people in which you telephone people to see if they want to buy something
someone who is telepathic has a mysterious ability to know what other people are thinking
a telepathic message is sent from one person to another by using thoughts, not by talking or writing
a way of communicating in which thoughts are sent from one person’s mind to another person’s mind
the system of communication that you use to have a conversation with someone in another place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reservations can be made by telephone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以电话预订。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve never met him, but I’ve spoken to him on the telephone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没见过他﹐但我和他通过电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I read the names out to him over the telephone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在电话里把名字读给他听。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He shouted at me down the telephone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在电话里对我大喊大叫。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say phone rather than telephone .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 phone﹐而不说telephone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She’s been on the phone all evening.

Sense.DEF: the piece of equipment that you use when you are talking to someone by telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The telephone rang just as I was leaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正要走﹐电话铃响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She picked up the telephone and dialled a number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿起电话﹐拨了个号码。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I said goodbye and put down the telephone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说了声再见就放下了电话。

Subsense.DEF: to be talking to someone, using the telephone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was on the telephone when he came in.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他进来时我正在打电话。

Subsense.DEF: to have a telephone in your home, office etc

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The telephone rang, but Tom didn’t answer it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃响了﹐但汤姆没接。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When I called the house, Mike answered the telephone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打电话到家里﹐迈克接的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was talking on the telephone when the doorbell rang.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 门铃响时﹐他正在打电话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: May I use your telephone?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She got a telephone call from Joe last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚她接到乔的电话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had a long telephone conversation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在电话里谈了很长时间。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘get/have a telephone from sb’. Say 而要说 get/have a telephone call from sb .

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone by telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sammy telephoned to say that he would be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨米打电话来说他要晚到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll telephone you later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过后给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: a service provided by banks so that people can find out information about their bank account, pay bills etc by telephone rather than by going to a bank

a
telephone directory
a small structure that is partly or completely enclosed, containing a public telephone
a very small building in a street where there is a telephone that the public can use

PIC.PICCONTENT: telephone box BrE 【英】/telephone booth AmE 【美】公用电话亭

Sense.DEF: when you speak to someone by telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a telephone call for you, Mr Baron.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有你的电话﹐巴伦先生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a telephone call from George this morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我接到乔治的电话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I make a quick telephone call ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能打个简短的电话吗？

Sense.DEF: a book containing a list of the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of all the people in a particular area
an office where telephone calls are connected
Sense.TRAN: 电话交换台﹐电话局﹐总机室

Sense.DEF: the number that you use to telephone a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your telephone number?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的电话号码是多少？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave me his address and telephone number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把他的地址和电话号码给了我。

Sense.DEF: a tall wooden pole for supporting telephone wires
someone whose job is to connect telephone calls to people in a large organization
telephone services, systems, or communication
Sense.TRAN: 电话〔指其服务﹑系统或通信〕

Sense.DEF:
a long
lens
that you put on a camera so that you can take clear photographs of things that are a long way away

in
science fiction
, to send a person or thing from one place to another in the form of energy or a copy, or to travel in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are teleported from the ship down to the planet’s surface.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在飞船上被远距传输到该行星表面。

Sense.DEF: a machine that prints messages that have been written on a machine somewhere else and sent along telephone lines
a way of selling products to people by telephone
a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Details on the moon’s surface can only be seen through a telescope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球表面的细节只有通过望远镜才能看到。

Sense.DEF: to make a process or set of events happen in a shorter time
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某一过程或某事件〕缩短

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole legal process was telescoped into a few weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个法律程序被缩短到几个星期。

Sense.DEF: if something telescopes, the parts of it press together or slide over each other, and it becomes smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: The front of the car telescoped when it hit the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车撞在墙上﹐车头都撞瘪了。

Sense.DEF: made of parts that slide over each other so that the whole thing can be made longer or shorter
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tripod with telescopic legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支架可以伸缩的三脚架

Sense.DEF: making distant things look bigger, like a telescope does
Sense.TRAN: 能望到远处的﹔似望远镜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a telescopic lens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 望远镜头
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rifle with a telescopic sight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带望远镜瞄准具的步枪

Sense.DEF: done using a telescope
Sense.EXAMPLE: his telescopic observations of the moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使用望远镜对月球的观察

Sense.DEF: a system of broadcasting written information on television
Sense.TRAN: 图文电视﹐电视文字广播

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can find more details about all this week’s films on teletext.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图文电视上会有更多有关本周影片的内容。

Sense.DEF: a long television show in which famous people provide entertainment and ask people watching to give money to help people
Sense.TRAN: 〔为募捐而播放的〕长时电视节目﹐马拉松式的电视 节目

Sense.DEF:
a
teleprinter
someone who appears regularly on television to try to persuade people to become Christians, and often also asks people to give them money
Sense.TRAN: 电视福音布道者〔定期在电视上宣传基督教并劝人捐款的人〕

Sense.DEF: to broadcast something on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: The game was televised live on ABC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛由美国广播公司进行电视现场直播。

Sense.DEF: a piece of electronic equipment shaped like a box with a screen, on which you can watch programmes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy turned on the television to watch the evening news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西打开电视收看晚间新闻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have a television in every room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每个房间都配有电视。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say TV rather than television .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 TV﹐不说 television
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What’s on TV tonight?

Sense.DEF: the programmes broadcast in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the evenings I like to relax and watch television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上﹐我喜欢放松下来﹐看看电视。

Sense.DEF: broadcast or being broadcast on television
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s on television tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚有什么电视节目？

Sense.DEF: the business of making and broadcasting programmes on television

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jean works in television.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼从事电视工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a television film crew
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视电影制作人员

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mum was in the lounge watching television.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈在客厅看电视。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She saw the race on television.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在电视上看了比赛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it louder or quieter

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her favourite television programme was just starting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最喜欢的电视节目刚开始。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a set of programmes with the same characters or subject, broadcast every day or every week
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He starred in the popular television series, ‘Friends’.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主演过热门电视连续剧《老友记》。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a film that has been made to be shown on television, not in a cinema

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The accident was shown on live television.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起事故由电视现场直播。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The President went on national television to appeal for calm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在国家电视上呼吁保持冷静。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘see/watch sth in television’. Say 而要说 see/watch sth on television .

Sense.DEF: an official piece of paper that you need to buy in Britain in order to legally use a television in your home
relating to television
Sense.EXAMPLE: a major televisual event like the Olympics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会等进行电视转播的大型活动

Sense.DEF: someone who works from home, and communicates with their employer, customers etc using a computer, telephone etc
Sense.TRAN: 远程工作者﹐在家上班的人

Sense.DEF: a method of communica-tion, in which messages are written on a special machine and then sent using the telephone network
a message sent in this way
Sense.TRAN: 电传〔通过电传发送的信息〕

Sense.DEF: if someone tells you something, they communicate information, a story, their feelings etc to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish someone had told me the meeting was canceled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有人告诉过我会议已取消就好了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Chief of Police told reporters that two people were killed in the blast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察局长告诉记者有两个人在爆炸中丧生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack had to go, but he didn’t tell me why.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克一定要走﹐但他没有告诉我为什么。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think you’d better tell me exactly what’s been going on around here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你最好实话告诉我这儿都发生了什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one had told them about the drug’s side effects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人告诉过他们这种药品的副作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll tell you all about it when I get back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回来再告诉你这一切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tell me your phone number again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再给我说一遍你的电话号码。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She told us some funny stories about her sister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给我们说了一些有关她妹妹的趣事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheppard was telling the truth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢泼德说的是实话。

GramExa.GLOSS: tell someone the truth, even though it might upset them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tell me straight, Adam. Just answer yes or no.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你跟我直说吧﹐亚当。你只要回答是或不是。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘tell that ...’. Say 而要说 tell someone that ... or 或 say that ...: She told me (NOT 不说 She told) that she was a vegetarian. 她告诉我她吃素。 | She said that she was a vegetarian. 她说她吃素。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to say that another writer describes something, rather than using tell .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们写别的作者描写了什么﹐常常更喜欢用describe﹐不用tell
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His book describes how the human brain has developed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的书描述了人脑的发育过程。

Sense.DEF: to give information in ways other than talking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The light tells you when the machine is ready.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器就绪后提示灯会亮。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bear’s sense of smell tells it where prey is hiding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 熊的嗅觉告诉它猎物藏在哪儿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What do these fossils tell us about climate change?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些化石告诉我们哪些气候变化信息？

Sense.DEF: to say that someone must do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher told the children to sit down quietly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师叫孩子们安安静静地坐下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I thought I told you not to touch anything!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我告诉过你什么都不要碰的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bernice was told she had to work late this evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯尼斯被告知她今晚得加班。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop trying to tell me what to do all the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别老是对我指手画脚的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Do as you are told obey me and don’t ask questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫你做什么你就做什么﹐不要提问题。

Sense.DEF: to know something or be able to recognize something because of certain signs that show this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She might have been lying. Benjy couldn’t tell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许她是在撒谎﹐本吉也说不清楚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The moment Kramer walked in, I could tell that things were not going well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克雷默一进来﹐我就看出情况不妙。

GramExa.GLOSS: know easily
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You could tell a mile off that he was lying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一看就知道他是在撒谎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to tell how long the job will take.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难说这个工作要花多长时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could tell from his tone of voice that Ken was disappointed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听口气﹐我知道肯失望了。

Sense.DEF: to be able to see how one person or thing is different from another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can you tell a fake Vuitton handbag from the real thing?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么辨别路易威登手袋的真假？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you tell the difference between sparkling wine and champagne?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能区分气泡酒和香槟的差别吗？

Sense.DEF: to persuade yourself that something is true
Sense.TRAN: 提醒自己某事﹐告诉自己某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I keep telling myself there is nothing I could have done to save him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不断告诉自己﹐我当时实在是没有办法救他。

Sense.DEF: to warn someone that something bad might happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I told you it was a waste of time talking to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉过你﹐跟他讲是浪费时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother told me not to trust Robert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈叫我不要相信罗伯特。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone in authority about something wrong that someone you know has done - used especially by children
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you hit me, I’ll tell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是打我﹐我就去告你的状。

Sense.DEF: to say something that is not true about someone else, in order to cause trouble for them - used especially about children
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpopular boy, who was always telling tales on the other children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个不招人喜欢﹑总爱打小报告的小男孩

Sense.DEF: altogether, when everyone or everything has been counted
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must have been eight cars in the accident, all told.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次事故肯定涉及到总共八辆汽车。

Sense.DEF: to have an effect on someone, especially a harmful one
Sense.TRAN: 产生影响〔尤指有害的影响〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These late nights are really beginning to tell on him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些天熬夜真的开始让他吃不消了。

Sense.DEF: to be able to know what time it is by looking at a clock
Sense.TRAN: 〔从钟表上〕会看时间﹐会看钟表

Subsense.DEF: used when you are suggesting or offering something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I tell you what – let’s have a picnic in the park.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟你说——我们到公园野餐吧。

Subsense.DEF: used in order to emphasize what you are really saying
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I tell you what, I’m not looking forward to standing up in court tomorrow.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听我说﹐我并不愿意明天出庭。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are being very honest
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t really want to go out, to tell the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老实说﹐我不太想出去。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I can tell you/I’m telling you
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true even though it may be difficult to believe
Sense.TRAN: 我可以肯定地说/我说的没错
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m telling you, the man is innocent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听我说﹐那人是无辜的。

Sense.DEF: used before asking a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell me, do you think this dress goes with these shoes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 告诉我﹐你觉得这条裙子和这双鞋配不配？
Sense.EXAMPLE: So tell me, how was it in Argentina?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐告诉我﹐你在阿根廷过得怎么样？

Sense.DEF: used when you have warned someone about a possible danger that has now happened and they have ignored your warning
Sense.TRAN: 我早告诉过你〔用于对方不听劝告而出了事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suppose you’ve come to say ‘I told you so.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你来就是为了说一句“我早告诉过你”的吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ll tell you something/one thing/another thing

Variant.LEXVAR: let me tell you something/one thing/another thing

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 我来讲一点﹐我告诉你一句〔尤用于强调自己所说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll tell you one thing – you’ll never get me to vote for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉你一点——你永远没法让我投他的票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me tell you something – if I catch you kids smoking again, you’ll be grounded for a month at least.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉你们——如果我再抓到你们这些孩子吸烟﹐就罚你们至少一个月不准出门。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you can tell him from me
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to tell another person something, when you are annoyed or determined
Sense.TRAN: 你可以向他转告我的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, you can tell him from me that I’m going to make a complaint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐你可以转告他﹐就说我要投诉。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not know the answer to their question
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How much would a rail ticket cost?’ ‘I couldn’t tell you; I always drive.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一张火车票要多少钱？”“不知道﹐我一直自己开车。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you cannot tell someone something because it is a secret
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where are you taking me?’ ‘I can’t tell you; it would spoil the surprise.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要把我带到哪儿去？”“不能告诉你﹐不然就没惊喜了。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you cannot express your feelings or describe something properly
Subsense.TRAN: 我无法表达﹐我没法形容

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t tell you how worried I’ve been.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说不出来我有多担心。

Sense.DEF: used to interrupt someone because you know what they are going to say or because you want to guess - used especially when you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 不用告诉我﹐别说了〔尤用于生气时打断对方的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sorry I’m late but…’ ‘Don’t tell me – the car broke down again?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我迟到了﹐不过…”“别说了﹐又是车子坏了？”

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone has told you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike tells me you’ve got a new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克告诉我说你找到新工作了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you already know and agree with something that someone has just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s such a pain to live with.’ ‘You’re telling me!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “和他一起住真讨厌。”“我 知道！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you already know how bad something is, especially because you have experienced it yourself
Sense.TRAN: 我早就知道了﹐我也有同感
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve been so tired lately.’ ‘Yeah, tell me about it!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我最近一直很累。”“是呀﹐我也有同感！”

Sense.LEXUNIT: you never can tell/you can never tell
Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot be certain about what will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy might turn out to be a genius. You never can tell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这男孩说不定最后还是个天才呢﹐谁知道呢。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is impossible to know what has happened or what will happen next
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no telling what she’ll try next.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁知道她接下去还想干什么。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot tell someone something because it is a secret
Sense.TRAN: 那可不能讲〔因为是秘密〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: tell sb where to go/where to get off
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone angrily that what they have said is insulting or unfair
Sense.TRAN: 叫某人滚开﹔叫某人不要胡说
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Andy started criticizing the way I was dressed.’ ‘I hope you told him where to get off!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “安迪开始批评我的穿着。”“你真该叫他别胡说八道！”

Sense.DEF: to say exactly what you think or what is true, without hiding anything that might upset or offend people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don always tells it like it is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐总是实话实说。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you refuse to tell someone something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Mum, what are you getting me for my birthday?’ ‘I’m not telling you – you’ll have to wait and see.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “妈妈﹐我生日你送我什么礼物？”“我不告诉你——你要耐心等待噢。”

Sense.DEF: used when you do not believe what someone has told you

Exponent.DEF: to give someone information by speaking or writing to them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She wrote to tell me she was getting married.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她写信告诉我说她要结婚了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you tell us where the nearest garage is?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道最近的加油站在哪里吗？

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone something when you know more about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let me know your new address as soon as you can.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请尽快告诉我你的新地址。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let us know what happens at the interview.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟我们讲讲面试怎么样。

Exponent.EXP: pass a message on to sb
Exponent.DEF: to tell another person the information that has been told to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s with a client at the moment, but I’ll pass the message on to her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这会儿在陪客户﹐不过我会转告她的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If I get any news, I’ll pass it on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有消息的话﹐我会转告的。

Exponent.DEF: to give someone all the necessary information about a situation, so that they can do their work
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police officers were briefed before going out to arrest the suspects.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察出去抓捕嫌犯之前听了基本情况介绍。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone about something that happened to you or to someone else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One girl related a story about a friend who had accidentally become pregnant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个女孩讲述了一位朋友意外怀孕的故事。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone about a series of events
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The guide recounted the history of the castle, from the 1300s onwards.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 导游讲述了十四世纪以来那座城堡的历史。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone about something that they did not know about, but which they need to know about
Exponent.TRAN: 引起某人对某事的关注
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wanted to bring the matter to your attention.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能关注此事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was the first person to study the effects of pesticides, and to bring them to people’s attention.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是第一个研究杀虫剂的影响并引起世人对此关注的人。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone about things that have happened recently, especially at work
Exponent.TRAN: 告诉某人最新信息〔尤指工作〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you fill Robert in on the progress we’ve made while he’s been on holiday?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你跟罗伯特讲讲他度假期间我们取得的进展﹐好吗？

Section.SECHEADING: TO OFFICIALLY TELL SOMEONE 正式告诉某人

Exponent.DEF: to officially tell someone about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you think we ought to inform the police?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得我们要报警吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors should inform patients about the possible side effects of any drugs they prescribe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生应该告知病人他们所开药物可能会有的副作用。

Exponent.DEF: to tell people publicly and officially about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The university chancellor announced his resignation on Friday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所大学的校长周五宣布辞职。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was announced that the company had made a profit of $6 billion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 据称那家公司获利60亿美元。

Exponent.DEF: to officially tell someone about something that has happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was able to report that the project was nearly finished.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可以报告说该工程即将完工。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone officially about something that has happened or that is planned to happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Staff were notified several months in advance that they would be losing their jobs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工在数月前就被告知他们即将失业。

Sense.DEF: to make someone less likely to succeed in achieving or winning something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I badly wanted the job, but knew that my age would probably tell against me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常想要这份工作﹐但我知道我的年龄可能会对我不利。

Sense.DEF: if you can tell two people or things apart, you can see the difference between them, so that you do not confuse them
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s almost impossible to tell the twins apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难分清这对双胞胎。

Sense.DEF: to describe an event or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poem tells of the deeds of a famous warrior.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首诗叙述的是一位著名武士的事迹。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that a poem, story etc is about something rather than tells of something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐诗﹑故事等关于某事一般用be about﹐不用tell of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What’s his latest poem about ?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最新的诗是写什么的？

Sense.DEF: if someone in authority tells you off, they speak to you angrily about something wrong that you have done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shelley was one of those kids who was always getting told off at school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢利是那种经常在学校挨训的孩子。

GramExa.PROPFORM: tell sb off for doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My dad told me off for swearing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸因为我说脏话而训斥我。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone in authority about something wrong that someone you know has done - used especially by children
Sense.TRAN: 告发﹐打…的小报告﹐告…的状〔尤为儿语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please don’t tell on me – my parents will kill me if they find out!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 求你不要去告状——我父母如果知道会宰了我的！

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to receive and pay out money in a bank
someone who counts votes
Sense.TRAN: 清点选票的人﹐点[计]票员

Sense.DEF: having a great or important effect
Sense.TRAN: 有力的﹔有效的﹔有重大影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a telling argument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有说服力的论点

Sense.DEF: showing the true character or nature of someone or something, often without being intended
Sense.TRAN: 说明问题的﹐显露真相的

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 透露内情的话语/活生生的例子/说明问题的细节等

Sense.DEF: when you tell a story
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story gets better with each telling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事每一次讲述精彩程度都会增添几分。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is no way to know what will happen in a certain situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no telling who is going to show up tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚谁来不得而知。

Sense.DEF: the act of telling someone that they have done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve already had one telling-off from Dad this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这星期我已经挨过爸爸一顿骂了。

Sense.DEF: signs etc that clearly show something has happened or exists, often something that is a secret
Sense.TRAN: 泄露秘密的痕迹/标记等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They examined the child carefully, looking for telltale signs of abuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们仔细检查了那个孩子﹐寻找被虐待的痕迹。

Sense.DEF: a child who tells adults about other children’s secrets or bad behaviour - used by children to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 爱搬弄是非的小孩﹐打小报告者〔儿语﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: television

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there anything good on telly tonight?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚电视上有什么好节目吗？

Sense.DEF:
an
earthquake
when someone says or does something in a way that shows a lack of respect for other people and is likely to offend them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He actually had the temerity to tell her to lose weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他竟然放肆地叫她减肥。

Sense.DEF: an office worker who is only employed temporarily
to work as a temp
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carol’s temping until she can find another job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡萝尔还没有找到别的工作﹐正在做临时工。

Sense.DEF: a tendency to become angry suddenly or easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: That temper of hers will get her into trouble one of these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那种脾气早晚会让她惹麻烦的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to Nathan, Robin has quite a temper .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据内森讲﹐罗宾脾气很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Theo needs to learn to control his temper .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西奥应该学会控制他的脾气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful, he’s got a pretty violent temper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心点﹐他的脾气非常暴躁。

GramExa.GLOSS: people become angry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mason’s temper flared when he spotted his girlfriend kissing another man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅森看到他的女朋友在亲吻别的男人﹐火气一下子蹿升上来。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very angry so that you cannot control yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never seen Vic lose his temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未看到过维克发脾气。

Sense.DEF: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s no use talking to him when he’s in a temper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在气头上时﹐跟他谈是没有用的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

GramExa.GLOSS: to be angry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Watch out – she’s been in a foul temper all day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心——她这一整天脾气都很暴躁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her boss would fly into a temper if a project wasn’t done on time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果项目没有按时完成﹐她的老板就会大发雷霆。

Sense.DEF: to stay calm when it would be easy to get angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was finding it increasingly difficult to keep my temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现我的脾气越来越难以控制。

Sense.DEF: having a good, bad temper etc
Sense.TRAN: 脾气好的/脾气坏的/脾气暴躁的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Minnie was always good-tempered and agreeable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明妮一向脾气好﹐讨人喜欢。

Sense.DEF: the general attitude that people have in a particular place at one time
Sense.TRAN: 〔某时某地人们普遍的〕态度﹐看法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the temper of life in Renaissance Italy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文艺复兴时期意大利人的生活态度

Sense.DEF: to make something less severe or extreme

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The heat in this coastal town is tempered by cool sea breezes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清凉的海风消减了这座海滨小城的暑气。

Sense.DEF: to make metal as hard as is needed by heating it and then putting it in cold water
Sense.EXAMPLE: tempered steel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回火钢

Sense.DEF: a type of paint in which the colour is mixed with a thick liquid
the emotional part of someone’s character, especially how likely they are to be happy, angry etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jill has such a lovely relaxed temperament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔性格随和从容﹐非常讨人喜欢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tolkien was, by temperament, a very different man from Lewis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从性情来说﹐托尔金和刘易斯是完全不同的人。

Sense.DEF: likely to suddenly become upset, excited, or angry – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 喜怒无常的﹔易兴奋的﹔易怒的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Preston is particularly good at handling temperamental people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普雷斯顿特别擅长对付喜怒无常的人。

Sense.DEF: a machine, system etc that is temperamental does not always work properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry if the heater’s a bit temperamental.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉加热器性能不稳定。

Sense.DEF: relating to the emotional part of someone’s character
Sense.EXAMPLE: serious temperamental differences between the couple
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妻之间性格上的严重不合

Sense.DEF: when someone never drinks alcohol because of their moral or religious beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 〔出于道德或宗教原因的〕戒酒﹐禁酒

Sense.DEF: sensible control of the things you say and do, especially the amount of alcohol you drink
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对饮酒的〕自我克制﹐节制

Sense.DEF: a type of weather or a part of the world that is never very hot or very cold
Sense.TRAN: 温带气候/温带/温带地区等

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is temperate is calm and sensible
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕温和的﹐心平气和的﹔自我节制的

Sense.DEF:
one of the two parts of the Earth that are north and south of the
tropics
a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这水温游泳正好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

Sense.DEF: the temperature of your body, especially used as a measure of whether you are sick or not
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse took measured my temperature .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士给我量了体温。

Sense.DEF: to have a body temperature that is higher than normal, especially because you are sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susie has a temperature and has gone to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏茜在发烧﹐上床睡觉了。

Sense.DEF: the temperature of a situation is the way people are reacting, for example whether they are behaving angrily or calmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The referee’s decision to give a penalty raised the temperature of the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判判罚点球使比赛气氛紧张了起来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: At high temperatures water is not able to hold as much oxygen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 水在高温下无法保有那么多氧。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Temperatures were so low most plants could not survive.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 气温很低﹐多数植物都无法存活。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The temperature of the room is kept constant.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间温度保持恒定。

Collocate.COLLOC: a rise in temperature/a temperature rise
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The result was a rise in the Earth’s temperature.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果是地球温度上升。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: At night there is a dramatic drop in temperature.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上﹐气温急剧下降。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The oil is affected by changes in temperature.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 油受温度变化的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Store the wine at room temperature.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 把葡萄酒贮存于室温下。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The temperature rose steadily throughout the morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上﹐温度平稳上升。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: rises quickly to a high level

Sense.DEF: a violent storm
an unimportant matter that someone has become upset about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Haley dismissed the lawsuit as a tempest in a teapot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑利认为这桩官司是小题大做。

Sense.DEF: a tempestuous relationship or period of time involves a lot of difficulty and strong emotions
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系〕动荡的﹐狂暴的﹐错杂的﹔〔时代〕风云变幻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tempestuous marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动荡不宁的婚姻

Sense.DEF: a tempestuous sea or wind is very rough and violent
Sense.TRAN: 波涛汹涌的﹔狂风大作的

Sense.DEF: a thin sheet of plastic or metal in a special shape or pattern, used to help cut other materials in a similar shape
Sense.TRAN: 〔切割材料时用的塑料或金属〕模板﹐型板﹐样板

Sense.DEF: a computer document containing some basic information that you use as a model for writing other documents, such as business letters, envelopes etc
Sense.TRAN: 模板﹐范本〔包含一些基本信息的计算机文件样板〕

Sense.DEF: something that is used as a model for another thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her childhood became a template for how she brought up her own children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的童年生活成了她抚育自己孩子的样板。

Sense.DEF:
a building where people go to
worship
, in the Jewish, Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, and Mormon religions

one of the two fairly flat areas on each side of your
forehead
the speed at which music is played or should be played
the speed at which something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: the easy tempo of island life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上生活的轻松节奏

Sense.DEF: related to or limited by time
Sense.TRAN: 关于时间的﹔受时间限制的﹔短暂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the temporal character of human existence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生的短促

Sense.DEF: related to practical instead of religious affairs
Sense.TRAN: 〔与宗教相对应的〕尘世的﹐世俗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edgar ruled over the Church as well as his temporal kingdom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德加除了统治世俗王国之外﹐还掌控着教会。

Sense.DEF: continuing for only a limited period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: temporary pain relief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛的暂时缓解
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和父母住在一起﹐但这只是暂时的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你定下来想做什么之前﹐也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was employed on a temporary basis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

Sense.DEF: intended to be used for only a limited period of time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临时住所
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bridge was erected as a temporary measure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座桥是作为临时设施搭建的。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Due to a small fire, the office will be closed temporarily.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为一场小火灾﹐办事处将暂时关闭。

Sense.DEF: to delay or avoid making a decision in order to gain time
to try to persuade someone to do something by making it seem attractive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new program is designed to tempt young people into studying engineering.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项新计划旨在吸引年轻人学工科。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would take a lot of money to tempt me to quit this job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得要很多钱才会让我动心放弃这份工作。

Sense.DEF: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果把贵重物品留在车上﹐会招来小偷的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m tempted to buy that dress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忍不住想买那条裙子。

Subsense.DEF: to do something that involves unnecessary risk and may cause serious problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fire officials said developers are tempting fate by building deep into the scenic canyons.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防官员称开发商在峡谷风景区深处盖房子是在拿生命开玩笑。

Subsense.DEF: to say too confidently that something will have a good result, that there will be no problems etc, when it is likely there will be problems

Sense.DEF: a strong desire to have or do something even though you know you should not

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There might be a temptation to cheat if students sit too close together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生如果坐得太近可能会产生作弊的念头。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Resist the temptation to buy the item until you’re certain you need it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要抵挡住购买的诱惑﹐除非你确有需要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I finally gave in to the temptation and had a cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最终还是屈从诱惑﹐抽了一支烟。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you want to have or do something, even though you know you should not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Selling alcohol at truck stops is an unnecessary temptation for drivers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在卡车中途停留站卖酒对驾驶员是一种不必要的诱惑。

Sense.DEF: something that is tempting seems very good and you would like to have it or do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tempting job offer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个诱人的工作机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: That pie looks tempting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那馅饼看上去很诱人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s tempting to believe her story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 真想相信她的故事。

Sense.DEF: a woman who makes a man want to have sex with her

a type of Japanese food that consists of fish or vegetables fried in
batter
Sense.TRAN: 天妇罗〔一种日式菜肴﹐蔬菜或鱼虾裹上面糊后油炸〕

Sense.DEF: the number 10
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snow had been falling steadily for ten days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪已经连续下了10天了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to be home by ten ten o’clock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得在10点之前回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the time, she was about ten ten years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时她10岁左右。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very likely
Sense.TRAN: 十之八九﹐十有八九﹐多半会
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten to one he’ll have forgotten all about it tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明天多半会把这事忘得一干二净。

Sense.DEF: to be very common and therefore not special or unusual
used in schools to give a perfect mark, or humorously to praise someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校〕给打了满分﹔得满分〔也用作称赞人的幽默说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You get ten out of ten for effort, Simon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你非常努力﹐这一点要给你打满分﹐西蒙。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money that is worth ten dollars or ten pounds
Sense.TRAN: 十美元纸钞﹔十英镑纸币
Sense.EXAMPLE: I reached inside my purse and handed him a ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从钱包里拿出一张十元钞票递给他。

Sense.DEF: a belief, argument etc that is tenable is reasonable and can be defended successfully
Sense.TRAN: 〔信仰﹑论点等〕有道理的﹐站得住脚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an idea which is no longer tenable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不再成立的观点

Sense.DEF: determined to do something and unwilling to stop trying even when the situation becomes difficult
Sense.TRAN: 坚持的﹔坚韧不拔的﹔顽强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tenacious negotiator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锲而不舍的谈判者

Sense.DEF: tenacious beliefs, ideas etc continue to have a lot of influence for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tenacious religious tradition that is still practised in Shinto temples
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神道教庙宇中仍然践行的一个经久不变的宗教传统

Sense.DEF: the period of time that someone rents a house, land etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔住房﹑土地等的〕租赁期﹐租用期
Sense.EXAMPLE: a six-month tenancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六个月的租赁期
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tenancy agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租赁合同

Sense.DEF: the right to use a house, land etc that is rented
Sense.TRAN: 〔住房﹑土地等的〕租赁权﹐租用权

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

Sense.DEF: someone who farms land that is rented from someone else

according to the Old Testament of the Bible, the set of rules that God gave to Moses on Mount Sinai, in order to tell people how they should behave. They are supposed to have been written on two stone
tablets
flat pieces of stone and they appear in the Christian, Jewish, and Islamic religions. The ten rules include ‘Thou shalt not kill’ and ‘Thou shalt not steal’. A set of basic rules is sometimes called the ‘Ten Commandments’.
Sense.TRAN: 十诫〔《圣经•旧约》中记载的上帝在西奈山上晓谕摩西﹑规定世人行为的一套律法﹐据说诫律刻写在两块石板上﹐其内容在基督教﹑犹太教和伊斯兰教中均有反映。十诫包括“不可杀人”﹑“不可偷盗”等等。有时也用于指一套基本规定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ‘Ten Commandments of Good Communication’ are designed to help people to communicate better within an organization.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《良好交流准则》旨在帮助人们在组织内部更好地沟通。

Sense.DEF: if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again
Sense.TRAN: 易于做某事﹐往往会发生某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: People tend to need less sleep as they get older.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着年龄的增长﹐人需要的睡眠通常会减少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My car tends to overheat in the summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的车夏天经常会变得过热。

Sense.DEF: to look after someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

Sense.DEF: to have one particular quality or feature more than others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles tends towards obesity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯有肥胖倾向。

Sense.DEF:
to work as a
bartender
Sense.TRAN: 〔在酒吧〕接待顾客﹐做酒吧招待工作

Sense.DEF: to move or develop in a particular direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Interest rates are tending upwards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率趋于上涨。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something has a tendency to do or become a particular thing, they are likely to do or become it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greg’s tendency to be critical made him unpopular with his co-workers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格爱挑剔的性格使他的同事都不喜欢他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drug is effective but has a tendency to cause headaches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药很有效﹐但可能会引起头疼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people may inherit a tendency to alcoholism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人可能遗传了酗酒倾向。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Researchers believe that the tendency for diabetes is present at birth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员认为糖尿病倾向出生时就存在。

Sense.DEF: a general change or development in a particular direction

GramExa.PROPFORM: there is a tendency (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is an increasing tendency for women to have children later in life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性晚育趋势不断上升。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a general tendency towards conservation and recycling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 节约和回收利用的普遍趋势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tendency among Americans to get married at a later age
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国人晚婚的趋势

Sense.DEF: a part of someone’s character that makes them likely to behave in a certain way or become an artist, criminal etc
Sense.TRAN: 暴力倾向/自杀倾向/犯罪倾向/艺术气质等
Sense.EXAMPLE: children with aggressive or anti-social tendencies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有攻击性倾向或反社会倾向的儿童

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: a group within a larger political group that supports ideas that are usually more extreme than those of the main group
Sense.EXAMPLE: the growing fascist tendency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日益膨胀的法西斯极端势力

Sense.DEF: a tendentious speech, remark, book etc expresses a strong opinion that is intended to influence people
Sense.TRAN: 〔演讲﹑评论﹑书籍等〕有强烈倾向性的﹐鼓动色彩浓厚的

Sense.DEF: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
Sense.TRAN: 嫩的﹐软的〔尤指烹饪恰到好处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that is tender is painful if someone touches it
Sense.EXAMPLE: My arm is still tender where I bruised it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我手臂撞伤的地方仍然一碰就疼。

Sense.DEF: gentle and careful in a way that shows love
Sense.TRAN: 温柔的﹔体贴入微的﹔慈爱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice was tender and soft.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音温柔亲切。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slow, tender kiss
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个绵长温柔的吻

Sense.DEF: easily damaged – used especially about plants or flowers
Sense.TRAN: 娇嫩的﹐幼嫩的﹐易损坏的〔尤指植物或花〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: tender plants that were killed by the harsh winter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被严冬天气冻死的幼嫩植株

Sense.DEF: sympathetic treatment and a lot of attention
the time when you are young or do not have much experience

GramExa.PROPFORM: at the tender age of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nicholas was sent to boarding school at the tender age of seven.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼古拉斯在年龄只有七岁时就被送进了寄宿学校。

Sense.DEF: to formally offer or show something to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: As company secretary, you must tender the proposal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为公司秘书﹐你必须提交建议书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The seller has the right to keep the goods until payment is tendered to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖方有权保留货物直至收到货款。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Minton tendered her resignation on Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明顿周五递交了辞呈。

Sense.DEF: to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are unable to tender competitively for the contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对这个合同无力竞标。

Sense.DEF: a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our bid was the lowest tender.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们投标的价格是最低的。

GramExa.GLOSS: to ask different companies to say how much they will charge for doing a particular job
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The contract for building the houses will be put out to tender.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 住房的建造合约将对外招标。

Sense.DEF: a small boat that takes people or supplies between the shore and a larger boat
Sense.TRAN: 〔来往于岸边和大船之间运送人员或补给品的〕驳运船﹐补给船﹐交通艇

Sense.DEF: part of a steam train used for carrying coal and water for the train
very kind and gentle
to make meat softer and easier to eat by preparing it in a special way
a substance that is put onto raw meat to make it softer and easier to eat after it has been cooked

meat that is soft and easy to eat, cut from each side of the
backbone
of cows or pigs
a thick strong string-like part of your body that connects a muscle to a bone
a thin leafless curling stem by which a climbing plant fastens itself to a support
a thin curling piece of hair
a large building divided into apartments, especially in the poorer areas of a city
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指城市贫民区的〕公寓大楼

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公寓楼/房屋/大楼

Sense.DEF: a principle or belief, especially one that is part of a larger system of beliefs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the basic tenets of democracy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主制度的基本原则之一

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the main tenet of his philosophy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的哲学思想的主要原则

Sense.DEF: ten times as much or as many of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business has increased tenfold in the past two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去两年里﹐业务扩展了十倍。

Sense.DEF:
a tall hat made of soft material with a wide
brim
, worn especially by
cowboys
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指牛仔戴的〕宽边高顶软帽

Sense.DEF: £10 or a ten-pound note
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you lend me a tenner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能借给我十英镑吗？

Sense.DEF:
a game for two people or two pairs of people who use
rackets
to hit a small soft ball backwards and forwards over a net

PIC.HEADING: TENNIS 网球
PIC.PICCONTENT: forehand 正手；linesman 司线员；baseline 底线；umpire 裁判员；ball boy 球童；court 球场；alley 单打边线和双打边线之间的区域；service line 发球线；net 球网；ball girl 女球童；smash 扣杀；serve 发球；volley 截击；lob 挑高球；backhand 反手

Sense.DEF: the four-sided area that you play tennis on
a medical problem in which your elbow is very painful
Sense.TRAN: 网球肘〔一种肘部十分疼痛的疾病〕

Sense.DEF: a light shoe used for playing sports, with a rubber surface on the bottom

an end of a piece of wood, that has been cut to fit exactly into a
mortise
in order to form a strong joint
a male singing voice that can reach the range of notes below the lowest woman’s voice, or a man with a voice like this
the part of a musical work that is written for a tenor voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arthur Davies sings the tenor solo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿瑟•戴维斯表演男高音独唱。

Subsense.DEF: the general way in which an event or process takes place
Subsense.TRAN: 〔事物的〕一般趋向﹔〔事件的〕一般（发展）进程
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many voters admitted being disturbed by the tenor of the election campaign.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多选民承认选举活动的发展趋势让他们感到担忧。

Subsense.DEF: the general meaning of something written or spoken, or the general attitude expressed in it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the general tenor of her speech
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她演讲的要旨

Sense.DEF:
a tenor voice or instrument has a range of notes that is lower than an
alto
voice or instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tenor saxophone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 次中音萨克斯管

Sense.DEF:
one of the ten bottle-shaped wooden objects that you try to knock down in
bowling
Sense.TRAN: 〔保龄球运动中作为目标的〕木柱瓶﹐木瓶

Sense.DEF: an indoor sport in which you roll a heavy ball along a floor to knock down bottle-shaped wooden objects
Sense.TRAN: 保龄球（运动）﹐十柱保龄球戏

Sense.DEF: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marion spoke, eager to break the tense silence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽昂说话了﹐急于打破这令人紧张的沉默。

Sense.DEF: feeling worried, uncomfortable, and unable to relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

Sense.DEF: unable to relax your body or part of your body because your muscles feel tight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Massage is great if your neck and back are tense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果颈部和背部肌肉紧张﹐按摩很管用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to relax her tense muscles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图放松紧张的肌肉。

Sense.DEF: to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relax, and try not to tense up so much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放松﹐尽量不要把肌肉绷得这么紧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every time the phone rang, she tensed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次电话铃一响她就紧张。

Sense.DEF: any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.
feeling so nervous or worried that you cannot relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian got so tensed up he could hardly speak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩十分紧张﹐几乎说不出话来。

Sense.DEF: able to be stretched without breaking
Sense.EXAMPLE: tensile rubber
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有伸缩性的橡胶

Sense.DEF:
the ability of steel or
concrete
etc to bear pressure or weight without breaking
a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种紧张变得难以忍受﹐我真想大声尖叫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Exercise is the ideal way to relieve tension after a hard day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动锻炼是劳累一天后最理想的减压方法。

Sense.DEF: the feeling that exists when people or countries do not trust each other and may suddenly attack each other or start arguing
Sense.TRAN: 〔人与人或国与国之间的〕紧张关系﹐紧张局势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In those days, there was a great deal of racial tension on campus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候校园里种族关系十分紧张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The obvious tension between Warren and Anne made everyone else uncomfortable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃伦和安妮之间明显的紧张关系让每个人都不舒服。

Sense.DEF: if there is tension between two things, there is a difference between the needs or influences of each, and that causes problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔需求或影响力间的〕冲突﹐紧张状况

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In business, there’s always a tension between the needs of customers and shareholders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在商业活动中﹐客户的需求和股东的需求之间始终存在着矛盾。

Sense.DEF: tightness or stiffness in a wire, rope, muscle etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔电线﹑绳子﹑肌肉等的〕拉紧﹐绷紧
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tension in the neck muscles can cause headaches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颈部肌肉紧张会导致头痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

Sense.DEF: the amount of force that stretches something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a lot of tension on the wire before it snapped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属丝承受着很大的拉力﹐最后绷断了。

Sense.DEF: a shelter consisting of a sheet of cloth supported by poles and ropes, used especially for camping
Sense.EXAMPLE: We looked for a flat spot where we could pitch our tent put up our tent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们寻找一个平缓的地方搭帐篷。

PIC.HEADING: TENT 帐篷
PIC.PICCONTENT: dome tent 圆顶帐篷；a ridge BrE【英】/A-frame AmE【美】tent三角帐篷；peg桩；rope绳

Sense.DEF:
one of the long thin parts of a sea creature such as an
octopus
which it uses for holding things
Sense.TRAN: 〔章鱼等海洋动物的〕触手﹐触角﹐触须

Sense.DEF: the influence or effect that something has on other people or things - used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s tentacles spread from car manufacturing to railways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的扩张触角从汽车制造业伸向了铁路运输业。

Sense.DEF: not definite or certain, and may be changed later
Sense.EXAMPLE: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

Sense.DEF: done without confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tentative smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犹疑的微笑

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔比犹豫地敲敲门﹐走了进去。

Sense.DEF: to feel nervous and excited because you are waiting to find out something or for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been on tenterhooks all night, expecting Joe to return at any moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一晚上都心神不定﹐等待着乔随时回来。

Sense.DEF: coming after nine other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the tenth century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在10世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: her tenth birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的10岁生日

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the tenth the tenth day of the month .

Sense.DEF: one of ten equal parts of something
a situation or relationship that is tenuous is uncertain, weak, or likely to change
Sense.TRAN: 缥缈的﹔脆弱的﹔不确定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: For now, the band’s travel plans are tenuous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队的巡演计划暂时还没确定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The United Peace Alliance had only a tenuous connection with the organized Labour movement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合和平协会和有组织的劳工运动关联甚微。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The link between her family and the King’s is rather tenuous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的家族和王室的关系不是很牢固。

Sense.DEF: very thin and easily broken
the right to stay permanently in a teaching job
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学教师的〕终身职位﹐终身教席﹐终身教职
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s becoming increasingly difficult to acquire academic tenure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得终身教职现在越来越难了。

Sense.DEF: the period of time when someone has an important job
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has doubled in value during his tenure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的任期内﹐公司的市值翻了一番。

Sense.DEF: the legal right to live in a house or use a piece of land for a period of time
a round tent with a pointed top, used by some Native Americans
Sense.TRAN: 〔一些美洲印第安人使用的〕圆锥形帐篷

Sense.DEF: a feeling, reaction etc that is tepid shows a lack of excitement or interest
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情﹑反应等〕缺乏热情的﹐冷淡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tepid response from the audience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众冷淡的反应

Sense.DEF: tepid liquid is slightly warm, especially in a way that seems unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体〕微温的﹐微热的〔尤指温度不合适〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: tepid coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不冷不热的咖啡

Sense.DEF: a strong alcoholic drink made in Mexico
Sense.TRAN: 龙舌兰酒﹐特奎拉酒〔一种墨西哥烈酒〕

Sense.DEF:
a
trillion
- used with units of measurement
Sense.TRAN: 太（拉）﹐万亿﹐兆兆〔和计量单位连用〕

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring computer information, equal to 1,024
gigabytes
, and used less exactly to mean one
trillion bytes
Sense.TRAN: 万亿字节﹐兆兆字节〔信息单位〕

Sense.DEF:
a unit that measures how fast a computer works. One teraflop is one
trillion
operations every second.
the day or year exactly 300 years after a particular event
if you explain or describe something in terms of a particular fact or event, you are explaining or describing it only in relation to that fact or event

GramExa.PROPFORM: describe/measure/evaluate etc sth in terms of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Femininity is still defined in terms of beauty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性美仍然以美貌来界定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a mistake to think of Florida only in terms of its tourist attractions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈到佛罗里达只想到它是旅游胜地是不对的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too early to start talking in terms of casualties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在就开始谈论伤亡人数为时过早。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did the experiment find any differences in terms of what children learned?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就儿童学到了什么而言﹐该实验是否发现了什么不同？

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are describing or considering a subject in a particular way or from a particular point of view
Sense.TRAN: 笼统地讲/从实际意义上来讲/从财政方面等来讲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We explain in simple terms what the treatment involves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用简单的语言来解释治疗的内容。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be wrong to describe society purely in economic terms .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单纯从经济角度来描述社会是错误的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war, although successful in military terms , left the economy in ruins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场战争虽然军事上是胜利的﹐但是对经济却造成了毁灭性的破坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do these statistics mean in human terms ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些统计数据从人类角度来讲有何意义？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In our terms, the scheme has not been a success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从我们的角度来说﹐计划没有成功。

GramExa.GLOSS: accurate, true, or including any related changes
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rail fares have fallen 17 per cent in real terms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车票价实际上降低了17%。

GramExa.GLOSS: compared with other, similar things
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students have less money in relative terms, but spend more on books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对来说﹐学生钱少﹐但买书花的钱却较多。

Sense.DEF: a word or expression with a particular meaning, especially one that is used for a specific subject or type of language

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Multimedia’ is the term for any technique combining sounds and images.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “多媒体”一词是指任何能把声音和图像结合起来的技术。

GramExa.GLOSS: in very clear and angry language
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 措辞明确〔而带怒气〕地﹐毫不含糊地
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Journalists were told in no uncertain terms that they were not welcome.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者们被明确告知﹐他们不受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: a fixed period of time during which someone does something or something happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人做某事或某事发生的〕时期﹐期限﹔任期

GramExa.GLOSS: the time someone spends doing an important job in government
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mayor was coming to the end of his term in office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长任期将满。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the maximum term of imprisonment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最长的刑期
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lease runs for a term of 99 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 租赁的期限为99年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men each received a 30-year prison term.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些男子每人获刑30年。

Sense.DEF: one of the periods of time that the school or university year is divided into. In Britain, there are usually three terms in a year.
Sense.TRAN: 学期〔在英国﹐一年一般有三个学期〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exams are at the end of the summer term.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试在夏季学期期末进行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers often feel overworked in term time during the term .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师在学期内经常觉得工作担子过重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: that all-important first day of term
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开学第一天那个非常重要的日子

Sense.DEF:
used to say what will happen or what happens generally over a long, short, or
medium
period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of living will go up in the short term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活费用会在短期内上涨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the long term, alcohol causes high blood pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期来看﹐酒精会引起高血压。

Sense.DEF: the end of a particular period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The agreement reaches its term next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议明年到期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child born two months before full term of pregnancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早产两个月的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can prolong life beyond its natural term .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以延长自然寿命。

Sense.DEF: to accept an unpleasant or sad situation and no longer feel upset or angry about it
Sense.TRAN: 与某事妥协﹐对某事让步﹔接受〔令人不快或悲伤的现实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: George and Elizabeth have come to terms with the fact that they will never have children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治和伊丽莎白已经接受了他们不能生孩子的事实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Counselling helped her come to terms with her grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理辅导帮助她摆脱悲伤。

Subsense.DEF: the conditions that are set for an agreement, contract, arrangement etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Under the terms of the agreement, the debt would be repaid over 20 years.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据协议条款﹐这笔债务将于20年内还清。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: your terms and conditions of employment
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的雇用条款和条件
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Delivery is within the terms of this contract.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 送货是写在这个合同条款之内的。

GramExa.GLOSS: conditions that are equal, unequal etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 平等/不平等/相同等的条件
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Small businesses have to compete on equal terms with large organisations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小企业不得不和大机构在同等条件下展开竞争。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Men and women should be able to work on level terms .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人和女人应该在待遇平等的条件下工作。

GramExa.GLOSS: according to the conditions that someone wants
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wanted our relationship to be only on his terms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望我们的关系只能由他的意愿来定。

Subsense.DEF: the arrangements for payment that you agree to when you buy or sell something
Subsense.TRAN: 付款条件﹔购买[出售]条件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some insurance companies offer very reasonable terms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些保险公司开出的条件很不错。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: This allowed tenant farmers to buy land on easy terms by paying small sums of money over a long period .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就使佃农可以分期付款购买土地。

Sense.DEF: if you are on good, bad etc terms with someone, you have a good, bad etc relationship with them

GramExa.PROPFORM: be on good/bad/friendly etc terms (with sb)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: By now, Usha and I were on familiar terms .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到现在﹐乌莎和我关系已经很熟了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is barely on speaking terms with his father they are angry and almost never speak to each other .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和他父亲几乎相互不说话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We were soon on first-name terms using each other’s first names, as a sign of friendship .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很快就互相直呼名字了。

Sense.DEF: the subjects that a person or group of people agree to consider
Sense.EXAMPLE: the committee’s terms of reference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会的考虑范围

Sense.DEF: one of the numbers or signs used in a mathematical calculation

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The site provides a glossary of legal terms.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该网站提供法律术语表。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘Gender’ is a technical term in grammar.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “性”是语法上的一个术语。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘The Old Bill’ is a slang term for the police. the Old Bill
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 是俚语﹐指警察。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is insulting or disapproving

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a term used by psychiatrists
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神科医生用的一个词

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: invent it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Funk coined the term ‘vitamin’ in 1912.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬克在1912年创造了“维生素”这个术语。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a word that is offensive or deliberately rude
Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘Geek’ is used as a term of abuse.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: geek被用作骂人话。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a word that expresses your love for someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: terms of endearment like ‘love’, ‘dear’, and ‘honey’
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “爱人”﹑“亲爱的”﹑“宝贝”等爱称

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Pope condemned Nazism in strong terms.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教皇用激烈的言辞谴责纳粹主义。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: praising someone or something highly
using ordinary words, not technical words

Sense.DEF: to use a particular word or expression to name or describe something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This condition is sometimes termed RSI, or repetitive strain injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病有时称为RSI﹐即重复性劳损。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roosevelt termed himself and his policies ‘liberal’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗斯福称他本人和他推行的政策是“开明的”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These developments are loosely termed ‘advanced manufacturing techniques’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些开发成果被泛泛地称作“先进的生产技术”。

Sense.DEF: a terminal illness cannot be cured, and causes death
Sense.EXAMPLE: terminal cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚期癌症

Sense.DEF: in a state of becoming worse and worse and never getting better
Sense.EXAMPLE: The once great industry is now in terminal decline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个曾经十分兴旺的行业现在已日薄西山。

Sense.DEF: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑公共汽车﹑轮船客运或货物运输的〕集散站﹐终点站
Sense.EXAMPLE: the airport’s passenger terminal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场航站楼

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 渡船码头/公共汽车终点站

Sense.DEF:
a piece of computer equipment consisting of at least a
keyboard
and a screen, that you use for putting in or taking out information from a large computer

one of the points at which you can connect wires in an electrical
circuit
if something terminates, or if you terminate it, it ends
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court ruled that the contract must be terminated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭裁决该合同必须终止。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman’s decision on whether or not to terminate the pregnancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女子关于是否终止妊娠的决定

Sense.DEF: if a train, bus, or ship terminates at a particular place, its journey ends there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train from Paris terminates at St Pancras International.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这趟从巴黎发出的火车终点站是圣潘克拉斯国际火车站。

Sense.DEF: the act of ending something, or the end of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You may face a reduction or termination of benefits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的津贴可能会减少或取消。

Sense.DEF: a medical operation to end the life of a developing child before it is born

a
sterile
seed from a
genet-ically modified
plant, that cannot be used to produce future crops
Sense.TRAN: 绝育种子﹐终结种子〔转基因植物所结的种子﹐不能用于再繁殖〕

Sense.DEF: the technical words or expressions that are used in a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: computer terminology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机术语

Sense.DEF: the station or stop at the end of a railway or bus line
Sense.TRAN: 〔铁路或公共汽车线路的〕终点站

Sense.DEF: an insect that eats and destroys wood from trees and buildings
a particular number of years that the law allows someone to stay in a particular political position

happening each
term one of the three periods in the school or university year
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students can pay fees in termly instalments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生可以分学期交纳学费。

Sense.DEF: a long piece of written work done by college students in the US, that is the most important piece of work in their course
the part of the year when classes are given at a school, college, or university
a black and white sea bird that has long wings and a tail with two points
a row of houses that are joined to each other, or a street with one of these rows in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔互相连接的〕一排房屋﹐排屋﹔〔排屋面对的〕街道

Sense.DEF: a flat outdoor area next to a building or on a roof, where you can sit outside to eat, relax etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔供人坐在室外吃喝、休息等的〕露天平台

Sense.DEF: the wide steps that the people watching a football match can stand on
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球赛观众可站立的〕阶梯看台

Sense.DEF: one of a series of flat areas cut out of a hill like steps, and used to grow crops
a terraced field, slope, garden etc has been cut into a series of flat areas along the side of the slope
Sense.EXAMPLE: terraced rice fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水稻梯田

Sense.DEF: a house which is part of a row of houses that are joined together
Sense.TRAN: 排屋〔一排相连房屋中的一幢〕

Sense.DEF:
hard reddish-brown baked
clay
Sense.EXAMPLE: a terracotta pot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赤陶土罐

Sense.DEF: a brownish red colour
land, rather than sea or air - used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were glad to be back on terra firma.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很高兴回到了陆地上。

Sense.DEF:
to change the conditions on a
planet
so that people can live on it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔行星〕地球化〔以适合人类居住〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would it be possible to terraform Mars?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有可能把火星改造成适合人类居住的地方？

Sense.DEF: a particular type of land
Sense.EXAMPLE: rocky terrain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多石的地形

Sense.DEF:
a small
turtle
that lives in water
Sense.TRAN: 水龟〔生活在水中的一种小龟〕

Sense.DEF: a large glass container that you grow plants in as a decoration
Sense.TRAN: 〔栽培装饰性植物所用的〕大玻璃盆

Sense.DEF:
relating to the Earth rather than to the moon or other
planets
living on or relating to land rather than water

TV etc that is broadcast from the Earth rather than from a
satellite
extremely severe in a way that causes harm or damage
Sense.TRAN: 剧烈的﹔厉害的﹔非常严重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their son had been injured in a terrible accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的儿子在一次严重事故中受过伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re worried that something terrible might have happened to Greg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们担心格雷格有可能遇到了什么可怕的事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a terrible storm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猛烈的暴风雨

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最好把它记下来﹐我的记性很差。

Sense.DEF: making you feel afraid or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的﹐骇人的﹔令人震惊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a terrible noise and the roof caved in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着一阵可怕的响声﹐房顶坍塌了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wept when she heard the terrible news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听说这个噩耗后痛哭流涕。

Sense.DEF: to a very great degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re making a terrible mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m terribly sorry to have kept you waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉﹐让你久等了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coach was not terribly worried about his team’s poor performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练对他所执教球队的糟糕表现并不是十分担忧。

Sense.DEF: very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The little boy missed his mother terribly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那小男孩太想念他妈妈了。

Sense.DEF: a small active type of dog that was originally used for hunting
Sense.TRAN: 〔一种最初用于狩猎的小型犬〕

Sense.DEF: very good, especially in a way that makes you feel happy and excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a terrific idea!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个主意真棒！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The actress who played the lawyer was terrific.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扮演律师的女演员表演十分出色。

Sense.DEF: very large in size or degree
Sense.TRAN: 〔尺寸或程度〕极其巨大的﹐大得惊人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a terrific bang
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砰的一声巨响
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drank a terrific amount of beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝了太多的啤酒。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been so terrifically busy that she barely had time to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她太忙了﹐几乎没有时间睡觉。

Sense.DEF: very frightened
Sense.TRAN: 非常害怕的﹐极度惊恐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a terrified little girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个惊恐万分的小女孩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sid is terrified of heights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 锡德有恐高症。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was terrified of being caught.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很怕被抓住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were terrified that the bridge would collapse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很害怕桥会倒塌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was terrified at the thought of being stranded in the woods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到自己被困在树林里﹐他感到非常恐惧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was terrified to stay home alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很害怕独自一人待在家里。

Sense.DEF: to make someone extremely afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband’s violence terrified her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫的暴力行为让她感到害怕。

Sense.DEF: extremely frightening
Sense.TRAN: 极其可怕的﹐骇人听闻的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He told her of his terrifying experience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她讲述了自己的可怕经历。

Sense.EXAMPLE: terrifying screams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的尖叫声
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was absolutely terrifying .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这极其恐怖。

Sense.DEF:
a food made of cooked meat, fish, or fruit formed into a
loaf
shape and served cold, or the dish this is served in
Sense.TRAN: 陶罐肉冻[鱼冻﹐水果冻]﹔〔装陶罐肉冻等的〕陶罐

Sense.DEF: related to land that is owned or controlled by a particular country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a territorial dispute
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领土争端
Sense.EXAMPLE: territorial claims
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领土（主权）要求

Sense.DEF: animals or people that are territorial are careful to guard the area of land that they consider to be their own, and prevent others from using it
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物或人类〕有地盘意识的﹐领地性的‚
