Sense.DEF: a military force of people in Britain who train as soldiers in their free time
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国业余时间接受军训的〕本土防卫义勇军

Sense.DEF: the sea near a country’s coast, which that country has legal control over
land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香港是中国的领土。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane was flying over enemy territory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架飞机当时在敌区上空飞行。

Sense.DEF: land of a particular type

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an expedition through previously unexplored territory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次穿越先前未勘探地区的探险

Sense.DEF: the area that an animal, bird etc regards as its own and will defend against other animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: A tiger has a large territory to defend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老虎要守护的地盘很广。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A dog uses urine to mark its territory .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗用尿来标记自己的领地。

Sense.DEF: a particular area of experience or knowledge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Actor Patrick Bergin returns to more familiar territory to play a menacing killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员帕特里克•博金重回他原来驾轻就熟的戏路﹐扮演一名危险的杀手。

Sense.DEF: an area in a town, country etc that someone is responsible for as part of their job, especially someone whose job is to sell products
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人负责的〕地区〔尤指产品销售人员负责的片区〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sales territory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售辖区

Sense.DEF: to be a natural and accepted part of a particular job, situation, place etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某种工作中﹑某种情况下﹑某个地方等〕是难免会碰到的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a cop – getting shot at goes with the territory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是个警察——干这一行挨枪子是难免的。

Sense.SIGNPOST: LAND THAT IS NOT A STATE
Sense.DEF: land that belongs to the United States, Canada etc but that is not a state
Sense.EXAMPLE: the US territory of Guam
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国属地关岛

Sense.DEF: a feeling of extreme fear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People fled in terror as fire tore through the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼里火势迅速蔓延﹐人们惊慌失措﹐纷纷逃离。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shots rang out, and I screamed in terror .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪声响起﹐我惊恐地尖叫起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We lived in terror of our father when he was drinking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲一喝酒我们便心惊胆战。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a look of sheer terror complete terror on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上的表情异常惊恐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sound of enemy planes struck terror into our hearts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一听到敌机的声音﹐我们就胆战心惊。

Sense.DEF: an event or situation that makes people feel extremely frightened, especially because they think they may die
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指令人担忧生命安危的〕可怕的事[情况]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the terrors of war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的恐怖

Sense.EXAMPLE: Death holds no terrors for does not frighten me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡吓不倒我。

Sense.DEF: violent action for political purposes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The resistance movement started a campaign of terror .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抵抗情绪造成恐怖事件接连发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tried to undermine the state by terror tactics .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图通过恐怖手段削弱国家政权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Jacobins’ reign of terror
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雅各宾派恐怖统治时期

Sense.DEF: a child who is difficult to control
Sense.EXAMPLE: That Johnson kid’s a real little terror!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊家的那个孩子真是个调皮鬼！

Sense.DEF:
the use of violence such as bombing, shooting, or
kidnapping
to obtain political demands such as making a government do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is doing everything possible to combat terrorism .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正在尽其所能打击恐怖主义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a despicable act of terrorism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖主义的卑劣行径
Sense.EXAMPLE: their involvement in international terrorism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们参与国际恐怖主义活动

Sense.DEF: someone who uses violence such as bombing, shooting etc to obtain political demands
Sense.EXAMPLE: We refuse to talk to terrorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们拒绝和恐怖分子对话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Twenty people were killed in the latest terrorist attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有20人死于最近这次恐怖袭击。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a terrorist bomb that left 168 people dead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子引爆造成168人死亡的炸弹

Sense.DEF: to deliberately frighten people by threatening to harm them, especially so they will do what you want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people have been terrorized into leaving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人受到恐吓被迫离开。

Sense.EXAMPLE: gangs who terrorize the neighbourhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使邻近地区人心惶惶的犯罪团伙

Sense.DEF:
a type of thick cotton cloth with uncut threads on both sides, that can take liquid into itself, and is used to make
towels
a terse reply, message etc uses very few words and often shows that you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔回答﹑信息等〕简短的〔常表示厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Derek’s terse reply ended the conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德里克的简短回答结束了谈话。

Sense.DEF: third in place, degree, or order
Sense.TRAN: 第三的﹔第三级的﹔第三位的

Sense.DEF: education at a college, university etc
a light strong artificial cloth
Sense.TRAN: 涤纶〔一种人造纤维面料〕

Sense.DEF: the teaching of English as a second language
Sense.TRAN: 作为第二语言的英语教学

Sense.DEF: the teaching of English to speakers of other languages
Sense.TRAN: 对外英语教学﹐对母语为非英语人士的英语教学

Sense.DEF: made of small flat pieces in various shapes and colours that fit together to form a pattern
a set of questions, exercises, or practical activities to measure someone’s skill, ability, or knowledge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have a test on irregular verbs tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我们要测验﹐考不规则动词。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you get a good mark in the test?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这次测验成绩好吗？
Sense.HINTTRAN: You take or do a test. Do not say ‘make a test’. To pass a test means to succeed in it, not simply to take it. 参加测验说take或do a test﹐不说make a test。pass a test的意思是通过测验﹐而不是仅仅指参加测验。

Subsense.DEF: a medical examination on a part of your body, or a substance taken from your body, to check your health or to discover what is wrong with you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The doctor said I need to have a blood test .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说我得验血。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an eye test
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼睛检查
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a hearing test
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听力检查
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m still waiting for my test results from the hospital.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还在等待医院的化验结果。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They don’t know what’s wrong with her yet – they’re doing tests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还不知道她有什么问题——他们正在做检查。

GramExa.GLOSS: it shows that someone has/does not have a condition, a substance in their blood etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tests were negative and the doctor said that she was in perfect health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 检测结果是阴性﹐医生说她的身体十分健康。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a test for HIV
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾滋病病毒检测

Subsense.DEF: an examination of someone’s blood, breath etc carried out by the police, to discover if they have done something illegal
Subsense.TRAN: 〔警方为检查违法之事而做的〕检查﹐测试
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a drugs test
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品测试
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The results of the DNA test proved that Simmons was the rapist. DNA
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 测试证明西蒙斯是强奸者。

GramExa.GLOSS: to find out if someone has been drinking alcohol before driving a car

Subsense.DEF: a piece of equipment used for carrying out a medical examination
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a pregnancy test
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 验孕试剂

Sense.DEF: a process used to discover whether equipment or a product works correctly, or to discover more about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: nuclear weapons tests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核武器试验

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a test for chemicals in the water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水中化学物质检测

Sense.EXAMPLE: Laboratory tests show that the new drug is very effective.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验室测试表明这种新药十分有效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went to the test site in Nevada.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去了位于内华达州的试验场。

Sense.DEF: a difficult situation in which the qualities of someone or something are clearly shown
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chess player Nigel Short faces Anatoly Karpov in the toughest test of his career so far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际象棋选手奈杰尔•肖特将和阿纳托利•卡尔波夫对弈﹐这是他职业生涯中迄今为止最为严峻的考验。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The problems she faced were a real test of character.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她面临的那些问题是对她人品的一次真正考验。

Sense.DEF: to force someone or something into a difficult situation in order to discover what the limits of their strength, skills etc are
Sense.EXAMPLE: Living together will soon put their relationship to the test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起生活马上就能考验他们的关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul soon found himself in an emergency situation that put all his training to the test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗很快发现自己情况危急﹐他所接受的全部训练都受到了考验。

Sense.DEF:
a
test match
Sense.TRAN: 板球[橄榄球]的国际比赛

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All candidates have to take a test.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有候选人必须参加测试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed in it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She passed her driving test first time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她第一次就通过了驾照考试。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He failed the test and had to take it again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他测验不及格﹐必须重考。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I didn’t do very well in the first part of the test.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一部分我考得不是很好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: On Monday we had a French test.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一我们进行了法语测验。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I didn’t do very well in the listening test.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 听力我考得不是很好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which each question has a list of answers to choose from
a test that measures your natural abilities

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The teacher began handing out the test papers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师开始分发试卷。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The test results are out on Friday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 测验成绩周五公布。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘make a test’. Say 而要说 take a test or 或 do a test .

Exponent.DEF: a set of questions or practical activities, which are intended to find out how much someone knows about a subject or skill
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have a chemistry test tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天有化学测验。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did Lauren pass her driving test?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳伦通过驾照考试了吗？

Exponent.DEF: an important test that you do at the end of a course of study or class or at the end of the school year
Exponent.TRAN: 〔课程或学年结束时举行的〕考试
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s upstairs, revising for an exam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在楼上复习迎考。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When do you get your exam results?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候可以拿到考试成绩？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s a written examination at the end of the course.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程结束时要进行书面考试。

Exponent.DEF: a quick test that a teacher gives to a class, usually to check that students are learning the things they should be learning
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We have a math quiz every Monday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每周一有数学小测验。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pop quiz a quiz given by a teacher without any warning
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 突击性小测验

Exponent.DEF: the last exams that you take at the end of a British university course
an important test that you take at the end of a particular class in high school or college
an important test that you take in the middle of a term, covering what you have learned in a particular class in high school or college
an exam in which you answer questions by speaking, instead of writing, for example to test how good you are at speaking a foreign language
an exam that tests your ability to do or make things, rather than your ability to write about them
tests that you take as practice before the official examinations
a set of printed questions used as an examination in a particular subject, or the answers people write
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The history paper was really difficult.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史试卷很难。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The papers are marked by the other teachers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 试卷由其他老师批改。

Sense.DEF: to examine someone’s blood, body etc in order to find out what is wrong with them, or to see if they have taken an illegal drug
Sense.TRAN: 化验〔血液等〕﹔检查〔身体〕﹐给…体检
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must have my eyes tested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须检查一下我的眼睛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They tested her for diabetes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给她做了糖尿病检查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Athletes who test positive for steroids are immediately banned.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 类固醇检测呈阳性的运动员会立即被禁赛。

Sense.DEF: to examine a substance or thing in order to find out its qualities or what it contains

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The water should be tested for lead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这水应该检测含铅量。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone spoken or written questions, or make them do a practical activity, to discover what they know about a subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: This task is designed to test your reading skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项任务的目的是考查你的阅读能力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re being tested on grammar tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们明天测验语法。

Sense.DEF: to use something for a short time to see if it works in the correct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Ferrari team wanted to test their new car out on the racetrack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法拉利车队想在跑道上试新车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: None of this range of cosmetics has been tested on animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一系列的化妆品都没有在动物身上做过试验。

Sense.DEF: to show how good or strong someone or something is, especially by putting them in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a game that will test the contestants’ strength and skill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考验选手体力和技能的比赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next six months will test your powers of leadership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的六个月将考验你的领导能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt that she was testing me, leaving all that cash lying around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉她把那么多现金到处乱放是在考验我。

Sense.DEF: to start to use an idea or plan to find out if it is correct or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Lee set up a series of experiments to test out this hypothesis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李博士设计了一系列实验来验证这个假设。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The theory was then tested against the results of the study.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个理论接着对照研究结果进行了检验。

Sense.DEF: to check people’s reaction to a plan before you decide to use it
Sense.TRAN: 试水﹐试探〔人们对某项计划的〕反应
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is clearly testing the water, to gauge the country’s reactions to their proposals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府显然是在试探国民对他们提案的反应。

Sense.DEF: testable things can be tested
Sense.TRAN: 可检验的﹔可试验的﹔可验证的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think this theory is testable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这一理论无法验证。

Sense.DEF: proving or showing very clearly that something exists or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aircraft’s safety record is a testament to its designers’ skill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的安全记录是设计师能力的明证。

Sense.DEF:
a
will 2 2

an agreement between countries to stop testing
nuclear
weapons
Sense.EXAMPLE: the test ban treaty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止核试验条约

Sense.DEF: a pattern or picture that is shown on television when there are no programmes
Sense.TRAN: 〔无节目时电视屏幕上显示的〕测试图案

Sense.DEF: a legal case that establishes a particular principle, that is then used as a standard which other similar cases can be judged against
Sense.TRAN: 判例〔确定某种判决准则﹑供其他类似案件作判决依据的案件〕

Sense.DEF: the official paper that proves that a car is legally safe enough to drive
an occasion when you drive a car so that you can decide if you want to buy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔购买汽车时的〕试验驾驶﹐试车

Sense.DEF: a person or piece of equipment that tests something
Sense.TRAN: 测试员﹐试验员﹔测试器﹐测试仪

Sense.DEF:
a small bottle of
perfume 1 1
etc, in a shop, for customers to try
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店里供顾客试用的〕小瓶装试用品〔如香水〕

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
testis

one of the two round organs that produce
sperm
in a male, that are enclosed in a bag of skin behind and below the
penis
to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Molto has agreed to testify at the trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫尔托先生已经同意出庭作证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Later, the witness who had testified against Muawad withdrew his allegation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来﹐举证指控穆瓦瓦德的那位证人撤回了证词。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you testify that you saw the defendant at the scene of the crime?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能作证你看到被告在犯罪现场吗？

Sense.DEF: to show clearly that something is the case

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The empty shops in the high street testify to the depth of the recession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大街上空无一人的商店说明了经济萧条的严重程度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The full ashtrays testify that smoking hasn’t been stubbed out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟灰装得满满的烟灰缸说明烟并未戒掉。

Sense.DEF: to stand up and tell people about how God has helped you in your life
Sense.TRAN: 作见证〔指基督徒向人们诉说上帝的恩典〕

Sense.DEF: a formal written statement describing someone’s character and abilities
Sense.TRAN: 〔介绍描述某人品格和能力的〕证明书﹐推荐信

Sense.DEF: something that is given or done to someone to thank or praise them, or show admiration for them
Sense.TRAN: 感谢信﹔表扬信﹔奖状﹔奖励
Sense.EXAMPLE: a testimonial dinner in honour of Senator Frank Flint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为参议员弗兰克•弗林特举办的答谢晚宴

Sense.DEF:
a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a
witness
makes in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

Sense.DEF: a fact or situation that shows or proves very clearly that something exists or is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These results are a testimony to the coach’s skill and hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些成绩是教练的水平和辛勤工作的证明。

Sense.DEF: a testing situation, experience etc is difficult to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a testing time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一段艰难时期。

Sense.DEF: a place where machines, cars etc are tested to see if they work properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑汽车等的〕试验场﹐试验地

Sense.DEF: a situation or problem in which you can try new ideas and methods to see if they work
Sense.TRAN: 〔新思想和新方法的〕试验机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eastern Europe has become a testing ground for high-speed privatization.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东欧已经成为高速私有化的试验场。

Sense.DEF:
a
testicle

a
cricket
or
rugby
match that is played between the teams of different countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球或英式橄榄球的〕国际比赛

Sense.DEF:
the
hormone chemical produced by the body
in males that gives them their male qualities
a pilot who flies new aircraft in order to test them
an occasion when you try doing something or using something before you really need to use it, to make sure everything works properly
a small glass container that is shaped like a tube and is used in chemistry
a baby that develops from an egg removed from a woman’s body, that is then put back inside the woman to continue developing
impatient and easily annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: testy remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不耐烦的话语
Sense.EXAMPLE: It had been a long day, and Sarah was getting a little testy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一天过得真慢﹐萨拉有点不耐烦了。

Sense.DEF:
a serious illness caused by
bacteria
that enter your body through cuts and wounds and make your muscles, especially your jaw, go stiff
likely to get angry or upset easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane’s a bit tetchy this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简今天上午有点犯急。

Sense.DEF: a private conversation between two people
Sense.EXAMPLE: friends having a cosy tête-à-tête
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私下亲切交谈的朋友

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at the end of your tether
Sense.DEF: to be so worried, tired etc that you feel you can no longer deal with a difficult or upsetting situation
Sense.TRAN: 忍无可忍﹔走投无路﹔一筹莫展

Sense.DEF: a rope or chain that an animal is tied to so that it can only move around within a limited area
to tie an animal to a post so that it can only move around within a limited area
having four of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tetrahedron solid shape with four sides
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个四面体

Sense.DEF: a solid shape with fourteen sides
having qualities that are thought to be typical of German people
Sense.TRAN: 日耳曼人作风的﹔典型德国人风格的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teutonic efficiency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日耳曼人的效率

Sense.DEF: relating to the ancient German peoples of northwest Europe
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teutonic mythology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条顿神话

Sense.DEF: relating to the music, cooking etc of Mexican-American people
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐﹑烹饪等〕墨西哥裔美国人风格的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Tex-Mex restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家墨西哥裔美国人餐馆

Sense.DEF: any written material
Sense.EXAMPLE: One disk can store the equivalent of 500 pages of text.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张磁盘可以储存相当于500页的文字。

Sense.DEF: the writing that forms the main part of a book, magazine etc, rather than the pictures or notes
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑杂志等的〕正文〔区别于图片或注释〕﹐文字
Sense.EXAMPLE: There should not be too much text in children’s books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童书籍里不应该有太多的文字。

Sense.DEF: a book or other piece of writing that is connected with learning or intended for study
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the original text has survived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些原始教材保留了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Literary texts, like all other works of art, have a historical context.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文学作品和其他所有的艺术作品一样﹐也是有历史背景的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hamlet’ is a set text one that must be studied for an examination this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《哈姆雷特》是今年指定的教材。

Sense.DEF: a textbook
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chemistry text
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学课本

Sense.DEF: the exact words of a speech, article etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only ‘The Times’ printed the full text of the President’s speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有《泰晤士报》刊载了总统演说的全文。

Sense.DEF:
a
text message
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sent me a text saying he would be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我发短信说他晚会儿到。

Sense.DEF: a short piece from the Bible that someone reads and talks about during a religious service
Sense.TRAN: 〔宗教仪式上某人诵读并讲述的一小段〕圣经经文

Sense.DEF:
to send someone a written message on a
mobile phone
a book that contains information about a subject that people study, especially at school or college
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biology textbook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本生物教科书

Sense.DEF: used to describe something that is done exactly as it should be done, or happens exactly as it should happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The advertising campaign was a textbook example of how to sell a product.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个广告活动是产品营销的一个范本案例。

Sense.DEF: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的主要出口商品是纺织品﹐尤其是丝绸和棉布。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: textile design and technology
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纺织品的设计和工艺
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a textile mill
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纺织厂

Sense.DEF: the industry involved in making cloth

a written message that is sent or received on a
mobile phone
or
pager
Sense.TRAN: 〔手机或传呼机的〕短信﹐短消息

Sense.DEF:
to send someone a written message on a
mobile phone
or
pager
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手机或传呼机〕给…发送短信
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always text messaging her friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是给她的朋友们发短信。

Sense.DEF: the abbreviations used in text messages
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘NP’ is textspeak for ‘No problem’. NP
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是No Problem（没问题）的短信简语。

Sense.DEF: relating to the way that a book, magazine etc is written
Sense.EXAMPLE: a detailed textual analysis of the Bible
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对《圣经》文本的详尽分析

Sense.DEF: the way a surface or material feels when you touch it, especially how smooth or rough it is
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指光滑或粗糙的〕手感﹐质感﹐质地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the smooth texture of silk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丝绸的光滑质感

Sense.EXAMPLE: a designer who experiments with different colours and textures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尝试不同色彩和材质的设计师

Sense.DEF: the way that a particular type of food feels in your mouth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This soup has a lovely creamy texture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这汤喝起来有奶油的口感﹐挺不错的。

Sense.DEF: the way the different parts of a piece of writing, music, art etc are combined in order to produce a final effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章﹑音乐﹑艺术等作品的〕神韵
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich texture of Shakespeare’s English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚笔下英语的丰富神韵

Sense.DEF: having a surface that is not smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: textured wallpaper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有纹理的墙纸

Sense.DEF: having a texture that is smooth etc
Sense.TRAN: 质地光滑/粗糙/细密等的
Sense.EXAMPLE: smooth-textured skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光滑的皮肤

Sense.DEF: used to describe a work of art, literature, music etc that has many different parts that are combined to produce a final effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: a richly textured novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有神韵的小说

Sense.DEF: a substance made from beans, used instead of meat
Sense.TRAN: 结构性植物蛋白﹐植物组织蛋白

Sense.DEF:
forms
ordinal
numbers, except with 1, 2, or 3
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 17th of June
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6月17日
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fifth of the total
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总数的五分之一

Sense.DEF:
another form of
-eth

GramExa.GLOSS: does

Sense.DEF: a drug given to people to make them calm, until it was discovered that it harmed the development of the arms and legs of unborn babies
Sense.TRAN: 沙利度胺﹐反应停〔原用作孕妇的镇静剂﹐被发现损害胎儿四肢发育后停用〕

Sense.DEF:
a soft blue-white metal that is poisonous, used in
photoelectric cells
and to kill rats, mice, and insects. It is a chemical
element
:symbol Tl
Sense.TRAN: 铊〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Tl〕

Sense.DEF: used when comparing two things, people, situations etc
Sense.TRAN: 比〔用于两个事物的比较﹐引出第二个事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Natalie was prettier than her sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳塔莉比她姐姐漂亮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need that money more than I do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你比我更需要那笔钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were more people there than I expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里的人比我预想的要多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it costs more than $60, I won’t buy it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果价格超过60美元﹐我就不买了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had woken even earlier than usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她甚至比平时醒得更早。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Divorce is more common than it was a generation ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在离婚比上一代人常见了。

Sense.DEF: except for a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: We never go to church other than for funerals and weddings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了参加葬礼和婚礼﹐我们从不去教堂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We know he lived in Fleet Road, but other than that we don’t know much about him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只知道他住在舰队路﹐除此之外﹐我们对他了解不多。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you prefer one thing to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d rather drive than go by train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宁愿开车去而不愿坐火车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said she’d rather die than live in the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她宁愿死也不住在城里。

Sense.DEF: used to say that one thing happens immediately after another thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: No sooner had I got into the house than the phone rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚进屋﹐电话铃就响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hardly had they reached Edinburgh than they were ordered to return to London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们刚抵达爱丁堡就接到回伦敦的命令。

Sense.DEF:
a man who fought for the King but was below the rank of a
knight
in early English history
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国早期历史上为国王服兵役﹑地位低于骑士的〕大乡绅

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that you are pleased and grateful for something they have done, or to be polite about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t had a chance to thank him yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有机会向他表示谢意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you thank Uncle Ron for the present?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你谢过罗恩叔叔给你礼物吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Madeleine thanked everyone for coming.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马德琳对大家的到来表示感谢。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very glad about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank God that’s over! I’ve never been so nervous in my life!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢上帝﹐终于结束了！我一生中从来没有这么紧张过！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Only ten miles to go.’ ‘Thank heavens for that!’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “只剩十英里了。”“谢天谢地！”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are very lucky, especially because they have avoided an unpleasant or dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should thank your lucky stars I got here when I did!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真走运﹐幸亏我及时赶到这里！

Sense.LEXUNIT: only have yourself to thank (for sth)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are responsible for something bad that has happened to you
Sense.TRAN: （某事）只能怪自己﹐（某事）是咎由自取
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has only herself to thank if she doesn’t have any friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她没有任何朋友﹐那只能怪她自己。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to be annoyed with you for doing or saying something, because it will be helpful to them later
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll thank me for this one day, Laura.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你总有一天会因此而感谢我的﹐劳拉。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb won’t thank you (for doing sth)
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that another person will be annoyed because of what they have done
Sense.TRAN: 某人不会（因你做了某事而）感谢你的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know you’re just trying to help, but he won’t thank you for telling him how to do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你只是想帮忙﹐但他不高兴你对他指手画脚。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ll thank you to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone in an angry way not to do something because it is annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 请你最好做某事〔用来要求别人不要做令说话人恼火的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll thank you to mind your own business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你别管闲事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sb to thank for (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: to say that you are grateful to someone who is responsible for something good happening. This expression is sometimes used humorously to mean that you are not grateful for what someone has done
Sense.TRAN: 因某事感谢某人〔有时为幽默用法﹐用作反语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have Phil to thank for getting me my first job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得感谢菲尔帮我找到了第一份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: And who do I have to thank for that mess on my desk?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的桌上那么乱﹐是谁干的好事？

Sense.DEF: grateful and glad about something that has happened, especially because without it the situation would be much worse
Sense.TRAN: 感谢的﹐感激的﹔为…感到高兴的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll be thankful for a good night’s sleep after the week I’ve had.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个星期下来﹐我要能好好地睡上一个晚上就感激不尽了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was thankful that Chantal was there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她庆幸有尚塔尔在。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was thankful to make any sort of progress at all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能取得任何一点进步我都感到欣慰。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are glad that something has happened, especially because a difficult situation has ended or been avoided
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thankfully, I managed to pay off all my debts before we got married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好﹐在我们结婚前我设法还清了所有债务。

Sense.DEF: feeling grateful and glad about something, especially because a difficult situation has ended or been avoided
Sense.TRAN: 庆幸地﹐满怀感激地〔尤指已摆脱或避开困境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We came in and collapsed thankfully onto our beds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进到屋里﹐满怀庆幸地倒在床上。

Sense.DEF: a thankless job is difficult and you do not get any praise for doing it
Sense.TRAN: 吃力不讨好的﹐徒劳无功的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cooking every day is a thankless task.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天做饭是一件费力不讨好的事。

Sense.DEF: a thankless person is not grateful
used to tell someone that you are grateful for something they have given you or done for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Pass the salt, please…thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “请把盐递过来…谢谢。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thanks a lot for the drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多谢你请我喝酒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks very much for your help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常感谢你的帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many thanks for the lovely flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花很漂亮﹐非常感谢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d love to go to the party. Thanks for asking me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常愿意去参加派对。谢谢你邀请我。

Sense.DEF: used as a polite way of accepting something that someone has offered you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want another cup of coffee?’ ‘Oh, thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你还想要一杯咖啡吗？”“呃﹐谢谢。”

Sense.DEF: used when politely answering someone’s question
Sense.TRAN: 谢谢〔用于对某人问题的礼貌回答〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hi, Bill, how are you?’ ‘ Fine, thanks .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “嗨﹐比尔﹐你好吗？”“很好﹐谢谢。”

Sense.DEF: used to say politely that you do not want something
Sense.TRAN: 不用﹐谢谢〔用于礼貌拒绝某事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How about some cake?’ ‘Oh, no thanks, I’m on a diet.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “来点蛋糕怎么样？” “哦﹐不用﹐谢谢﹐我在节食。”

Sense.DEF: used when really you are annoyed about something and you do not mean ‘thank you’ at all
Sense.TRAN: 谢谢你〔反语﹐表示对某事感到生气〕

Sense.DEF: the things you say or do to show that you are grateful to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe got up and left without a word of thanks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔起身离开了﹐一句感谢的话也没有说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My thanks to all of you for your help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对你们大家的帮助表示感谢。

Sense.DEF: because of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 归功于某人/某事物﹔多亏某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve reached our goal of $50,000, thanks to the generosity of the public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完成了募集50,000美元的目标﹐这要归功于公众的慷慨大方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some ski resorts opened early, thanks to a late-October snowstorm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些滑雪胜地提前开放了﹐这多亏10月末的一场暴风雪。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘thank to someone/something’.

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning ‘in spite of’, used when someone should have helped you but did not
Sense.TRAN: 并非由于某人/某事物才…
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was no thanks to you that we managed to win the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们并不是因为你才打赢了那场比赛。

Sense.DEF: an expression of thanks to God
a public holiday in the US and in Canada when families have a large meal together to celebrate and be thankful for food, health, families etc
Sense.TRAN: 感恩节〔美国和加拿大的一个公共假日〕

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are grateful for something they have given you or done for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margaret handed him the butter. ‘Thank you,’ said Samuel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特把黄油递给了他。“谢谢你。”塞缪尔说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you very much, Brian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常感谢﹐布赖恩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s good to see you, Mr. Mathias. Thank you for coming.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高兴见到您﹐马赛厄斯先生。 谢谢您的光临。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dear Grandma, thank you for the lovely shirt you sent me for Christmas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲爱的外婆﹐谢谢您圣诞节寄给我那件漂亮的衬衫。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘I thank you’.

Sense.DEF: used as a polite way of accepting something that someone has offered
Sense.TRAN: 谢谢你〔接受某事的礼貌表示〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I give you a lift into town?’ ‘Oh, thank you.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “搭我的车进城好吗？”“噢﹐谢谢你。”

Sense.DEF: used when politely answering someone’s question
Sense.TRAN: 谢谢你〔对某人问题的礼貌回答〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How was your trip to Paris?’ ‘Very nice, thank you.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的巴黎之行怎么样？”“非常愉快﹐谢谢。”

Sense.DEF: used to say politely that you do not want something
Sense.TRAN: 不用﹐谢谢〔用于表示礼貌拒绝〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like some more coffee?’ ‘No, thank you, I’m fine.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “再来点咖啡吗？”“不用了﹐谢谢﹐我够了。”

Sense.DEF: used at the end of a sentence when telling someone firmly that you do not want their help or advice and are slightly annoyed by it
Sense.TRAN: 多谢〔用于句末﹐表示略带气愤地谢绝对方提供的帮助或建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can manage quite well on my own, thank you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己完全能行﹐多谢！

Sense.DEF: something you say or do in order to thank someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: This present’s a thank-you for helping me last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份礼物是对上个星期你帮助我的感谢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to say a big thank-you to everyone who supported us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就想对所有支持过我们的人表示由衷的感谢。

Sense.DEF: a short letter etc in which you thank someone
used to refer to a person, thing, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about
Sense.TRAN: 那﹐那个〔指已经提到或已经知道的人﹑事物﹑想法等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You never cared about me.’ ‘That’s not true.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你从不关心我。”“那不是事实。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you wouldn’t say things like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你不要那么说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did you do with those sandwiches?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些三明治你怎么处理了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victoria Street? That’s where my sister lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚街？我的姐姐就住在那儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you remember that nice Mr Hoskins who came to dinner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还记得那位来这儿吃过晚饭的好人霍斯金斯先生吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got that pain in my back again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的背又疼起来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He killed a man once and that’s why he had to leave Ireland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他曾杀死过一个人﹐这就是他不得不离开爱尔兰的原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We’ve been cheated,’ she said. Those were her exact words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们被骗了。”她说。这是她的原话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I have to go,’ she said, and with that after saying that she hung up the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我得走了。”说完她就把电话挂了。

Sense.DEF:
used after a noun as a
relative pronoun
like ‘who’, ‘whom’, or ‘which’ to introduce a
clause
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于名词后﹐相当于who﹐whom 或 which 一类的关系代词﹐以引出从句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are lots of things that I need to buy before the trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去旅行之前我需要买很多东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the people that live next door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在隔壁的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got a machine that prints names on badges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有一台机器﹐可以在徽章上印上名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the greatest boxer that ever lived
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有史以来最伟大的拳击手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who was it that said ‘The Law’s an Ass’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “法律是狗屁”这句话是谁说的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The day that my father died, I was on holiday in Greece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲去世的那天﹐我正在希腊度假。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: That is often left out when it is the object of the verb in the relative clause.
F2NBox.TRAN: 关系从句中﹐that用作动词宾语时﹐常省略
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They have not kept the promises they made that they made.
F2NBox.EXPL: That can only be used as a relative pronoun to specify a person or thing, not to add extra information. When adding extra information, use who or which .
F2NBox.TRAN: that用作关系代词时﹐只特指人或事物﹐不是补充内容。补充内容用who或which
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She had to look after her husband, who was ill.

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a particular person or thing of the general type that has just been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 那﹐那个﹐那种〔用于指某类人或事物所属的大类〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my opinion, the finest wines are those from France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为﹐最好的葡萄酒产自法国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His own experience was different from that of his friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自己的体会和他朋友的体会不同。

Sense.DEF: people who
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are those who disapprove of all forms of gambling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人反对任何形式的赌博。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those who saw the performance thought it memorable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看过的人都认为这场表演令人难忘。

Sense.DEF: used after adding a piece of information which emphasizes and increases what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 此外﹐而且〔用于强调并增加内容〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should be able to answer the question in a single sentence, and a short one at that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该能用一个句子﹐而且是一个简短的句子来回答这个问题。

Sense.DEF: used to give more exact information about something or to correct a statement
Sense.TRAN: 亦即﹐那就是说﹐换句话说
Sense.EXAMPLE: One solution would be to change the shape of the screen, that is, to make it wider.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个方法﹐就是改变屏幕的形状﹐或者说﹐把屏幕加宽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Languages are taught by the direct method, that is to say, without using the student’s own language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言教学使用直接教学法﹐也就是说﹐不用学生的母语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I loved him – that is, I thought I did.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时是爱他的——或者说﹐我以为我是爱他的。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a person or thing that is not near you
Sense.TRAN: 那﹐那个〔指较远的人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is that my pen you’ve got there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那儿的那支笔是我的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s Eileen’s house across the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路对面就是艾琳的房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look at those men in that car. What on earth are they doing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看那辆车上的那些男人。他们究竟在干些什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our tomatoes never get as big as that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的番茄从来没有那么大。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is typical of a particular group of people, situation etc
Sense.TRAN: 那便是生活/男人/政治等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think I was fairly treated, but then that’s life, isn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我受到的待遇是不公平的﹐但那就是生活﹐对不对？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We go out for a romantic meal and all he wants to do is talk about football. That’s men for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很浪漫地出去吃饭﹐可是在饭桌上他只想谈论足球。男人就这样。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is completely finished or that a situation cannot be changed
Subsense.TRAN: 就这样〔指某事彻底结束或形势不能更改〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s it, then. There’s nothing more we can do.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就这样吧﹐我们再没有别的办法。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are doing something correctly
Subsense.TRAN: 就这样〔用于告诉某人某事做得没错〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Slowly…slowly. Yeah, that’s it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢点……慢点。对了﹐就是这样。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are angry about a situation and you do not want it to continue
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s it. I’m leaving.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 够了﹐我要走了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a situation or a decision cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 就是那样﹐就这样定了〔表示情况﹑决定等不能更改〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I refuse to go and that’s that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不去﹐就这么定了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no money left, so that’s that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没钱了﹐就那样。

Sense.DEF: used when you are not sure who is answering the telephone
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于不确定电话接听者是谁时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello, is that Joan Murphy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂！是琼•墨菲吗？

Sense.DEF: and similar things
Sense.TRAN: 等等﹔以及诸如此类的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew he was interested in computers and all that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他喜欢电脑什么的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: that’s a good girl/that’s a clever dog etc
Sense.DEF: used to praise a child or animal
Sense.TRAN: 这才是好姑娘/这才是聪明的狗狗等

Sense.DEF: used when you want to emphasize that something that has just been suggested is not acceptable to you

used after verbs, nouns, and adjectives to introduce a
clause
which shows what someone says or thinks, or states a fact or reason
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于动词﹑名词或形容词后引导一个从句﹐表示某人所说或所想﹐或陈述一个事实或理由〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she said that she’d come, she’ll come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她说来﹐她就会来的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe that he’s only 17.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢相信他只有17岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure that they live in Park Lane?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定他们住在花园巷吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: allegations that he is guilty of war crimes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于他犯有战争罪的指控
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact that he is your brother-in-law should not affect your decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是你姐夫这个事实不应该影响你的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He might have left the money for the simple reason that he didn’t know it was there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没动那笔钱原因可能很简单——他不知道钱在那里。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: That is sometimes left out after verbs and adjectives, and occasionally after nouns, especially in speech.
F2NBox.TRAN: that在动词和形容词之后有时省略﹐名词之后偶尔也省略﹐尤其是在口语中
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He said it would be much too dangerous.
I’m not surprised you were upset.

Sense.DEF:
used after a phrase with ‘so’ or ‘such’ to introduce a
clause
that shows the result of something
Sense.TRAN: 以至于〔用于与so或such连用的短语之后﹐引导表示结果的从句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was so tired that I fell asleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累得睡着了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school was so badly damaged that it had to be pulled down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校毁坏严重﹐不得不拆除。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had been away for such a long time that I had forgotten her name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们分开了这么长时间﹐我都忘了她的名字。

Sense.DEF:
used to introduce a
clause
that refers to a fact, when describing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于引导一个从句描述某个事实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s odd that I haven’t heard of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很奇怪﹐我没听说过你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That anyone should want to kill her was unthinkable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竟然有人想要杀她﹐真不可思议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem is that no-one knows what will happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题是没人知道将会发生什么。

Sense.DEF: in order that something may happen or someone may do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give us strength that we may stand against them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赐予我们力量﹐让我们能和他们抗衡。

Sense.DEF: used to express a wish for something to happen or be true, especially when this is not possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, that she were alive to see this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐但愿她还活着﹐能看到这一切！

Sense.DEF: used to say how big, how much etc, especially when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands
Sense.TRAN: 那么〔大﹑多等〕〔尤指通过手势比画来表示大小﹑数量等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was quite a large fish – about that long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条挺大的鱼——大约那么长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He missed hitting the car in front by that much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他差这么点就撞上前面的车了。

Sense.DEF: as much as in the present situation or as much as has been stated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I hadn’t realized the situation was that bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉﹐我不知道情况有那么糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one expected it to cost that much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人想到会要那么多钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The advanced exam is more difficult, but not many students progress that far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级考试更难﹐但是能达到那个程度的学生不是很多。

Sense.DEF: used to mean fairly short, only a few etc
Sense.TRAN: 没有那么长/那么多等〔表示相当短﹑仅一点点等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will’s not that tall, considering he’s 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考虑到威尔已经16岁了﹐他个子不算太高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film wasn’t all that good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影不怎么好看。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how big, bad, much etc something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was that embarrassed I didn’t know what to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常尴尬﹐都不知道该说些什么。

Sense.DEF:
straw
,
reeds
, leaves etc used to make a roof, or the roof made of them
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来盖屋顶的〕茅草﹐稻草﹐芦苇﹔茅草屋顶

Sense.DEF: a thick untidy pile of hair on someone’s head

a thatched roof is made with dried
straw
,
reeds
, leaves etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thatched cottage one with a thatched roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茅草屋

Sense.DEF:
someone whose job is making roofs from dried
straw
,
reeds
, leaves etc
if ice or snow thaws, or if the sun thaws it, it turns into water
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake thawed in March.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3月里﹐湖水解冻了。

Sense.DEF: if it thaws, the weather becomes warmer, so that ice and snow melt
Sense.TRAN: 〔因天气变暖而〕冰雪融化[解冻]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It thawed overnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一夜之间冰雪融化。

Sense.DEF: to let frozen food become warmer until it is ready to cook
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thaw frozen meat in its packet and then cook as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先将冻肉连包装解冻﹐然后尽快烹煮。

Sense.DEF: to become friendlier and less formal
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a few glasses of wine Robert began to thaw a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几杯酒下肚﹐罗伯特放开了些。

Sense.DEF: if your body thaws out, or if you thaw it out, it gets warmer until it is a normal temperature again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He held his hands in front of the fire to thaw them out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把手伸到炉火前取暖。

Sense.DEF: a period of warm weather during which snow and ice melt
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thaw begins in March.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解冻期从3月份开始。

Sense.DEF: an improvement in relations between two countries, after a period of unfriendliness
Sense.TRAN: 〔两国之间关系的〕回暖﹐缓和﹐改善

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are talking about a particular thing or person that has already been mentioned, is already known about, or is the only one
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示正在谈论一个已经提到过﹑已经知道﹐或是唯一存在的人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience clapped and cheered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众鼓掌欢呼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ordered a pizza and salad. The pizza was nice but the salad was disgusting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我点了比萨饼和色拉。 比萨饼很好吃﹐但色拉却令人倒胃口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tallest building in the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上最高的建筑物
Sense.EXAMPLE: sailing across the Pacific
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 横跨太平洋航行
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister has intervened personally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总理亲自出面干预。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elections will be held later in the year this year .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举将在今年晚些时候举行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are all the family your family ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里人都好吗？

Sense.DEF: used before nouns referring to actions and changes when they are followed by ‘of’
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于名词前﹐指某种行为或变化﹐名词后跟of〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the growth of the steel industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢铁业的发展
Sense.EXAMPLE: the arrival of our guests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的客人的到来

Sense.DEF: used when you are about to make it clear which person or thing you mean
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s the school that Terry went to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就是特里上过的学校。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She laughed at the birthday card from Myra.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看着迈拉送的生日贺卡笑了。

Sense.DEF: used before the name of a family in the plural to refer to all the members of that family
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于姓氏复数形式之前﹐指这家人的所有成员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Johnsons had lived in this house for many years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊一家住在这房子里有很多年了。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that everyone knows because it is part of our natural environment or part of daily life
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来指自然界或日常生活中大家都知道的某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What was the weather like?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气如何？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked out into the darkness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向外望着这漆黑的一片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes the traffic kept her awake at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时来往的车辆吵得她晚上睡不着觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shops open at 9 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店9点开始营业。

Sense.DEF: used before a singular noun to refer to a type of institution, shop, system etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于单数名词前﹐指某类机构﹑商店﹑系统等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You used to buy them from the chemist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你过去经常在药店买这些东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard it on the radio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在收音机里听说这件事的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll put it in the mail for you today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天就把它给你邮寄过去。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a part of someone’s body
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来指某人身体的某一部位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lieutenant Taylor was wounded in the knee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒中尉膝盖受伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s the ankle? Is it still hurting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脚腕怎么样了？还痛吗？

Sense.DEF: used before an adjective to make it into a plural noun when you are referring to all the people that the adjective describes
Sense.TRAN: 〔用在形容词前构成复数名词﹐指某一类人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She devoted her life to helping the poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她毕生致力于帮助穷人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a school for the deaf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聋人学校
Sense.EXAMPLE: wars between the English and the French
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英法之间的战争

Sense.DEF: used before an adjective to make it into a noun when you are referring to the particular kind of situation or thing that the adjective describes
Sense.TRAN: 〔用在形容词前构成名词﹐指某一类情况或形容词所描述的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on now, that’s asking for the impossible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐你在要求不可能的事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fantasy movies that make the unreal seem real
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把虚幻演成真实的幻想片

Sense.DEF: used before a singular noun when you are referring to a particular type of thing or person in a general way
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于单数名词前﹐表示泛指某类人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tiger is without doubt the most magnificent of the big cats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老虎无疑是大型猫科动物中最威武的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer has changed everyone’s lives in so many ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑从许多方面改变了每个人的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: complicated dances like the tango
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 探戈之类的复杂舞蹈

Subsense.DEF: used to refer to a period of time, especially a period of 10 or 100 years
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于指一个时期﹐尤指某个年代或世纪〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: fashions of the 60s
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 60年代的时尚
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the great novelists of the 1900s
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪伟大的小说家
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She remembers the war years.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还记得那个战争年代。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In the thirties unemployment was widespread.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 30年代失业现象很普遍。

Subsense.DEF: used to mention a date
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the 3rd of November
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 11月3日
Subsense.EXAMPLE: March the 21st
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3月21日
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Shall we meet on the twelfth?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们12号见面好吗？

Sense.DEF: enough of something for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t the time to talk just now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在没有时间谈话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eric didn’t even have the common sense to send for a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克甚至连去请大夫的常识都没有。

Sense.DEF: used to say which type of musical instrument someone plays
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fiona’s learning the flute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲奥娜在学吹长笛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays the violin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拉小提琴。

Sense.DEF:
used to refer to a type of sport or a sports event, especially in
athletics
or swimming
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于指某项运动或某个运动项目﹐尤指田径或游泳项目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who won the long jump?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跳远比赛谁赢了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swam up and down, practising the crawl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来来回回地游﹐练习自由泳。

Sense.DEF:
used before a word or phrase that describes someone or something when you are angry,
jealous
, surprised etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于形容某人或某事物的单词或短语前﹐表示愤怒﹑嫉妒﹑吃惊等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s stolen my parking space, the bastard!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他偷占了我的停车位﹐这个混蛋！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get this carton open, the stupid thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打不开这个纸板盒﹐这破玩意儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Jamie’s won a holiday in Hawaii.’ ‘The lucky devil!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “杰米中了奖﹐获得一次去夏威夷度假的机会。”“这家伙真走运！”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the person, place, or thing you are mentioning is the famous one, or the best or most fashionable one. ‘The’ is pronounced strongly or written in a special way
Sense.TRAN: 〔重读或以特殊方式书写﹐表示指称的是知名或最好﹑最时尚的人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Elizabeth Taylor was there.’ ‘Not the Elizabeth Taylor, surely?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “伊丽莎白•泰勒在那儿。”“肯定不是那个伊丽莎白•泰勒﹐对吧？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miami is THE place for girls who like to live life to the full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈阿密是喜欢充分享受生活的女孩的乐园。

Sense.DEF: used before the names of certain common illnesses
Sense.EXAMPLE: If one of the children got the measles, we all got the measles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果一个孩子得了麻疹﹐我们都会得麻疹。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use the
F2NBox.TRAN: 以下不用 the：
F2NBox.EXPL: – with uncountable or plural nouns to talk about a type of thing rather than specific things the reader or listener already knows about.
F2NBox.TRAN: the不和表示一类事物（但不是读者或听者已知的特定事物）的不可数名词或复数名词连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I like music.
We use computers.
F2NBox.EXPL: – with the name of a language.
F2NBox.TRAN: the不和表示语言的名词连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Do you speak English?
F2NBox.EXPL: – with words for institutions such as school , prison , college , university , and church when you are talking about them in a general way.
F2NBox.TRAN: 当school﹐prison﹐college﹐university和church表示泛指的时候﹐不和the连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Her son is at school.
She spent a year in prison.
Do you go to church?
F2NBox.EXPL: – generally, with times, days and months (but see note below).
F2NBox.TRAN: the一般不和表示时间﹑天﹑月的词连用（但要参见以下注释）
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: at midnight
on Tuesday
in May
F2NBox.EXPL: – with a date when you write it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 书写日期时不用the
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His birthday is July 29th.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的生日是7月29日。But in spoken British English, you say the date as ‘July the 29th’. 但在英国英语口语中却说July the 29th。
F2NBox.EXPL: – generally, with the name of a meal.
F2NBox.TRAN: the一般不和表示一日三餐的名词连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Have you had breakfast?
Come round after dinner.
F2NBox.EXPL: – with the name of a place, for example a street, town, country, or airport. the
F2NBox.TRAN: 不和表示地点的名词连用,如街道﹑城镇﹑国家或机场
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This is Downing Street.
We flew to Boston.
They love Japan.
He’s climbed Qomolangma twice.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已两次登上了珠穆朗玛峰。
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: But some places and countries, and all rivers and oceans, have the as part of their name. 但有些地名和国家名以及所有河流和海洋名称中都有the: the Bronx 布朗克斯区| the Netherlands 荷兰| the UK 英国| the Rockies 落基山脉|the Mississippi 密西西比河| the Atlantic 大西洋
F2NBox.EXPL: Use the
F2NBox.TRAN: 以下情况用 the:
F2NBox.EXPL: – when you are talking about something specific or something that the reader or listener already knows about.
F2NBox.TRAN: 谈论特指的事物或是读者﹑听者已经知道的事物用the
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I didn’t like the music in the film.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢那部电影里的音乐。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All the computers the computers in this building are down.
F2NBox.EXPL: – with words for institutions when you are talking about a particular one. the
F2NBox.TRAN: 和表示机构的单词连用﹐表示特指
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They go to the school in the village.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们上的是村里的那所学校。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the church on the corner
F2NBox.EXPL: – with days when you give more information about which specific one you mean.
F2NBox.TRAN: the和某个日子连用﹐以进一步说明具体指哪一天
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: on the Tuesday before Christmas
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 在圣诞节前的那个星期二

Sense.DEF:
used before two
comparative
adjectives or adverbs to show that the degree of one event or situation is related to the degree of another one
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于两个形容词或副词的比较级之前﹐表示两件事或两种情况的相关性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The more he eats the fatter he gets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吃得越多就越胖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘When do you want it?’ ‘The sooner the better.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你什么时候想要？”“越快越好。”

Sense.DEF: used before an adjective or adverb to emphasize that something is bigger, better etc than all others, or as big, good etc as it is possible for it to be
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于形容词或副词前﹐强调是最大的﹑最好的等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He likes you the best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最喜欢你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had the worst headache last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨晚头痛得厉害极了。

Sense.DEF:
another form of
theo-
a building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open-air theatre a theatre that is outside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露天剧场
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mercury Theater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水星剧院

PIC.HEADING: THEATRE 剧场
PIC.PICCONTENT: 1 stage 舞台；2 orchestra pit 乐池；3 curtains 帷幕；4 row 一排座位；5 seat 座位； 6 circle BrE【英】/balcony AmE【美】 楼厅；7 stalls BrE【英】/orchestra AmE【美】 正厅座位；8 boxes 包厢

Subsense.DEF: plays as a form of entertainment
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I enjoy theater and swimming.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢看戏和游泳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s really interested in literature and the theatre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对文学和戏剧很感兴趣。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Yeats’ plays are great poetry but they are not good theatre good entertainment .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叶芝的剧作都是伟大的诗篇﹐但娱乐性不强。

Subsense.DEF: the work of acting in, writing, or organizing plays
Subsense.EXAMPLE: classes in theater and music
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧和音乐班

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been working in the theatre over thirty years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从事戏剧工作已有三十余载。

Sense.DEF: a building where films are shown
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Bambi’ was the first movie I ever saw in the theater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《小鹿斑比》是我在电影院里看的第一部电影。

Sense.DEF: a special room in a hospital where medical operations are done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marilyn is still in theatre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽莲还在接受手术。

Sense.DEF: a large area where a war is being fought
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Pacific theater during World War II
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战期间的太平洋战场

Sense.DEF: someone who regularly watches plays at the theatre
the performance of a play on a central stage with the people watching sitting in a circle around it
Sense.TRAN: 〔舞台在正中央﹑观众坐在四周的〕圆形剧场式演出

Sense.DEF: relating to the performing of plays
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Polish theatrical company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家波兰剧团

Sense.DEF: behaving in a loud or very noticeable way that is intended to get people’s attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a theatrical sigh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她夸张地叹了口气。

Sense.DEF: performances of plays
Sense.EXAMPLE: amateur theatricals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 业余戏剧表演

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is very loud and noticeable and is intended to get people’s attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can do without all these theatricals, Andrew!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用不着这么夸张﹐安德鲁！

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is very loud and noticeable, and is intended to get people’s attention

a word meaning ‘you’, used as the
object
of a sentence
the crime of stealing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car theft is on the increase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车盗窃案在上升。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an arrest for petty theft stealing small things
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以小偷小摸罪名逮捕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three men were charged with attempted theft .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名男子被指控企图行窃。

Sense.DEF: an act of stealing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been a number of thefts in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区发生了几宗偷窃案。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the theft of £150 from the office
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室150英镑失窃

Sense.DEF: belonging to or connected with people or things that have already been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: They washed their faces and went to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们洗过脸后上床睡觉去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The twins spend all their time together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对双胞胎总是待在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People had moved back into their own homes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们搬回了自己的家中。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘his or her’
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于谈论人时泛指两性﹐以避免使用his或her〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone is free to express their own opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都可以自由表达自己的意见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each student will have their own coursework folder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个学生都要有自己的课程作业文件夹。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with people that have already been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 他们的﹐她们的〔用于指代属于前面所提之人的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When our washing machine broke, our neighbours let us use theirs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的洗衣机坏了的时候﹐邻居就让我们用他们的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our house is number 25, and theirs is just opposite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的房子是25号﹐他们的就在对面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We compared scores and found that theirs were higher than ours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们比较了一下﹐发现他们的得分比我们的高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They shared the prize money with a friend of theirs .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们与一位朋友分享那笔奖金。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘his or hers’
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于谈论人时泛指两性﹐以避免使用his或hers〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone wants what is theirs by right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都想得到理应属于自己的东西。

Sense.DEF: the belief in the existence of God or gods
used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has anyone seen my keys? I can’t find them anywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人见到我的钥匙吗？我哪儿都找不到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were very helpful when I spoke to them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和警察说了﹐他们很帮忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I lent him several books, but he hasn’t read any of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我借给他几本书﹐但他一本还没看过。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘him or her’
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于谈论人时泛指两性﹐以避免使用him或her〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anyone phones, tell them I’ll be back later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人打电话来﹐就说我过一会儿就回来。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘those’. Many people think this use is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 那些〔许多人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t understand all them long words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法理解那些长单词。

Sense.DEF:
relating to a particular
theme
, or organized according to a theme
Sense.EXAMPLE: the thematic organization of paintings in the exhibit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参展画作的主题安排

Sense.DEF: the main subject or idea in a piece of writing, speech, film etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book’s theme is the conflict between love and duty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书的主题是爱与责任之间的冲突。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Campbell has made health care a central theme in his campaign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎贝尔在竞选活动中把医疗保健作为中心主题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Nature is a recurrent theme a theme that appears repeatedly in Frost’s poetry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大自然是弗罗斯特诗作中反复出现的一个主题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of Kurt’s other pictures were variations on the same theme .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 库尔特的其他大部分画作都是同一主题的变奏。

Sense.DEF: music or a song that is often played during a film or musical play, or at the beginning and end of a television or radio programme
Sense.TRAN: 主题音乐/主题歌/主题曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: the theme song from ‘The Brady Bunch’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《欢乐家庭》的主题曲

Sense.DEF: a short simple tune that is repeated and developed in a piece of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freia’s theme in Wagner’s opera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦格纳歌剧中的弗莱雅主旋律

Sense.DEF: a particular style
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her bedroom is decorated in a Victorian theme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的卧室是维多利亚时代风格装饰。

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing on a particular subject that you do for school
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某一特定题目写作的〕作文﹐短论文

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your homework is to write a two-page theme on pollution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们的家庭作业是就污染问题写一篇两页的作文。

Sense.DEF: a themed place or event has been designed to make people who go there feel like they are in a particular place or historical period
Sense.EXAMPLE: themed restaurants such as the Rainforest Café
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诸如“雨林咖啡厅”之类的主题餐馆

Sense.DEF:
a type of park where you can have fun riding on big machines such as a
roller coaster
, and where the whole park is based on one subject such as water or space travel
a party where everyone has to dress in a particular way connected with a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Wild West theme party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “荒野西部”主题晚会

Sense.DEF: used when you are talking about one person, but you want to avoid saying ‘himself’ or ‘herself’ because you do not know the sex of the person. Many people think this use is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 他自己﹔她自己〔指性别不详的人﹐以避免使用himself或herself﹔许多人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It makes me happy to help someone help themself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助别人自强起来让我感到快乐。

Sense.DEF: used to show that the people who do something are affected by their own action
Sense.TRAN: 他们自己﹔她们自己﹔它们自己
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers have no choice but to take measures to protect themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师们别无选择﹐只能采取措施来保护自己。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our neighbours have just bought themselves a jacuzzi.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们邻居刚刚买了一个按摩浴缸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids seem very pleased with themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些孩子好像自得其乐。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the pronoun ‘they’, a plural noun etc
Sense.TRAN: 自己﹐自身〔用于强调代词they﹑复数名词等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors themselves are the first to admit the treatment has side effects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生自己最先承认这种治疗方法有副作用。

Sense.DEF: used after words like ‘everyone’, ‘anyone’, ‘no one’ etc when you talk about someone already mentioned and you do not know what sex they are or it is not important. Many teachers think this is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 他自己〔用于谈论性别不详或不重要的人﹐许多教师认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone told me they’d actually seen the accident happen themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人告诉我说是亲眼看到这场事故发生的。

Sense.DEF: considered without other related ideas or situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: The carvings are works of art in themselves, even disregarding their religious significance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些雕刻即使不考虑其宗教含义﹐本身也是艺术品。

Subsense.DEF: alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: older people who are living all by themselves
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独自生活的老人们

Subsense.DEF: without help from anyone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did the children make the model all by themselves?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个模型是孩子们自己做的吗？

Sense.DEF: if people have something to themselves, they do not have to share it with anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had the whole beach to themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个海滩上只有他们。

Sense.DEF: if people are not themselves, they do not feel or behave in the way they usually do because they are nervous, upset, or ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔因神经紧张﹑烦恼或生病〕表现反常﹐状态不对

Sense.DEF: at a particular time in the past or future
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I had known then what I know now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望那时我就知道现在所知道的一切。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was then that I realised she’d tricked me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到那时我才知道她骗了我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started his career in St Petersburg – or Leningrad as it then was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在圣彼得堡——当时叫列宁格勒——开始他的事业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re sending out the results next week, so we won’t know anything until then.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要在下个星期寄出结果﹐所以我们要到那个时候才会知道。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was late evening when the doctor arrived, and by then it was too late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生赶到时已是深夜﹐这时候已经太晚了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: That was in 1970. Since then the place has changed a lot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时是1970年。从那以后那地方变化很大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They met in 1942 and from then on starting at that time they were firm friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们1942年认识﹐从那时起就一直是好朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silently she closed the door. Just then she heard a noise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她默不作声地关上了门。 就在那时﹐她听到有声响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was paid £1,000, which was a lot of money back then a long time ago when things were different in the 1950s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给了我1,000英镑﹐在20世纪50年代那可是一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: used to say what happens next or what you do next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mix the flour and butter, then add the eggs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面粉和黄油和在一起﹐然后加入鸡蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Byron travelled to Italy and then to Greece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拜伦先去意大利旅行﹐然后去了希腊。

Subsense.DEF: used when saying what the result of a situation or action will be
Subsense.TRAN: 那么〔用于指某个情况或行为的结果〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you won’t tell him, then I will.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不告诉他﹐那么我去跟他说。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Start off early, then you won’t have to rush.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早点动身﹐这样你就不必匆匆忙忙的了。

Subsense.DEF: used when you think that something is probably true because of what you know about the situation
Subsense.TRAN: 那么〔根据所知情况作出判断〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Still in your pyjamas? Have you just got out of bed then?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还穿着睡衣？那么你刚起床喽？

Sense.DEF: used to say that although something is true, something else is also true which makes the first thing seem less important
Sense.EXAMPLE: William didn’t succeed first time, but then very few people do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉第一次没有成功﹐不过﹐很少有人第一次就成功的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elaine’s father might lend them the money, but then again he might not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莱恩的父亲也许会借给他们钱﹐不过也可能不会借。

Subsense.DEF: used at the beginning of a conversation or activity
Subsense.TRAN: 那么〔表示交谈或行动的开始〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now then, what would you like to do today?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐你今天想干些什么呢？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Right then, shall we start?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那好吧﹐我们开始好吗？

Subsense.DEF: used at the end of a conversation, especially to show that something has been agreed
Subsense.TRAN: 那么﹐那〔用于谈话结束时﹐表示某事已商定〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Good, that’s settled then. We’ll all meet here next Wednesday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的﹐那就这么定了。我们下星期三全都在这儿碰头。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Okay then, I’ll see you at work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么好吧﹐上班的时候再见。

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are saying something because of what someone has just said
Subsense.TRAN: 那﹐那么〔用于表示所说的话是对某人刚刚所说内容的回应〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘We’re late.’ ‘We’d better hurry, then.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们晚了。”“那么我们最好快一点。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Friday’s no good.’ ‘Then how about Saturday?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “星期五不好。”“那么星期六如何？”

Sense.DEF: used to add something to what you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to invite your parents and my parents, and then there’s your brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得邀请你的父母和我的父母﹐另外还有你的弟弟。

Sense.DEF: used to refer back to what you have just been talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: This then was the situation facing the government at the end of the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就是战争结束时摆在政府面前的情况。

Sense.DEF: immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t prepared to wait – he wanted the money then and there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不打算等——他想立马拿到钱。

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning the person who had a particular job, title, or position at a time in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: a visit to China by the then US President, Richard Nixon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时的美国总统理查德•尼克松对中国的访问

Sense.DEF: from there or following that
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went to Trieste, and thence by train to Prague.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去了的里雅斯特﹐又从那里坐火车去了布拉格。

Sense.DEF: starting from that time
relating to God or gods
Sense.EXAMPLE: theology study of religion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神学

Sense.DEF: a social system or state controlled by religious leaders

a piece of equipment used by a land
surveyor
for measuring angles
someone who has studied theology
a college for training people to become priests or church ministers
the study of religion and religious ideas and beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: He studied theology at college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在大学读的是神学。

Sense.DEF: a particular system of religious beliefs and ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to Muslim theology there is only one God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据穆斯林的宗教信仰﹐神只有一个。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a comparison of Eastern and Western theologies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东西方神学的比较

Sense.DEF: a statement, especially in mathematics, that you can prove by showing that it has been correctly developed from facts
relating to the study of ideas, especially scientific ideas, rather than with practical uses of the ideas or practical experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: theoretical physics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理论物理
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aristotle’s theoretical model of the universe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚里士多德有关宇宙的理论模型
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has theoretical knowledge of teaching, but no practical experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有教学方面的理论知识﹐但没有实际经验。

Sense.DEF: a theoretical situation or condition could exist but does not really exist
Sense.TRAN: 理论上的﹔推想的﹐臆测的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Equality between men and women in our society is still only theoretical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们这个社会里﹐男女平等仍然停留在理论上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a theoretical risk of an explosion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理论上的爆炸风险

Sense.DEF: used to say what is supposed to be true in a particular situation, especially when the opposite is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Theoretically, Damian’s the boss, but I coordinate the team on a day-to-day basis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按理说达米安是老板﹐但全队日常的协调工作是由我来做的。

Sense.DEF: according to a scientific idea that has not been proven to be true in a practical way
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is theoretically possible for computers to be programmed to think like humans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对电脑进行编程﹐使它像人一样思考﹐这在理论上是可能的。

Sense.DEF: someone who develops ideas within a particular subject that explain why particular things happen or are true
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leading economic theorist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要经济学理论家

Sense.DEF: to think of a possible explanation for an event or fact
Sense.TRAN: 建立理论﹔从理论上说明

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Researchers theorize that there was once a common language for all humanity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究者提出一种理论﹐称人类曾使用同一种语言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have been theorizing about what may have caused the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直在推测是什么造成了这场火灾。

Sense.DEF: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指尚未得到证实的〕学说﹐理论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: different theories about how the brain works
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于大脑如何运作的各种学说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Darwin’s theory of evolution
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文的进化论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the theory that light is made up of waves
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 光是由波组成的理论

Sense.DEF: general principles and ideas about a subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freudian theory has had a great influence on psychology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m taking a course on political theory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在修习政治理论课程。

Sense.DEF: something that is true in theory is supposed to be true, but might not really be true or might not be what will really happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: In theory, everyone will have to pay the new tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从理论上讲﹐每个人都得缴纳这项新税。

Sense.DEF: an idea or opinion that someone thinks is true but for which they have no proof

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Detectives are working on a theory that he knew his murderer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探们的调查基于一个猜想﹐即死者认识凶手。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These birds helped Darwin develop his theory of natural selection.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鸟雀帮助达尔文提出了物竞天择的理论。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Researchers gave workers a questionnaire to test that theory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员向工人分发问卷测试那个理论。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: No evidence emerged to prove either theory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尚未有证据出现能证明这两种理论。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Modern research strongly supports this theory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当代研究强有力地支持了这个理论。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show that it is wrong
make people stop believing in it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Scientific theories can be tested experimentally.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学理论可经实验验证。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His economic theory assumes that both labour and capital are perfectly mobile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的经济理论假设劳动力和资金都是完全流动的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a theory that an event was the result of secret plan made by two or more people
a personal theory that you strongly believe

Collocate.EXAMPLE: According to the theory of relativity, nothing can travel faster than light.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据相对论﹐没有哪种物体运动速度可以超过光速。

Sense.DEF: making you feel calm and relaxed
Sense.TRAN: 使人镇静的﹐使人放松的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I find swimming very therapeutic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得游泳能让人很放松。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the therapeutic effect of gardening
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 园艺劳动使人放松的作用

Sense.DEF: relating to the treatment or cure of an illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some claim that the herb has therapeutic value for treating pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人称这种草药具有止痛的疗效。

Sense.DEF: the part of medical science relating to the treatment and cure of illness
someone who has been trained to give a particular form of treatment for physical or mental illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speech therapist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 言语治疗师

Sense.DEF: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: new drug therapies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的药物疗法
Sense.EXAMPLE: radiation therapy for cancer treatment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗癌症的放射疗法

Sense.DEF: the treatment or examination of someone’s mental problems by talking to them for a long time about their feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rob was in therapy for several years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布接受过几年的心理治疗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a therapy group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理治疗小组

Sense.DEF: used to say that something exists or happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there any milk left?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有牛奶剩下吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are a few things we need to discuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些事情我们需要讨论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be easier ways of doing this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事一定还有更简单的做法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seems to be a lack of communication.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看起来是缺乏沟通。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There remain several questions still to be answered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍有几个问题要回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly there was a loud explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然传出一声巨大的爆炸声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were all laughing when there came a knock at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都在大笑﹐这时传来了敲门声。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use there is/are to say that something exists or happens. There cannot be left out.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某事存在或发生用there is/are﹐there不能省略
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There is one exception (NOT 不说 Is one exception).
There was an argument.
F2NBox.EXPL: When the noun is plural, use there are/were , even when using ‘a lot of’ before it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 名词为复数时﹐用there are/were﹐即使它前面用了a lot of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There are many interesting places to visit.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多有意思的地方可以去看。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There are a lot of problems.(NOT 不说 There is a lot of problems) with this theory.
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse there with the possessive determiner their . 不要将there和所有格限定词their混淆: They love their jobs. 他们热爱自己的工作。

Sense.DEF: in or to a particular place that is not where you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could go back to my cottage and have lunch there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以回到我的小屋去吃午饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scotland? I’ve always wanted to go there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰？我一直想去那儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold it right there and don’t move.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就站在那里﹐不要动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you pass me that wine glass there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把那个葡萄酒杯递给我吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, there’s that bookshop I was telling you about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看﹐那就是我跟你说过的那家书店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s that man over there ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那边的那个男人是谁？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too far to drive there and back in one day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天开车来回太远了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are we going to get there arrive before the banks close?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行关门之前﹐我们到得了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know there’s a mouse under there somewhere.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道在那下面什么地方有只老鼠。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We flew to Miami and from there to La Paz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们飞到迈阿密﹐又从那儿飞到拉巴斯。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说‘to there’: We went there (NOT 不说 went to there) by car. 我们开车去那里。

Sense.DEF: if something is there, it exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chance was there, but I didn’t take it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机会是有过﹐可是我没有抓住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The countryside is there for everyone to enjoy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡间是供所有人享受的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three months after the operation, the pain was still there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术三个月了﹐疼痛仍未消失。

Sense.DEF: at or to a particular point in time, in a process, or in a story
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s stop there and I’ll tell you the rest of the story tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就讲到这儿吧﹐明天我接着讲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got a divorce, but her troubles didn’t end there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她离婚了﹐但她的烦恼并没有就此结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s still a lot of work to do, but we’re getting there coming to the end of the process slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有很多工作要做﹐不过我们慢慢地也快做完了。

Sense.DEF: immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought I’d have to wait, but they offered me the job there and then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为我得等着﹐但他们当即就把那份工作给了我。SPOKEN PHRASES 口语短语

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that someone has said when you are answering them
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s true. I agree with you there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对﹐在这一点上我同意你的说法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why did the system fail?’ ‘Well, there you’ve got me – I really don’t know.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “系统为什么会失灵？”“你问倒我了——我真的不知道。”

Sense.DEF: used when greeting someone or calling to them
Sense.TRAN: 嘿﹐嗨〔用于向某人问好或呼喊某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hi there, you must be Laura.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐你一定是劳拉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, you there! Watch out!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐说你呢！当心！

Sense.LEXUNIT: there it is/there they are etc
Sense.DEF: used when you have found something or someone that you are looking for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen my keys anywhere? Ah, there they are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你见过我的钥匙吗？啊﹐在这儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There you are. I’ve been looking for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来你在这儿﹐我一直在找你。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to speak to someone on the telephone and someone else answers
Sense.TRAN: 在〔用于打电话时问对方某人在不在〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello, Georgie, is your mother there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好﹐乔治﹐你妈妈在吗？

Sense.DEF: to be always ready to help someone when they need help
Sense.TRAN: （在某人身边）随时提供帮助﹐随时乐于帮助（某人）
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s what I loved about my father - he was always there for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我喜欢我父亲的地方——在我需要的时候他总是在我身边。
