Sense.LEXUNIT: there I was/there they were etc
Sense.DEF: used to describe what situation someone was in at a particular point in the story you are telling
Sense.TRAN: 我/他们等就这样〔用于叙述某事时描述某人在某一时刻所处的情形〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: So there I was, stranded in London with no money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所以我就这样﹐身无分文地滞留在伦敦。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not all there seems stupid or slightly crazy

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s a good boy/clever dog etc
Sense.DEF: used to praise a child or animal
Sense.TRAN: 这才是乖孩子/聪明狗狗等

Sense.LEXUNIT: there it is/there you are/there you go
Sense.DEF: used to say that nothing can be done to change an unsatisfactory situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s all very sad, but there it is. There’s absolutely nothing any of us can do about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事固然令人伤心﹐但也只能这样。我们谁都无能为力。

Sense.DEF: used when someone does something annoying that they often do
Sense.EXAMPLE: There you go, blaming everything on me, as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你又是这样﹐照例把一切都怪罪到我头上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There she goes again, complaining about the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又来了﹐又在抱怨天气。

Subsense.DEF: used when giving something to someone or when you have done something for someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There you are. I’ll just wrap it up for you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行了﹐我这就给你包起来。

Subsense.DEF: used when you think you have proved to someone that what you are telling them is right
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There you are, then. There’s nothing to worry about.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看﹐没什么可担心的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that an action or situation is a good example of a particular quality
Subsense.TRAN: 你看这就是…﹐这才叫〔某种素质〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s intelligence for you! She’s solved the problem already.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这才叫聪明！她已经把题解出来了。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are annoyed or disappointed to say that someone’s behaviour is the opposite of the quality you are naming
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, there’s gratitude for you. She didn’t even say thank you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看﹐这就叫感激﹐她连句谢谢也没说。

Subsense.DEF: used when you see someone or something going past or away from you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There goes a very worried man.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走过去一个忧心忡忡的男人。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you can hear something such as a bell ringing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There goes the phone. I’ll answer it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃响了﹐我去接。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are losing something, for example an opportunity or money, as a result of something that has just happened
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There go our chances of winning the championship.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们夺冠的机会就这么完了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There goes my career.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的事业就这么完了。

Sense.DEF: used to express satisfaction that you have been proved right or that you have done what you intended to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: There! I’ve done it! I’ve resigned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瞧！我做到了！我已经辞职了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There, what did I tell you? I knew it wouldn’t work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看﹐我怎么跟你说的？我就知道这是不行的。

Sense.DEF: used to comfort someone who is crying, especially a child
Sense.TRAN: 好啦﹐好啦！〔用来安慰哭泣的人﹐尤指孩子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There, there, don’t get so upset!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐好啦﹐别这么难过！

Sense.DEF: used to show someone that you do not care what they think and you are not going to change your mind - used by children
Sense.TRAN: 我主意已定！没什么可商量的！〔儿语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to Elly’s party, and you can’t stop me, so there!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就要去参加埃利的聚会﹐你阻止不了我的﹐就这样！

Sense.DEF: near a particular time, place, number etc, but not exactly
Sense.TRAN: 接近〔某一时间﹑地点﹑数目等〕﹐近乎﹐大约﹐左右
Sense.EXAMPLE: These houses were built in 1930 or thereabouts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房子是1930年左右建造的。

Sense.DEF: after a particular event or time
Sense.EXAMPLE: 10,000 men had volunteered by the end of September; thereafter, approximately 1,000 men enlisted each month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到9月底时已有10,000人志愿参军﹐此后﹐每个月差不多有1,000人应征入伍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sophie was born in France, but shortly thereafter her family moved to the United States.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲出生在法国﹐但不久以后她全家就移居到了美国。

Sense.DEF: with the result that something else happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became a citizen in 1978, thereby gaining the right to vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在1978年成为公民﹐由此获得了投票权。

Sense.DEF: as a result of something that has just been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的车大些﹐所以更舒适些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止进展十分顺利﹐所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

Exponent.DEF: for this reason
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She already had a lot of experience and therefore seemed the best candidate for the job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经有了许多经验﹐因此似乎是这份工作的最佳人选。

Exponent.DEF: therefore. So is less formal than therefore , and is more common in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 因此〔没有therefore正式﹐日常英语中更常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They had not eaten all day, so they were very hungry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一整天没吃饭﹐因此很饿。

Exponent.DEF: as a result of what you have just mentioned
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The program is very simple and thus easy to run.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 程序很简单﹐因此容易运行。

Exponent.DEF: for this reason
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This material is highly poisonous, hence the importance of careful handling.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种材料有剧毒﹐因此必须小心处理。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that because of a particular situation, something else happens or is true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some people suffer from stress at work and become ill as a result.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些人受工作压力的影响﹐最后病倒了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Economic growth slowed down as a result of inflation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 受通货膨胀的影响﹐经济增长放缓。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that because of a particular situation, something else happens or is true. Consequently and as a consequence are more formal than as a result .
Exponent.TRAN: 结果〔consequently和as a consequence比as a result正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The disease attacks the plant, the flower does not open, and consequently no seeds are produced.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病侵害植株﹐造成植株不能开花﹐从而不能结籽。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying what the result of something is
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If students arrive late, this means that lesson time is wasted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有学生迟到﹐就会造成上课时间的浪费。

Exponent.DEF: used when explaining the reason for something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Spell check programs do not recognize when you have used the wrong word. For this reason, you must still read over your work carefully.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拼写检查程序无法识别用错的词。因此﹐还是需要仔细检查作业。

Sense.DEF: in that place, or in that piece of writing
Sense.TRAN: 在那里﹔在那篇文章[那本书]里
Sense.EXAMPLE: See Thompson, 1983, and the references cited therein.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见汤普森（1983）以及书中引用的参考资料。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is caused by or comes from a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 此即﹐缘此〔用以说明某事是由某种情况引起的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treaty was imposed by force, and therein lay the cause of its ineffectiveness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该条约是通过武力强制执行的﹐它之所以没有起到作用﹐原因就在于此。

Sense.DEF: later in the same official paper, statement etc
relating to something that has just been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: States differ in standards for products and the labelling thereof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各州的产品标准不同﹐标签的标注也不同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money, or the lack thereof , played a major role in their marital problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱﹐或者说没钱﹐是他们婚姻出现问题的主要原因。

Sense.DEF: on the thing that has just been mentioned
relating to an agreement, piece of writing, or thing that has just been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 关于〔已提及的协议﹑文字资料或事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the treaty and any conditions attaching thereto
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该条约及其所附的任何条件

Sense.DEF: under something that has just been mentioned
according to a document, law, or part of an agreement that has just been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 根据〔刚提及的文件﹑法律或协议中的部分内容〕

Sense.DEF: immediately after something else has happened, and usually as a result of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thereupon the whole audience began cheering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是﹐全体观众开始欢呼。

Sense.DEF: relating to a subject that has just been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: I read your article, and wish to comment thereupon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我读了你的文章﹐并且想就此作出评论。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring heat, especially when calculating amounts of gas used
Sense.TRAN: 撒姆〔计量煤气的热量单位﹐尤用于计算煤气使用量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: UK gas was selling for as little as 6p a therm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国煤气每一撒姆只卖六便士。

Sense.DEF:
another form of
thermo-
relating to or caused by heat
Sense.TRAN: 热的﹔热量的﹔由热引起的
Sense.EXAMPLE: thermal energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热能

Sense.DEF: thermal clothing is made from special material to keep you warm in very cold weather
Sense.EXAMPLE: thermal underwear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保暖内衣

Sense.DEF: thermal water is heated naturally under the earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: thermal springs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温泉

Sense.DEF: a rising current of warm air used by birds
special warm clothing, especially underwear, worn under your other clothes
Sense.TRAN: 保暖型衣服〔尤指保暖内衣〕

Sense.DEF: relating to heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thermostat for controlling temperature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恒温器
热稳定的

Sense.DEF: the science that deals with the relationship between heat and other forms of energy
a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thermometer registered over 100˚C.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度计显示高于100摄氏度。

GramExa.GLOSS: used in cooking
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 糖果/肉类温度计〔用于烹饪〕

Sense.DEF:
thermonuclear weapons use a
nuclear
reaction, involving the splitting of atoms, to produce very high temperatures and a very powerful explosion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thermonuclear device
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热核装置

Sense.DEF: a plastic that is soft and bendable when heated but hard when cold
Sense.TRAN: 热塑性塑料〔加热时柔软可弯曲但冷却后坚硬的塑料〕

Sense.DEF: a special container like a bottle, that keeps drinks hot or cold
thermosetting plastic becomes hard and unbendable after it has been heated
an instrument used for keeping a room or a machine at a particular temperature
a book in which words are put into groups with other words that have similar meanings

the plural of
this
a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD
Sense.TRAN: 论文﹐毕业论文﹐学位论文
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛西娅还在写论文。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wrote his doctoral thesis on contemporary French literature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写的博士论文是关于法国当代文学的。

Sense.DEF: an idea or opinion about something, that you discuss in a formal way and give examples for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

Sense.DEF:
in writing, the thesis is the sentence or group of sentences which state what the main idea of an
essay
is
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paragraph introducing your thesis statement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 介绍文章主题的一个段落

Sense.DEF: an actor - sometimes used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: a distinguished thespian
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知名的演员

Head.GRAM: used as the subject of a verb

Sense.DEF: used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob and Sue said they wouldn’t be able to come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃和休说他们来不了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken gave me some flowers. Aren’t they beautiful?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯送给我一些花。很漂亮吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all want to come to the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都想来参加婚礼。

Sense.DEF: used to state what people in general say or think
Sense.EXAMPLE: They say it’s bad luck to spill salt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说把盐弄撒了会有坏运气。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a particular organization or group of people
Sense.TRAN: 他们〔特指某一组织或某一群人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where are they going to build the new highway?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将在哪儿修建新的公路？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re going to take an X-ray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要照X光。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘he or she’
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于谈论人时泛指两性﹐以避免使用he or she〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anyone has any information related to the crime, will they please contact the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本案如有知情人士请与警方联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every child, whoever they are, deserves to have a mum and a dad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个孩子﹐无论他是谁﹐都应该有爸爸和妈妈。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: You can use they , them , and their to refer to a single person when you do not want to show that the person is male or female. People do this because they want to avoid suggesting that the person can only be male, or using longer expressions such as ‘he or she’, ‘him or her’ etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果不想说明是男性还是女性﹐可以用they﹐them和their指代一个人。人们这么做是想避免暗示此人只能是男性﹐或不想使用he or she或him or her等较长表达法
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If anyone doesn't like it, they can leave.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人不喜欢﹐可以离开。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: When a friend upsets you, do you tell them?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果一个朋友惹你生气了﹐你会告诉他们吗？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Someone has left their coat behind.
F2NBox.EXPL: This use is acceptable and very common in speech, and is becoming more acceptable in writing as well. However, some people consider this use to be incorrect. You can sometimes avoid the problem by making the subject plural.
F2NBox.TRAN: 这一用法在口语中很常见﹐在书面语中也越来越为人们所接受。但也有人认为这种用法是错误的。要避免这一问题﹐可以把主语变成复数
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If people don't like it, they can leave.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人不喜欢﹐可以离开。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: When friends upset you, do you tell them?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果朋友惹你生气了﹐你会告诉他们吗？

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘they had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: If only they’d been there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们当时要在那儿就好了。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘they would’
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a pity my parents didn’t come – they’d have enjoyed it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐我的父母没有来——要不然他们也会很开心的。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘they will’
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll be tired after the long journey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们经过这长途旅行会很疲劳的。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘they are’
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re going to Crete next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们下周要去克里特岛。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘they have’
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve had a lot of trouble with their car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的车子出过许多毛病。

Sense.DEF: a natural chemical in some foods, that you need in order to prevent particular illnesses
if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thick oak door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一扇厚实的橡木门
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thick slice of homemade bread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片厚厚的自制面包
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was wearing thick glasses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他戴着厚厚的眼镜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: short thick fingers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短粗的手指
Sense.EXAMPLE: thick wool socks socks that are heavy and warm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚厚的羊毛袜子
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want a thicker blanket, there are more here in the closet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想要更厚的毯子﹐这个柜子里还有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meat is done when the thickest part turns from pink to white.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉最厚的部分从粉红色变成白色﹐就说明熟了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The furniture was thick with dust there was thick dust on the furniture .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家具上蒙了厚厚一层灰尘。

PIC.HEADING: THICK 厚的﹔粗的
PIC.PICCONTENT: a chunky bracelet 粗的手镯；a fat wallet 鼓鼓的钱包；a thick book 厚厚的书

Sense.DEF: measuring a particular distance between two opposite sides or surfaces of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The walls are about two meters thick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙大约两米厚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How thick should the glass in the tank be?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水箱的玻璃应该要多厚？
Sense.EXAMPLE: This layer of brain tissue is no thicker than 2 mm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这层脑组织的厚度不超过2毫米。

Sense.DEF: growing very close together or having a lot of leaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: birds hiding in the thick undergrowth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 躲在茂密的灌木丛里的鸟

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The walls were thick with ivy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上爬满了常春藤。

Sense.DEF: filling the air, and difficult to see through or breathe in
Sense.EXAMPLE: thick fog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓雾

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The air was thick with cigarette smoke .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气里满是浓重的香烟味。

Sense.DEF: almost solid, and therefore flowing very slowly, or not flowing at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a thicker gravy, add more flour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想要肉汁浓一点﹐就再加些面粉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paint is too thick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆太稠了。

Sense.DEF: having a lot of hair or fur
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran her fingers through her thick brown hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手指拢了拢她那浓密的褐色头发。

Sense.DEF: a thick person is stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a nice guy, but he’s a bit thick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个好人﹐但有点傻。

GramExa.GLOSS: very stupid

Subsense.DEF:
if someone has a thick
accent
, the way they speak shows clearly which particular place or part of a country they come from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Olga speaks English with a thick Russian accent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥尔加说英语带着浓重的俄罗斯口音。

Subsense.DEF: if someone’s voice is thick, it is not as clear or high as usual, for example because they are upset
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因为难过等嗓音〕沙哑的﹐低沉的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bill’s voice was thick and gruff.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔声音粗哑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her voice was thick with emotion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为激动嗓音也变沙哑了。

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cod were so thick in the water that they caught thousands very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水里鳕鱼密密麻麻﹐他们很快就捕到了几千条。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The roads were thick with holiday traffic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上密密麻麻都是外出度假的车辆。

Sense.DEF: to be present or available in large amounts or numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cheap houses aren’t as thick on the ground as they used to be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 廉价房不再像从前那样随处可见了。

Sense.DEF: to not care if people criticize you or do not like you
Sense.TRAN: 厚脸皮〔指不介意别人的批评或反感〕

Sense.DEF: if two people are as thick as thieves, they are very friendly with each other and seem to share a lot of secrets, making other people think they are hiding or planning something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lately Nick and Lou have been as thick as thieves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近尼克和卢打得火热。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb a thick ear/get a thick ear
Sense.DEF: to hit someone or be hit on the head, as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 打某人的耳光/被打耳光
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any more cheek from you and you’ll get a thick ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你再这样放肆会挨耳光的。

Sense.DEF: to be very friendly with someone
used to say something is a little unfair or annoying
thickly. Many teachers think this is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 厚厚地〔许多教师认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: peanut butter spread thick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抹得很厚的花生酱

Sense.DEF: arriving or happening very frequently, in large amounts or numbers
Sense.TRAN: 大量而急速地﹔频繁且迅猛地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Entries have been coming in thick and fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参赛作品纷至沓来。

Sense.DEF: involved in the busiest, most active, most dangerous etc part of a situation
Sense.TRAN: 在…的最繁忙[最活跃﹐最危险]时刻[部分]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brown hopes to be back in the thick of the action as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗希望尽快回去﹐参与到最紧要的行动中。

Sense.DEF: in spite of any difficulties or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then, families stuck together through thick and thin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐家家户户团结一致﹐无惧艰难。

Sense.DEF: to become thick, or make something thick
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fog was beginning to thicken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾气渐浓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thicken the soup by adding potatoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加些马铃薯让汤变稠。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stew thickened with lentils and vegetables
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入小扁豆和蔬菜而变浓的炖菜

Sense.DEF: a substance used to thicken a liquid
a group of bushes and small trees
extremely stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s so thick-headed he can’t understand simple instructions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笨极了﹐连简单的指令都理解不了。

Sense.DEF: in a way that makes a thick piece or layer of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cheese was sliced thickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶酪切得很厚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thickly carpeted hallway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺着厚厚地毯的走廊

Sense.DEF: if an area is thickly populated, wooded etc, there are a lot of people, trees etc there close together
Sense.TRAN: 人口稠密的/树木茂密的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eastern part of the country is more thickly populated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国东部地区人口比较稠密。

Sense.DEF: how thick something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thickness of the walls is 5 feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙体厚度为5英尺。

Sense.DEF: a layer of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wrap the cake in a double thickness of foil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用两层箔纸把蛋糕包好。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very stupid
having a wide strong body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short thickset man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个膀阔腰圆的矮个子男人

Sense.DEF: not easily offended by other people’s criticism or insults
Sense.TRAN: 厚脸皮的﹐受得起批评[羞辱] 的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thick-skinned insurance salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位厚脸皮的保险推销员

Sense.DEF: someone who steals things from another person or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thieves broke into the offices and stole $150,000’s worth of computer equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷破门进入办公室﹐偷走了价值15万美元的电脑设备。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were nothing but petty thieves thieves who steal small things .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只不过是小毛贼。

Exponent.DEF: someone who steals things from a person or place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The thief grabbed her handbag and ran off down the street.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷抓过她的包沿街逃之夭夭。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Car thieves are operating in this area.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 偷车贼在这一地区作案。

Exponent.DEF: someone who goes into houses, offices etc to steal things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Burglars broke into the house and took a computer worth £1,000.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼闯进屋子﹐偷走了一台价值1,000英镑的电脑。

Exponent.DEF: someone who steals from banks, offices, houses etc, especially using threats or violence
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gang of bank robbers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一伙银行劫匪
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an armed robber (=a robber with a gun)
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装劫匪

Exponent.DEF: someone who takes things from shops without paying for them, especially by hiding them in their clothes or in a bag
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The store has installed hidden cameras to catch shoplifters.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 店铺安装了隐形摄像头来抓捕窃贼。

Exponent.DEF: someone who steals from people’s pockets, especially in a crowded public place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Look out for pickpockets in busy tourist areas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在热闹的旅游区要小心扒手。

Exponent.DEF: a thief who violently attacks someone in the street and robs them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The mugger punched him in the face and tried to steal his wallet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个行凶抢劫犯一拳打在他脸上﹐要抢他钱包。

Exponent.DEF: someone who steals a car and drives it very fast for fun
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police pursued the teenage joyriders across three counties.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察跑了三个县追捕偷车兜风的少年。

Exponent.DEF: someone who breaks into shops or homes and steals things, after there has been a natural disaster, a war, or a violent protest
Exponent.TRAN: 〔趁着天灾﹑战争或暴动抢掠的〕趁乱打劫者
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police chiefs have warned that looters will be shot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察局长警告说趁火打劫者将被击毙。

Exponent.DEF: a member of an armed group of thieves who travel around attacking people in country areas
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The village was attacked by a gang of bandits.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 村庄遭到一伙土匪袭击。

Exponent.DEF: someone who hunts animals, birds etc illegally on other people’s land
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their job is to prevent poachers from killing the elephants.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的工作是防止偷猎者猎杀大象。

Sense.DEF: thieving
the act of stealing things
like a thief
Sense.TRAN: 贼头贼脑的﹐贼眉鼠眼的

Sense.DEF:
the top part of your leg, between your knee and your
hip
the top part of a bird’s leg, used as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken thighs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡腿

Sense.DEF: the bone in the top part of a leg
a small metal or plastic cap used to protect your finger when you are sewing
a very small quantity of liquid
if something is thin, there is only a small distance between its two opposite sides or surfaces
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thin gold chain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条细细的金链
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s only wearing a thin summer jacket a jacket made of light material .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只穿了一件薄薄的夏装外套。
Sense.EXAMPLE: two thin slices of bread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄薄的两片面包
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road was covered with a thin layer of ice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路面上覆盖着一层薄薄的冰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The skin on the eyelids is the thinnest on the body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼睑上的皮肤是人体最薄的皮肤。

GramExa.GLOSS: very thin
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep your voice down – the walls are paper thin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小点声﹐墙很薄。

PIC.HEADING: thin 薄的﹔细的
PIC.PICCONTENT: a narrow lane 狭窄的巷子；a thin slice of lemon 柠檬薄片；a fine paintbrush 纤细的画笔；a slim phone 薄薄的手机

Sense.DEF: having little fat on your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was tall and thin, with short brown hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又高又瘦﹐一头棕色的短发。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has long thin hands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一双瘦长的手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most high school girls say they want to be thinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数中学女生都说希望自己再瘦些。

Sense.DEF: if someone has thin hair, they do not have a lot of hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thin straggly beard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀疏杂乱的胡子
Sense.EXAMPLE: His hair is quite thin on top.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头顶上的头发稀稀拉拉的。

Sense.DEF: a liquid that is thin flows very easily because it has a lot of water in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: thin paint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀油漆

Sense.DEF: smoke or mist that is thin is easy to see through
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fog is quite thin in places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些地方雾很薄。

Sense.DEF:
air that is thin is more difficult to breathe than usual because it has less
oxygen
in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the thinner air high in the mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高山上较为稀薄的空气

Sense.DEF: a thin excuse, argument, or evidence is not good or detailed enough to be useful or effective
Sense.TRAN: 贫乏的﹐空泛的﹐不能令人信服的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evidence that capital punishment deters crime is pretty thin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极刑能制止犯罪的说法缺少有力的证据。

Sense.DEF: a very small number or amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Engle beat Blanchard by a razor-thin margin a very small number of votes in the race for governor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恩格尔在州长竞选中以极其微弱的多数票优势击败了布兰查德。

Sense.DEF: a thin smile does not seem very happy or sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlie gave her a thin smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查利对她淡淡一笑。

Sense.DEF: a thin voice or sound is high and unpleasant to listen to
Sense.TRAN: 尖声细气的﹔刺耳难听的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His thin voice trailed off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尖细的声音越来越小﹐最后听不到了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the thin end of the wedge
Sense.DEF: an expression meaning something that you think is the beginning of a harmful development
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers believe the job cuts are just the thin end of the wedge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们认为裁员只是厄运的开始。

Sense.DEF: if a particular type of person or thing is thin on the ground, there are very few available
Sense.TRAN: 不是随处可见﹐十分少有
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taxis seem to be thin on the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出租车好像很少。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be having a thin time (of it)
Sense.DEF: to be in a difficult situation, especially one in which you do not have enough money
Sense.TRAN: 过得不顺﹐遇到麻烦〔尤指钱不够用〕

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation in which you are likely to upset someone or cause trouble
Sense.TRAN: 处境不妙﹐很可能招惹麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was on thin ice, and I knew it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时处境不妙﹐我知道的。

Sense.DEF: to disappear completely in a mysterious way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victor and his kidnappers had vanished into thin air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克托和劫持他的人已经消失得无影无踪。

Sense.DEF: out of nowhere, as if by magic
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems like researchers have just pulled the numbers out of thin air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据就好像是研究人员凭空变出来似的。

Exponent.DEF: having little fat on your body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tall, thin man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名高高瘦瘦的男子

Exponent.DEF: thin in an attractive way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: her slim figure
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她苗条的身材
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slim woman in her fifties
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位五十多岁苗条的女性
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Magazines are always full of advice about how to stay slim.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂志上总是有很多如何保持苗条身材的建议。

Exponent.DEF: thin in an attractive and graceful way – used especially about parts of the body, and used especially about women
Exponent.TRAN: 苗条的〔尤指身体部位﹐尤用于女性〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: her long, slender legs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她修长的双腿
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is slender, with very fair hair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身材苗条﹐一头金发。

Exponent.DEF: thin and looking healthy and fit
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his lean body
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他精瘦的身体
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was lean and looked like a runner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他精瘦精瘦的﹐看上去像个赛跑选手。

Exponent.DEF: very thin in a way that is not attractive
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a skinny teenager
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个瘦骨嶙峋的少年
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your arms are so skinny!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的胳膊瘦得都皮包骨了！

Exponent.DEF: thin and delicate
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a small, slight girl with big eyes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个有着大眼睛和纤巧身材的矮个子女孩

Exponent.DEF: very thin, small, and weak-looking
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a scrawny kid in blue jeans
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穿蓝色牛仔裤的瘦弱小孩

Exponent.DEF: below the usual weight for someone of your height, and therefore too thin
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had no appetite and remained underweight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有胃口﹐身体依然偏瘦。

Exponent.DEF: very thin and pale, especially because of illness or continued worry
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因生病或持续担心〕消瘦憔悴的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looked gaunt and had not shaved for days.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去消瘦憔悴﹐几天没刮胡子了。

Exponent.DEF: extremely thin and weak, because you are ill or not getting enough to eat
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因生病或食不果腹〕极为瘦弱的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tents were filled with emaciated refugees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 帐篷里挤满了瘦弱不堪的难民。

Exponent.DEF: used about someone who is so thin that you can see the shape of their bones
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were shocked by the skeletal figures of the camp’s prisoners.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们看到集中营囚犯那瘦骨嶙峋的身形都感到震惊。

Exponent.DEF: used about someone who is extremely thin because they have a mental illness that makes them stop eating
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her daughter is anorexic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她女儿瘦极了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: anorexic teenagers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 极瘦的少年

Exponent.DEF: not wide
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a thin slice of cake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄薄一片蛋糕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a thin layer of ice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一层薄冰
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The gold was very thin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 金层很薄。

Exponent.DEF: thin, especially in a way that looks attractive
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slim volume of poetry
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄薄一本诗集
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slim mobile phone
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 机身纤薄的手机
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slim wooden box
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭长的木盒

Exponent.DEF: tall or long and thin, in a way that looks attractive, but is often not very strong
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the slender columns that supported the roof
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 支撑屋顶的细长柱子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The spider was hanging by a slender thread.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜘蛛悬在一根细长的线上。

Exponent.DEF: extremely thin, like paper
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The walls of the apartment were paper-thin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公寓墙体薄如纸片。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: wafer-thin slices of pastry
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 极薄的一块油酥点心

Sense.DEF: thinly. Many teachers think this is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 薄薄地﹔细细地〔许多教师认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t cut the bread so thin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把面包切得这么薄。

Sense.DEF: to become fewer in number, especially when there were many before, or to remove people, plants, or things so that fewer remain
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔拥挤的人群﹑植物﹑物品等〕变稀少﹔散去
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd had thinned out and only a few people were left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群渐渐散去﹐只剩下几个人了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees thinned as we got closer to the top of the mountain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着我们慢慢接近山顶﹐树木也变得越来越稀少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic was finally thinning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上行驶的车辆终于越来越少了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thin the carrots to two inches apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把胡萝卜间成相隔两英寸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair had been thinned and cut shorter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发削薄了﹐也剪短了。

Sense.DEF: to make something thinner or to become thinner
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clouds had begun to thin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 云层渐稀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A narrow smile thinned his lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浅浅的一笑使他的嘴唇看上去更薄了。

Sense.DEF: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thin the sauce by adding milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入牛奶把酱汁调稀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pastels can be thinned with water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些水粉颜料可以用水稀释。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s hair is thinning, they have less hair than they used to
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall man with thinning hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头发日渐稀疏的高个子男人

Sense.DEF: if something thins the ranks of a group of people, there are fewer of them as a result of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Illness had thinned our ranks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病使我们的人员减少了。

Sense.DEF: yours
a word meaning your, used before a word beginning with a vowel or ‘h’
Sense.TRAN: 你的﹔你们的〔用在以元音或字母h开头的单词前〕

Sense.DEF: an idea, action, feeling, or fact that someone thinks, does, says, or talks about, or that happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: People say things they don’t mean when they are angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生气时就会口不择言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a horrible thing to happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生这样的事情太糟糕了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I plan to do all the things I’ve been meaning to do for ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算去做我多年以来一直想做的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first thing to do is to give them food and shelter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首要的事是给他们提供食物和住所。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a terrible thing to say .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这话说得太难听了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I kept wondering if I was doing the right thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在怀疑我这么做是否正确。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A priest has to arrange funerals, marriages, that sort of thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师得负责安排葬礼﹑婚礼之类的事情。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting more American ideas into British business would be a good thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将更多的美国式理念注入英国商界会是一件好事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I did no such thing ,’ he protested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我没干过这样的事。”他抗议道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know a thing or two a lot about dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对狗所知甚详。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a democracy, it is no bad thing to be able to compromise it is good, even though it may not seem good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在民主国家﹐能够妥协并非就是坏事。

Sense.DEF: an object that you are talking about without saying its name, or whose name you do not know
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s that red thing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个红色的东西是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just switch this thing off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把这东西关一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a round metal thing on the path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路上有一个圆圆的金属物。

GramExa.GLOSS: and other similar things
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The shed is where we keep our tools and things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这棚子是我们放工具等东西的地方。

Sense.DEF: clothes and possessions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jim began to unpack his things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆打开包开始整理他的东西。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to sell some of my things, but they aren’t worth much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想卖掉一些东西﹐但它们值不了几个钱。

Sense.DEF: the tools, equipment, clothes etc that you need for a particular job, sport etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一工作、体育活动等所需的〕东西﹐用品﹐设备﹐物件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I left my swimming things at home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把游泳用的东西落在家里了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the shed where he kept his gardening things
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放置园艺工具的棚子

Sense.DEF: life in general and the way it is affecting people
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of 1942, things were starting to change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到1942年底﹐情况开始发生变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things could be worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情还不算太糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As things turned out, we didn’t have much time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果我们也没有很多时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are things with you, Sarah?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉﹐近来怎么样？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She would get angry quickly, which made things difficult for me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她动不动就生气﹐让我日子很难过。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t change the way things are .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无法改变现状。

Sense.DEF: used as part of a negative statement to mean ‘anything’
Sense.TRAN: 任何东西﹔任何事〔用于否定句〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t find a thing that I wanted to buy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到一样想买的东西。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He took his glasses off and couldn’t see a thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摘下眼镜﹐什么也看不见了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry about a thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么事都不用担心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no such thing as ghosts they do not exist .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根本就没有鬼这种东西。

Sense.DEF: used to talk to or about a person or animal, when you are describing what they are like or showing sympathy for them
Sense.TRAN: 家伙﹐东西〔用于形容人﹑动物或对其表示同情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby is a nice little thing when he’s not screaming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个宝宝不哭叫时是个可爱的小家伙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was terribly upset, poor thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常难过﹐可怜的人儿。

Sense.DEF: used to say something about a particular part of a situation, person etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The thing about teaching is that it takes more time to prepare than most people realize.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教书有一特别之处﹐就是备课的时间比大多数人认为的要长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The funny thing is, I really enjoyed it, even though I hadn’t expected to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有意思的是﹐我还真的玩得很开心﹐尽管这是我没有料到的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good thing you saw her before she saw you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好在她看到你之前你已经看到她了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are going to explain something, give the reason for something, or give an opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It sounds like a good idea. Why don’t you invest?’ ‘Well, the thing is, I can’t afford to.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “听起来是个好主意。那你为什么不投资呢？”“唉﹐问题是我没钱投资。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The thing is that you can’t always judge your own work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题是你不能总是自己来评价自己的工作。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the last thing sb wants/expects/needs etc
Sense.DEF: something that someone does not want, expect etc at all
Sense.TRAN: 某人根本不想要/指望/需要等的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last thing I want is to upset him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最不愿意做的事就是让他伤心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last thing I should have done was let her move into my house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最不应该做的事就是让她搬进我的房子。

Sense.DEF: at the end of a day, afternoon, evening etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔一天﹑下午﹑晚上等做的〕最后一件事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: She likes a hot bath last thing at night .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢晚上睡觉前洗个热水澡。

Sense.DEF: at the beginning of a day, morning, afternoon etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔一天﹑上午﹑下午等的〕第一件事﹐最开始
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jean liked to go for a swim first thing in the morning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼喜欢早晨起来先去游泳。

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving one fact, reason, effect etc but want to suggest that there are many others
Sense.TRAN: 〔除了已陈述的事实﹑原因外〕还有许多其他的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The substance is used in the manufacture of cosmetics and drugs, among other things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种东西用于生产化妆品﹑药品等等。

Sense.DEF: used to give one reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, for one thing, it’s too big.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐一个原因是它太大了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not that wonderful. He’s bad-tempered for one thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有那么好﹐首先是脾气太坏。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a thing of the past
Sense.DEF: to no longer exist or happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before AIDS, many health care experts believed that large-scale infectious diseases were a thing of the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在艾滋病出现之前﹐很多卫生保健专家认为大规模的传染病已成为历史。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is lucky or good that something has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good thing we brought some food with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏我们随身带了一些食品。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is just one of those things
Sense.DEF: used to say that something unpleasant or unlucky cannot be prevented
Sense.TRAN: 这是没办法的事﹐这是不可避免的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t really the driver’s fault; it was just one of those things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那其实也不是驾驶员的错﹐这是不可避免的。

Sense.DEF: used to say what the problem with someone or something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thing about talk shows is that you never know how they will turn out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱口秀节目的问题是你永远不知道结局会怎样。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is true in general, but that other things may cause the situation to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: All things being equal, smaller animals need smaller brains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别的都一样﹐只是身体小的动物脑袋也要小。

Sense.DEF: exactly the thing that you want or that is necessary
Sense.TRAN: 正是想要的东西﹔正是需要的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: A holiday is probably just the thing for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许度假正是你需要的。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised or shocked by something that someone has done or said
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave up a promising career as a stockbroker to become a weaver, of all things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真没想到﹐她放弃当证券经纪人的大好前途﹐当了一名织布工。

Sense.DEF: to do something in the way that you like instead of copying other people or following strict rules
Sense.TRAN: 按照自己的方式做事﹐走自己的路
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to live my own life and do my own thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想过自己的生活﹐做自己的事。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something involves or affects a particular group of people only
Sense.TRAN: 是女孩子/关于足球/关于音乐等的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer games aren’t just a guy thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑游戏不只是男人玩的。

Sense.DEF: when you consider all the parts or events of a situation
Sense.TRAN: 所有情况考虑进来﹐综合考虑起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: All things considered, we had surprisingly few injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总体来看﹐我们的受伤人数少得令人意外。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be all things to all men/people
Sense.DEF: to try to please or be useful to all of many different groups, often without succeeding
Sense.TRAN: 力图讨好所有人〔往往都未能达到目的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In order to get votes, he tries to be all things to all men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了拉到选票﹐他想四面讨好。

Sense.DEF: if you are onto a good thing, you are in a situation that is very helpful, comfortable, or profitable for you

GramExa.PROPFORM: think/know you are onto a good thing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Directors who take dividends instead of salary may think they are onto a good thing but could have problems on retirement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些拿红利而不领薪的董事现在可能会认为他们日子很好过﹐但是到退休时可能就有麻烦了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a big thing of/about/out of sth
Sense.DEF: to make something seem more important than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 对某事小题大做﹐对某事大惊小怪
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can apologise without making a big thing out of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以悄悄地去道个歉﹐不要把事情搞大。

Sense.DEF: the way of behaving or doing something that is socially acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is not the done thing for teachers to hit children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师打学生是不对的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s one thing to... , (it’s) another thing to...
Sense.DEF: used to say that doing one thing is very different from doing another thing, especially where the second thing is more difficult, important, or serious …
Sense.TRAN: 是一回事﹐…则是另一回事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s one thing being able to run fast, but quite another to win a marathon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑得快是一回事﹐但要赢得马拉松比赛则是另一回事了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what with one thing and another
Sense.DEF: used to explain that you have had a lot of work, problems, or jobs that you had to do
Sense.TRAN: 忙了这个又要忙那个﹐忙这忙那地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been so busy these last few days, what with one thing and another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最近几天忙这忙那地忙个不停。

Sense.DEF: to like or dislike someone or something very much, often without a good reason
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指莫名其妙地〕对某人/某事物非常喜欢［反感］
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always had a thing about Peter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直对彼得有种特别的感情。

Sense.DEF: used to explain how a series of events caused something to happen without giving any details
Sense.TRAN: 事情一件接着一件发生〔用于解释一连串事件如何引起某事﹐但是不说明细节〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One thing led to another and, before I knew it, I had invited her family to stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这样一来二去的﹐我在不知不觉间已经邀请她的家人住下了。

Sense.DEF: something that is popular or fashionable at the moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Amelia bought a new car it had to be the latest thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿梅莉亚要是买新车﹐一定会买最流行的车。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about an activity and everything that is involved with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jody tried the college thing but finally dropped out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔迪也上过大学﹐但最后没读完。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there is only one thing for it
Sense.DEF: used to say that there is only one action that you can take
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s only one thing for it. We’ll have to call the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在只有一个办法﹐我们必须报警。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a lot of unpleasant or unlucky things keep happening to you
considering all the facts
to have a strong effect on someone
Sense.TRAN: 使某人十分激动﹔震撼某人

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the best thing since sliced bread

Exponent.DEF: used when you do not need to say the name, or when you do not know the name
Exponent.TRAN: 东西〔用于不必说出名称或不知其名时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s that thing on the kitchen table?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房桌子上那东西是什么？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you got all your things?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的东西都拿好了吗？

Exponent.DEF: a thing – used when you are not sure what the thing is
Exponent.TRAN: 某物〔用于不确定为何物时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s something on your shirt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你衬衫上有什么东西。

Exponent.DEF: a solid thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sharp metal object
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖锐的金属物

Exponent.DEF: a particular kind of thing, or one of a group of things
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某一种类或一组之中的一件〕物品
Exponent.EXAMPLE: household items
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 居家物品
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a luxury item
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 奢侈品
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an item of equipment
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件设备
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The items included pieces of old pottery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 物品中有几件旧陶器。

Exponent.DEF: a particular kind of thing, or one of a group of things. Article is very formal, and is used especially in the phrase an article of clothing .
Exponent.TRAN: 物件〔该词很正式,尤用于短语an article of clothing〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They found several articles of clothing in the bushes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在灌木丛中找到几件衣服。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: suspicious articles
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可疑物品

Exponent.DEF: an object that someone has made, especially one that is very old and has historical value
Exponent.TRAN: 人工制品﹐〔尤指旧的﹑有历史意义的〕手工艺品
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The museum has a collection of early Roman artifacts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家博物馆拥有一批古罗马时代早期的器物。

Exponent.DEF: a thing – used especially when you cannot remember the name of the thing, but often the other person knows what you are talking about
Exponent.TRAN: 那东西〔尤在说话人记不住名称但对方知其为何物时使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you pass me the thingy?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把那东西递给我好吗？

Sense.DEF: used when you cannot remember or do not know the name of the thing you want to mention
Sense.TRAN: 那东西〔用来指记不得或不知道叫什么名字的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you call that thingamajig? You know – the circle with the line through it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你管那东西叫什么？你知道的——就是一个圆圈﹐中间穿一条线。

Sense.DEF: used when you cannot remember or do not know the name of the person you want to mention
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is thingy going?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个谁会去吗？

Sense.DEF: to have a particular opinion or to believe that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think that you’re being unfair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你这么做不公平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought I heard something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我听到了什么声音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t think anyone would believe him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得没人会相信他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think I should call him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为我应该打电话给他吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some reason, I keep thinking it’s Friday today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知为什么﹐我总觉得今天是周五。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recession lasted longer than anyone thought it would.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也没有想到这次经济萧条会持续这么久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Am I right in thinking that you have a brother?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你是有个兄弟的﹐对吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t help thinking that he’s made a mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总觉得他弄错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you honestly think I would do something so stupid?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真认为我会做这么愚蠢的事吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: what do you think of/about sb/sth?
GramExa.GLOSS: used to ask someone for their opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What do you think of your new school?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为你的新学校如何？

GramExa.GLOSS: believe it is necessary, possible etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 认为有必要/有可能/最好等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I thought it best to call first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为最好还是先打个电话。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I thought it appropriate to invite her to speak at the meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为应当邀请她在会上发言。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We must start thinking in terms of reducing costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须开始考虑降低成本了。

GramExa.GLOSS: be believed to be (doing something)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fraud is thought to be costing software companies millions of dollars a year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据认为欺诈行为每年使软件公司损失数百万美元。

Sense.DEF: to use your mind to decide about something, form an opinion, imagine something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She thought very carefully before answering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回答前她仔细斟酌了一番。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait a minute – I’m thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下﹐我正在想。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lay awake thinking about the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醒着﹐躺在那儿心里盘算着那笔钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t think what else we could have done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想不出我们当时还能做些什么。

GramExa.GLOSS: think for a long time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She thought very hard before deciding to leave her job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仔细考虑后才决定辞职。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Holmes sat thinking deeply thinking in a serious and careful way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福尔摩斯坐着﹐陷入沉思。

GramExa.GLOSS: I do not want to think about something because it will be unpleasant
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I dread to think how much this call is going to cost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢去想这通电话要花多少钱。

Sense.DEF: to have words or ideas in your mind without telling them to anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How strange!’ he thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “真奇怪！”他想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t care!’ she thought to herself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我才不在乎呢！”她暗想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was impossible to know what he was thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想要知道他的想法是不可能的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was just thinking what a lovely time we had yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是在想﹐我们昨天过得多开心啊。

Sense.DEF: to remember something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was trying to think where he’d seen her before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在努力回想以前在哪儿见过她。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t think where I’d left my keys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想不起来把钥匙放在哪儿了。

Sense.DEF: to consider that someone or something is a particular thing or has a particular quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter had always thought of Kate as someone to be avoided.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得一向认为应该远离凯特这个人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want you to think of this as your home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要你把这儿当成自己的家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always thought of myself as a sensible person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直以为自己是个理智的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents never thought me capable of doing a degree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母从不认为我能攻读学位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We have good reason to think kindly of consider in an approving way a school that has provided all our children with an excellent education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于一所为我们所有孩子提供了优质教育的学校﹐我们应该给予肯定。

Sense.DEF: to consider the possibility of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had never thought of becoming an actor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未考虑过要当一名演员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did think about moving to Tokyo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确实考虑过要搬去东京。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t even think about calling him used to tell someone strongly not to do something .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打电话给他你想都别想。

Sense.DEF: to think very carefully before deciding to do something, because you know about the dangers or problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔在决定做某事之前〕再三考虑﹐慎重考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: A visible alarm makes burglars think twice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个显眼的报警器能使盗贼有所顾虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A previous divorce can make you think twice about getting married again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离过一次婚﹐你就会慎重对待再婚问题。

GramExa.PROPFORM: think twice before doing sth/before you do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d think twice before taking out such a large loan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要申请这么大数额的贷款﹐我会慎重考虑的。

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about a plan, decision, idea etc, especially with the result that you change your mind or do something differently
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you think car crime can’t happen to you, think again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你认为汽车犯罪事件不会发生在你头上﹐那你就得再想想了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Universities may be forced to think again about the courses they provide.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各大学也许不得不重新考虑他们开设的课程。

Sense.DEF: used when you are saying that you believe something is true, although you are not sure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary is in the garden, I think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽在花园里吧﹐我想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think Ray will mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为雷不会介意的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you understand what I mean?’ ‘Yes, I think so .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你懂我的意思吗？”“是的﹐我想是懂了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Haven’t we met before?’ ‘ I don’t think so .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们以前没见过吗？”“我想没有吧。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought he was honest, but I was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为他为人诚实﹐但我错了。

Sense.DEF: used to say what you will probably do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll go to bed early tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想今晚我要早点上床。

Sense.DEF: used when you are politely suggesting something to do
Sense.TRAN: 我想〔用于礼貌地建议做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought we’d go swimming tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们明天可以去游泳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought we could meet for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们可以见个面﹐一起吃午饭。

Variant.LEXVAR: I would have thought, I should think/I should have thought

Sense.DEF: used when you are saying that you believe something is probably true
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll need about 10 bottles of wine, I should think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我说﹐我们会需要大约10瓶葡萄酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would have thought it would be better to wait a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们最好等一会儿。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you expect something to be true, although it is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: You would have thought the school would do more to help a child like Craig.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你本以为学校会去做更多的事帮助像克雷格这样的孩子。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are asking someone politely to do something for you
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于礼貌地请某人为你做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you think you could help me move these boxes?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能帮我搬一下这些箱子吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone’s opinion
Subsense.TRAN: 你认为…吗〔用于征求某人的意见〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you think I need to bring a jacket?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为我需要带上一件夹克吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone’s opinion
Subsense.TRAN: 你认为是谁/什么等？〔用来征求某人的意见〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Who do you think will win?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为谁会赢？

Subsense.DEF: used when asking someone angrily about something
Subsense.TRAN: 你以为是谁/什么等？〔用于气愤地责问某人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where do you think you’re going?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要去哪里？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you strongly believe something is not true or that you disagree with someone
Sense.TRAN: 我不这样认为﹔我不同意
Sense.EXAMPLE: This could be a coincidence, but I think not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许这是个巧合﹐但我不这样认为。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to imagine or consider something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just think – we could be millionaires!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想象一下——我们有可能成为百万富翁！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be lovely, but think of the expense!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是很不错﹐可想想那费用！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just think what could have happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想想看﹐差点发生了什么。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (now I) come to think of it
Sense.DEF: used to mention something you have just realized or remembered
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Were there any letters for me?’ ‘Yes there were, come to think of it.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “有我的信吗？”“有﹐我想起来了。”

Sense.DEF: used as a way of saying you are sorry because you have upset someone
Sense.TRAN: 我太冒昧了﹐是我欠考虑〔用于道歉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I shouldn’t have said that. I wasn’t thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不该说那样的话。是我太冒昧了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very surprised about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: To think we lived next door to him and never knew what he was doing!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想﹐我们就住在他隔壁﹐却从来不知道他在干些什么！

Sense.LEXUNIT: if you think...,you’ve got another think coming!
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that if they think someone is going to do something, they are wrong
Sense.TRAN: 如果你认为…﹐那你就大错特错了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you think I’m going to wait for you, you’ve got another think coming!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你认为我会等你﹐那你就大错特错了！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you strongly disagree with someone
Sense.TRAN: 那是你/他们等的看法！〔表示你强烈反对某人的看法〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very surprising
Sense.TRAN: 谁会想到呢？〔表示某事非常令人吃惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who would have thought she’d end up dancing for a living?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁会想到呢﹐她最后竟靠跳舞谋生？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not surprised by something someone tells you
Sense.TRAN: 我已经料到﹐我已看出个大概〔表示并不吃惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Andy failed his driving test.’ ‘I thought as much when I saw his face.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “安迪没有通过驾驶考试。”“我看到他的表情就猜出个大概了。”

Sense.DEF: used as a polite or joking way of showing that you disagree with what someone has said or think it is silly
Sense.TRAN: 我想〔一种有礼貌或开玩笑的说法﹐表示你不同意某人的说法﹐或认为某人的说法很愚蠢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why isn’t it working?’ ‘I should have thought it was obvious.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “它为什么不行呢？”“我想这不是很明白的吗。”

Sense.DEF: to not do something that you had planned to do, because you realize that it is not a good idea
Sense.TRAN: 认为还是不做的好﹐想想又改变主意
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started to say something, then thought better of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开口想说点什么﹐后来想想又算了。

Sense.DEF: to think that a particular activity is normal or easy, even though other people think it is unusual or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thinks nothing of staying up all night in casinos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得通宵达旦泡在赌场里很正常。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is not important and then realize later that it is important
Sense.TRAN: 把某事不当回事〔尤指后来意识到它的重要性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a pain in my back but thought nothing of it at the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾经背痛过﹐但当时没把它当回事。

Sense.DEF: to not consider doing something, especially when you later wish you had done it
Sense.TRAN: 没有想到做某事〔尤指后来希望做过〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think to question the treatment I was given.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有想过质疑给我的治疗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never thought to ask him for his address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从没有想到问他要地址。

Sense.DEF: to have ideas and thoughts of your own rather than believing what other people say
Sense.TRAN: 有自己的思想﹐独立思考
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents have to teach their children to think for themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母必须教会孩子独立思考。

Sense.DEF: to say what you are thinking, without talking to anyone in particular
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, sorry. I was thinking aloud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐对不起﹐我在自言自语。

Sense.DEF: to think clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m so nervous I can’t think straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很紧张﹐思路都混乱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can I think straight with you talking all the time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一直在说话﹐我哪里还能想得清楚？

Sense.DEF: to not like someone or something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think much of his new girlfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的新女友不怎么样。

Sense.DEF: to admire or respect someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事评价很高﹐欣赏某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your boss must think highly of you if she gives you so much responsibility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你的老板对你委以重任﹐那她肯定很欣赏你。

Sense.DEF: to like or love someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children think the world of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们非常喜欢她。

Sense.DEF: to disapprove of someone or what they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please don’t think badly of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请不要把我想得太坏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you think less of me for agreeing to do it?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我答应做这件事﹐你会因此看轻我吗？

Sense.DEF: to consider someone’s behaviour in a way that makes them seem as good as possible or as bad as possible
Sense.TRAN: 把某人往最好里想/最坏里想
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s determined to think the worst of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非要把我往最坏里想。

Sense.DEF: to plan to do things that are difficult, but will be very impressive, make a lot of profit etc
Sense.TRAN: 打算大干一番﹐胸怀大志
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is thinking big.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司想大干一番。

Sense.DEF: to think of new, different, or unusual ways of doing something, especially in business
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业中〕不拘一格地思考﹐跳出框框思考

Sense.DEF: to believe that you are going to be successful or that good things are going to happen
Sense.TRAN: 有乐观的想法﹐有自信的想法
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to think positive if you’re going to be successful in this game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想在这次比赛中获胜﹐你一定要自信。

Sense.DEF: to think of ideas and make decisions very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: In this job you need to be able to think on your feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干这项工作得思路敏捷。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had thought to deceive me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们曾经想骗我。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone behaves as if a particular thing were true, although it is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone would think he owns the place, the way he talks!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看他说话的那副样子﹐谁都会以为那地方是他的呢！

Section.SECHEADING: TO HAVE A PARTICULAR OPINION 有某种想法

Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think you’re right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你是对的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She didn’t think that the film was very good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不认为这部影片很好看。

Exponent.DEF: to have an opinion that you are sure is right, especially about an important subject such as politics or religion
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The protestors believe that it is wrong to experiment on animals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者相信﹐用动物做实验是不对的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you really believe that the only solution to violence is more violence?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的相信对付暴力唯一的方法是以暴制暴吗？

Exponent.DEF: to have a particular opinion, especially one that is based on your feelings, not on facts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She feels that there is no alternative.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到别无选择。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I just felt that it was the right thing to do.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是觉得应该那样做。

Exponent.DEF: to have a particular opinion
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The court took the view that the company had acted unreasonably.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭认为该公司的行为不合理。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The college takes the view that smoking in the workplace is a fire risk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家学会认为﹐在工作场所吸烟属火灾隐患。

Section.SECHEADING: TO THINK ABOUT SOMETHING 思考某事

Exponent.DEF: to use your mind to decide about something, form an opinion, imagine something etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been thinking about what you said – maybe you’re right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在斟酌你的话——也许你是对的！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I need some time to think.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要一段时间思考。

Exponent.DEF: to think about something carefully before deciding what to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you considered working for a year before going to college?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有考虑过先工作一年再上大学？

Exponent.DEF: to carefully think about a plan or choice by comparing all the advantages and disadvantages involved
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You need to weigh up the pros and cons the advantages and disadvantages , and decide which investment is the best one for you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要比较一下优缺点﹐决定哪种投资最适合你。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The committee are still weighing the alternatives.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会仍在权衡各种方案。

Exponent.EXP: give sth some/a lot of thought
Exponent.DEF: to think carefully about something, before you make a final decision about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you give it some thought and then get back to me?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你先考虑一下﹐然后给我个回音如何？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had obviously given the matter a lot of thought.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然已再三考虑过此事。

Exponent.DEF: to think about a problem, plan etc before making a decision
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a bit of time to mull it over?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我一点时间考虑好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about something, especially a problem or something complicated
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is still pondering what to do.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍在考虑该怎么办。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Officials are pondering ways to remove the oil from the beaches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们在考虑去除海滩油污的方法。

Exponent.DEF: to think about something you might do in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you ever contemplate resigning?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你考虑过辞职吗？

Exponent.DEF: to think carefully about something, especially something that happened in the past
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a good time to reflect upon the changes that had happened in my life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时候正好可以反省一下我生活中发生的种种变化。

Section.SECHEADING: TO KEEP THINKING ABOUT SOMETHING 一直思考某事

Exponent.DEF: to keep thinking for a long time about something that worries you or that makes you angry or upset
Exponent.TRAN: 念念不忘〔令人担忧或不愉快的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no point brooding over things you can’t change.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对自己无法改变的事﹐想也没用。

Exponent.DEF: to spend too much time thinking about something sad or unpleasant
Exponent.TRAN: 对某事〔指令人伤心或不愉快的事〕不能释怀
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I try to enjoy my life today and not dwell on the past.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量去享受今天的生活﹐而不沉溺于过去。

Sense.DEF: to think about things that happened in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thinking back, it amazes me how we survived on so little sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在回想起来我觉得很奇怪﹐那时候我们睡那么少竟然也挺过来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He thought back to the day he’d first met Sophie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回想起那天第一次见到索菲的情景。

Sense.DEF: to produce an idea, name, suggestion etc by thinking
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re still trying to think of a name for the baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还在给那个婴儿取名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you think of any other way to do it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还能想出其他办法来做这事吗？

Sense.DEF: to remember something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t think of the name of the hotel we stayed in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想不起我们住的酒店的名字了。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that shows that you want to treat other people well
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was very good of you to think of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢你对我的关心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always thinking of other people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是替别人着想。

Sense.DEF: to only do things that are good for you and not think about what other people want - used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a spoiled child who thinks only of herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个被惯坏了的孩子﹐只想着自己。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you care about and feel sympathy for someone who is in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take care! I’ll be thinking of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保重！我会想你的。

Sense.DEF: to think about all the parts of something carefully before deciding or planning exactly what to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went for a walk to think things out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去走了走﹐把事情想想清楚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal needs to be carefully thought out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项提议需要认真加以考虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had thought out what she was going to say.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把要说的话都仔细考虑好了。

Sense.DEF: to consider something carefully before making a decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been thinking over your suggestion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在认真考虑你的建议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you think it over and give me a call in a couple of days?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认真地考虑一下﹐过几天给我电话好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want some more time to think things over .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要更多时间认真考虑考虑。

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about the possible results of something
Sense.TRAN: 认真地考虑〔做某事可能产生的结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The policy has not been thought through properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项政策没有经过充分考虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s my fault. I didn’t think it through .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是我的错﹐我没有认真考虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need time to think things through .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要时间把事情考虑清楚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People need time to think through what the changes will mean for them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们需要时间来想清楚这些变化对他们意味着 什么。

Sense.DEF: to produce a new idea, name etc by thinking
Sense.TRAN: 想出﹐构思出〔新主意﹑名字等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was trying to think up an excuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在设法编出一个借口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you think that up yourself?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是你自己想出来的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who thinks up names for new products?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁给新产品起名字？

Sense.DEF: to think about a problem or question
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have a think and let you know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要想一想再告诉你。

Sense.DEF: able to be thought about or considered
Sense.TRAN: 可想象的﹐想象得出来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that time, it would not have been thinkable to openly criticize the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在当时﹐公开批评政府是不可思议的。

Sense.DEF:
someone who thinks carefully about important subjects such as science or
philosophy
, especially someone who is famous for thinking of new ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: great thinkers such as Kant and Schopenhauer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康德﹑叔本华等伟大的思想家

Sense.LEXUNIT: an independent/a positive/a free etc thinker
Sense.DEF: a person who thinks in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 独立思考的人/思想积极的人/思想自由的人等

Sense.DEF: your opinion or ideas about something, or your attitude towards it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Administration’s thinking changed as the war progressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着战事的发展﹐政府的态度改变了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, to my way of thinking in my opinion , they should have done that years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唉﹐依我看来﹐他们早就应该做那件事了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He laughed and accused me of wishful thinking falsely believing that something will happen just because I want it to .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑着骂我是一厢情愿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich countries’ current thinking on aid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕国家目前对于援助的看法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the thinking behind the company’s new public relations campaign
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司这一次新的公关活动背后的理念

Sense.DEF: when you think about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it weren’t for Jeff’s quick thinking , Tillie could have been badly hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是杰夫反应快﹐蒂莉就可能要受重伤了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really needed to do some thinking .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真得好好考虑考虑了。

GramExa.GLOSS: a particular way of thinking about things
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 清晰的/批判性的/分析性的等思维

Sense.DEF: to try to think seriously about a problem in order to solve it
Sense.TRAN: 动脑筋﹐通过思考解决问题

Sense.DEF: a thinking person is intelligent and tries to think carefully about important subjects
used to say that someone or something is liked by intelligent people
Sense.TRAN: 有思想的男人/女人等所喜欢的人[物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: the thinking man’s pop band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有思想的男士喜欢的流行乐队

Head.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词

Sense.DEF: a group of people with experience or knowledge of a particular subject, who work to produce ideas and give advice
Sense.TRAN: 智囊团﹐智库〔就某方面问题出谋划策的专家小组〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a leading member of a Tory think tank
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党智囊团的一位领军人物

Sense.DEF: in a way that has a very small distance between two sides or two flat surfaces
Sense.EXAMPLE: thinly sliced bread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切得很薄的面包片

Sense.DEF: scattered or spread over a large area, with a lot of space in between
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sow the radish seeds thinly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把萝卜籽撒播得稀一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mountain regions are more thinly populated than the lowlands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山区比低地人烟稀少。

Sense.DEF: if something is thinly disguised etc, someone is pretending it is something else, but you can easily see what it really is
Sense.TRAN: 伪装/隐瞒得不够巧妙的﹔很容易识破的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked at Frank’s new car with thinly veiled envy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带着掩饰不住的嫉妒看着弗兰克的新车。

Sense.DEF:
a liquid such as
turpentine
that you add to paint to make it less thick
Sense.TRAN: 稀释液〔指稀释油漆用的松节油等〕

Sense.DEF: someone with thinning hair is losing their hair
too easily offended or upset by criticism
Sense.TRAN: 脸皮薄的﹐一批评就生气的

Sense.DEF: coming after two other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the third century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在3世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: her third birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的3岁生日

Sense.DEF: used when you have failed to do something twice and hope to be successful the third time
Sense.TRAN: （但愿）第三次会交好运〔表示两次失败后希望第三次取得成功〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the third the third day of the month .

Sense.DEF: one of three equal parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Divide it into thirds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它分成三等份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A third of these jobs are held by women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些工作有三分之一由女性担任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two-thirds of the profits are given to charities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润的三分之二捐给慈善机构。

Sense.DEF: the lowest type of degree that is given by a British university
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学颁发的〕第三等学位﹐三级荣誉学位

Sense.DEF: a cheap class of mail in the US, usually used for sending advertisements
Sense.TRAN: 三等邮件〔美国的一种廉价邮件﹐通常用来寄送广告〕

Sense.DEF: the lowest type of degree that is given by a British university
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学颁发的〕第三等学位﹐三级荣誉学位

Sense.DEF: the cheapest and least comfortable part of a train or ship
Sense.TRAN: 〔火车最廉价的〕三等车厢﹔〔轮船的〕三等舱

Sense.DEF: to ask someone a lot of questions in order to get information from them
Sense.TRAN: 〔为获得信息而〕严加盘问某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got home after midnight and Dad gave me the third degree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我午夜过后才回家﹐爸爸严厉盘问了我一番。

Sense.DEF: the most serious kind of burn, that goes right through your skin
murder etc that is considered by a court to be the least serious of three different kinds
Sense.TRAN: 三级谋杀/入室盗窃/人身侵犯等

Sense.DEF: someone who is not one of the two main people involved in an agreement or legal case, but who is affected by it or involved in it in some way
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议或法律案件中的〕第三方

Sense.DEF: insurance that pays money to someone who is hurt or whose property is damaged by something that you have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does third party insurance cover pay for this type of damage?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第三方责任险是否对这类损失进行赔偿？

Sense.DEF:
a form of a verb or
pronoun
that is used for showing the person, thing or group that is being mentioned. ‘He’, ‘she’, ‘it’, and ‘they’ are third person pronouns.
a story written in the third person is told as the experience of someone else, using the pronouns ‘he’, ‘she’, or ‘they’
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事的叙述〕以第三人称形式

Sense.DEF: of very bad quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: a third-rate hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家三流宾馆

Sense.DEF: the feeling of wanting or needing a drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ice water is the only thing that really quenches my thirst gets rid of it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有冰水才能让我真正解渴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had worked up a thirst done something that made us thirsty ﹐and so we decided to stop for a beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们干得口渴了﹐因此决定停下来喝杯啤酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie woke up with a raging thirst an extremely strong thirst .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉醒来时感到口干舌燥。

Sense.DEF: the state of not having enough to drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the animals had died of thirst .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多动物因缺水而死亡。

Sense.DEF: a strong desire for knowledge etc
Sense.TRAN: 对知识/教育/信息等的渴望
Sense.EXAMPLE: the thirst for knowledge in Renaissance Italy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文艺复兴时期意大利人对知识的渴求

Sense.DEF: to be thirsty
to want something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: young men thirsting for adventure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渴望冒险的年轻男子

Sense.DEF: feeling that you want or need a drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have a glass of water? I’m really thirsty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能喝一杯水吗？ 我太渴了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d been working in the garden and was very hot and thirsty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在花园里干活﹐又热又渴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this digging is thirsty work work that makes you want a drink .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种挖地的活干了让人口渴。

Sense.DEF: having a strong desire for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a generation thirsty for change
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 渴求变革的一代

Sense.DEF: fields or plants that are thirsty need water
the number 13
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve only sold thirteen tickets so far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止他们仅仅售出13张票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When it happened, I was thirteen 13 years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那事发生时﹐我13岁。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the thirteenth the 13th day of the month.

Sense.DEF: the number 30
the years from 1930 to 1939
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the thirties, air travel really began to take off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在30年代﹐乘飞机旅行迅速流行了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family sold the house in the early thirties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 30 年代初期﹐这家人把房子卖了。

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 30 and 39
Sense.TRAN: 在三十到三十九岁之间﹐是三十多岁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She must be in her early thirties by now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在肯定是30岁出头。

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the thirties, it is between 30 degrees and 39 degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hot day, with temperatures in the low thirties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气温在三十一二度的一个热天

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the thirtieth the 30th day of the month.

Sense.DEF: someone between the age of 30 and 39
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new magazine aimed at thirtysomethings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对象为三十多岁人士的新杂志

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a person, thing, idea etc that has just been mentioned or to something that has just happened
Sense.TRAN: 这﹐这个〔指刚提到的人﹑物﹑想法或刚发生的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must make sure this doesn’t happen again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须确保此事不会再次发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there any way of solving these problems?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么方法能解决这些问题吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: If young Daly continues to improve at this rate, he’ll soon be in the A Team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果年轻的戴利继续以这种速度提高的话﹐他很快就能进入甲级队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will be discussed in the next chapter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将在下一章讨论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This boyfriend of yours – how old is he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的这位男朋友——他多大了？

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the present time or a time that is close to the present
Sense.TRAN: 这﹐这个〔指现在或离现在不远的一个时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be another meeting later this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周晚些时候还要开个会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This has been the worst year of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年是我一生中最糟糕的一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought he would have been back before this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我原以为他会在此之前回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be seeing Malcolm this Friday on Friday of the present week .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这星期五我们要去看马尔科姆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry I was late this morning today in the morning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉我今早迟到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone seems to be in a hurry these days at the present period .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些天大家似乎都匆匆忙忙的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to see you in my office this minute immediately .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要你立即到我办公室来见我。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the present situation
Sense.TRAN: 这个﹐这样〔用于指现在的状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate this cold damp weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌这种寒冷潮湿的天气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things have never been as bad as this before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前情况从没有这么糟糕过。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a thing or person that is near you, the thing you are holding, or the place where you are
Sense.TRAN: 这﹐这个〔指附近的人或物﹑手里拿的东西或所在的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are your gloves, aren’t they?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是你的手套﹐对吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to park on this side of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得把车停在路的这边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t bear the atmosphere in this house much longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这屋子里的气氛我忍不了多久了。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that you are going to say or that is just about to happen
Sense.TRAN: 这个〔用于指你就要说的或就要发生的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, listen to this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在﹐听听这个。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait till you hear this joke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听听这个笑话吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is going to surprise you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事会让你吃一惊的。

Sense.DEF: used in stories, jokes etc when you mention a person or thing for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 这个〔用于在故事﹑笑话里第一次提到某个人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met this really weird guy last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨晚碰到了一个好奇怪的家伙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, there was this tremendous bang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然传来一声巨响。

Subsense.DEF: used to introduce someone to someone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sam, this is my sister, Liz.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆﹐这是我的妹妹莉兹。

Subsense.DEF: used to give your name when you are speaking on the telephone
Subsense.TRAN: 我〔用于在电话里报自己的名字〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I speak to Joan, please?’ ‘This is Joan speaking.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “请问我能和琼说话吗？”“我就是琼。”

Sense.DEF: various different things, subjects etc
Sense.TRAN: 形形色色的东西﹔各种不同的话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What have you two been gossiping about all evening?’ ‘Oh this, that, and the other.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你们俩整个晚上一直在闲聊些什么？”“哦﹐这样那样的杂事。”

Sense.DEF: used to ask what is happening, what people are saying, what someone’s problem is etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s this? Crying again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么了？又哭了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s all this about a ghost?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有鬼？这是怎么回事？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something you expected to happen is actually going to happen
Sense.TRAN: 终于来到了〔指期待的事情将要发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is it, boys, the moment we’ve been waiting for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 终于来到了﹐小伙子们﹐我们等待的时刻终于来到了。

Sense.DEF: used to say how big, how much etc, when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands
Sense.TRAN: 这么﹐这样〔用手比画表示有多大或有多少〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The table’s about this high and this wide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那桌子大约有这么高﹐这么宽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to cut about this much off the end of the pipe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要从管子头上切下大约这么多。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: as good, bad, much etc as in the present situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t realised that things had got this bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有意识到事情变得这么糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never had this much money before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未有过这么多钱。

Sense.DEF: a wild plant which has leaves with sharp points and purple or white furry flowers
Sense.TRAN: 蓟〔一种叶片带刺﹑开紫色或白色毛茸状花朵的野生植物〕

Sense.DEF: the soft feathery substance fastened to thistle seeds that helps them to float in the air
in that direction

Sense.TRAN: a short form of 缩略式= ‘though’ 虽然﹔然而

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of leather used to fasten something or as part of a whip
