a type of shoe that covers the bottom of your foot, with a
strap
that goes between your toes to hold it on your foot as you walk

a piece of underwear or the bottom half of a
bikini
that has a single string instead of the back part

the part of your body between your neck and
diaphragm area just above your stomach

the part of an insect’s body between its head and its
abdomen
a sharp point that grows on the stem of a plant such as a rose
a bush or tree that has thorns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long, low hedge of thorns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一长排矮矮的荆棘树篱

Sense.DEF: someone or something that annoys you or causes problems for a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 某人的肉中刺〔指长时间让你心烦或给你惹麻烦的人或事〕﹐使人苦恼[招来麻烦]的人[事]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been a thorn in the side of the party leadership for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他多年来一直是该党领导人心头的一根刺。

Sense.DEF: a question etc that is complicated and difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: the thorny question of immigration policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民政策这个棘手的问题

Sense.DEF: a thorny bush, plant etc has thorns
including every possible detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor gave him a thorough check-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生给他做了一次全面的体检。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thorough and detailed biography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 详尽的传记
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police investigation was very thorough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的调查十分彻底。
Sense.EXAMPLE: thorough notes of the meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 详尽的会议记录

Sense.DEF: careful to do things properly so that you avoid mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The screening of applicants must be thorough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 筛选申请者一定要仔细。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the bad qualities of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 彻头彻尾的讨厌鬼/十足的麻烦/混乱不堪

Sense.DEF: a horse that has parents of the same very good breed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thoroughbred stallion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹纯种种马

Sense.DEF: someone who seems to do something naturally to a very high standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: football thoroughbred Mick Jones
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球天才米克•琼斯

Sense.DEF: the main road through a place such as a city or village
Sense.EXAMPLE: The motel was off the main thoroughfare .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家汽车旅馆远离大路。

Sense.DEF: a written sign used to tell people that they cannot go on a particular road or path
Sense.TRAN: 此路不通﹔禁止通行〔标牌用语〕

Sense.DEF: very thorough and careful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thoroughgoing analysis of the data
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对数据的仔细分析

Sense.DEF: a thoroughgoing action or quality is complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme has been a thoroughgoing success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个方案十分成功。

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat feeling thoroughly miserable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐着﹐感到极度痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: thoroughly cooked meat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮透了的肉

Sense.DEF: carefully, so that nothing is forgotten
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room had been thoroughly cleaned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间彻底打扫过了。

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
that
a thousand or a thousandth
Sense.EXAMPLE: They paid about sixty-nine thou for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们买它花了大约69,000块。

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘you’, used as the subject of a sentence
used to introduce a statement that makes the main statement coming after it seem surprising, unlikely, or unexpected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Though she’s almost 40, she still plans to compete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管已经快40岁了﹐她仍然打算参加比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pascal went ahead with the experiment even though he knew it was dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然帕斯卡知道这个试验很危险﹐但他仍然进行下去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rooms, though small, were pleasant and airy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房间虽小﹐但舒适又通风。

GramExa.PROPFORM: old though it is/tired though he was etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Strange though it may seem, I like housework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说来也许奇怪﹐但我喜欢做家务。

Sense.DEF: used like ‘but’ to add a fact or opinion that makes what you have just said seem less definite, less important etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought he’d been drinking, though I wasn’t completely sure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他喝了酒﹐不过不是十分肯定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The offenders were dealt with firmly though fairly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些违法者受到了严厉但公正的处罚。

Subsense.DEF: in a way that makes you think something is true
Subsense.TRAN: 好像〔指某种情形使你认为某事属实〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It looks as though everyone else has gone home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看起来好像其他所有人都回家了。

Subsense.DEF: in a way that might make you think something was true, although you know it is not true
Subsense.TRAN: 好像﹐仿佛〔指某种情形也许会让你有种感觉﹐但其实你知道事实并非如此〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She stared at me as though I were a complete stranger.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她盯着我看﹐好像我完全是个陌生人。

Sense.DEF: used after adding a fact, opinion, or question which seems surprising after what you have just said, or which makes what you have just said seem less true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two heart attacks in a year. It hasn’t stopped him smoking, though.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年里心脏病发作了两次﹐可是那也没让他把烟戒掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sounds like a lot of fun. Isn’t it rather risky though?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听上去很有趣。可是这不是也很危险吗？

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
think 1
something that you think of, remember, or realize
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an interesting thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这想法很有趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought that I might not have a job next year is a bit troubling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到明年可能失业我有点心烦。

Sense.DEF: a person’s ideas or opinions about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are your thoughts, Michael?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么意见﹐迈克尔？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any thoughts on how we should spend the money?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于我们该如何花这些钱﹐谁有什么建议吗？

Sense.DEF: careful and serious consideration
Sense.EXAMPLE: With more thought and care this would have been a first-class essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是再认真琢磨一下﹐这就是一篇一流的文章了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: give sth thought/give thought to sth
GramExa.GLOSS: think carefully about sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been giving your proposal a lot of thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在认真考虑你的提议。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you given any more thought to going back to school?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有再考虑回去上学呢？

Sense.DEF: the act or process of thinking

GramExa.GLOSS: thinking so much that you do not notice what is happening around you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Derek was staring out of the window, lost in thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德里克凝视着窗外﹐陷入沉思。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Piaget’s research focused on children’s thought processes the way their minds work .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮亚杰的研究重点是儿童的思维方式。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of worrying or caring about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He went back into the burning building with no thought for his own safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不顾自己的安危﹐又回到烈火熊熊的大楼里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you no thought for anyone but yourself?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就只顾自己﹐不想想其他人吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: You are always in my thoughts used to tell someone that you think and care about them a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你始终在我的心里。

Sense.DEF: intention or hope of doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had no thought of gaining any personal advantage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并没有想要捞取个人的好处。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lucy gave up all thought of finishing the essay that day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西完全打消了当天写完文章的念头。

Sense.DEF: a way of thinking that is typical of a particular group, period of history etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一团体的〕思想（方法）﹔〔某一历史时期的〕思潮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kant’s ideas had a strong influence on political thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康德的观点对政治思想有很深刻的影响。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they should think about someone who is in a worse situation than they are
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于要求别人〕给某人一点关心
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spare a thought for those who don’t have enough to eat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关心一下那些吃不饱肚子的人吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that what you have just said is only a suggestion and you have not thought about it very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was just a thought, Duncan. I didn’t mean any offence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这仅仅是一个想法而已﹐邓肯。我无意冒犯。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has made a good suggestion
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why don’t you ask Walter?’ ‘That’s a thought! I’ll phone him right away.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么不问问沃尔特？”“这是个好主意！我这就打电话给他。”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry after they have told you they are sorry
Sense.TRAN: 别把它放在心上﹐不要再往心里去〔用于回答某人的道歉〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are grateful for a gift from someone even though it is small or unimportant
Sense.TRAN: 重要的是心意〔用于表示礼物虽小﹐你也是非常感激的〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I just had a funny thought.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚有个有趣的想法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say what they are or tell other people about them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was finding it difficult to express his thoughts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得难以表达自己的想法。

Collocate.COLLOC: a thought occurs to/comes to/strikes sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone suddenly has a thought
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The thought occurred to him that she might be lying.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然想到她可能在撒谎。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone has a thought
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The thought never crossed my mind that I could be wrong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从没想过可能是我错了。

Collocate.COLLOC: can’t bear the thought of sth
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 无法接受对某事的想法
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can’t bear the thought of you being hurt.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到你受伤我心里就难受。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: they start thinking about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As summer approaches, people’s thoughts turn to holidays.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏日临近﹐人们开始考虑度假了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My first thought was that a bomb had gone off.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一个想到的就是炸弹爆炸了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a quick, not very serious thought
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He never gives his appearance more than a passing thought.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他几乎从不考虑自己的外表。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that makes you feel serious
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have the power to destroy the world, which is a sobering thought.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能毁掉世界﹐这一想法令人警醒。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: even the idea of doing something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The very thought of going on stage made her feel ill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到要上台她就感觉不舒服。

Sense.DEF: always thinking of the things you can do to make people happy or comfortable
Sense.TRAN: 想得周到的﹔体贴的﹐关心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul is very thoughtful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗非常体贴人。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is thoughtful of sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was really thoughtful of you to remember my birthday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真是细心﹐还记得我的生日。

Sense.DEF: serious and quiet because you are thinking a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thoughtful look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 若有所思的神情
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thoughtful silence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉思不语

Sense.DEF: well planned and carefully thought about
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thoughtful analysis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周密的分析

Sense.DEF: not thinking about the needs and feelings of other people, especially because you are thinking about what you want
Sense.TRAN: 欠考虑的﹔不为他人着想的﹐自私的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a selfish and thoughtless man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自私而不顾他人的人

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is thoughtless of sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was thoughtless of her not to tell you where she was going.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没告诉你她要去哪儿﹐这有点欠考虑。

Sense.DEF: planned and organized carefully, well etc
Sense.TRAN: 考虑仔细的/周密的/不周的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carefully thought-out speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 字斟句酌的演讲

Sense.DEF: the police organization in George Orwell’s novel Nineteen Eighty-Four whose job is to control what people think and the way that they think. The expression ‘thought police’ is sometimes used for describing any group that tries to tell other people what opinions they should have or what words they should use.
Sense.TRAN: 思想警察〔乔治•奥威尔小说《一九八四》中控制人们思想的警察组织。此词有时用于指试图左右别人思想或言论的任何团体〕

Sense.DEF: making people think seriously about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 发人深省的﹐引人深思的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thought-provoking article
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发人深省的文章

Sense.DEF: the number 1,000
Sense.EXAMPLE: a journey of almost a thousand miles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将近1,000英里的旅程

GramExa.EXAMPLE: five thousand dollars
The company employs 30 thousand people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司雇用着3万名员工。

Sense.DEF: an extremely large number of things or people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been this route a thousand times before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路线我以前走过无数次了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are thousands of things I want to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有很多事情想做。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the thousandth anniversary of the founding of the city
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市建城一千周年纪念

Sense.DEF: the state of being a slave
controlled or strongly influenced by someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 在某人/某事的奴役[束缚﹐控制]之下
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have a congress that is in thrall to special interest groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的国会受制于一些特殊利益集团。

Sense.DEF: to move or make something move from side to side in a violent or uncontrolled way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girl was thrashing about in the water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩在水里拼命地挣扎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Salmon thrash their tails and leap from the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲑鱼甩动着尾巴跃出水面。

Sense.DEF: to beat someone violently, especially in order to punish them
Sense.TRAN: 毒打﹐痛打〔尤指作为惩罚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My poor brother used to get thrashed for all kinds of minor offences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那可怜的哥哥过去常常因为各种各样的小错而挨打。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone very easily in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brazil thrashed Italy 5-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴西队以五比零大败意大利队。

Sense.DEF: to discuss something thoroughly with someone until you find an answer, reach an agreement, or decide on something
Sense.TRAN: 彻底讨论﹐仔细商讨〔直到找出解决办法﹐达成协议或作出决定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We still have to get together and thrash out the details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还得一起商定细节。

Sense.DEF: a violent movement from side to side

a type of loud fast
rock music
a loud noisy party
an occasion when you beat someone or are beaten violently as a punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you speak to your mother like that again, you’ll get a thrashing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你再那样跟你妈说话﹐就要挨揍了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you the thrashing you deserve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要狠狠揍你一顿﹐你这是罪有应得。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you defeat someone or are defeated very easily in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manager resigned after his team’s 14-0 thrashing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练在他的球队0比14惨败后辞职。

Sense.DEF: a long thin string of cotton, silk etc used to sew or weave cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m looking for a needle and thread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在找针线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: hand-sewn with gold and silver thread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用金线和银线手工缝制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spool of thread small object that thread is wound around
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一卷线

Sense.DEF: an idea, feeling, or feature that connects the different parts of an explanation, story etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a common thread running within his work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贯串他作品的共同主线
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mind wandered, and he lost the thread of what she was saying was no longer able to understand it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走神了﹐跟不上她的思路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thread running through the film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贯串电影的一条主线

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a thread of spirituality in her work
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贯串在她作品中的灵性

Sense.DEF: to begin something again after a long period, especially a relationship or way of life
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某种关系或生活方式中断很长时间后〕再继续下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had known each other as children, and were picking up the threads of their friendship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们儿时就相识﹐现在又重拾友谊。

Sense.DEF: a series of messages concerning the same subject, written by members of an Internet discussion group
Sense.TRAN: 〔网上讨论区涉及同一个主题的〕一连串帖子
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to refer to something that was posted in an earlier thread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想提一下早前的那些帖子中说到的一件事。

Sense.DEF: a long thin line of something, such as light, smoke etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Colorado River was just a thread of silver, 4,000 feet below.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 4,000英尺高空下的科罗拉多河犹如一条细长的银线。

Sense.DEF: a continuous raised line of metal that winds around the curved surface of a screw
clothes
to put a thread, string, rope etc through a hole
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you thread the needle for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能替我穿一下针吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom threaded the rope through the safety harness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆把绳子穿进安全吊带。

Sense.DEF:
to put a film, tape etc correctly through parts of a camera,
projector
, or
tape recorder
to connect two or more objects by pushing something such as string through a hole in them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue threaded the glass beads onto a piece of heavy string.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休把玻璃珠穿到一根粗线上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: thread your way through/into sth etc
Sense.DEF: to move through a place by carefully going around things that are blocking your way
Sense.TRAN: 小心〔避开障碍物〕穿过/进入某地等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came towards me, threading her way through the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿过人群朝我走来。

Sense.DEF:
clothes,
carpets
etc that are threadbare are very thin and in bad condition because they have been used a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a threadbare old sofa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张破旧的沙发

Sense.DEF: an excuse etc that is no longer effective because it has been used too much
Sense.TRAN: 陈旧的托词/论点/笑话等

Sense.DEF: a way of removing hair from the face in which hairs are pulled out with a thread
a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your threats don’t scare me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the threat of military invasion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事入侵的威胁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He says his family received phone threats from the group.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他的家人接到过这个组织的恐吓电话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: threats made against his wife and children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他妻儿的威胁
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职﹐但从未付诸行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无视这项声明﹐认为是个空口威胁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

Sense.DEF: the possibility that something very bad will happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the threat of famine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饥荒的威胁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: According to the Secretary of State, the Russians face no threat from an expanded NATO.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据国务卿的说法﹐俄罗斯人不会受北约组织扩张的威胁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The area remains under threat from commercial developers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区仍然受到商业开发商的威胁。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be under threat of closure/attack etc
GramExa.GLOSS: be likely to be closed, attacked etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 面临关闭/攻击等的威胁
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The program is under threat of closure due to lack of funding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该方案由于缺少资金﹐面临终止的威胁。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is regarded as a possible danger
Sense.TRAN: 威胁﹐可能会带来危险的人[事]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fighting is a major threat to stability in the region.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场战事对于该地区的稳定是一个很大的威胁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pollution poses a threat to fish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染对鱼类构成威胁。

Sense.DEF: to say that you will cause someone harm or trouble if they do not do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Postal workers are threatening a strike if they don’t receive a pay increase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮政工人威胁如果不加薪﹐他们就要罢工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He threatened to take them to court.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扬言要把他们告上法庭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors are sometimes threatened with violence if they don’t do what patients want.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生如果不按照病人的要求去做﹐有时会受到暴力威胁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Then he became angry and threatened that he would go to the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后他生气了﹐威胁说要去报警。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to harm or destroy something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poaching threatens the survival of the rhino.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偷猎危及犀牛的生存。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The incident threatens to ruin his chances in the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事威胁到他当选的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Large areas of the jungle are now threatened with destruction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大片大片的热带丛林现在面临毁灭的危险。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to happen or be in a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔不利的事〕可能发生﹔可能引起〔不利的后果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s fishing industry remains threatened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的捕鱼业仍然面临着威胁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dark clouds threatened rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌云预示着要下雨了。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s behaviour is threatening, you believe they intend to harm you
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice sounded threatening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话音里暗含威胁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a threatening gesture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个威胁的手势

Sense.DEF: if the sky or clouds are threatening, bad weather is likely
Sense.EXAMPLE: a threatening thundercloud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片阴沉沉的雷雨云

Sense.DEF: the number 3
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve won their last three games.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们赢了最近三场比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better go. It’s almost three three o’clock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该走了。快3点了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My little sister’s only three three years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的小妹妹只有3岁。

Sense.DEF: in groups of three people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers taking part will be asked to work in threes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加的老师将被要求分成三人一组进行活动。

Sense.DEF: having three corners
a competition which involves three people or groups
a horse-riding competition that takes place for three days
having, or seeming to have, length, depth, and height
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-dimensional structure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三维结构
Sense.EXAMPLE: objects that are three-dimensional
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立体物体

Sense.DEF: a three-dimensional character in a book, film etc seems like a real person
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影等中的人物〕有立体感的﹐逼真的

Sense.DEF: three times as much or as many
Sense.EXAMPLE: increase production threefold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让产量增长三倍

Sense.DEF: a race in which two people run together, with one person’s right leg tied to the other person’s left leg
Sense.TRAN: 绑腿赛跑﹐二人三足赛跑〔一种两人一组的赛跑﹐其中一人的右腿与另一人的左腿绑在一起〕

Sense.DEF: an order from a leader of a British political party telling MPs in that party that they must vote in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 三线鞭令〔英国政党领袖发出的指令﹐指示党内议员必须如何投票〕

Sense.DEF:
a place in Pennsylvania in the US, where there was a serious accident in 1979 in a
nuclear power
station a place where electricity is produced using nuclear energy . The people in charge managed to prevent a
meltdown when the nuclear material melts and burns through its containers
, but the accident increased opposition to nuclear power in the US and prevented new power stations from being built.
Sense.TRAN: 三英里岛〔美国宾夕法尼亚一地区﹐1979年那里的一座核电站发生严重事故﹐负责人员经过努力才阻止了核反应堆堆芯熔毁﹐但这次事故引起美国国内更多人反对核能源并阻止建造新的核电站〕

Sense.DEF: three old pence
a small coin used in Britain before 1971 that was worth three old pence
Sense.TRAN: 〔1971年之前在英国使用的〕三便士硬币

Sense.DEF:
a suit that consists of a
jacket
,
waistcoat
, and trousers made from the same material
Sense.TRAN: 三件套衣服〔包括上衣﹑马甲和裤子〕

Sense.DEF:
two chairs and a
sofa
covered in the same material

three-ply wood, wool,
tissue
etc consists of three layers or threads
Sense.TRAN: 〔木板﹑纸巾等〕三层的﹔〔羊毛线等〕三股的

Sense.DEF: a way of turning your car so that it faces the opposite way, by driving forwards, backwards, and then forwards again while turning
Sense.TRAN: 三点转向〔指汽车的一种掉头方法﹐先往前驶﹐再后退﹐再往前驶﹐都同时伴随着转向动作〕

Sense.DEF: three quarters of the full size, length etc of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-quarter violin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把四分之三小提琴
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-quarter length coat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 七分长大衣

Sense.DEF: an amount equal to three of the four equal parts that make up a whole

GramExa.EXAMPLE: three-quarters of an hour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 45分钟

Sense.DEF: a film or book that continues the story of two previous films or books – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑小说的〕第三部〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first two films were huge hits, but the threequel flopped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前两部影片大受欢迎﹐但第三部砸锅了。

Sense.DEF: a place or situation that is confusing because there is too much activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how you can work in that office – it’s like a three-ring circus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道你怎么能够在那样的办公室里工作——那里就像一个闹哄哄的大马戏团。

Sense.DEF:
a
circus
that has three areas in which people or animals perform at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 三环马戏表演〔三台同时表演的马戏〕

Sense.DEF:
reading, writing, and
arithmetic
, considered as the basic things that children must learn in school
Sense.TRAN: 〔儿童上学必须学会的〕读写算技能﹐三R技能

Sense.DEF: a group of three people or things
a three-star hotel, restaurant etc has been judged to be of a high standard
a car that has three wheels

a vehicle that has three wheels, especially a
motorcycle
,
tricycle
, or special
wheelchair
Sense.TRAN: 三轮摩托车[自行车﹐轮椅]

Sense.DEF:
in the New Testament of the Bible, three kings or wise men who came from the East, guided by a star, and brought gifts of gold,
frankincense
, and
myrrh
for the baby Jesus. The expression ‘three wise men’ is sometimes used, especially in newspapers, to describe three men who work together as a group.
Sense.TRAN: 东方三博士〔《圣经•新约》中来自东方的三位国王或博士﹐他们在一颗星的指引下为新降生的耶稣带来了黄金﹑乳香和没药。three wise men这一表达方式有时用于形容三人工作小组﹐此用法尤见于报纸上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: MPs are debating the report provided by the three wise men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议员们正就一个三人小组提交的报告进行辩论。

Sense.DEF: a funeral song or poem for someone who has died
to separate grains of corn, wheat etc from the rest of the plant by beating it with a special tool or machine
a machine used for separating grains of corn, wheat etc from the rest of the plant
Sense.TRAN: 〔给玉米﹑小麦等脱粒的〕脱粒机﹐打谷机

Sense.DEF: the entrance to a room or building, or the area of floor or ground at the entrance
Sense.EXAMPLE: She opened the door and stepped across the threshold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打开门﹐跨过门槛。

Sense.DEF: the level at which something starts to happen or have an effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事开始发生或产生效果的〕起始点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eighty percent of the vote was the threshold for approval of the plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 80%的票数是这个计划能够获得批准的“门槛”。

GramExa.GLOSS: the ability or inability to suffer a lot of pain or boredom before you react to it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 很高/低的忍痛力/耐乏味能力等

Sense.DEF: at the beginning of a new and important event or development

GramExa.PROPFORM: be on the threshold of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The creature is on the threshold of extinction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种生物已濒临灭绝。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
throw 1
three times
wise and careful use of money, so that none is wasted

a shop that sells used goods, especially clothes, often in order to get money for a
charity
Sense.TRAN: 廉价旧货店〔出售旧货的商店﹐尤指卖旧衣服的商店﹐通常为了给慈善机构筹款〕

Sense.DEF: using money carefully and wisely
Sense.EXAMPLE: hard-working, thrifty people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勤劳节俭的人们

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong feeling of excitement and pleasure, or the thing that makes you feel this
Sense.TRAN: 〔突然而又强烈的〕激动﹐狂喜﹔令人激动的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winning first place must have been quite a thrill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赢得第一名肯定让人非常激动。

GramExa.GLOSS: the excitement you get from something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the thrill of travelling at high speeds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速行驶的刺激感

Sense.EXAMPLE: Even though I’ve been acting for years, I still get a thrill out of going on stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我演了多年戏﹐走上舞台我仍然感到十分激动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It gave Pat a thrill to finally see the group perform live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特终于看到这个乐队现场表演﹐感到十分激动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a thrill of pride as her son stepped forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当她的儿子迈步向前﹐她感到一阵自豪。

GramExa.PROPFORM: do sth for the thrill of it
GramExa.GLOSS: do something for excitement and not for any serious reason
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 为了寻求刺激而做某事

Sense.DEF: the excitement and danger involved in an activity, especially a sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指体育运动中的〕惊险刺激

Sense.DEF: the excitement you feel when you are trying to get something that is difficult to get, especially when you are trying to get a romantic relationship with someone
Sense.TRAN: 追求过程中的刺激感〔尤指追求某人时〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel excited and happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: His music continues to thrill audiences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐依然能扣人心弦。

Sense.DEF: to feel excited and happy about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the 1960s, the public thrilled to the idea of space exploration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代﹐公众对于太空探险的想法感到激动不已。

Sense.DEF: very excited, happy, and pleased
Sense.TRAN: 非常激动的﹐兴奋的﹐高兴的

GramExa.PROPFORM: be thrilled to see/hear/learn etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were so thrilled to hear about the baby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到那个婴儿的消息﹐我们非常激动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m absolutely thrilled that you are coming.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能来我真是太高兴了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was thrilled about being asked to play.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人邀请他参加演出﹐他十分激动。

GramExa.GLOSS: very thrilled

Sense.DEF: a book or film that tells an exciting story about murder or crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔关于谋杀或犯罪的〕惊险小说﹐惊险电影

Sense.DEF: interesting and exciting
Sense.TRAN: 引人入胜的﹔令人激动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thrilling 3-2 victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比分为3比2的激动人心的胜利

Sense.DEF: someone who does things that are dangerous because they like the feeling of excitement it gives them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a roller coaster that will please thrill-seekers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让寻求刺激的人感到过瘾的过山车

Sense.DEF: to become very successful or very strong and healthy
Sense.TRAN: 兴旺﹐欣欣向荣﹔茁壮成长
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say do well rather than thrive .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 do well﹐而不说thrive
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The whole family seems to be doing well .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 全家人似乎都干得不错。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy or be successful in a particular situation, especially one that other people find difficult or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 乐意做〔别人觉得难做或不乐意做的事〕﹔ 〔在其他人认为不利的环境中〕成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t want that much pressure, but she seems to thrive on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是不希望有那么多的压力﹐但她却好像乐在其中。

Sense.DEF: a thriving company, business etc is very successful
Sense.TRAN: 欣欣向荣的﹐兴旺发达的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thriving tourist industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欣欣向荣的旅游业

Sense.DEF: the passage from the back of your mouth to the top of the tubes that go down to your lungs and stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: The singer complained of a sore throat after Wednesday’s show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期三演出后﹐这位歌手说喉咙痛。

Sense.DEF: the front of your neck
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fingered the pearls at her throat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手指拨弄脖子上的珍珠。

Sense.DEF: to make a noise in your throat, especially before you speak, or in order to get someone’s attention
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指说话前或为引人注意而〕清清嗓子

Sense.DEF: to force someone to accept or listen to your ideas and opinions
Sense.TRAN: 强迫某人接受自己的意见

Sense.DEF: if two people are at each other’s throats, they are fighting or arguing
to behave in a way that is certain to harm you, especially because you are proud or angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因骄傲或发怒而〕自己害自己﹐自寻死路

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a frog in your throat

Sense.DEF: a throaty laugh, cough, voice etc sounds low and rough
Sense.TRAN: 〔笑﹑咳嗽﹑说话等时〕声音低沉的﹐声音沙哑的

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body throbs, you have a feeling of pain in it that regularly starts and stops
Sense.EXAMPLE: The back of my neck throbbed painfully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的后颈阵阵抽痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her foot was throbbing with pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脚一阵阵地痛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I woke up with a throbbing headache .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我醒来时脑袋阵阵作痛。

Sense.DEF:
if music or a machine throbs, it makes a low sound or
vibration
with a strong regular beat
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐或机器〕有规律地颤动﹐震响
Sense.EXAMPLE: a throbbing bass line
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有节奏的低音旋律

Sense.DEF: if your heart throbs, it beats faster or more strongly than usual
if a place throbs with life, energy etc, it has a lot of life etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river is throbbing with life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条河生机勃勃。

Sense.DEF: a low strong regular beat or sensation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the throb of the engines
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机的震动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a steady throb of pain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有规律的抽痛

Sense.DEF: in the middle of a very difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country in the throes of a profound economic crisis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个陷于严重经济危机的国家

Sense.DEF:
a serious medical problem caused by a
clot
forming in your blood that prevents the blood from flowing normally
a special chair used by a king or queen at important ceremonies
the position and power of being a king or queen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is next in line to the throne will become king when the present ruler dies .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是第一王位继承人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1913, George V was on the throne was ruling .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1913年乔治五世在位。

Sense.DEF: a large group of people in one place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got lost in the throng.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在人群中迷路了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a throng of excited spectators
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群兴奋的观众

Sense.DEF: if people throng a place, they go there in large numbers
Sense.TRAN: 〔人群〕蜂拥而至﹐群集﹐挤满〔某地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tourists thronged the bars and restaurants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客挤满了酒吧和餐馆。

Sense.DEF: if a place is thronged with people or things, there are a lot of them there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The streets were thronged with Christmas shoppers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街道上挤满了圣诞购物者。

Sense.DEF: to kill or injure someone by holding their throat very tightly so that they cannot breathe
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grabbed her by the throat and began throttling her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他掐住她的咽喉﹐使劲勒紧。

Sense.DEF: to make it difficult or impossible for something to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: policies which are throttling many Asian economies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抑制许多亚洲国家经济发展的政策

Sense.DEF:
to reduce the amount of
fuel
flowing into an engine, in order to reduce its speed

a piece of equipment that controls the amount of
fuel
going into a vehicle’s engine
Sense.TRAN: 〔控制汽车发动机油量的〕节流阀﹐油门

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The engines were at full throttle the throttle was open so the engines could go very fast .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机开足马力在运转。

Sense.DEF: as fast or as much as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team’s offense ran full throttle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队开始全力进攻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a political campaign on full throttle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场如火如荼的政治运动

Sense.DEF: into one side or end of an entrance, passage, hole etc and out of the other side or end
Sense.TRAN: 从一端至另一端﹐穿过﹐通过〔入口﹑通道﹑洞孔等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She smiled at him as he walked through the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从门口进来时﹐她朝他笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water will be pumped through a pipe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水将通过管子抽上来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to squeeze through a gap in the hedge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法从篱笆上的一个缺口挤了过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were suddenly plunged into darkness as the train went through a tunnel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车穿过隧道﹐他们顿时陷入黑暗之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were people standing in the doorway and I couldn’t get through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人站在门口﹐我过不去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went through to the kitchen to see who was there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走到厨房去看看谁在那儿。

Sense.DEF: cutting or breaking something, or making a hole from one side of it to the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: A football came crashing through the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个足球破窗飞了进来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bullet passed straight through his skull.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗子弹直穿他的头骨。

Sense.DEF: from one side of an area to the other or between a group of things
Sense.TRAN: 穿过﹐通过〔指经过某一地区或从一组物体中穿过〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We passed through France on our way to Italy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去意大利时途经法国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We made our way through the village to the farm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们穿过村庄来到了农场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind howled through the trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风呼啸着刮过树林。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had to push his way through the crowd to get to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不挤过人群才来到她身边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me through – I’m a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我过去——我是医生。

GramExa.GLOSS: reach a place after a difficult journey
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll never get through – the snow’s two metres deep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你根本到不了——雪有两米深。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rescue teams have finally made it through to the survivors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 营救队伍终于抵达幸存者身边。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We drove right through the town centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开车径直穿过市中心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carry on straight through the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直接穿过这个村庄﹐继续往前。

Sense.DEF: if you see something through glass, a window etc, you are on one side of the glass etc and it is on the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see her through the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我透过窗户看到了她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see right through the thin curtains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我透过薄薄的窗帘看得一清二楚。

Sense.DEF: past a place where you are supposed to stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took us ages to get through passport control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了很长时间才通过护照查验处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drove straight through a red light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遇到红灯直接闯了过去。

Sense.DEF: during and to the end of a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cold weather continued through the spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷的天气持续了整个春天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slept right through the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他睡了一整天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fighting went on all through the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗持续了整夜。

Sense.DEF: from the beginning to the end of a process or experience
Sense.TRAN: 经过〔全部的过程或经历〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book guides you through the whole procedure of buying a house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书可对购房提供全程指导。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you have been through a terrible experience like that, it takes a long time to recover.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历过那样可怕的事情﹐之后要花很长时间才能恢复过来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a miracle that these buildings came through the war undamaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建筑物在经历了这场战争后竟然没有受损﹐简直是个奇迹。

Sense.DEF: past one stage in a competition to the next stage
Sense.TRAN: 通过〔比赛的一个阶段而进入下一阶段〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is the first time they’ve ever made it through to the final.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他们第一次打入决赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They didn’t even get through the first round of the contest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们甚至没能通过第一轮比赛。

Sense.DEF: because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many working days were lost through sickness last year?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年因为员工生病损失了多少个工作日？

Sense.DEF: by means of a particular method, service, person etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got her first job through an employment agency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她通过职业介绍所得到了第一份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a success that was achieved through co-operative effort and wise leadership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭借齐心协力和英明领导而取得的成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard about it through a friend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是从一个朋友那里听说此事的。

Sense.DEF: if a proposal passes through a parliament, it is agreed and accepted as a law
Sense.EXAMPLE: A special bill was rushed through Congress to deal with the emergency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会紧急通过一项特殊议案﹐以应对这一突发事件。

Sense.LEXUNIT: May through June/Wednesday through Friday etc
Sense.DEF: from May until June, from Wednesday until Friday etc
Sense.TRAN: 从5月到6月/从星期三到星期五等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store is open Monday through Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店周一至周六营业。

Sense.DEF: in the middle of an event or period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I left halfway through the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我电影看了一半就离开了。

Sense.DEF: connected to someone by telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried phoning you, but I couldn’t get through .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你打过电话﹐但没打通。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please hold the line and I’ll put you through .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请不要挂电话﹐我给你接过去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you manage to get through to her?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打通她的电话了吗？

Sense.DEF: completely wet, cooked etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re wet through. What on earth have you been doing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你湿透了。你到底干什么了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It should only take a few minutes to heat this through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该只要几分钟时间就能热透。

Sense.DEF: if someone is a particular type of person through and through, they are completely that type of person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll say one thing for Sandra – she’s a professional through and through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要为桑德拉说一句——她可是地地道道的专业人士。

Sense.DEF: as far as London, Paris etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does this train go through to Glasgow?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这班火车开往格拉斯哥吗？

Sense.DEF: to use a lot of something quickly
Sense.TRAN: 快速而大量地使用某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: George Ward started smoking at the age of nine, and at one time he was getting through 80 a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治·沃德九岁就开始吸烟﹐一度每天要抽掉 80 支烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of the year he had run through all the money inherited from his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到年底﹐他已经把从父亲那儿继承来的钱全部花光了。

Subsense.DEF: to have finished doing something or using something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not through just yet – I should be finished in an hour.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有做完——一个小时后应该能完成了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you through with the computer yet?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用完电脑了吗？

Subsense.DEF: to no longer be having a relationship with someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s it! Simon and I are through.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结束了！ 我和西蒙已经完了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m through with you!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和你结束了！

Sense.DEF: a train by which you can reach a place, without having to use other trains
a road that joins cities, towns, or villages together
in every part of a particular area, place etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large organization with offices throughout the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在世界各地都设有办事处的一家大型机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease spread rapidly throughout Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病迅速在整个欧洲蔓延开来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house is in excellent condition, with fitted carpets throughout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子状况极好﹐全部铺着地毯。

Sense.DEF: during all of a particular period, from the beginning to the end
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are open every weekend throughout the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们全年每个周末都对外开放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was involved in politics throughout his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一生都和政治联系在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The debate continued, but Meredith remained silent throughout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辩论继续进行着﹐但梅雷迪思自始至终保持沉默。

Sense.DEF: the amount of work, goods, or people that are dealt with in a particular period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔在一定时间内的〕工作量﹐吞吐量﹐接待人数

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an airport with a weekly throughput of 100,000 passengers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周旅客吞吐量为10万人的一个机场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a large store with a high throughput of goods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 货物流量大的大商店

Sense.DEF:
a
thruway

the past tense of
thrive
to make an object such as a ball move quickly through the air by pushing your hand forward quickly and letting the object go

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He threw his shirt to someone in the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把他的衬衫扔给了人群中的一个人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone threw a stone at the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人朝汽车扔了一块石头。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a crowd of boys throwing snowballs at each other
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 互扔雪球的一群男孩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Throw me that towel, would you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把那块毛巾扔给我吧。

Sense.HINTTRAN: You throw something to someone when you want them to catch it. You throw something at someone when you want to hit them. 扔东西给某人用throw...to...﹐朝某人扔东西用throw...at...。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere quickly and carelessly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw a handful of money onto the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把一把钱扔到了桌子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just throw your clothes on the floor – pick them up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要把衣服扔在地板上——捡起来！

Sense.DEF: to push someone or something roughly and violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus stopped suddenly and we were all thrown forwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车猛地停住﹐我们都往前栽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guards threw Biko to the ground and started kicking him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫兵们把比科推倒在地﹐开始踢打他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bomb exploded, throwing bricks and debris into the air .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹爆炸了﹐碎砖瓦砾四处横飞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She drew the curtains and threw open the windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拉开窗帘﹐一把推开窗户。

Subsense.DEF: to make your opponent fall to the ground in a sport in which you fight
if a horse throws its rider, it makes them fall onto the ground

Sense.DEF: to suddenly and quickly move your hands, arms, head etc into a new position
Sense.EXAMPLE: I threw my arms around her and kissed her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一把把她抱住﹐亲吻她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw his head back and laughed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仰头大笑。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very confused
Sense.EXAMPLE: It threw me completely when she said she was coming to stay with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她要来和我们一起住﹐把我弄得不知所措。

Sense.DEF: to move or jump somewhere suddenly and with a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 突然猛力地扑向/跳到/冲进/扑倒等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw himself down onto the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一头倒在床上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She committed suicide by throwing herself out of a tenth floor window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从十楼窗户跳下去自杀了。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone who opposes the regime is thrown in jail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是反对这个政权的人都被投进监狱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: throw sb out of work/office etc
Sense.DEF: to suddenly take away someone’s job or position of authority
Sense.TRAN: 突然把某人解雇/解职等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of men were thrown out of work when the mine closed down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矿井关闭﹐数百人一下子都失去了工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elections were held, and the government was thrown out of office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举举行后﹐政府被赶下台。

Sense.DEF: to make people feel very confused and not certain about what they should do
Sense.TRAN: 使某人/某事陷入困惑/混乱/凌乱等中
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone was thrown into confusion by this news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都被这个消息弄得不知所措。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The transport industry has been thrown into chaos by the strike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运输业因为这次罢工陷入了一片混乱。

Sense.DEF: to make people think that something is probably not true
Sense.TRAN: 使人们对某事产生怀疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fresh evidence has thrown doubt on her story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的证据让人对她的说法产生了怀疑。

Sense.DEF: to make people think that someone is probably guilty
Sense.TRAN: 使人们对某人产生怀疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: This latest document throws suspicion on the company chairman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份最新的文件使人们开始对公司的董事长产生了怀疑。

Sense.DEF: to quickly look at someone with a particular expression that shows how you are feeling
Sense.TRAN: 朝某人看了看/瞥了一眼/笑了笑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw Anna a big smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对安娜粲然一笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw a glance at Connor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瞥了康纳一眼。

Sense.DEF: to react in a very angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t tell my parents – they’d throw a fit!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能告诉父母——他们会大发雷霆的！

Sense.DEF: to say something to someone or ask them something roughly
Sense.TRAN: 粗鲁地（对某人）提问题/说话等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They threw a few awkward questions at me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们问了我几个令人尴尬的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re early!’ she threw at him accusingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你来早啦！”她责怪他。

Subsense.DEF: to allow people to go into a place that is usually kept private

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plans have been announced to throw the Palace open to the public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣布了向公众开放宫殿的计划。

Subsense.DEF: to allow anyone to take part in a competition or a discussion

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would now like to throw the debate open to our audience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在想让观众加入我们的讨论。

Sense.DEF: to make something start or stop working by moving a control
Sense.TRAN: 扳动开关/把手/控制杆〔使设备启动或停止〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw a switch and the lights all went out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他按了一下开关﹐所有的灯都熄灭了。

Sense.DEF: to organize a party and invite people
to try to solve a problem by spending a lot of money but without really thinking about the problem
Sense.TRAN: 大量花钱〔以解决某个问题﹐但没经过深思熟虑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem cannot be solved by throwing money at it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题靠砸钱是解决不了的。

Sense.DEF: to be forced to have to depend on your own skills, knowledge etc
Sense.TRAN: 只得依赖〔自己的技能﹑知识等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once again, we were thrown back on our own resources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不得不再次自力更生。

Sense.DEF: to start doing an activity with a lot of effort and energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since her husband died, she’s thrown herself into her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从丈夫去世后﹐她就全心投入工作。

Sense.DEF: to use your position of authority to tell people what to do in an unreasonable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the sort of insensitive bully who enjoys throwing his weight around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个冷漠无情﹑仗势欺人的家伙﹐就爱到处横行霸道。

Sense.DEF: to support a plan, person etc and use your power to make sure they succeed
Sense.TRAN: 支持某人/某事﹐作为某人/某事的后盾
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party leadership is throwing its weight behind the campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 党的领导层鼎力支持这项活动。

Sense.DEF: to make something easier to understand by providing new information
Sense.TRAN: 〔提供新资料〕使某事更易理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent investigations have thrown new light on how the two men died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的调查为这两名男子的死因提供了新的解释。

Sense.DEF: to make light or shadow fall on a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees threw long, dark shadows across the cornfield.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木在玉米地里投下长长的﹑黑乎乎的影子。

Sense.DEF: to punish someone as severely as possible or charge them with as many offences as possible
Sense.TRAN: 从严惩罚某人﹔从严起诉某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you get caught they’ll throw the book at you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你被抓住﹐他们决不会轻饶你！

Sense.DEF: to be unkind to someone after they have been kind to you or helped you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt that everything I’d done for them was thrown back in my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到我为他们做的一切都是好心没好报。

Sense.LEXUNIT: throw up your hands (in horror/dismay etc)
Sense.DEF: to do something that shows you think something is not good but feel you cannot do anything to change it
Sense.TRAN: （惊恐/沮丧等地）扬起双手〔表示你认为某事不好﹐却又无可奈何〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ted threw up his hands in disgust. ‘Can’t you make her change her mind?’ he asked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德反感地扬了扬手。“你不能让她改变主意吗？”他问道。

Sense.DEF: to stop trying to do something
to try very hard to attract someone’s attention because you want to have a sexual relationship with them
Sense.TRAN: 勾引某人﹐向某人投怀送抱

Sense.DEF: to try to hit someone with your hand in a fight
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to sort this out before people start throwing punches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要在人们开始动武之前把这件事处理好。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately lose a fight or sports game that you could have won
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was allegedly offered £20,000 to throw the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据称有人给他两万英镑让他故意输掉比赛。

Sense.DEF:
to roll
dice
or to get a particular number by rolling dice
Sense.TRAN: 掷骰子/掷了六点/掷出四点等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to throw a six to start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须掷一个六点才能开始。

Sense.DEF: to make a pot by shaping clay as it turns round on a special wheel
to use a special trick to make your voice seem to be coming from a different place from the place you are standing
Sense.TRAN: 说腹语〔利用特别方法让你的声音听起来像是来自别处〕

Sense.DEF: to ignore the risks and deliberately behave in a way that may cause trouble or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: I threw caution to the winds and followed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不顾一切跟随他。

Sense.LEXUNIT: throw the baby out with the bath water
Sense.DEF: to get rid of good useful parts of a system, organization etc when you are changing it in order to try and make it better
Sense.TRAN: 把婴儿和洗澡水一起倒掉﹐不分良莠一起抛弃

Crossrefto.REFLEX: throw in/cast your lot with sb

Exponent.DEF: to make something such as a ball or stone move quickly through the air using your hand
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I threw the ball back to him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把球扔还给他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Protestors began throwing stones at the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者开始向警察投掷石块。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I just threw the letter in the bin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚把信扔进垃圾桶。

Exponent.DEF: to throw something, especially in a careless way without using much effort
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tossed her coat onto the bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把外套往床上一抛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you chuck me the remote control?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把遥控器扔过来给我好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to throw something with a lot of force
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone hurled a brick through his window.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把砖头砸进他家窗户。

Exponent.DEF: to angrily throw something somewhere with a lot of force, or to carelessly throw something somewhere because you have very little time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He flung her keys into the river.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她的钥匙猛地扔进河里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I flung a few things into a suitcase.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我随手把几样东西扔进手提箱。

Exponent.DEF: to throw something heavy using a lot of effort
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They heaved the log into the river.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把圆木抛进河里。

Exponent.DEF: to throw something high into the air over someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police lobbed tear gas canisters over the heads of the demonstrators.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察向示威者头顶上空抛掷催泪弹。

Section.SECHEADING: to throw a ball in a sport 体育比赛中掷球

Exponent.DEF: to throw the ball to another member of your team
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He passed the ball to Wilkinson, who kicked the ball over the goalposts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把球传给威尔金森﹐威尔金森射高了。

Exponent.DEF: to throw the ball to the batter in a game of baseball
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stoddard pitched for the Chicago White Sox.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯托达德在芝加哥白袜队任投手。

Exponent.DEF: to throw the ball towards the person who is batting in a game of cricket
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Harmison bowled superbly and took 5 wickets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈米森投球相当出色﹐令五名击球手出局。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something that you do not want or need
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never throw clothes away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从不丢弃衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shouldn’t have thrown away the receipt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不应该扔掉那张收据。

Sense.DEF: to spend money in a way that is not sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t afford to throw money away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我浪费不起钱。

Sense.DEF: to waste something good that you have, for example a skill or an opportunity
Sense.EXAMPLE: This could be the best chance you’ll ever have. Don’t throw it away!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这或许是你能得到的最好机会。 别白白错过了！

Sense.DEF: to add something to what you are selling, without increasing the price
Sense.EXAMPLE: We paid $2,000 for the boat, with the trailer and spares thrown in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了2,000美元买那艘船﹐拖车和备用件是附送的。

Sense.DEF: if you throw in a remark, you say it suddenly without thinking carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: She threw in a couple of odd remarks about men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然说了几句关于男人的怪话。

Sense.DEF: to admit that you have been defeated
to take off a piece of clothing in a quick careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: They threw off their clothes and dived in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们匆匆脱掉衣服﹐扎入水中。

Sense.DEF: to get free from something that has been limiting your freedom
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1845, they finally threw off the yoke of foreign rule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1845年﹐他们终于摆脱了外国统治的枷锁。

Sense.DEF: if you throw off an illness, you get better from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s taken me ages to throw off this cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感冒了很长时间才好。

Sense.DEF: to escape from someone or something that is chasing you
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ran flat out for about half a mile before we could throw them off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们拼命跑了大约半英里才把他们甩掉。

Sense.DEF: to produce large amounts of heat or light
Sense.TRAN: 散发出﹐放射出〔大量热或光〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine was throwing off so much heat that the air above it shimmered with haze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机散发出大量热量﹐以致它的上方雾蒙蒙的一片。

Sense.DEF: to put on a piece of clothing quickly and carelessly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I threw on a pair of jeans and a T-shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我套上牛仔裤和T恤衫。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something that you do not want or need
Sense.EXAMPLE: We usually throw out all our old magazines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们通常把所有的旧杂志都扔掉。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place, school, or organization, especially because they have done something that is against the rules
Sense.TRAN: 撵走﹐开除﹐解雇〔尤指违反规章者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick got thrown out of college in the second year for taking drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克在大学二年级时因为吸毒被开除了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew he would never throw us out on the street make us leave our home when we have nowhere else to live .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他决不会把我们赶到大街上去。

Sense.DEF: if people throw out a plan or suggestion, they refuse to accept it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea was thrown out by the committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个想法被委员会否定了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill was thrown out by the Senate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议案被参议院否决了。

Sense.DEF: if something throws out smoke, heat, dust etc, it produces a lot of it and fills the air with it
Sense.TRAN: 散发出〔大量烟雾﹑热量﹑灰尘等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: huge trucks throwing out noxious fumes from their exhausts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排气管喷着有毒废气的大型卡车

Sense.DEF: to end a romantic relationship with someone
Sense.TRAN: 甩掉〔某人﹐指结束恋爱关系〕

Sense.DEF: to make something such as a meal quickly and not very carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s lots of food in the fridge – I’m sure I can throw something together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱里有许多食物——我肯定能做点东西来吃。

Sense.DEF: if a situation throws people together, it makes them meet and know each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the war that had thrown them together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是战争使他们相遇相知。

Sense.DEF: to bring food or drink up from your stomach out through your mouth because you are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Georgia was bent over the basin, throwing up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治娅俯身在脸盆上呕吐。

Sense.DEF: to produce problems, ideas, results etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arrangement may throw up problems in other areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的安排可能会带来其他方面的问题。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle, runner etc throws up dust, water etc as they move along, they make it rise into the air
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆﹑跑步者等经过时〕扬起〔灰尘等〕﹐溅起〔水〕

Sense.DEF: to suddenly leave your job, your home etc
Sense.TRAN: 突然辞去〔工作〕﹔抛弃〔家庭〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t just throw everything up and come and live with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能就这么抛弃一切﹐来和你一同生活。

Sense.DEF: to build something quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: new houses hastily thrown up by developers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发商匆忙盖起来的新房子

Sense.DEF: an action in which someone throws something
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a great throw!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么漂亮的一投！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a throw of over 80 metres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投出八十多米的距离

Sense.DEF:
an action in which someone rolls a
dice
in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your throw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该你掷骰子了。

Sense.DEF: a large piece of cloth that you put loosely over a chair to cover it and make it look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brightly-coloured cotton throw
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩鲜艳的棉椅套

Sense.DEF: something that someone says or writes quickly, without thinking carefully about it
Sense.TRAN: 随口说出的话语﹔随意写下的内容
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was only a throwaway comment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只是随口一说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claims people overreacted to a few throwaway lines in the article.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说人们对文章里的一些无心之言反应过激。

Sense.DEF: throwaway products have been produced cheaply so that you can throw them away after you have used them
Sense.TRAN: 用后即扔的﹐一次性使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a throwaway cigarette lighter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次性打火机

Sense.DEF: used to show disapproval when talking about modern societies in which products are not made to last a long time
Sense.TRAN: 一次性物品充斥的社会〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: something that is similar to something that existed in the past, or belongs to the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her whole outfit was a throwback to the 1970s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的整套衣服透出了回归20世纪70年代的复古风格。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a social event which is a throwback to a different age
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回归到另一个时代的社交活动

Sense.DEF: an action in which someone throws the ball back onto the field in a game of football
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beckham will take the throw-in .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将由贝克汉姆来掷这个边线球。

Sense.DEF:
a small
cushion
that you put on
sofas
and chairs for decoration

Sense.TRAN:
a short form of 缩略式=
through
通过﹔穿过﹔完成

Sense.DEF: to make a low sound like the sound of an engine
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine thrummed into life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎轰轰地发动了起来。

Sense.DEF: a brown bird with spots on its front

an infectious disease that can affect a person’s
vagina
or mouth
Sense.TRAN: 鹅口疮﹐口腔念珠菌病﹔念珠菌性阴道炎

Sense.DEF: to push something somewhere roughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She thrust a letter into my hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把一封信往我手里一塞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thrust me roughly towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他粗暴地把我推到门口。

Sense.DEF: to make a sudden movement forward with a sword or knife

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He skipped aside as his opponent thrust at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对手向他刺来﹐他闪身向旁边一躲。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to think about something
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某事〕抛在一边﹔拒绝考虑〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our complaints were thrust aside and ignored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的投诉被扔在一边没人理睬。

Sense.DEF: if something is thrust upon you, you are forced to accept it even if you do not want it
Sense.TRAN: 把…强加于﹐强迫…接受﹐强人所难
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never enjoyed the fame that was thrust upon her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来都不喜欢强加于她身上的名声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had marriage thrust upon him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被迫结婚。

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: He jumped back to avoid another thrust of the knife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他往后一闪﹐躲避再次捅来的一刀。

Sense.DEF: the main meaning or aim of what someone is saying or doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the main thrust of the government’s education policy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府教育政策的宗旨

Sense.DEF: the force of an engine that makes a car, train, or plane move forward
Sense.TRAN: 〔发动机推进汽车﹑火车﹑飞机的〕推力﹐推进力

Sense.DEF: a small engine on a spacecraft that controls its height and direction by pushing out gas
a wide road for fast traffic that you pay to use
the low sound made by a heavy object hitting something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔重物碰击其他东西时发出的〕砰的一声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a dull thud as the box hit the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 箱子撞到地上﹐发出一声闷响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His head hit the floor with a sickening thud .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头撞在地上﹐发出一声让人心惊的闷响。

Sense.DEF: to hit something with a low sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stone thudded to the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石头砰的一声砸到地上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: waves thudding against the side of the ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍击船舷的波浪

Sense.DEF: to walk or run with your feet making a heavy sound as they touch the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: A horse thudded over the frozen grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹马在冰冻的草地上地跑。

Sense.DEF: if your heart thuds, it beats strongly because you are excited or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔心脏由于激动或恐惧而〕怦怦地跳
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter was aware of his heart thudding in his chest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得感觉自己的心脏在胸口怦怦直跳。

Sense.DEF: a violent man
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was beaten up by a gang of young thugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遭到一群小混混的痛打。

Sense.DEF: violent behaviour in which people fight and attack others
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of football thuggery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球暴力的问题

Sense.DEF: thuggish behaviour is violent behaviour in which people fight and attack others
the part of your hand that is shaped like a thick short finger and helps you to hold things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby sucking its thumb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吮着大拇指的婴儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: She held the coin carefully between finger and thumb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心翼翼地把那枚硬币捏在食指和拇指之间。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a
glove
that fits over your thumb
to be unable to do something in which you have to make small careful movements with your fingers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you do up these buttons for me? I seem to be all thumbs today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮我扣上这些纽扣好吗？今天我感觉自己笨手笨脚的。

Sense.DEF: when an idea or plan is officially accepted or not accepted
Sense.TRAN: 正式接受/拒绝〔观点或计划〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project was finally given the thumbs up .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目终于获得批准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her performance got the thumbs down from the critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的表演受到了评论家的批评。

Sense.DEF: to be so strongly influenced by someone that they control you completely
Sense.TRAN: 完全在某人的控制之下﹔在某人的巨大影响下
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was still under his father’s thumb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍受制于他的父亲。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: stand/stick out like a sore thumb

Sense.DEF: to persuade a driver of a passing car to stop and take you somewhere, by putting your hand out with your thumb raised
Sense.TRAN: 伸出拇指请求搭车﹐伸出拇指拦车
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thumbed a lift into town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拦顺路车进了城。

Sense.DEF: to show that you do not respect rules, laws etc or you do not care what someone thinks of you
Sense.TRAN: 蔑视〔规则﹑法律等〕﹔不在乎〔别人对自己的看法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to thumb his nose at the college authorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑战学院领导的机会

Sense.DEF: to look through a book, magazine etc quickly
Sense.TRAN: 匆匆翻阅﹐浏览〔图书﹑杂志等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I began thumbing through the pages of a gardening catalogue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我随便翻起一本园艺目录册。

Sense.DEF: a line of round cuts in the edge of a large book which have the letters of the alphabet on them and help you find the part of the book you want
Sense.TRAN: 拇指索引﹐书边挖月索引

Sense.DEF: a short description that gives only the main facts about a person, thing, or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thumbnail sketch of recent political events in America
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对美国最近政治事件的简略描述

Sense.DEF: the nail on your thumb
a small picture of a document on a computer screen, showing you what it will look like when you print it
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上显示的〕缩略图
Sense.EXAMPLE: Click on the thumbnails to view a larger version of each image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点击缩略图﹐可以看到每个图像的大图。

Sense.DEF: an object that was used in the past to punish people by crushing their thumbs
Sense.TRAN: 拇指夹〔旧时的一种刑具〕

Sense.DEF: a short pin with a flat top that is used for fixing notices on walls
to hit someone very hard with your hand closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t shut up, I’m going to thump you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是不住嘴﹐我就揍你！
Sense.EXAMPLE: She thumped the table with her fist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挥拳砸在桌子上。

Sense.DEF: to hit against something loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: His feet thumped loudly on the bare boards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脚踏在光光的地板上咚咚作响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thumped his cup down on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把茶杯重重地放在桌子上。

Sense.DEF: to walk or run with your feet making a loud heavy sound as they touch the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stella came thumping down the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉噔噔噔地跑下楼梯。

Sense.DEF: if your heart thumps, it beats very strongly and quickly because you are frightened or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔心脏因恐惧或激动〕怦怦地跳
Sense.EXAMPLE: My heart was thumping inside my chest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的心在胸口怦怦地跳。

Sense.DEF: the dull sound that is made when something hits a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The box fell to the floor with a thump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盒子砰的一声掉到了地板上。

Sense.DEF: an action in which you hit someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he does that again, I’ll give him a good thump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他再这么干﹐我就狠狠地揍他一顿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thump on the jaw
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打在下巴上的一记重击

Sense.DEF: very big or great
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mulroney swept to power with a thumping majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔罗尼以压倒性的多数票轻松掌权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He told us some thumping great lies!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我们撒了弥天大谎！

Sense.DEF: thumping music has a strong loud beat
a very bad headache
the loud noise that you hear during a storm, usually after a flash of lightning
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were woken in the night by thunder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上我们被雷声惊醒。

Sense.DEF: a loud deep noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: She heard the thunder of hooves behind her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到身后隆隆的马蹄声。

Sense.DEF: if someone has a face like thunder, they look very angry
if it thunders, there is a loud noise in the sky, usually after a flash of lightning
to run or move along quickly, in a way that makes a very loud noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children came thundering downstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们噔噔噔地走下楼梯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Huge lorries thundered past us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大卡车轰隆隆地从我们身边开过。

Sense.DEF: to make a very loud deep noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guns roared and thundered all around us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们四周炮声隆隆。

Sense.DEF: to shout loudly and angrily
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You must be mad!’ he thundered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你一定是疯了！”他怒吼道。

Sense.DEF:
a flash of
lightning
which hits a person or thing and kills or destroys them
Sense.TRAN: 〔击中某人或某物的〕雷电﹐霹雳

Sense.DEF: a sudden event or piece of news that shocks you
Sense.TRAN: 晴天霹雳般的事件﹔令人震惊的消息
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea hit her like a thunderbolt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法让她大吃一惊。

Sense.DEF: a single loud noise of thunder
Sense.EXAMPLE: A thunderclap exploded above us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声霹雳在我们头顶炸响。

Sense.DEF: a large dark cloud that you see before or during a storm
extremely loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech was greeted with thunderous applause .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演讲赢得雷鸣般的掌声。

Sense.DEF: looking or sounding very angry
Sense.TRAN: 面色阴沉的﹔怒气冲冲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thunderous voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怒气冲冲的声音

Sense.DEF: a storm with thunder and lightning
extremely surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 极其震惊的﹐惊得目瞪口呆的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeff looked thunderstruck when he saw me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫见到我时惊得目瞪口呆。

Sense.DEF: thundery weather is the type of weather that comes before a thunderstorm
the day between Wednesday and Friday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went to Edinburgh on Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期四去了爱丁堡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was working Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她星期四在工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a meeting on Thursday night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期四晚上有一个会议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was arrested last Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上星期四被捕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark and I are driving south this Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期四我和马克要开车南下。

GramExa.GLOSS: Thursday of next week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you next Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我下星期四来看你。

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the Thursdays in the year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Christmas Day is on a Thursday this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的圣诞节在星期四。

Sense.DEF: as a result of something that you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the evidence was destroyed in the fire. Thus it would be almost impossible to prove him guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数证据已在大火中烧毁﹐因而要证明他有罪几乎是不可能的。

Sense.DEF: in this manner or way
Sense.EXAMPLE: They diluted the drug, thus reducing its effectiveness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把药稀释﹐这样就减轻了它的药效。

Sense.DEF: until now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her political career thus far had remained unblemished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的政治生涯迄今为止仍是清白的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Thus is formal or literary. In everyday English, people usually say so .
F2NBox.TRAN: thus语气正式﹐带文学色彩。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说so
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: So it was decided that he should be chairman.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是就决定由他来当主席。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We haven’t had any problems so far .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止我们没有任何问题。

Sense.DEF: a short loud sound like something hitting a hard surface
to prevent someone from doing what they are trying to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fierce opposition thwarted the government’s plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激烈的反对阻碍了政府计划的实施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: thwarted ambition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未酬的壮志

Sense.TRAN:
a written abbreviation of 书面缩写=‘thanks’, used in email or
text messages
on
mobile phones
谢谢〔电子邮件或手机短信用语〕

Sense.DEF: your
Sense.EXAMPLE: We praise thy name, O Lord.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主啊﹐我们赞美你的名。

Sense.DEF: a plant used for giving food a special taste
an organ in your neck that produces substances that affect the way your body grows and the way you behave
yourself

the seventh note in a musical
scale
according to the
sol-fa
system

a piece of jewellery like a small
crown
, that a woman sometimes wears on very formal or important occasions
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子在正式场合佩戴的〕冕状宝石头饰
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diamond tiara
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钻石冠饰

Sense.DEF: a bone in the front of your leg
a sudden movement of a muscle in your face, that you cannot control
a mark (√) written next to an answer, something on a list etc, to show that it is correct or has been dealt with
Sense.TRAN: 〔在答案旁边或名单上标明正确或已经处理的〕钩号〔√〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put a tick in the box if you agree with this statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你同意这种说法﹐就在方框内打一个钩。

Sense.DEF: a very small animal like an insect that lives under the skin of other animals and sucks their blood
the short repeated sound that a clock or watch makes every second
a very short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be with you in a tick soon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上就来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll only take two ticks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要一会儿。

Sense.DEF: if you buy something on tick, you arrange to take it now and pay later
if a clock or watch ticks, it makes a short repeated sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old clock ticked noisily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只古老的钟大声地嘀嗒着。

Sense.DEF: to mark a test, list of questions etc with a tick, in order to show that something is correct, to choose something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tick the description that best fits you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给最符合你的描述打钩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just tick the box on your order form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在你订单的方框内打钩。

Sense.DEF: the thoughts, feelings, opinions etc that give someone their character or make them behave in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 形成某人性格[影响某人行为]的思想[情感﹐见解]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never really understood what makes her tick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直没搞清楚她为何会是这样一个人。

Sense.DEF: if something ticks all the right boxes, it does everything that you wanted it to do or is everything you wanted it to be
Sense.TRAN: 事情发展如人所愿﹐一切顺利

Sense.DEF: if time ticks away, by, or past, it passes, especially when you are waiting for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指等待某事发生时〕时光在流逝﹐时间一点一点地过去
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need a decision – time’s ticking away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要作出决定——时间正在一分一秒地过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minutes ticked past and still she didn’t call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间一分一秒地过去﹐她仍未打电话来。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone angrily that you are annoyed with them or disapprove of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Watts will tick you off if you’re late again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你再迟到﹐沃茨太太要骂你了。

Sense.DEF: to mark the things on a list with a tick to show that they have been dealt with, chosen etc
Sense.TRAN: 给…打钩号〔表明已作处理﹑选择等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As you finish each task, tick it off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每完成一项任务﹐就打一个钩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you ticked off Kate’s name on the list?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在名单里凯特的名字上打钩了吗？

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her attitude is really ticking me off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的态度真让我光火。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone a list of things, especially when you touch a different finger as you say each thing on the list
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carville began ticking off points on his fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡维尔开始扳着手指一一列举。

Sense.DEF: if an engine ticks over, it works while the vehicle is not moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark left the engine ticking over and went back inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克让引擎空转着﹐又回到了屋里。

Sense.DEF: if a system, business etc ticks over, it continues working but without producing very much or without much happening
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一系统﹑公司等〕进展迟滞地缓慢运作
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is just about ticking over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司勉强经营着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane will keep things ticking over while I’m away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不在的时候将由简来维持。

Sense.DEF: a small square space on a document or computer screen where you can put a mark to choose something
angry or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark’s ticked off with me for some reason.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克不知为何对我很生气。

Sense.DEF: your heart

a special machine that prints or shows the price of company
stocks
as they go up and down
Sense.TRAN: 〔股票行情〕自动收录机﹐电子显示器

Sense.DEF:
long narrow paper on which infor-mation, for example the price of company
stocks
, is printed by a special machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔一种供专门机器打印信息用的窄长条〕纸带

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone important or famous walks or drives through an American city and pieces of paper are thrown from high buildings to welcome them
Sense.TRAN: 盛大欢迎〔指某位要人或名人在美国某城市经过时﹐人们从高楼上撒纸片的欢迎仪式〕

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 电影院/公共汽车/火车等
Sense.DEF: a printed piece of paper which shows that you have paid to enter a cinema, travel on a bus, plane etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much are tickets for the concert?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会的票价是多少？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like two tickets to Berlin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想买两张去柏林的票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a ticket to watch the US Open
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张观看美国公开赛的票

Sense.DEF: a printed piece of paper with a number on it that you buy because you will get a prize if that number is chosen
a printed note ordering you to pay money because you have done something illegal while driving or parking your car

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 违法停车/超速行驶罚 款单

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper fastened to something in a shop that shows its price, size etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店里货物的〕标签﹐价格标签
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much does it say on the price ticket ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价签上标明的价格是多少？

Sense.DEF: a list of the people supported by a particular political party in an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran for governor on the Republican ticket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他作为共和党的候选人竞选州长。

Sense.DEF: a way of becoming successful, famous etc
Sense.TRAN: 成功/出名/成为明星等的手段
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael thought an MBA would be a ticket to success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔认为工商管理硕士学位是走向成功的敲门砖。

Sense.DEF: to be exactly what is needed

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 火车票/公共汽车票/长途汽车票
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve lost my train ticket.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的火车票丢了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a ticket to a place but not back again
a ticket to a place and back
one that allows you to make a journey or go to a sports stadium, theatre etc as often as you like during a fixed time period
one that is legally or officially acceptable

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We booked our tickets well in advance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提前很长时间订好了票。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a place where you can buy tickets
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 售票处/售票亭/售票柜台
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a long queue at the ticket office.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 售票处前排了很长的队。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a gate or other barrier at a station that you need a ticket to get through
a company that sells tickets for concerts, sporting events, etc

Sense.DEF: to produce and sell tickets for an event, journey etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: air travel sold and ticketed in the UK
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国销售和出票的航空旅行业务
Sense.EXAMPLE: ticketed events such as concerts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像音乐会之类售票的活动

Sense.DEF: to give someone a ticket for parking their car in the wrong place, driving too fast etc
Sense.TRAN: 给〔违法停车﹑超速驾驶等的人〕开罚单
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drivers stopping here will be ticketed and have their cars towed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在此停车者将被罚款﹐车还要被拖走。

Sense.DEF: to be intended for a particular use, purpose, job etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某种用途﹑目的﹑工作等〕被指定﹐被指派
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three of the army bases have been ticketed for closure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三个军事基地已被指定关闭。

Sense.DEF: the process or system of selling or printing tickets for planes, trains, concerts etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most airlines are using electronic ticketing now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数航空公司现在都采用电子售票形式。

Sense.DEF: someone who sells tickets outside a theatre or sports ground at a high price because there are not many available

a thick strong cotton cloth used for making
mattress
and
pillow
covers
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于制作床垫套或枕套的〕结实厚棉布

Sense.DEF: to tell someone angrily that you are annoyed with them or disapprove of something they have done
to move your fingers gently over someone’s body in order to make them laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop tickling me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别挠我痒痒！

Sense.DEF: if something touching your body tickles you, it makes you want to rub your body because it is slightly uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mommy, this blanket tickles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐这毛毯扎人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mazie’s fur collar was tickling her neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马齐耶的毛领子扎得她脖子痒痒的。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, remark etc tickles you, it amuses or pleases you

GramExa.GLOSS: be very pleased or amused
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids were tickled pink to see you on TV!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到你上电视﹐孩子们都好开心啊！

Sense.DEF: if something tickles your fancy, you want to have it or to try doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I see something that tickles my fancy, I’m going to buy it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是看到什么我感兴趣的东西﹐我就会买。

Sense.DEF: a feeling in your throat that makes you want to cough
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a tickle in my throat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的喉咙发痒。

Sense.DEF: to move your fingers gently over someone’s body in order to make them laugh
someone who is ticklish laughs a lot when you tickle them
a ticklish situation or problem is difficult and must be dealt with carefully, especially because you may upset people
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况或问题〕需小心应对的﹐棘手的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Handling awkward neighbours can be a ticklish business .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和难处的邻居打交道有时是件十分棘手的事情。

Sense.DEF: a ticklish cough is in your throat rather than in your chest
the regular sound that a large clock makes every second
ticky-tacky houses, buildings etc are made of material that is cheap and of low quality
a children’s game in which two players draw X’s or O’s in a pattern of nine squares, trying to get three in a row
Sense.TRAN: 圈叉游戏〔两人轮流在井字格中画X或O﹐首先将三个X或O连成一线者获胜〕

Sense.DEF: relating to the regular rising and falling of the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: tidal currents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潮流

Sense.DEF: a very large ocean wave that flows over the land and destroys things
a very large amount of a particular kind of feeling or activity happening at one time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tidal wave of crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一波犯罪高潮
