GramExa.EXAMPLE: Voters were swept away on a tidal wave of enthusiasm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民热情高涨。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of food that tastes good
a small but interesting piece of information, news etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: juicy tidbits of hot news
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有趣的热门花边新闻

Sense.DEF: a very small fish
slightly drunk
very small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiddly little insect
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只很小的昆虫

Sense.DEF: a children’s game in which you try to make small round pieces of plastic jump into a cup by pressing their edge with a larger piece
Sense.TRAN: 弹塑料片游戏〔用大塑料圆片压小塑料圆片﹐使其弹入杯中的儿童游戏〕

Sense.DEF: the regular rising and falling of the level of the sea

GramExa.GLOSS: the sea is at a high/low level

Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the tide going out or coming in ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是退潮还是涨潮？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went for a walk and got cut off by the tide .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去散步﹐结果被潮水困住了。

Sense.DEF: a current of water caused by the tide
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strong tides make swimming dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇上大潮时游泳很危险。

Sense.DEF: the way in which events or people’s opinions are developing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With the tide of public opinion against him, the president may lose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于公众舆论的反对﹐总统可能会落败。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was their first major victory. The tide had turned changed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他们的首次重大胜利﹐形势已逆转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tide of battle turned against the Mexican army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的形势变得对墨西哥军队不利。

GramExa.GLOSS: support or oppose what most people think

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something that is increasing and is difficult to control

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crisis prompted a rising tide of protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 危机引起抗议浪潮不断高涨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She swallowed back a tide of emotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她强忍住了自己的激动情绪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to stem the tide of hysteria caused by the shootings prevent it from getting worse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扼制枪击事件造成的恐慌情绪蔓延的努力

Sense.DEF: a large number of people or things moving along together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the tide of refugees flowing over the border
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 涌过边界的难民潮

Sense.DEF: a particular time of the year or day
Sense.TRAN: 圣诞节期间/晚间/早晨时光等

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the sea covers the shore
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can’t walk on the beach when the tide is in.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 涨潮时不能在沙滩上行走。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the sea comes nearer
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Once the tide comes in, the cove is cut off.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦涨潮﹐那个小海湾就被隔绝了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: starts coming in or going out

Collocate.COLLOC: be cut off by the tide
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become trapped as the sea rises

Sense.DEF: to help someone through a difficult period, especially by lending them money
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指借给某人钱〕帮助…渡过难关
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you lend me £10 to tide me over till next week?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能借我10英镑救个急吗？我下周还你。

Sense.DEF: a mark left on the beach by the sea, that shows how high the sea reached
Sense.TRAN: 〔潮水在海岸上留下的最高〕潮痕

Sense.DEF: a dirty mark left around the inside of a bath by the water
a small area of water left among rocks by the sea when the tide goes out
Sense.TRAN: 〔潮水退走后在礁石间留下的〕潮水潭

Sense.DEF: water that flows onto the land or into rivers when the tide rises
Sense.TRAN: 〔涨潮时涌到陆地上或河流里的〕潮水

Sense.DEF: an area of land at or near the coast
news

GramExa.GLOSS: good news

Sense.DEF: a room, house, desk etc that is tidy is neatly arranged with everything in the right place
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑房子﹑书桌等〕整洁的﹐整齐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tidy desk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整洁的书桌
Sense.EXAMPLE: I try to keep the garden tidy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量保持花园整洁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellen’s room is always neat and tidy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦的房间总是非常整洁。

Sense.DEF: someone who is tidy keeps their house, clothes etc neat and clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris is a naturally tidy person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯天生是个爱整洁的人。

Sense.DEF: a large amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sold the house for a tidy sum and moved south.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把房子卖了一大笔钱﹐然后移居到南方。

Sense.DEF: if someone has a tidy mind, the way they think is very organized and clear

Exponent.DEF: a place, room etc that is tidy looks nice because everything has been arranged and put in the right place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tidy desk
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整洁的桌子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I want to leave the place clean and tidy before we go.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想在我们走之前把这里收拾干净。

Exponent.DEF: use this about things that are carefully arranged in a way that is nice to look at
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a neat pile of towels
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整整齐齐的一叠毛巾
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The room was neat and tidy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个房间很整洁。

Exponent.DEF: a place or thing that is immaculate is perfectly clean and neat – use this to emphasize how clean something looks
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our house was always immaculate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家一直都是一尘不染。

Exponent.DEF: a well-kept building or garden is very well cared for and looks neat and clean
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a large house on well-kept grounds
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 庭院得到精心打理的大房子

Exponent.DEF: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The room was orderly and uncluttered.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间收拾得很整洁﹐没有杂物。

PIC.HEADING: TIDY 整洁
PIC.PICCONTENT: a tidy room 整洁的房间；a cluttered room 杂乱的房间

Sense.DEF: to make a place look tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tidy your room!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的房间收拾一下！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we tidied up the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该收拾收拾办公室了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of tidying up after you boys tidying somewhere that someone else has made untidy .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟在你们这些男孩后面收拾已经烦透了。

Sense.DEF: to put something back in the place where it should be, especially in a cupboard, drawer etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s tidy these toys away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把这些玩具收拾起来吧。

Sense.DEF: a container for putting small objects in, used to keep your desk, car etc tidy
Sense.TRAN: 桌面收纳盒/汽车杂物袋/洗涤槽杂物容器

Subsense.DEF: to fasten things together or hold them in a particular position using a piece of string, rope etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tie this label to your suitcase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这个标签系在手提箱上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They tied him to a tree and beat him up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把他绑在树上狠狠地打。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I kept all his letters tied together with a ribbon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用丝带把他所有的信捆扎在一 起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of them tied her hands behind her back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们中的一人把她的手反绑起来。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I tie my hair back when I’m jogging.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我慢跑时把头发扎在脑后。

Subsense.DEF: to fasten something around, over etc something else and tie the ends together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had only a towel tied around his waist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只在腰间系了一条浴巾。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tied a scarf over her head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用围巾包着头。

Subsense.DEF: to make a knot in a piece of string, rope etc, for example to fasten shoes or other clothes
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you tie your shoelaces by yourself?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会自己系鞋带吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pulled the ribbon tightly and tied a bow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把丝带抽紧﹐打了一个蝴蝶结。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: This dress ties at the back.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件连衣裙在后面系扣。

Sense.DEF: if two players, teams etc tie or are tied in a game or competition, they finish it with an equal number of points
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛或竞赛中双方〕得分相同﹐打成平局

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the end of the season, we were tied with the Tigers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛季结束时﹐我们与老虎队得分相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Woosnam and Lyle tied for fourth place on 264.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伍斯纳姆和莱尔并列第四﹐总杆数都是264。

Sense.DEF: to be related to something and dependent on it
Sense.TRAN: 和某物联系在一起﹔依附于某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flat is tied to the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套公寓是为这个职位配的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest rates are tied to the rate of inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率和通货膨胀率紧密联系在一起。

Sense.DEF: to be restricted by a particular situation, job etc, so that you cannot do exactly what you want
Sense.TRAN: 被某事物束缚[约束﹐限制]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women felt tied to the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多妇女觉得自己被束缚在家里了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to be tied to commuting to London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想受约束天天乘车到伦敦去上班。

Sense.EXAMPLE: With children, you’re tied by school holidays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有孩子﹐你就会被学校的假期牵住。

Sense.DEF: to get married
to become very upset because you are confused, nervous, or worried
to get drunk
to restrict someone’s freedom to do what they want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t want to be tied down by a full-time job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想被全职工作束缚住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you ready to be tied down to a wife and children?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备好受妻子儿女的牵绊了吗？

Sense.DEF: to be similar to another idea, statement etc, so that they seem to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her description tied in with that of the other witness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的描述和另一位目击者的描述一致。

Sense.DEF: to be related in some way to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: How does all this tie in with their long-term aims?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这和他们的长期目标有什么联系？

Sense.DEF: to happen at the same time as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book was published to tie in with the TV series.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书和电视剧同步发行。

Sense.DEF: to tie someone’s arms, legs etc so that they cannot move
Sense.EXAMPLE: The intruders tied Kurt up and left him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闯入者把库尔特捆绑起来﹐然后丢下他走了。

Sense.DEF: to fasten something together, using string, rope etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tied up all the old newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把所有旧报纸都捆扎起来。

Sense.DEF: to be very busy, so that you cannot do anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t see you tomorrow – I’ll be tied up all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天没法见你——我整天都会忙得脱不开身。

Sense.DEF: to block a system or use it so much that other people cannot use it or it does not work effectively
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t tie up the phone lines making personal calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要一直占着电话线打私人电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Protesters tied up the traffic for three hours today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天抗议者使交通堵塞了三个小时。

Sense.DEF: if your money is tied up in something, it is all being used for that thing and is not available for anything else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My money’s all tied up in the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钱全部套在房子上了。

Sense.DEF: to finish arranging all the details of something such as an agreement or a plan
Sense.TRAN: 订妥〔协议或计划〕﹔安排好某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better tie up the details with a solicitor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好找个律师把细节商量妥当。

Sense.DEF: to be very closely related to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shortage of teachers is tied up with the issue of pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 师资紧缺和工资问题有密切联系。

Sense.DEF: to do the things that are necessary in order to finish a piece of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to tie up a few loose ends before I go on vacation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去度假前要把一些事情了结掉。

Sense.DEF: to tie an animal to something with a rope, chain etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She left the dog tied up to a tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就把狗拴在树上。

Sense.DEF: to tie a boat to something with a rope, chain etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tied up alongside a barge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把船系泊在一艘驳船旁边。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a boat tied up at the jetty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 码头上泊着一艘小船。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of cloth tied in a knot around the neck, worn by men
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wear a shirt and tie at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上班穿衬衫打领带。

Sense.DEF: a strong relationship between people, groups, or countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑团体或国家之间的〕关系﹐联系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the importance of strong family ties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭关系密切的重要性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: close ties between the two countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间的密切关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Japan’s strong economic ties with the US
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本和美国之间牢固的经济关系

Sense.DEF: the result of a game, competition, or election when two or more people or teams get the same number of points, votes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛﹑竞赛或选举中〕分数相同﹐票数相同﹐平局﹐平手
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match ended in a tie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛以平局告终。

Sense.DEF: a piece of string, wire etc used to fasten or close something such as a bag
one game, especially of football, that is part of a larger competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: England’s World Cup tie against Argentina
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰对阿根廷的一场世界杯淘汰赛

Sense.DEF: something that means you must stay in one place, job etc or prevents you from being free to do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you enjoy travelling, young children can be a tie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你喜欢旅游﹐小孩子可能会是个拖累。

Sense.DEF: a heavy piece of wood or metal supporting a railway track

an extra question in a game or
quiz
, used to decide who will win when two people have the same number of points

the final game of a
set
in tennis, played when each player has won six games
a house that a farm worker rents from a farmer while he is working on that farm
Sense.TRAN: 〔农场工人受雇于农场期间从农场主那儿租住的〕契约屋﹐雇工农舍

Sense.DEF:
a
pub
that can only sell the beer made by a particular company
Sense.TRAN: 〔只出售某公司所产啤酒的〕特约经销酒馆

Sense.DEF:
to make a pattern on a piece of material by tying string around it and colouring it with
dye coloured liquid
Sense.TRAN: 扎染〔把布料捆扎后再用染料染色〕

Sense.DEF: a product such as a record, book, or toy that is related to a new film, TV show etc
Sense.TRAN: 周边产品﹐衍生产品〔指与一部新电影﹑电视剧等有关的唱片﹑图书或玩具之类的产品〕

Sense.DEF:
a thing used for keeping a man’s
tie
fastened to his shirt or as a decoration
one of several levels or layers that rise up one above the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lower tier has 10,000 seats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下面一层有一万个座位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Terraces of olive trees rose in tiers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排排的橄榄树像阶梯一般级级上升。

GramExa.GLOSS: having two, three etc levels or layers
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a three-tiered wedding cake
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三层的婚礼蛋糕

Sense.DEF: one of several levels in an organization or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the most senior tier of management
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高管理层

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The second tier of the programme is in-house training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划的第二层级是公司内部培训。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-tier system of government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二级制政府管理体系

Sense.DEF: an agreement to become business partners

GramExa.EXAMPLE: IBM’s tie-up with Auspex System Inc
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: IBM与Auspex系统公司的联营

Sense.DEF: a strong connection between two or more things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the tie-up between class interests and politics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阶级利益与政治之间的关系

Sense.DEF: a situation in which traffic is prevented from moving or there is a problem which prevents a system or plan from working
Sense.TRAN: 〔交通的〕阻塞﹔〔系统或计划的〕停顿﹐停滞不前

Sense.DEF: a slight argument between friends or people who are in love
Sense.TRAN: 〔朋友或情侣之间的〕口角﹐吵嘴

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dave’s had a tiff with his girlfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫同女友吵嘴了。

Sense.DEF: a large wild animal that has yellow and black lines on its body and is a member of the cat family
tight clothes fit your body very closely, especially in a way that is uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: tight jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧身牛仔裤
Sense.EXAMPLE: My shoes were so tight that I could hardly walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鞋子很紧﹐我几乎不能走路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jacket is rather a tight fit it fits too tightly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件夹克衫太紧了。

Sense.DEF: string, wire, cloth etc that is tight has been pulled or stretched firmly so that it is straight or cannot move
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bandage must be tight enough to stop the bleeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绷带必须缠紧才能止血。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tied the rope around the post and pulled it tight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把绳子绑在柱子上﹐然后拉紧。

Sense.DEF: a screw, lid etc that is tight is firmly attached and difficult to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check that the screws are tight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查看一下螺丝钉是否拧紧了。

Sense.DEF: if you keep or have a tight hold on something, you hold it firmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother kept a tight hold on his hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲紧紧抓住他的手。

Sense.DEF: controlling something very strictly or firmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is keeping tight control on immigration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对移民控制得非常严格。

GramExa.PROPFORM: keep a tight grip/hold/rein on sth
GramExa.GLOSS: control it very firmly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The former dictator still keeps a tight grip on power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前任独裁者仍然牢牢控制着政权。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anna was determined to keep a tight hold on her feelings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜决意牢牢地控制住自己的情感。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Security is always tight for the opening day of parliament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会开幕这天安保措施总是非常严密。

GramExa.GLOSS: manage a company, organization etc strictly and effectively

Sense.DEF: if money is tight, you do not have enough of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Money was tight and he needed a job badly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手头很紧﹐他急需一份工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: As you know, I run the magazine on a pretty tight budget .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也知道﹐我做这份杂志预算很紧。

Sense.DEF: if time is tight, it is difficult for you to do everything you need to do in the time available
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time is tight, and she has another meeting to go to this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间很紧﹐她今天下午还有一个会议要参加。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should arrive on time, but it’ll be tight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该能按时到达﹐但时间很紧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As usual, his schedule on Saturday was tight he had arranged to do several things in a short time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和往常一样﹐他周六的日程排得很紧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m working to a very tight deadline I have to finish a piece of work very quickly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在赶一项期限很紧的工作。

Sense.DEF: if space is tight, there is only just enough space to fit something into a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Six in the car will be a tight squeeze.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六个人坐一辆车会很挤。

Sense.DEF: not generous, or trying hard to avoid spending money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so tight!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要这么小气！

Sense.DEF: placed or standing closely together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The animal’s body was curled up in a tight little ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个动物的身体紧紧地缩成一小团。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore her hair in a tight bun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把头发紧紧地盘成一个髻。

Sense.DEF: a tight group of people, countries etc have a close relationship with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔人与人﹑国家与国家等之间〕关系密切的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Together, the young film-makers formed a tight group.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年轻的电影制作人一起组成了一个关系密切的团体。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tight bonds that had grown between them
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间慢慢形成的紧密关系

Sense.DEF: a tight bend or turn is very curved and turns quickly in another direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Danny lost control on a tight bend, and the car ran off the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼急转弯时失去了控制﹐车冲出了路面。

Sense.DEF: if your chest, stomach, or throat feels tight, it feels painful and uncomfortable, because you are ill or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before she went on stage her chest felt tight and her throat hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上台前胸口发闷﹐喉咙疼痛。

Sense.DEF: a tight expression, smile, or voice shows that you are annoyed or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Look, I’m sorry…,’ she said, forcing a tight smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “噢﹐我很抱歉……”她说道﹐勉强挤出一丝生硬的笑容。

Sense.DEF: in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a good man to have around if ever you’re in a tight corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你遇到困难﹐有他在身边会很有帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did something go wrong?’ ‘Let’s just say I got into a bit of a tight spot.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么不对劲的吗？”“我只能说﹐我遇到了一点小麻烦。”

Sense.DEF: playing a piece of music or giving a performance very exactly and well, without any pauses or mistakes
Sense.TRAN: 准确的﹐紧凑的﹐一气呵成的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band gave a really tight performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队的表演一气呵成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tight, well-rehearsed production
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一气呵成﹑排练充分的演出

Sense.DEF: a tight game, competition etc is one in which the teams, players etc play equally well, and it is not easy to win
Sense.TRAN: 紧张激烈的﹔不相上下的﹐势均力敌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opening quarter of the game was very tight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开场的一节比赛十分紧张激烈。

Sense.DEF: drunk

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Marie held the baby tightly in her arms.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽把婴儿紧紧地抱在怀中。

Sense.DEF: very firmly or closely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold tight to the handrail!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抓紧扶手！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept my eyes tight shut .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我双眼紧闭。

Sense.DEF: to close or fasten something firmly by turning it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tighten the screws firmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把螺丝拧紧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d put the new tyre on, but I hadn’t tightened up the wheel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把新轮胎装上了﹐但没有上紧轮子。

Sense.DEF: if you tighten a rope, wire etc, or if it tightens, it is stretched or pulled so that it becomes tight
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you tighten guitar strings, the note gets higher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把吉他的弦紧一紧﹐音就会变高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rope tightened around his body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身上的绳子绷紧了。

Sense.DEF: to become stiff or make a part of your body become stiff
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔身体的某一部分〕变得僵硬﹐变得僵直
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mouth tightened into a thin, angry line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的嘴抿成了一条细线﹐一副生气的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tighten up the muscles of both arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绷紧两臂肌肉。

Subsense.DEF: to control a place or situation more strictly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Rebel forces have tightened their hold on the capital.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军加强了对首都的控制。

Subsense.DEF: to hold someone or something more firmly
Subsense.TRAN: 更紧地抓住〔某人或某物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sarah tightened her grip on my arm.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉把我的手臂抓得更紧了。

Sense.DEF: to make a rule, law, or system more strict
Sense.TRAN: 加紧﹐加强〔规则﹑法律或制度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Efforts to tighten the rules have failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格规章制度的努力失败了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a range of measures to tighten up on illegal share dealing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列严格控制非法股票交易的措施

Sense.DEF: to try to spend less money than you used to
Sense.TRAN: 勒紧裤带﹐设法更节俭地过日子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Businesses were tightening their belts and cutting jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业都在勒紧裤带﹐削减工作岗位。

Sense.DEF: to try to force someone to do something, by threatening them or making things difficult for them - used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 胁迫﹐威逼（某人）﹔（对某人）采取更为严厉的措施〔用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Closing the border would tighten the screws on the terrorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 封锁边境将使恐怖分子受到更为严厉的打击。

Sense.DEF: if a race or competition tightens, the distance between the competitors becomes smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: He expects the presidential race to tighten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他预计总统角逐还会更激烈。

Sense.DEF: if a team or group tightens up, they start working together more effectively

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have tightened up the defence and are winning matches as a result.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们加强了防守﹐因此目前一直处于领先。

Sense.DEF: not generous with money
fitting very closely or tightly
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服〕紧身的﹐贴身的﹔〔盖子〕严密的﹐严实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tight-fitting skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条紧身裙

Sense.DEF: a tight-knit group of people are closely connected with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tight-knit island community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个紧密团结的岛上社区

Sense.DEF: unwilling to talk about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Diplomats are remaining tight-lipped about the negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交官们对谈判的情况仍然闭口不谈。

Sense.DEF: with your lips tightly pressed together because you are angry

a rope or wire high above the ground that someone walks along in a
circus
to be in a difficult situation in which something bad could happen if you make a mistake
Sense.TRAN: 走钢丝〔比喻处境困难﹐如有差错就会发生不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel as though I’m walking a tightrope between success and failure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到自己就像走钢丝一样﹐在成功与失败之间摇摆。

Sense.DEF: a piece of women’s clothing made of very thin material that fits tightly over the feet and legs and goes up to the waist
a piece of clothing similar to women’s tights but too thick to see through, worn especially by dancers
someone who hates to spend or give money
a female tiger
a type of Indian food that consists of small pieces of meat covered in spices, and cooked
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken tikka
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度烤鸡

Sense.TRAN:
a short form of 缩略式=
till 1
直到

Sense.DEF: a mark (~) placed over the letter ‘n’ in Spanish to show that it is pronounced /nj/
Sense.TRAN: 〔西班牙语中置于字母n之上的〕腭化符号

Sense.DEF: a flat square piece of baked clay or other material, used for covering walls, floors etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: bathroom tiles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴室瓷砖

Sense.DEF: a thin curved piece of baked clay used for covering roofs
out drinking, dancing etc for enjoyment until late at night
Sense.TRAN: 通宵达旦纵情玩乐﹐彻夜花天酒地

Sense.DEF: to cover a roof, floor etc with tiles
Sense.TRAN: 铺瓦于〔屋顶〕﹔贴地砖于〔地面等〕

Sense.DEF: an area or surface covered with tiles, or the work of covering a surface with tiles
Sense.TRAN: 瓷砖[地砖]面﹐瓦屋顶﹔盖瓦﹐贴瓷砖﹐铺地砖

Sense.DEF: until
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have a boyfriend till I was 17.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我直到17岁才有男朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shop’s open till nine o’clock on Fridays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店周五营业到9点。

Sense.DEF: a machine used in shops, restaurants etc for calculating the amount you have to pay, and for storing the money
money in the till is money that a company or organization has
Sense.EXAMPLE: You keep as much money as you need in the till to run your operations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你做业务要储备足够的钱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your hands/fingers in the till
Sense.DEF: to steal money from the place where you work
Sense.TRAN: 偷本单位的钱﹔监守自盗

GramExa.PROPFORM: be caught with your hands/fingers in the till
GramExa.GLOSS: to be caught stealing from your employer
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 偷本单位的钱时当场被抓住

Sense.DEF: to prepare land for growing crops
the activity of preparing land for growing crops

a long handle fastened to the
rudder part that controls the direction
of a boat
to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother tilted her head and smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈歪着头笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ned’s mouth tilted upwards slightly at the corners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内德的嘴角微微翘起。

Sense.DEF: to move or make something move into a position where one side is higher than the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: As it came in to land, the plane tilted sideways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机降落时有点侧偏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man was tilting his chair back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男人往后翘着椅子。

Sense.DEF: if an opinion or situation tilts, or if something tilts it, it changes so that people start to prefer one person, belief, or action to others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crisis situations tend to tilt the balance of power in favour of the president.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危急形势总是会把权力天平倾向于总统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Government tax policy has tilted toward industrial development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的税收政策已经向工业发展倾斜。

Sense.DEF: to attack someone in what you say or write
to waste time and energy attacking an enemy that is not real
Sense.TRAN: 攻击幻想的敌人﹐庸人自扰

Sense.DEF: as fast as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: He charged full tilt down the slope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他全速冲下斜坡。

Sense.DEF: a movement or position in which one side of something is higher than the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slight tilt of the head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头的微侧

Sense.DEF: a preference for one person, belief, or action over others
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人﹑某信仰或某行为的〕倾向﹐偏向

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recent tilt toward the Democrats
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近向民主党倾斜的民意

Sense.DEF: an attempt to win something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team is preparing for another tilt at the European Cup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队正在为再一次问鼎欧洲杯备战。

Sense.DEF: a spoken or written attack on someone or something
wood used for building or making things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bench made of timber
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木制长椅

Sense.DEF: trees that produce wood used for building or making things
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于建筑和制作物品的〕树木﹐林木
Sense.EXAMPLE: the timber trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林木业

Sense.DEF: a wooden beam, especially one that forms part of the main structure of a house
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指构成房屋主要结构的〕栋木﹐大梁

Sense.DEF: used to warn people that a tree being cut down is about to fall
Sense.TRAN: 大树要倒啦！〔用来警告人们所伐树木快要倒下〕

Sense.DEF: timbered buildings have a frame made of wooden beams, or have wooden beams showing on the outside
an area of land that is covered by trees, especially ones that will be used for wood
the height above the level of the sea beyond which trees will not grow
Sense.TRAN: 林木线〔指树木能生长的最高海拔〕

Sense.DEF: the northern or southern limit in the world beyond which trees will not grow
Sense.TRAN: 树木生长线〔指南﹑北半球树木能生长的最高纬度〕

Sense.DEF: the quality of the sound made by a particular instrument or voice
Sense.TRAN: 〔乐器或嗓音的〕音质﹐音品﹐音色

Sense.DEF:
a
tambourine
a city on the edge of the Sahara Desert in Mali, West Africa, whose correct name is Tombouctou. People sometimes mention Timbuktu as an example of a place that is very far away.
Sense.TRAN: 廷巴克图〔非洲西部马里境内﹑撒哈拉沙漠边缘一城市﹐其正确名称为Tombouctou（通布图）﹔人们有时用廷巴克图来指遥远的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were enough cars to stretch from here to Timbuktu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车多得足够从这里一直排到遥远的廷巴克图了。

Sense.DEF: the thing that is measured in minutes, hours, days, years etc using clocks
Sense.EXAMPLE: Einstein changed the way we think about space and time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱因斯坦改变了我们的时空概念。
Sense.EXAMPLE: close relationships established over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期建立起来的亲密关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customers have only a limited amount of time to examine the goods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客只有有限的时间可以检查商品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their marriage got better as time went by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着时间的推移﹐他们的婚姻越来越和美。

Sense.DEF: a particular point in time shown on a clock in hours and minutes
Sense.TRAN: 〔钟表上显示的〕时间﹐钟点﹐时刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What time is it?’ ‘It’s about two thirty.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “几点了？”“2点半左右。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time are you going out tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今晚什么时候出去？

GramExa.PROPFORM: what time do you make it?
GramExa.GLOSS: used to ask someone with a watch what time it is
used to ask someone if they know what time it is
be able to understand a clock
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Robin’s just learning to tell the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗宾正在学看钟表。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you realize that it is later than you thought it was
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 看看已经几点了〔表示比想象的要晚〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh no. Look at the time. I’ll be late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哦﹐坏了﹐你看都几点了。我要迟到了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you suddenly realize what the time is
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is that the time? I must go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 都这个时候啦？我得走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By this time tomorrow I’ll know whether I’ve got the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天这个时候我就知道我是否得到这份工作了。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when something happens or someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was the only time we disagreed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我们唯一一次意见有分歧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you remember the time I hit Tom Benson?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还记得那次我打汤姆•本森的事吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary had seen the film many times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽已看过这部电影许多次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was the first time that he had lost a game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他第一次输掉比赛。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gerry had just had back surgery for the third time in two years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里刚做了背部手术﹐这是两年里的第三次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you drop in for a drink next time you’re over this way?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你下次路过进来喝一杯怎么样？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The last time the most recent time I saw Jonathan was Thursday evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上次看到乔纳森是在星期四晚上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The freezing weather did not return until February but this time we were prepared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到2月份天气再次寒冷起来﹐不过这次我们做好了准备。

GramExa.GLOSS: the first, second etc time something happens
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 第一次/第二次/下一次/上一次等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I missed their concert the first time round so I’m going next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我错过了他们的第一次音乐会﹐所以下周我要去听。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I meet up with Julie every time I go to Washington.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每次到华盛顿都和朱莉见面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How many times did you take your driving test?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你考了几次驾照？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How many times have I told you not to wander off like that? I have told you many times
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉过你多少次不要那样乱跑？

Sense.EXAMPLE: One time once I went to a garage sale and bought fifteen books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一次我去了旧物售卖会﹐买回15本书。

Sense.DEF: the particular minute, hour, day etc when something happens or should happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事发生或应该发生的〕具体时刻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was three months pregnant at the time of Stephen’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬去世时﹐她怀孕三个月了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is performing as well as at any time in his career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表现出色﹐一如他事业生涯中的任何一个时候。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The UK has 500,000 stray dogs on its streets at any one time at any particular time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何时候英国大街上都有50万条流浪狗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the time when this scheme was introduced, it was recognised that there might be problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划刚刚启动的时候﹐大家就意识到可能会有问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The phone was ringing but by the time she got indoors, it had stopped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃在响﹐但是等到她进了门又不响了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rosie – it’s time to get up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗茜——该起床了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come on, it’s time for bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐该睡觉了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He glanced at his watch. ‘It’s time for me to go.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看了一眼手表说:“我该走了。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s time I fed the dog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该喂狗了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Now is the right time for us to move to London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在正是我们搬到伦敦去的好时机。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This might be a good time to start planning the new garden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许这个时候开始规划新花园正好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now is not the time to annoy Peter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时候不能惹彼得生气。

GramExa.PROPFORM: there’s no time like the present
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that now is a good time to do something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 再没有比现在更好的时间
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When do you want to meet?’ ‘Well, there’s no time like the present.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想什么时候见面？”“嗯﹐再没有比现在更好的时间了。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s nearly dinner time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快到吃晚饭的时间了。

GramExa.GLOSS: the time when a shop, bar etc opens or closes
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔商店﹑酒吧等的〕开门/关门时间
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We empty the till each night at closing time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每晚打烊时我们都把现金出纳机清空。

GramExa.GLOSS: the time when a train, plane etc arrives or leaves
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔火车﹑飞机等的〕到达/出发时间
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our estimated arrival time is 2:30 pm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预计到达时间为下午2时30分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: England is so lovely at this time of year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年这个时候英格兰的景色都非常迷人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll sort that out when the time comes when it becomes necessary .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必要时我们会解决的。

Sense.DEF: a period of time during which something happens or someone does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dustin wanted to spend as much time as possible with his family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达斯廷想尽可能多花时间和家人在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I first met Jennifer a long time ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次遇见珍妮弗是在很久以前。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They stopped for a short time to rest the horses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们稍停了一会儿﹐让马歇口气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Andy and Tom talked for some time for a fairly short period .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪和汤姆谈了一会儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alison was married, for a time for a fairly short period , to a comedian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾莉森曾和一位喜剧演员有过一段短暂的婚姻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin disliked being away from his family for any length of time for more than just a short period .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁不喜欢离家太久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took her a long time to make a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她花了很长时间才作出决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Learning a language isn’t easy – it takes time takes a long period of time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学一门语言不容易——这需要时间。

GramExa.GLOSS: deliberately spend time doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: While in New York he took time to visit some friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在纽约时﹐他抽时间拜访了一些朋友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wanted to make better use of my travel time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想更好地利用旅行的时间。

Sense.DEF: an amount of time that is available for you to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll visit him if I have time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有时间我会去拜访他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Molly would like to do some diving if there is time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时间的话﹐莫莉想去潜水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She realized she would have time for a coffee before her train left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现在火车出发之前她还有时间喝杯咖啡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have to rush. We have all the time in the world have plenty of time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不必匆忙﹐有的是时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: June had little time to spare available time for making her own clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼几乎没有时间给自己做衣服。

GramExa.GLOSS: time when you are not working
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He writes poetry in his spare time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他空闲时写诗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Being prepared for meetings will save time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做好会议准备可以节省时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to waste time arguing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想浪费时间争吵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spent precious time valuable and important time looking for a telephone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把宝贵的时间花在找电话上了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I seem to spend most of my time on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像把大部分时间都花在打电话上了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: McDuff passed the time writing letters wrote letters because he had nothing else to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克达夫写信打发时间。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have time on your hands/time to kill
GramExa.GLOSS: not have enough to do
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now the children have left home, she has too much time on her hands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在孩子们都离开家了﹐她有太多空闲时间。

GramExa.GLOSS: plan so that you have time available for something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make time to talk to your children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽出时间和孩子们谈谈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Book your ticket soon, as time is running out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点订票﹐时间不多了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that it is the end of the time allowed for something such as a competition or examination
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔比赛或考试〕时间到﹐没有时间了

GramExa.GLOSS: used on radio and television programmes to say that there is no more time available on the programme
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔电视和电台节目中说〕〔节目）接近尾声了

Sense.DEF: continuously or very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: I keep practising and I’m improving all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不断练习﹐因此一直在进步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He worries about her the whole time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在担心她。

Sense.DEF: very often or almost always
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can speak German but we speak English most of the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会说德语﹐但我们大多数时候说英语。

Sense.DEF: if something happens half the time, especially something annoying, it happens quite often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Half the time you don’t even notice what I’m wearing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你常常连我穿什么都没注意。

Sense.DEF: sometimes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life is hard at times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活有时很艰辛。

Sense.DEF: sometimes, but not regularly or very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: These food safety scares happen from time to time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种食品安全恐慌事件时有发生。

Sense.LEXUNIT: time after time/time and time again
Sense.DEF: often, over a long period
Sense.TRAN: 反复多次﹔一而再﹐再而三
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were catching the same kids stealing time after time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察几次三番地抓住同一批孩子在偷东西。

Sense.DEF: always – used especially in official rules and statements
Sense.TRAN: 随时﹐总是〔尤用于正式规定和声明〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children must be supervised at all times while in the park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童在公园里必须一直有人照看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents are welcome at all times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随时欢迎家长。

Sense.LEXUNIT: nine times out of ten/99 times out of 100 etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is almost always true or almost always happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nine times out of ten she’s right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十有八九她都是对的。

Sense.DEF: at a particular moment or period in the past when something happened, especially when the situation is very different now
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was about ten or eleven at the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时大概十或十一岁。

Sense.DEF: at a time in the past but not now
Sense.EXAMPLE: At one time she wanted to be a nurse, but the thought of working at night put her off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她曾经想当一名护士﹐但想到上夜班她就退却了。

Sense.DEF: at this particular moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President said his actions were ‘the right ones at this time’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统说他的行动“在此时此刻是正确的”。

Sense.DEF: used to say strongly that something never happened or should never happen
Sense.TRAN: 从来没有﹐在任何时候都不（应该）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At no time did anyone involved speak to the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何相关人员都没有向媒体发表过言论。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At no time was the company informed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司从来没有得到过消息。

Sense.DEF: for a short period of time from now, but not permanently
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, for the time being, she is living with her father in Tijuana.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下﹐她和父亲暂住在蒂华纳。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in 10 days’/five years’/a few minutes’ etc time
Sense.DEF: ten days, five years etc from now
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has an appointment with the doctor in two days’ time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他约好了两天后去看医生。

Subsense.DEF: before the time by which it is necessary for something to be done
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Will you be able to finish it in time?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能及时完成吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They ran all the way to the corner just in time to see the bus disappearing up the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一路跑到转角处﹐正好看到公共汽车消失在街头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The painting was successfully repaired in time for the opening of the exhibition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画及时修复成功﹐正好赶上展览会开幕。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in good time/in plenty of time
GramExa.GLOSS: a long time before the necessary time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We arrived at the concert hall in good time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们早早就到了音乐厅。

Subsense.DEF: after a certain period of time, especially after a gradual process of change and development
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He wants to see changes in the company and I am sure he will, in time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想看到公司的变化﹐我相信过一段时间他一定会看到的。

Sense.DEF: sooner than expected or necessary
Sense.TRAN: 还有剩余的时间〔指比预期要快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should arrive in New York with time to spare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该可以提前到达纽约。

Sense.DEF: if something happens over time, it happens gradually during a long period
Sense.EXAMPLE: The research project will be assessed over time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个研究项目要假以时日才能作出评估。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students are encouraged to consider the way language changes over time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓励学生们去思考语言随着时间变化的方式。

Sense.DEF: after a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 随着时间的推移﹐逐渐地
Sense.EXAMPLE: These symptoms will start to get better with time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些症状过一段时间就会开始好转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would have thought of the answer, given time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是给我时间﹐我会想出答案的。

Subsense.DEF: to do something slowly or carefully without hurrying

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marie took her time cutting my hair and did it really well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽仔细地给我剪发﹐剪得相当好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had planned to take his time over the journey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他原来计划这一路慢慢地走。

Subsense.DEF: to do something more slowly than seems reasonable
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re taking your time with the lab tests. We need the results now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们实验做得太慢了。我们现在就要结果。

Sense.DEF: used to say how much greater, more etc one thing is than another …
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sound travels four times faster in water than in air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声音在水中的传播速度是在空气中的四倍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were three times as many girls as boys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩人数是男孩的三倍。

Subsense.DEF: if someone deals with things one, three, ten etc at a time, they deal with them separately or in groups of three, ten etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you raise your hands, I’ll answer questions one at a time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你们举手﹐我会逐一回答你们的问题。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Frank took the stairs two at a time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克一步跨两级台阶。

Subsense.DEF: if something happens for hours, days, months etc at a time, it continues for several hours, months etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Because of his work, he’s often away for weeks at a time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为工作的原因﹐他经常连续几周都不在家。

Sense.DEF: at the correct time or the time that was arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack was worried about whether he’d be able to get there on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克担心他是否能准时赶到那里。

GramExa.GLOSS: at exactly the right time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane arrived right on time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机准点到达。

Sense.DEF: earlier or later than the time when something happens, should be done etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prepare what you plan to say in the meeting ahead of time before the meeting .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事先准备好你在会上的发言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train left twenty minutes behind time after it should have left .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车晚点了20分钟发车。

Sense.DEF: used to say strongly that you think something should happen soon or should already have happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s about time our team won.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该是我们队赢的时候了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s high time we had a party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们早该举行一次聚会了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something should have happened sooner
Sense.EXAMPLE: Philip is going to be punished and not before time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普要受到惩罚了﹐早该如此了。

Sense.DEF: the best, biggest etc of a particular kind of person or thing that has ever existed
Sense.TRAN: 有史以来最好/最大等的…
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is the greatest athlete of all time, in my opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他是有史以来最伟大的运动员。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in no time (at all)/in next to no time
Sense.DEF: very quickly or soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be there in no time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们马上就到。

Sense.DEF: very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘When is she due back?’ ‘Any time now.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她应该什么时候回来？”“马上。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will definitely happen at some time in the future, but you do not know when
Sense.TRAN: 这（只）是个时间问题〔指某事肯定会发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll find the key eventually. It’s just a question of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总会找到钥匙的﹐只是个时间问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only a matter of time before we catch the person who killed her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们迟早会抓到杀害她的凶手。

Sense.DEF: used to say that at some time in the future it will become clear whether or not something is true, right etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only time will tell if the treatment has been successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有时间才能证明这种治疗是否有效。

Sense.DEF: a particular period in history
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mankind has used the horse since ancient times .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类从古时候起就使用马匹了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In earlier times, servants would use the bare wooden stairs at the back of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去﹐仆人只能走房子后面光光的木楼梯。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at/in/during etc the time of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lived at the time of the Napoleonic wars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生活在拿破仑战争时期。

GramExa.GLOSS: the present period in history
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Air pollution has become one of the most significant health problems of our time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气污染成了我们这个时代最重大的健康问题。

Sense.DEF: old-fashioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our equipment is a bit behind the times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的设备有点过时。

Sense.DEF: to change when other things in society, business etc change
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got to move with the times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须与时俱进。

Sense.DEF: having or using the most advanced ideas, methods, designs, technology etc
Sense.TRAN: 最先进的﹐超越时代的﹐具有前瞻性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coleridge was far ahead of his time in his understanding of the unconscious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柯尔律治对潜意识的理解远远超前于他所处的时代。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 令人愉快的/令人不快的
Sense.DEF: a good time, bad time, difficult time etc is a period or occasion when you have good, bad, difficult etc experiences
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was the happiest time of her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是她一生中最幸福的时光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had their happy times, but they had their hard times too.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有过快乐的时光﹐但也经历过艰难的岁月。

GramExa.GLOSS: enjoy yourself
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you have a good time at the party?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在聚会上玩得高兴吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie went to a wedding at the weekend and had the time of her life enjoyed herself very much .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉周末去参加了一个婚礼﹐玩得非常开心。

Sense.DEF: the period of time when you were living in a particular place, working for a particular company etc
Sense.TRAN: 某人在〔某地生活或任职〕的时候
Sense.EXAMPLE: In her time at the United Nations she was considered a tough negotiator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在联合国的时候被认为是一个强硬的谈判对手。

Subsense.DEF: before you were born or before you started working or living somewhere
Subsense.TRAN: 在…出生[开始工作﹐到某地生活]之前﹔早于…的时代
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They say he was a great actor but that was before my time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说他是个伟大的演员﹐但那时我还没有入行。

Subsense.DEF: if you do something, especially get old, before your time, you do it before the time when most people usually do it in their lives
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He seemed to grow into an old man before his time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎过早地衰老了。

Sense.DEF: the way of referring to points in time in one particular part of the world
Sense.TRAN: 〔世界上某一特定地区的〕时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eastern Standard Time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东部标准时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: British Summer Time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国夏令时
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flight to Boston arrives at 1.15 pm local time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞往波士顿的班机将于当地时间下午1点15分到达。

Subsense.DEF: the amount of time taken by a competitor in a race
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Olympic medallist’s time in the 200 metres final was 2 minutes 11.56 seconds.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位奥运会奖牌得主在200米决赛中的成绩是2分11秒56。

Subsense.DEF: the amount of time a journey takes
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The journey time to London is approximately four hours.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前往伦敦的行程需时约4小时。

Sense.DEF: the end of the normal period of playing time in a sports game, especially football
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指足球的〕比赛时间结束﹐终场
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mason’s goal 13 minutes from time earned his team a place in the finals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅森终场前13分钟的进球使他的球队进入了决赛。

Sense.DEF:
the number of beats in each
bar
in a piece of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: Waltzes are usually in three-four time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华尔兹舞曲通常是四分之三拍。

Sense.DEF:
if you do something in time to a piece of music, you do it using the same
rhythm
and speed as the music
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gloria was tapping her feet in time to the music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格洛丽亚跟着音乐的节拍脚步轻点。

Sense.DEF:
to show the
rhythm
and speed that a piece of music should be played at to a group of musicians, using your hands
if a clock keeps good time, it always shows the correct time
to spend a period of time in prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul was doing time for burglary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗因入室盗窃在监狱服刑。

Sense.LEXUNIT: pass the time of day (with sb)
Sense.DEF: to say hello to someone and have a short talk with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: People like to pass the time of day with neighbours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们喜欢和邻居寒暄。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there was a time when you used to be able to do something, when something used to happen etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time was when no one had television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去谁都没有电视机。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you must do something quickly because there is very little time
Sense.TRAN: 没时间了﹐必须抓紧时间

Sense.DEF: if you make good time on a journey, you travel quickly, especially more quickly than you expected
Sense.TRAN: 〔旅途中〕快速行进〔尤指比预期要快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We made good time and were at the hotel by lunchtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们路上很快﹐午饭时间就到酒店了。

Sense.DEF: to try to finish or achieve something even though you have very little time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark was racing against time to complete the work by Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克争分夺秒﹐想赶在周五之前完成工作。

Sense.DEF: used to say that wasting time or delaying something costs money
Sense.TRAN: 时间就是金钱﹐一寸光阴一寸金

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is young enough to be able to wait before doing something or until something happens

Sense.LEXUNIT: time is a great healer/heals all wounds
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will become less upset as time passes
Sense.TRAN: 时间是疗伤的一剂良药/时间能治愈一切创伤

Sense.DEF: used to say that time seems to pass very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time flies when you’re having fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玩得开心时﹐时间过得飞快。

Sense.DEF: if you study or do work in your own time, you do it outside normal school or work hours
Sense.TRAN: 在空闲时间﹐在业余时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nurses in training study in their own time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加培训的护士在业余时间学习。

Sense.DEF: when you are ready
Sense.TRAN: 在自己做好准备之时﹐在自己认为合适之时
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bobby will tell them about it in his own good time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博比会在他认为合适的时候把这事告诉他们的。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to be patient because something they are waiting for will certainly happen after a period of time, and probably quite soon
Sense.TRAN: 快了﹐别急〔告诉某人他期待的事最终肯定会发生﹐而且也许即将发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’d love to see it.’ ‘All in good time.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我真想看看。”“别急。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a lot of/no time for sb/sth
Sense.DEF: if you have a lot of time for someone or something, you like or admire them
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢[欣赏]/不喜欢[不欣赏]某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has no time for does not like people who talk too much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不喜欢话太多的人。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to someone’s age
Sense.EXAMPLE: At my time of life, you can’t take too many shocks like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这个年纪的人﹐受不了太多那样的打击。

Sense.DEF: used in certain expressions to refer to the period when you are alive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve met some rude women in my time but she’s the worst.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这辈子也见过一些粗鲁的女人﹐但她是当中的极品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was many things in his time – musician, pilot, cattle-rancher, industrialist, journalist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一生有多重身份——音乐家﹑飞行员﹑养牛的牧场主﹑实业家和记者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I had my time over again lived my life again , I’d probably do exactly the same things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果人生重来﹐我很可能还会做同样的事。

Sense.DEF:
the time when a woman has her
period
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s that time of the month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的经期来了。

Sense.DEF: a very long time, or a very long time ago

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a whale of a time

Section.SECHEADING: A TIME WHEN SOMETHING HAPPENS 某事发生的时间

Exponent.DEF: a time when something happens or when you should do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The last time I saw her she was in high school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最后一次看到她的时候她在上中学。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s time for you to go to bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该睡觉了。

Exponent.DEF: a time when something happens. Occasion is more formal than time .
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They have been seen together on several occasions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人好几次看到他们在一起。

Exponent.DEF: a particular point in time when something happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At that moment at exactly that time, the door bell rang.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐门铃响了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The next moment she was gone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一会儿她就不见了。

Exponent.DEF: a particular time during a longer period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At one point during the play she completely forgot her lines.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出中有那么一会儿她完全忘记了台词。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the lowest point of the holiday
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假日里最不开心的时刻

Section.SECHEADING: A LONG TIME 很长一段时间

Exponent.DEF: a long period of time, especially many months or years
Exponent.TRAN: 很长时间〔尤指数月或数年〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’ve been married a long time – nearly 30 years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们结婚很长时间了——将近30年。

Exponent.DEF: many hours, weeks, months, or years – used to emphasize that it is a long time, or much longer than it should be
Exponent.TRAN: 数小时/数周/数月/数年〔用于强调时间之久〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s years since I rode a bike.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好几年没骑自行车了。

Exponent.DEF: a very long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been standing here for ages.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我站在这里很长时间了。

Exponent.DEF: a fairly long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t seen Paul for a while, and he’d completely changed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一段时间没见保罗了﹐他完全变了。

Exponent.DEF: a very long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For the longest time, my daughter wasn’t reading at all.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我女儿有很长一段时间根本不看书。

Section.SECHEADING: A SHORT TIME 很短一段时间

Exponent.DEF: a short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll call you back in a minute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一会儿给你回电话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I show you something? It will only take a moment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你看样东西好吗？一会儿就行。

Exponent.DEF: a very short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll be ready in a second.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上就好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Just a second – I can’t find my wallet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍等片刻——我找不到钱包了。

Exponent.DEF: a very short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In an instant, they were gone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瞬间,他们就不见了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He paused for an instant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停顿了片刻。

Exponent.DEF: a short period of time, especially a few hours, days, or weeks
Exponent.TRAN: 不久〔尤指数小时﹑数日或数周〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been to Tokyo, but I was only there for a short while.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去过东京﹐不过只待了没多久。

Sense.DEF: to arrange that something should happen at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 安排…的时间﹐选好…的时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw from the station clock that I had timed my arrival perfectly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从车站的钟上看到我到的时间正好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tour has been timed to allow visitors to attend the opening night of the Verona opera season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次游览的时间安排使得游客可以参加维罗纳歌剧节的开幕之夜。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her book was timed to coincide with arranged to be at the same time as an exhibition of Goya’s paintings at the National Gallery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的书安排在国家美术馆举办戈雅画展的时候出版。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meeting has been timed for three o’clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议安排在3点钟开始。

Sense.DEF: to measure how fast someone or something is going, how long it takes to do something etc
Sense.TRAN: 测定…的速度﹔记录…所需的时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to run up the stairs while the Sergeant timed us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须跑上楼梯﹐中士给我们计时。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They timed the winner at 2 minutes and 14.05 seconds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给获胜者测定的时间为2分14秒05。

Sense.DEF: to hit a ball or make a shot at a particular moment
Sense.TRAN: 把握〔击球﹑射门或投篮〕的时机

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keith timed the pass well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基思传球的时机把握得很好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautifully timed shot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时机把握得恰到好处的一记射门

Sense.DEF: one and a half times the normal rate of pay
Sense.TRAN: 相当于平时一倍半的工资
Sense.EXAMPLE: We get time and a half for working on Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期天加班拿一倍半的工资。

Sense.DEF: a study of working methods to find out how effective they are
Sense.TRAN: 时间和动作研究〔指对工作方法的效率进行的研究〕

Sense.DEF: a bomb that is set to explode at a particular time
a situation that is likely to become a very serious problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cutting down the rainforest is an environmental time bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 砍伐热带雨林对于环境来说是一枚定时炸弹。

Sense.DEF: a container that is filled with objects from a particular time, so that people in the future will know what life was like then
Sense.TRAN: 时间囊〔存放某个时代物件的一个容器﹐以供后人了解当时的生活情况〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of card on which the hours you have worked are recorded by a special machine
Sense.TRAN: 工作时间记录卡﹐考勤卡

Sense.DEF: a special clock that records the exact time when someone arrives at and leaves work
taking a long time to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: a complex and time-consuming process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复杂而费时的过程

Sense.DEF: the period of time during which you expect or agree that something will happen or be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a ten year time frame for the implementation of the new policies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新政实施为期十年。

Sense.DEF: a time-honoured method or custom is one that has existed for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔方法﹑习俗等〕古老的﹐历史悠久的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharon became involved with music in the time-honoured fashion – through her family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎伦是通过家庭熏陶这一传统的方式走上音乐道路的。

Sense.DEF: someone who officially records the times taken to do something, especially at a sports event

Subsense.DEF: someone who is good or bad at arriving at work at the right time
a watch or clock that is good or bad at showing the right time

Sense.DEF: the period of time between two connected events
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个相关联事件之间的〕时间间隔﹐时间差
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is generally a two-year time lag in the information being made available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常这类信息公开要等两年。

Sense.DEF: time-lapse photography involves taking many pictures of something over a period of time and then showing them together, so that a very slow process seems to happen much faster
Sense.TRAN: 〔摄影〕延时的〔指在一段时间内对非常缓慢的过程每隔一段时间拍摄一张照片﹐然后连续放映﹐高速呈现该过程〕

Sense.DEF: remaining attractive and not becoming old-fashioned
Sense.TRAN: 万古长新的﹔永不过时的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the timeless beauty of Venice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尼斯万古不变的美

Sense.DEF: continuing for ever
Sense.EXAMPLE: the timeless universe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 永恒的宇宙

Sense.DEF: the longest time that you are allowed in which to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The time limit for applications is three weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请的期限为三周。

Sense.DEF: a plan for when things will happen or how long you think something will take
Sense.EXAMPLE: The timeline for the project is optimistic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目的进程十分乐观。

Sense.DEF: a line showing the order in which events happened
done or happening at exactly the right time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏警察及时赶到﹐打斗总算停止。

GramExa.GLOSS: as quickly as is reasonable in a particular situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We aim to settle all valid claims in a timely manner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力求做到及时处理所有有效索赔。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that makes you remember something important
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crash served as a timely reminder of the dangers of drinking and driving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场车祸及时地提醒了人们酒后驾车的危险。

Sense.DEF: in stories, a machine in which people can travel backwards or forwards in time
Sense.TRAN: 时间机器〔故事中可以带着人们穿越到过去或未来的机器〕

Sense.DEF: time when you are officially allowed not to be at work or studying

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you ever had to take time off for health reasons?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你曾因健康原因请过假吗？

Sense.DEF: to rest or do something different from your usual job or activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: In between jobs, Liz always took time out to return to her first love – travelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在换工作的空档里﹐莉兹总是歇一歇﹐去做她最喜欢的事情——旅行。

Sense.DEF: a short break during a sports match when the teams can rest, get instructions from their manager etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: With 15.7 seconds left, Washington State called time out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还剩下15.7秒时﹐华盛顿州队请求暂停。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a computer stops using a particular program because the user has not done any work for a period of time
a clock or watch
someone who is time-poor does not have very much free time because they work all day and often work in the evenings too
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为从早忙到晚而〕缺乏空闲时间的

Sense.DEF: an instrument that you use to measure time, when you are doing something such as cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Set the timer on the cooker for three minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把炉子上的定时器设定为三分钟。

Sense.DEF: someone who works part or all of a normal working week
multiplied by
Sense.EXAMPLE: two times two equals four (2×2=4)
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二二得四

Sense.DEF: to multiply a number
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then you times that by 1,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后你把它乘以1,000。

Sense.DEF: designed to reduce the time usually needed to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a time-saving device
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 省时装置

Sense.DEF: the period of time it takes for something to happen or be completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The timescale for completing the work would be fairly tight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完成这项工作的时间很紧。

Sense.DEF: someone who does the least amount of work possible in their job
Sense.TRAN: 磨洋工的人﹐混时间的人

Sense.DEF: a holiday home that you buy with other people so that you can each spend a period of time there every year, or when you arrange to do this
Sense.TRAN: 分时享用的度假住房﹔分时享用度假住房

Sense.DEF:
a situation in which one computer is used by many different people at different
terminals
at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 分时操作﹐时间共享〔计算机在不同终端同时被多人使用〕

Sense.DEF: the practice of owning a timeshare
Sense.TRAN: 拥有分时享用的度假住房

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper on which the hours you have worked are written or printed
Sense.TRAN: 工作时间记录单﹐考勤单

Sense.DEF: a sound on the radio that shows the exact time

two numbers at the beginning of a line of music that tell you how many
beats
there are in a
bar
a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to imagine a time span of a million years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难想象100万年这么长的时间跨度。

Sense.DEF:
a large
square a broad, open area with buildings on all sides
in New York City, close to many theatres. Each year there is a big New Year’s Eve celebration in Times Square, and at midnight a large red ball is lowered down a building to show that the New Year has begun.
Sense.TRAN: 时代广场〔纽约市的一个大广场﹐附近有许多剧院﹐每年在时代广场上都要举行大规模的迎新年庆祝活动﹐子夜时分会有一只红色大球从大楼落下﹐表示新年的开始〕

Sense.DEF: a list, used especially by children in school, that shows the results when each number between one and twelve is multiplied by each number between one and twelve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know the eleven times table?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道11的乘法表吗？

Sense.DEF: an electronic control that can be set to start or stop a machine at a particular time
a list of the times at which buses, trains, planes etc arrive and leave
Sense.TRAN: 〔公共汽车﹑火车﹑飞机等的〕运行时间表﹐时刻表

Sense.DEF: a list of the times of classes in a school, college etc
a plan of events and activities, with their dates and times
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件或活动的〕时间表﹐日程表

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Council has set out a timetable for returning to civilian rule.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会已制订出恢复文官统治的时间表。

Sense.DEF: to plan that something will happen at a particular time in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The carnival parade is timetabled for 12.00 on both days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂欢节游行两天都定在12点举行。

Sense.DEF: to arrange the times at which classes will take place in a school or college
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course is timetabled for one period each week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程被安排每周一节课。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Art students have very few timetabled hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学艺术的学生固定的上课时间很少。

Sense.DEF:
in
science fiction
, the action of going to a time in the past or the future
to have not changed even though everyone or everything else has
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house seemed to be stuck in a 19th-century time warp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋房子似乎还停留在19世纪。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary situation in which the past or future becomes the present
time-worn objects are old and have been used a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: time-worn steps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 磨损了的台阶

Sense.DEF: time-worn ideas and beliefs are no longer sensible or useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: time-worn prejudices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陈腐的偏见

Sense.DEF: one of the 24 areas that the world is divided into, each of which has its own time
not having courage or confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was a timid child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾是个胆小的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a policy that is both timid and inadequate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项既无胆识又不完善的政策

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone is shy rather than timid .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐说某人害羞一般说 shy﹐不说timid。

Sense.DEF: the skill of doing something at exactly the right time
Sense.TRAN: 时机的掌握﹐火候的把握

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was just walking into the restaurant when we got there. Perfect timing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到的时候他正好走进饭店﹐时间算得好准。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He told jokes with an exquisite sense of timing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲笑话时很会把握时机。

Sense.DEF: the time when someone does something or when something happens, especially when you are considering how suitable this is
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人做某事或某事发生的〕时间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President and I did not discuss the timing of my departure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和总统没有讨论我离职的时间。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Ferry schedules and precise timings are subject to weather conditions on the day of departure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渡轮时刻表和准确时间视出发当天的天气而定。

Sense.DEF:
the way in which electricity is sent to the
spark plugs
in a car engine
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车发动机的〕点火时间控制

Sense.DEF: lacking confidence and easily frightened
Sense.TRAN: 胆怯的﹔缺乏自信的﹔易受惊吓的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was no helpless, timorous female.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决不是柔弱胆怯的女性。

Sense.DEF:
a set of large drums that are played in an
orchestra
a soft silver-white metal that is often used to cover and protect iron and steel. It is a chemical element: symbol Sn
Sense.TRAN: 锡〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Sn〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old tin bath
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧的锡浴缸

Sense.DEF: a small metal container in which food or drink is sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sardine tin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙丁鱼罐头

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tin of baked beans
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一罐烤豆子

Sense.DEF: a metal container with a lid in which food can be stored
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biscuit tin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饼干盒

Sense.DEF: a metal container in which food is cooked
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 7-inch cake tin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7英寸的蛋糕烤盘
Sense.EXAMPLE: a roasting tin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烧烤盘

Sense.DEF: a metal container with a lid, in which paint, glue etc is sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔盛涂料﹑胶水等的〕马口铁罐﹐白铁桶

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tin of brown paint
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一桶棕色涂料

Sense.DEF:
made of
tin
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tin roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白铁皮房顶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tin mug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个锡制大杯子

Sense.DEF: a medical substance mixed with alcohol
dry material that burns easily and can be used for lighting fires
a place or situation that is dangerous and where there could suddenly be a lot of fighting or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is a tinderbox that could again plunge the country into civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地区是个火药桶﹐很可能再次使国家陷入内战。

Sense.DEF: a box containing things needed to make a flame, used in the past
extremely dry and likely to burn very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole forest is tinder-dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整片森林都很干燥﹐容易失火。

Sense.DEF: a pointed part of something that has several points, for example a fork
thin shiny metal that bends like paper and is used for covering food
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于包裹食物等的〕锡箔﹐锡纸

Sense.DEF: a high clear ringing sound
the high clear ringing sound that is made by a small bell
a very small amount of a colour, emotion, or quality
Sense.TRAN: 淡淡的色调﹔些许﹐一点﹐一丝〔颜色﹑情绪或品质〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a tinge of sadness in her voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音里带着一丝哀愁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This glass has a greenish tinge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块玻璃带点淡淡的绿色。

Sense.DEF: to give something a small amount of a particular colour, emotion, or quality
Sense.TRAN: 着淡色于…﹔使带有一点〔情绪﹑特质等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The light of the setting sun tinges the buildings with delicate colours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 落日的余晖给建筑物染上一抹柔和的色彩。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Pink tinged her cheeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她面色粉红。

Sense.DEF: showing a small amount of a colour, emotion or quality
Sense.TRAN: 略带一点〔某种颜色﹑情绪﹑品质等〕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His voice was tinged with sadness and regret.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音里带有一丝悲伤和遗憾。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: white blossom tinged with pink
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 略带粉红色的白花

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 粉红色的/带点爵士乐风格的/带点浪漫色彩的等

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body tingles, you feel a slight stinging feeling, especially on your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: My body tingled all over and I had a terrible headache.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我全身刺痛﹐头疼欲裂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Graham felt a tingling sensation in his hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆感到手上一阵刺痛。

Sense.DEF: to feel excitement, fear etc very strongly
Sense.TRAN: 感到很激动/充满恐惧/充满期待等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tingled with excitement. Soon she would be able to tell Martha everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她激动不已﹐很快她就能把一切都告诉玛莎了。

Sense.DEF: to make small changes to something in order to repair it or make it work better
Sense.TRAN: 做小改动﹐做小修补﹔摆弄

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress has been tinkering with the legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会一直在对这项立法做些小修小补。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad was always tinkering around with engines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸总是在摆弄发动机。

Sense.DEF: in the past, a tinker was someone who travelled from place to place selling things or repairing metal pots, pans etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时走街串巷的〕小贩﹐补锅匠

Sense.DEF: a disobedient or annoying young child
a light ringing sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the distant tinkle of a cow-bell
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处牛铃的叮当声

Sense.DEF: to call someone on the telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you a tinkle tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天给你打电话。

Sense.DEF:
to
urinate pass water from your body
- used especially by children or when talking to children
to make light ringing sounds, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tinkling bell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叮当作响的铃铛

Sense.DEF:
to
urinate pass water from your body
- used especially by children or when talking to children
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have to go tinkle ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要撒尿吗？

Sense.DEF: tinned food is food that is sold in small metal containers which can be kept for a long time before they are opened
Sense.EXAMPLE: tinned tomatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罐头番茄

Sense.DEF: an illness in which you hear noises, especially ringing, in your ears
a tinny sound is high, weak, and unpleasant, and sounds like it is coming out of something made of metal
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音〕尖细的﹐像金属片碰撞声的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tinny music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像金属片碰撞声的音乐

Sense.DEF:
a tool for opening
tins
of food
the people who produce popular music or the part of the city where they work
Sense.TRAN: 锡盘巷〔指流行音乐界或城市中该行业的集中地〕

Sense.DEF:
very thin sheets of iron or steel covered with
tin
a tin-pot person, organization etc is not very important, although they think that they are - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑组织机构等〕卑微而又自负的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tin-pot dictator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无足轻重却自我陶醉的独裁者

Sense.DEF: thin strings of shiny paper used as decorations, especially at Christmas
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指圣诞节期间装饰用的〕闪光纸

Sense.DEF: something that seems attractive but is not valuable or important
Sense.TRAN: 花哨而无用的东西﹐华而不实的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tinsel and glamour of Holly wood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞的浮华和诱惑力

Sense.DEF:
a humorous informal name for Hollywood, which is used to give the idea that people in Hollywood care only about
glamour
and the way things look, and not about anything serious
Sense.TRAN: 浮华城〔对好莱坞的戏称﹐意指好莱坞人只注重光鲜的外表﹐而不注重实在的东西〕

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a particular colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: paper with a yellowish tint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泛黄的纸张

Sense.DEF: an artificial colour that is used to slightly change the colour of your hair
Sense.EXAMPLE: red tints in her hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头发上染的红色

Sense.DEF: to slightly change the colour of something, especially hair
tinted glass is coloured, rather than completely transparent
a musical instrument like a small pipe with six holes, that you play by blowing
extremely small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiny community in the Midwest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中西部地区一个极小的社区
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earrings were tiny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耳环很小。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiny little baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丁点大的婴儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always felt a tiny bit sad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是感到一丝悲伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bad teachers are a tiny minority .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 差老师只占极少数。
Sense.EXAMPLE: tiny pieces of paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎纸屑片

Sense.DEF:
another form of the suffix
-ion
the end of something, especially something pointed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He kissed the tip of her nose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吻了一下她的鼻尖。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the southern tip of South America
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南美的最南端
GramExa.EXAMPLE: lights on the wing tips of aeroplanes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机翼尖上的灯

Sense.DEF:
a small amount of additional money that you give to someone such as a
waiter
or a taxi driver
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you leave a tip ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你留小费了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave the guy a big tip .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给了那家伙不少小费。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a $5 tip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5 美元的小费

Sense.DEF: a helpful piece of advice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps she could give us a few tips .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许她能给我们一些建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This week’s magazine has some tips on healthy eating.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这周的杂志刊载了一些有关健康饮食的建议。

GramExa.GLOSS: useful tip
GramExa.EXAMPLE: handy tips for decorating a small flat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小公寓装修的实用建议

Sense.EXAMPLE: gardening tips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 园艺小窍门

Sense.DEF: a small sign of a problem that is much larger
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reported cases of food poisoning are only the tip of the iceberg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些被报道出来的食物中毒事件只是冰山一角。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the tip of your tongue

Subsense.DEF: if something is on the tip of your tongue, you really want to say it, but then you decide not to
Subsense.TRAN: 话到嘴边﹐想说而未说的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was on the tip of my tongue to say, ‘I’d rather have dinner with a snake.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经话到嘴边:“我宁愿和一条蛇共进晚餐。”

Subsense.DEF: if a word, name etc is on the tip of your tongue, you know it but cannot remember it
Subsense.TRAN: 就在嘴边〔但想不起来了〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What is her name? It’s on the tip of my tongue. Joan. Joan Simpson. That’s it!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她叫什么？就在我嘴边。琼——琼•辛普森。就是这名字！

Sense.DEF: an area where unwanted waste is taken and left
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾场
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll take this lot to the tip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要把这堆东西全都扔到垃圾场去。

Sense.DEF: an extremely dirty or untidy place
Sense.TRAN: 极不干净[极不整洁]的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was an absolute tip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子简直是个垃圾堆。

Sense.DEF: special information about which horse will win a race
Sense.TRAN: 〔关于赛马中哪匹马会赢的〕特别情报﹐内部情报

Sense.DEF: a secret warning or piece of information, especially to police about illegal activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acting on a tip, the police were able to find and arrest Upton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方根据密报采取行动﹐找到并逮捕了厄普顿。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He gave me some tips on how to improve my game.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给了我一些如何提高比赛技巧的建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The writer passes on many tips that she has learned over the years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位作家分享了不少她多年来积累的窍门。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: To keep your bike in good condition, follow these simple tips.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为使自行车保持良好车况﹐请遵照这些简单的方法。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 很好的/有用的/有帮助的/好用的建议
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Go to their website to find useful tips on buying and selling a home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 请上他们的网站寻找房产交易的有用建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has some simple tips for saving money when you’re at the supermarket.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一些怎么在超市省钱的简单窍门。

Sense.DEF: to move into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His helmet had tipped forward and the boy pushed it back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 头盔向前耷拉下来﹐男孩把它往后推了推。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eric fell asleep, his head gently tipping to one side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克睡着了﹐头微微倒向一边。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘So what?’ asked Brian, tipping his chair back on its rear legs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “那又怎么样？”布赖恩问道﹐翘起椅子腿向后倾倒。

Sense.DEF: to pour something from one place or container into another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tip the onions and oil into a large ovenproof dish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洋葱和油倒入一个大的耐热盘子里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ben tipped the contents of the drawer onto the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本把抽屉里的东西倒在桌上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall I tip the water out?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我把水倒出来吗？

Sense.DEF:
to give an additional amount of money to someone such as a
waiter
or taxi driver
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you tip the waiter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给侍应生小费了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tipped him $5.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给了他5美元小费。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is tipped to do something, people think that they are most likely to succeed in doing it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the man tipped to become the next President
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被认为很有可能成为下一任总统的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s tipped as a future world champion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被认为是未来的世界冠军。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had been widely tipped to get the new post of deputy director.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都认为他有望获得副主任的新职。

Sense.DEF: having a tip that is made of or covered with gold, steel etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silver-tipped walking stick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银头 手杖

Sense.DEF: to give a slight advantage to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three factors helped to tip the balance in favour of the Labour leadership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三个因素促使天平向工党领导层倾斜。

Sense.DEF: to weigh a particular amount, used especially of someone who will be taking part in a sports competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指参加拳击等比赛前〕称得重量为…
Sense.EXAMPLE: At today’s weigh-in he tipped the scales at just over 15 stone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他今天赛前称得体重正好超过15英石。

Sense.DEF: said when it is raining very heavily
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was absolutely tipping it down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天正下着倾盆大雨。

Sense.DEF: to have one end covered in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: arrows tipped with poison
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒箭
Sense.EXAMPLE: red petals tipped with white
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓣尖为白色的红色花瓣

Subsense.DEF: to touch or raise your hat as a greeting to someone
to say or do something that shows you admire what someone has done

Sense.DEF: to give someone secret information
to give someone such as the police a secret warning or piece of information, especially about illegal activities
Sense.TRAN: 秘密警告〔某人〕﹔〔尤指将非法活动〕通风报信给〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police must have been tipped off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察一定是得到了密报。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His contact had tipped him off that drugs were on the premises.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的线人向他密报说场内有毒品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you tip him off about Bernard?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关伯纳德的事你警告过他了吗？

Sense.DEF: if you tip something over, or if it tips over, it falls or turns over
Sense.EXAMPLE: The candle tipped over and the hay caught fire.
