Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜡烛翻倒﹐干草着了火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The current was starting to tip the canoe over and I began to panic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪流即将倾覆小舟﹐我开始惊慌起来。

Sense.DEF: if you tip something up, or if it tips up, it moves into a sloping position, so that one end or side is higher than the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tipped the bottle up so that the last of the liquid flowed into his glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把瓶子倾斜过来让最后一滴液体流进他的杯子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ken tipped up the wheelbarrow, then stood back to rest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯斜着放好独轮手推车﹐然后站到后面去休息。

Sense.DEF: a secret warning or piece of information, especially one given to the police about illegal activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arrests came after a tip-off from a member of the public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方接到一名老百姓的密报后﹐随即展开了逮捕行动。

Sense.DEF: something that shows you that something is true, even though you did not expect it to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact that he hasn’t called should be a tip-off that he’s not interested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有来电话﹐说明他不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF:
the beginning of a
basketball
game, when the ball is thrown into the air and two players jump up to try to gain control of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔篮球比赛开始时的〕中圈跳球

Sense.DEF:
to use a white liquid in order to cover over mistakes in writing,
typing
etc

white liquid that is used to cover over mistakes in writing,
typing
etc
the moment when one particular result of a process becomes the most likely one, after a period when the result is not sure
someone’s favourite alcoholic drink
someone who drinks alcohol

on
tiptoe
- used especially by children or when talking to children
Sense.TRAN: （我）踮着脚﹐（我）蹑手蹑脚〔尤为儿语〕

Sense.DEF:
a newspaper that gives advice and information about which
shares
should be bought and sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tip sheet for private investors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面向私人投资者的股票信息报

Sense.DEF: someone who gives information about which horse is likely to win a race
slightly drunk
if you stand or walk on tiptoe, you stand or walk on your toes, in order to make yourself taller or in order to walk very quietly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood on tiptoe to kiss him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她踮起脚吻他。

Sense.DEF: to walk quietly and carefully on your toes, so that nobody hears you
Sense.TRAN: 踮着脚走﹐蹑手蹑脚地走
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother tiptoed into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲踮着脚走进了房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tiptoed along the corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我沿着走廊蹑手蹑脚地走。

Sense.DEF: to try to avoid dealing with a difficult or embarrassing subject or problem
Sense.TRAN: 绕开﹐避而不谈〔困难或尴尬的话题或问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were tiptoeing around the delicate subject of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对钱这一敏感话题避而不谈。

Sense.DEF: excellent
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s in tip-top condition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车的状况非常好。

Sense.DEF: a long angry speech criticizing someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He launched into a tirade against the church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始大发议论﹐抨击教会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tirade of abuse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一通谩骂

Sense.DEF: to start to feel tired, or make someone feel tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: As we neared the summit, we were tiring fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接近山顶时﹐我们感到越来越累了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get tired rather than tire .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get tired﹐而不说tire
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The climbers were starting to get tired .

Sense.DEF: to become bored with someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sooner or later he’ll tire of politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟早他会厌倦政治的。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy doing something again and again, especially in a way that annoys other people
Sense.TRAN: 不厌其烦地做某事〔因此令人厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never tires of talking about the good old days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是不厌其烦地谈论过去的好时光。

Sense.DEF: to make someone very tired
Sense.TRAN: 使精疲力竭﹐使疲劳不堪
Sense.EXAMPLE: All that walking tired me out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走了那么多路﹐把我累坏了。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
tyre
feeling that you want to sleep or rest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m so tired I could sleep for a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累得一觉能睡一个星期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was too tired to argue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他累得不想争吵。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He looks tired out very tired .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看起来累坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No,’ Frank said in a tired voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不。”弗兰克语带疲倦地说。

Sense.DEF: bored with something, because it is no longer interesting, or has become annoying
Sense.TRAN: 对（做）某事感到厌烦[厌倦]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of watching television; let’s go for a walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看电视都看腻了﹐我们出去走走吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was getting tired of all her negative remarks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对她的那些消极言论越来越感到厌烦了。

Sense.DEF: familiar and boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: tired old speeches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陈词滥调

Exponent.DEF: feeling that you want to sleep or rest
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was really tired the next day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天我非常累。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the tired faces of the children
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们疲倦的面容

Exponent.DEF: extremely tired
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was exhausted after the long trip home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 长途旅行回家后﹐我累得筋疲力尽。

Exponent.DEF: very tired because you have been working hard
Exponent.EXAMPLE: With three small children to care for, she was always worn out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要照料三个年幼的孩子﹐她总是累得筋疲力尽。

Exponent.DEF: tired because you have been travelling, worrying, or doing something for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因旅行﹑担心或长久做某事而〕疲倦的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: weary travellers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 疲倦的游客
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a weary sigh
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 疲惫的叹息
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looks tired and weary after 20 years in office.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 任职20年﹐他看上去又累又倦。

Exponent.DEF: very tired and feeling as if all your energy has gone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Afterwards, he felt drained, both physically and mentally.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来﹐他感到身心俱疲。

Exponent.DEF: very tired
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m bushed. I think I’ll go to bed early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累极了﹐我想早点睡觉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m beat. I don’t think I’ll go for a run tonight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累死了﹐今晚不想去跑步了。

Exponent.DEF: extremely tired
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I first started teaching, I came home shattered every night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚开始教书的时候﹐每晚回到家都精疲力竭。

Exponent.DEF: extremely tired, so that you cannot do anything but sleep
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was absolutely dead by the time I got home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到家时累得半死。

Sense.DEF: working very hard in a determined way without stopping
Sense.TRAN: 不知疲倦的﹐孜孜不倦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tireless efforts of the rescue workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营救人员坚持不懈的努力

Sense.DEF: making you feel annoyed or impatient
Sense.EXAMPLE: the whole tiresome business of filling out the forms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 填写表格这套烦人事
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with tiring making you feel tired 不要与tiring混淆: It was a long, tiring day. 这是漫长而累人的一天。

Sense.DEF: making you feel that you want to sleep or rest
Sense.TRAN: 令人困倦的﹔令人疲劳的﹐令人感到累的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve all had a long tiring day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家都经历了漫长而劳累的一天。

Exponent.DEF: making you feel that you want to sleep or rest
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The journey was really tiring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅途非常劳累。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve had such a tiring day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天可累得够呛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was tiring work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是件累人的差事。

Exponent.DEF: extremely tiring
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had to drive nine hours without a break – it was exhausting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一刻不停地开了九小时的车——让人精疲力竭。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an exhausting week of singing, acting, and dancing
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱歌﹑表演﹑跳舞﹐令人精疲力竭的一周

Exponent.DEF: very tiring and difficult – used about days, journeys etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hard day at work
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛苦工作的一天
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The last part of the journey was very hard.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅途的最后一程很艰难。

Exponent.DEF: tiring because you have to use a lot of your mental energy, and often become bored – used about people, situations etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I find her constant questions rather wearing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不停地问问题我觉得很烦。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kids of that age can be very wearing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个年龄的孩子会很烦人。

Exponent.DEF: very tiring physically or mentally – used when you have to keep doing something for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 使人疲劳的﹐累心的〔用于必须长久地做某事时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gruelling journey across the desert
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越沙漠的劳累旅途
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a gruelling race
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰苦的比赛
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a punishing schedule
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁重的日程安排

Exponent.DEF: backbreaking work is extremely tiring and needs a lot of physical effort
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Clearing the land was slow backbreaking work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 清理土地费时又费力。

Sense.DEF: it is - used especially in poetry
a piece of soft thin paper, used especially for blowing your nose on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a box of tissues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒面巾纸

Sense.DEF: light thin paper used for wrapping, packing etc
the material forming animal or plant cells
a story or account that is completely untrue
a woman’s breast
to annoy someone a lot
a type of small European bird
Sense.TRAN: 山雀〔欧洲的一种小型鸟〕

Sense.DEF: a very strong or important person
very big, strong, impressive etc
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的﹔力大无比的﹔重大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a titanic struggle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大搏斗

Sense.DEF:
a large British passenger ship which was considered impossible to sink, but which hit an
iceberg
in the Atlantic Ocean, and as a result sank, killing more than 1,500 of its passengers. According to one story, the band continued playing while the ship was sinking. People sometimes use the phrase ‘like rearranging the deckchairs on the Titanic’ to describe the actions of a person or organization which makes small and useless changes to a situation, when the situation is already hopeless and certain to fail.
Sense.TRAN: “泰坦尼克”号〔英国大型客轮﹐曾被认为不可能沉没﹐但在大西洋撞上冰山﹐造成1,500多名乘客遇难﹔like rearranging the deckchairs on the Titanic 用于形容人们在绝望情形下所作的于事无补的努力〕

Sense.DEF:
a strong light silver-white metal that is used to make aircraft and spacecraft, and is often combined with other metals. It is a chemical
element
: symbol Ti
Sense.TRAN: 钛〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Ti〕

Sense.DEF:
in Greek
mythology
, the first gods who ruled the universe, before Zeus became the most powerful god. They were thought of as
giants like humans, but extremely large and tall
.
Sense.TRAN: 提坦〔希腊神话中﹐在宙斯成为最强大的神之前最早统治宇宙的众神﹐形象为巨人〕

Sense.DEF: a small piece of food
a small but interesting piece of information etc
a humorous or insulting way of talking to or about a small person
Sense.TRAN: 矬子﹐小不点儿〔对身材矮小的人的谑称或贬称〕

Sense.DEF: extremely small
something bad that you do to someone because they have done something bad to you
a particular amount that some Christians give to their church
a tax paid to the church in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时支付给基督教会的〕什一税

Sense.DEF: if a picture or a story titillates someone, it makes them feel sexually interested
the name given to a particular book, painting, play etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔书籍﹑绘画﹑戏剧等的〕题目﹐标题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The title of this play is ‘Othello’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部剧的剧名是《奥赛罗》。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something is called... , rather than saying its title is... .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 something is called...﹐不说its title is...

Sense.DEF: a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UK’s 20 best-selling titles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国20种最畅销的书

Subsense.DEF: a name such as ‘Sir’ or ‘Professor’, or abbreviations such as ‘Mrs’ or ‘Dr’, that are used before someone’s name to show their rank or profession, whether they are married etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔表明某人地位﹑职业﹑婚姻状况等的〕头衔﹐称谓

Subsense.DEF: a name that describes someone’s job or position
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her official title is editor.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的正式职称是编辑。

Sense.DEF: the position of being the winner of an important sports competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tyson won the WBA title in 1987.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰森于1987年赢得了世界拳击协会冠军的头衔。

Sense.DEF: law the legal right to have or own something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has title to the land.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拥有那块土地的所有权。

Sense.DEF: the coloured bar at the top of a computer window that shows the name of the program and whether it is being used at that time

having a title in the
aristocracy
, such as ‘lord’,
duke
,
earl
etc
Sense.TRAN: 有贵族头衔的﹐有爵位的

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper giving legal proof that someone owns a particular property
the person or team that is the winner of an important sports competition
someone who owns a title deed
Sense.TRAN: 房地产契据持有人﹐产权人

Sense.DEF: the page at the front of a book which shows the book’s name, the writer etc
the main acting part in a play or film, which is the same as the name of the play or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔主角与剧作或电影名称一样的〕剧名角色﹐片名角色

Sense.DEF:
the song on a
cd
,
cassette
etc that has the same name as the whole CD or cassette
Sense.TRAN: 〔激光唱片﹑磁带等的〕标题歌曲

Sense.DEF: someone who has won an important sports competition
to laugh quietly in a high voice, especially because you are nervous
Sense.TRAN: 窃笑﹔傻笑﹔嗤嗤地笑 〔尤因紧张〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the word ‘breast’, some of the class tittered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到“乳房”这个词﹐班上有些同学嗤嗤地笑了起来。

Sense.DEF: unimportant conversation about other people and what they are doing
a woman’s breast
someone who is the official leader or ruler of a country but who does not have real power or authority

a system that allows you to record television programmes
digitally
feeling worried, nervous, and confused
Sense.TRAN: 焦虑不安的﹐心慌意乱的

Sense.DEF: a place where two roads meet and form the shape of the letter T
the first letters of the words in a three-word phrase, for example BTW (‘by the way’) or IMO (‘in my opinion’), used as a short form, especially on the Internet and in emails
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因特网上和电子邮件中使用的〕三个字母的缩写词

Sense.DEF: kindness and love that you show someone to make them feel better and happier

Sense.TRAN: a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= trademark 商标
an abbreviation of 缩写= transcendental meditation 超在禅定（法）﹐超脱静坐

Sense.DEF: a powerful explosive

Head.GRAM: used before the basic form of a verb to show that it is in the inf initive
Head.GRAMTRAN: 用于动词原形前表示是不定式

Subsense.DEF:
used after a verb, noun, or adjective when an
infinitive
completes its meaning
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于动词﹑名词或形容词后 使意思完整〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We tried to explain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们试图解释。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was starting to rain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始下雨了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The manager asked them to leave.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理要求他们离开。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to escape
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃跑的企图
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Have you got permission to stay here?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你获准待在这儿了吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Our team’s certain to win.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们队肯定会赢。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you ready to start?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备好开始了吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This delicious dessert is easy to make you can make it easily .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这道美味的甜点制作容易。

Subsense.DEF:
used by itself instead of an
infinitive
in order to avoid repeating the same verb
Subsense.TRAN: 〔代替不定式单独使用﹐以避免重复使用同一个动词〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can drive today if you want to if you want to drive .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天要是想开车﹐就开吧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I could have helped, but nobody asked me to.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本可以帮忙﹐但没人叫我。

Sense.DEF: used after a word such as ‘how’, ‘where’, ‘who’, ‘what’, or‘whether’to refer to an action about which someone is not certain
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于how﹐where﹐who﹐what 或 whether 之后﹐表示某人不确定的某个行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know where to go but I don’t know how to get there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道去什么地方﹐但我不知道怎样去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wondered whether or not to trust him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知道该不该信任他。

Sense.DEF: used to show a purpose or intention
Sense.EXAMPLE: They left early to catch the 7.30 train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们早早动身去赶7点30分的火车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To find out more about university courses, write to this address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想要了解更多大学课程的信息﹐按此地址来函。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need more money to improve transport in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要更多资金来改善伦敦的交通状况。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often use in order to rather than just to when expressing a purpose or intention, because it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们经常用in order to而不只是to表示“为了…”﹐因为这样听上去更正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Investment has been increased in order to improve the transport system.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经增加了投资以改善交通。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to an action or state, when describing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s nice to be wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被人需要感觉很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s finding it hard to cope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现这件事很难应付。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To say I am disappointed is an understatement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说我失望只是轻描淡写。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The simplest solution would be to increase the price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最简单的解决办法就是提高价格。

Sense.DEF: used to say what can or cannot be done, or what should be done
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示能否做什么或应该做什么〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll soon be old enough to vote in elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你很快就到可以投票的年龄了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not have the energy to resist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无力抵抗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m too tired to go out tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我太累了﹐今晚没法出去。

Sense.DEF: used after the verb ‘be’ to give an order or to state arrangements for the future
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于动词be后﹐表示下指令或说明未来的安排〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You are to wait here until I return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要在这儿等到我回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are to be married on May 25th.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将于5月25日结婚。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone discovers or experiences when they do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔指某人做某事时的发现或经历〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He arrived there to find that the last train had already left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赶到那里﹐发现最后一班火车已经开走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The princess stepped ashore to be greeted by an enthusiastic crowd of admirers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王妃踏上岸﹐受到一群崇拜者的热烈欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She woke to see Ben standing by the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醒来时看到本站在窗边。

Sense.DEF: used to say what your attitude or purpose is in saying something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never heard of him, to be quite honest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老实说﹐我从未听说过他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To begin with, let’s look at Chapter 3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐让我们来看第三章。

Sense.DEF: used to say where someone or something goes
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood up and walked to the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站起来走到窗前。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the road to London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往伦敦的路
Sense.EXAMPLE: our weekly trip to the supermarket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每周一次的超级市场之行
Sense.EXAMPLE: sending a spaceship to Mars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向火星发射宇宙飞船
Sense.EXAMPLE: These people go from house to house selling goods visit many different houses .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人挨家挨户兜售货物。

Sense.DEF: used to say who receives something or is told or shown something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sent presents to the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给孩子们寄了礼物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She whispered something to the girl beside her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她悄悄跟旁边的女孩说了些什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give my best wishes to your parents when you see them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见到你的父母﹐替我向他们问好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t show these letters to anyone else.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要给其他任何人看这些信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a message from the Emperor to his people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇帝向臣民下的谕旨

Sense.DEF: used to show in which direction something is in relation to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knutsford is about 16 miles to the south of Manchester
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳茨福德位于曼彻斯特以南约16英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a table to the left of the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门口左边有一张桌子。

Sense.DEF: used to show the purpose, event, or activity for which you go somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sophie goes to gymnastics every Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲每周五都去做体操。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you get an invitation to their wedding?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你接到他们婚礼的邀请函了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget, we’re going to a party tomorrow night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了﹐我们明晚要去参加聚会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he needed help, Mother came rushing to the rescue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他需要帮助﹐母亲就赶紧来帮忙。

Sense.DEF: used to say what state someone or something is in as a result of an action or change
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sang the baby to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唱歌哄宝宝入睡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait until the lights change to green.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等绿灯再走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a return to a traditional way of life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统生活方式的回归

Sense.DEF: used to say that one thing is touching another
Sense.EXAMPLE: He held a knife to her throat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿着一把刀抵在她的喉咙上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They danced cheek to cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们脸贴着脸跳舞。

Sense.DEF: used to say where something is fastened or connected
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tied the rope to a tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把绳子系到一棵树上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Attach a recent photograph to your application form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在申请表上附一张近照。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cash machines are linked up to a central computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自动取款机和一台中央电脑连接。

Sense.DEF: facing something or in front of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat with my back to the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我背对窗户坐着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were standing face to face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们面对面站着。

Sense.DEF: used to show a relationship with someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: George’s sister was married to an Italian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治的姐姐嫁给了一个意大利人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was first cousin to King Philip VI.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是国王腓力六世的表亲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The robbery may be linked to other crimes of violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次抢劫有可能和其他暴力犯罪有关联。

Subsense.DEF: as far as a particular point or limit
Subsense.TRAN: 达到〔某一点或某个限度〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She can already count from one to twenty.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经能从1数到20了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The water came right up to our knees.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水一直涨到了我们的膝部。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Temperatures dropped to 25 degrees below zero.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度降到了零下25度。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s ten kilometres from here to the coast.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这儿到海边有10公里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She read the novel from beginning to end.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把小说从头到尾看了一遍。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Does your interest in nuclear physics extend to nuclear weaponry?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对核物理的兴趣是不是还包括核武器？

Subsense.DEF: until and including a particular time or date
Subsense.TRAN: 直到﹐到…为止〔并包括在内〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They stayed from Friday night to Sunday morning.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从星期五晚上待到了星期日早上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be on duty from 8 am to 10 pm.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从上午8点到晚上10点值班。

Sense.DEF: used to say what or who an action, attitude, situation etc affects or is related to
Sense.TRAN: 对﹐对于〔指受某一行为﹑某种态度﹑情况等影响的对象〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory clearly represents a danger to health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂对于健康显然是个危害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always been kind to animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一向善待动物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his attitude to life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对生活的态度
Sense.EXAMPLE: What have you done to the radio? It’s not working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把收音机怎么了？它不响了。

Sense.DEF: used to say who someone works for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane is secretary to the managing director.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简是总经理的秘书。

Sense.DEF: used to say what something is needed for
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m still waiting for an answer to my question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还在等待我的问题能有个回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen the key to the back door?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到过后门的钥匙吗？

Sense.DEF: used when comparing two things, numbers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: England beat Scotland by two goals to one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队以二比一击败了苏格兰队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes, she was punished, but it was nothing to what she deserved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是的﹐她受到了惩罚﹐但是与应得的惩罚比起来就不算什么了。

Sense.DEF: used to say who has a particular attitude or opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole thing sounds very suspicious to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整件事在我听来十分可疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tickets cost £10 each and to some people that’s a lot of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门票每张10英镑﹐这对有些人来说是不少钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To my mind, age does not matter; love is what matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐年龄不是问题﹐爱情才最重要。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone’s reaction is when something happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示某事发生时某人的反应〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much to everyone’s surprise she passed the exam with distinction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让大伙吃惊的是﹐她竟然以优异的成绩通过了考试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I discovered to my horror that my passport was missing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我惊恐地发现我的护照不见了。

Sense.DEF: used when saying how much time there is before a particular event or time
Sense.TRAN: 〔离某件事或某时间〕还差…时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only two weeks to Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离圣诞节只有两个星期了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long is it to dinner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到晚饭时间还有多久？

GramExa.PROPFORM: ten to five/twenty to one etc
GramExa.GLOSS: ten minutes, twenty minutes etc before a particular hour

Subsense.DEF: used when talking about a rate or quantity to say how many smaller units equal a larger unit
Subsense.TRAN: 等于﹐每一〔表示数量或比率〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re only getting 130 yen to the dollar at the moment.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前一美元仅能兑换130日元。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are just over four and a half litres to a gallon
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1加仑大约有4.5升多一点。

Subsense.DEF: used to show the relationship between two different measurements or quantities
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于表示两个不同度量﹑数量之间的关系〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The car will do over 40 miles to the gallon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车1 加仑汽油能行驶40多英里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The scale of your map is one inch to the mile.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这张地图的比例尺为一英寸比一英里。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular sound is heard at the same time as something happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示某事发生时伴随的声音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I woke to the sound of torrential rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在滂沱的雨声中醒来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The royal couple arrived to a fanfare of trumpets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室夫妇在一片号角花彩声中抵达。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like to exercise to music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢伴着音乐进行锻炼。

Sense.DEF: used between two numbers when you do not know exactly what the real number or amount is
Sense.TRAN: 至﹐到〔用于两个数字之间﹐表示估计数字〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must have been eighteen to twenty thousand people at the concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场音乐会上肯定有一万八到两万人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drowned in 10 to 12 feet of water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他淹死在10到12英尺深的水中。

Sense.DEF: if you have something or someone to yourself, you do not have to share them with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the first time I’d had a room to myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我第一次独自拥有一个房间。

Sense.DEF: used to say what the chances of something happening are
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll bet you ten to one he’ll forget all about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和你打赌﹐他十有八九会把这事忘得干干净净。

Sense.DEF: if a door is pushed to, it closes or almost closes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind blew the door to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风把门吹上了。

Sense.DEF:
a small animal that looks like a large
frog
and lives mostly on land

a British dish made of
sausages
cooked in a mixture of eggs, milk, and flour
Sense.TRAN: 面裹烤香肠〔一道英国菜〕

Sense.DEF:
a wild plant like a
mushroom
, that can be poisonous
someone who pretends to like an important person and does things for them, so that that person will help them – used to show disapproval
to pretend to like an important person and do things for them, so that they will help you – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 谄媚﹐奉承﹐拍马屁〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: toadying to the boss
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍老板的马屁

Sense.DEF: if someone or something moves to and fro, they move in one direction and then back again
continuous movement of people or things from place to place
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或物的〕来来往往﹐川流不息

Sense.DEF: bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a piece of toast for breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早饭吃了一片吐司。

Sense.DEF: if you drink a toast to someone, you drink something in order to thank them, wish them luck etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔为答谢或祝福某人而进行的〕祝酒﹐敬酒﹐干杯
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to propose a toast ask people to drink a toast to the bride and groom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提议为新郎新娘干杯。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the toast of Broadway/Hollywood etc
Sense.DEF: to be very popular and praised by many people for something you have done in a particular field of work
Sense.TRAN: 百老汇/好莱坞等的大红人

Sense.DEF: very warm and comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sat near the fire, warm as toast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坐在火边﹐温暖又舒适。

Sense.DEF: to be in trouble because of something you have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you challenge her, you’re toast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你和她对着来﹐那是自找麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to drink a glass of wine etc to thank some-one, wish someone luck, or celebrate something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They toasted the birth of their new baby with champagne.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用香槟酒庆贺自己孩子的出生。

Sense.DEF: to make bread or other food brown by placing it close to heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: I toasted the cheese sandwiches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我烤了干酪三明治。

Sense.DEF: to sit near a fire to make yourself warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom was toasting his feet by the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆在火边烘脚。

Sense.DEF: a machine you use for toasting bread
a long fork used to hold bread over a fire to toast it

someone who introduces the speakers at a formal occasion such as a
banquet large formal meal
Sense.TRAN: 〔在宴会等正式场合中介绍演讲者的〕（宴会）主持人

Sense.DEF: warm and comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: our nice toasty bed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们温暖舒适的床

Sense.DEF: the dried brown leaves that are smoked in cigarettes, pipes etc
the plant that produces these leaves
someone who has a shop that sells tobacco, cigarettes etc
Sense.TRAN: 烟草店老板﹐烟草经销商

Sense.DEF: a shop that sells tobacco, cigarettes etc
someone who will soon be married, soon be a parent etc
Sense.TRAN: 准新郎/丈夫/父亲[母亲]等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magazine aimed at young mums-to-be
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对年轻准妈妈的杂志

Sense.DEF: a light wooden board with a curved front, used for sliding down hills covered in snow
to slide down a hill on a toboggan
a piece of music, usually for piano or organ, that is played very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 托卡塔〔一种用钢琴或管风琴快速演奏的乐曲〕

Sense.DEF: a loud warning bell, used in the past
by yourself
on the day that is happening now
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t go shopping yesterday so I’ll have to go today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨天没能去买东西﹐所以今天我必须去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed has his music lesson today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德今天有音乐课。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re going on holiday today week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下周的这个时候要去度假。

Sense.DEF: at the present time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students today seem to know very little about geography.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的学生似乎对地理知识了解得很少。

Sense.DEF: the day that is happening now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Today is my birthday!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天是我的生日！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen today’s paper?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看今天的报纸了吗？

Sense.DEF: the present period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Today’s computers are becoming much smaller and lighter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的电脑越来越小﹐越来越轻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: young people of today
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的年轻人

Sense.DEF: if a small child toddles, it walks with short, unsteady steps
to walk somewhere, especially in a slow and relaxed way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every afternoon, Marge would toddle down to the library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天下午﹐玛吉都会溜达到图书馆。

Sense.DEF: a very young child who is just learning to walk
Sense.TRAN: 学步的儿童﹐刚学走路的小孩

Sense.DEF:
a hot drink made with
whisky
, sugar, and hot water
Sense.TRAN: 托地酒﹐香甜热酒〔由威士忌加糖和热水调制而成〕

Sense.DEF: extremely good or desirable – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 好得要命的﹐极合意的〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Betty’s strawberry cheesecake is simply to-die-for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝蒂的草莓奶酪蛋糕好吃极了。

Sense.DEF: a lot of unnecessary excitement or angry feelings about something
Sense.TRAN: 无谓的骚动[喧闹]﹔大惊小怪
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was such a to-do when I said I didn’t want to be married in a church!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说我不想在教堂里举行婚礼﹐就引起这么大的震动！

Sense.DEF: one of the five movable parts at the end of your foot
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stubbed his toe hurt it by kicking it against something on a rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脚趾踢到一块石头上受了伤。

GramExa.GLOSS: the largest of your toes

Sense.DEF: the part of a shoe or sock that covers the front part of your foot
to offend someone, especially by becoming involved in something that they are responsible for
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因涉足别人负责的范围而〕得罪某人﹐触犯某人

Sense.DEF: to make sure that someone is ready for anything that might happen
Sense.TRAN: 使某人随时准备行动﹔使某人保持警觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: They do random checks to keep workers on their toes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们进行随机抽查﹐让工人不懈怠。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very embarrassed or uncomfortable
Sense.TRAN: 使某人感到尴尬﹔使某人感到不舒服

Sense.DEF: to bend downwards so that your hands touch your toes, without bending your knees
Sense.TRAN: 〔膝盖不弯曲〕躬身用手碰脚趾

Sense.LEXUNIT: put/dip a toe in the water
Sense.DEF: to try a little of something or try an activity for a short time to see if you like it
to do what other people in a job or organization say you should do, whether you agree with them or not
Sense.TRAN: 〔不管同意与否〕听从命令﹐服从纪律﹐按规定行事
Sense.EXAMPLE: You toe the line or you don’t stay on the team!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要么服从纪律﹐要么就别待在队里！

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal or leather that covers the front part of a shoe
your first involvement in a particular activity, from which you can develop and become stronger
Sense.TRAN: 〔事业发展壮大的〕初步的立脚点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has gained a toehold in the competitive computer market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司在竞争激烈的电脑市场初步站稳了脚跟。

Sense.DEF: a place on a rock where you can put your foot when you are climbing
Sense.TRAN: 〔攀岩时可落脚的〕立足点﹐踏足点

Sense.DEF: the hard part that covers the top of each of your toes
someone you dislike
someone who is rich or has a high social position – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 有钱人﹔上流人士〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a sticky sweet brown substance that you can eat, made by boiling sugar, water, and butter together, or a piece of this substance
to be very bad at doing something
Sense.TRAN: 根本干不了某事﹐完全无法胜任某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can’t sing for toffee!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本就不会唱歌！

Sense.DEF: an apple covered with toffee and put on a stick
Sense.TRAN: 太妃苹果〔苹果外裹有太妃糖﹐插于棍上〕

Sense.DEF: a toffee-nosed person thinks that they are better than other people because of their social position – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 势利的﹔好摆架子的﹐自命不凡的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
a soft white food made from
soya beans
, used in cooking instead of meat
clothes

a unit for measuring the warmth of
duvets
,
sleeping bags
, jackets etc
Sense.TRAN: 托格〔计量羽绒被﹑睡袋﹑外套等保暖性的单位〕

Sense.DEF: to be or get dressed for a particular occasion or activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔为出席特殊场合或活动而〕打扮起来

Sense.DEF: a long loose piece of clothing worn by people in ancient Rome
Sense.TRAN: 托加袍〔古罗马人穿的宽松长袍〕

Sense.DEF: if two or more people do something together, they do it with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve very much enjoyed working together .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在一起工作非常开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve decided to spend more time together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定要花更多时间在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He and my father were at school together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和我父亲一起上过学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Together they went back inside the villa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一起回到了别墅里。

Sense.DEF: if you put two or more things together, you join them so that they touch or form one whole thing or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d tried to glue the broken pieces together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他曾试图把那些碎片粘在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mix the butter and sugar together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄油和糖搅拌在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She clasped her hands together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双手紧握着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took the engine apart and then put it back together again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把发动机拆开﹐然后又重新装起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The model was held together with string.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个模型是用细绳连在一起的。

Sense.DEF: if two people are together, they are married, or are having a romantic or sexual relationship
Sense.TRAN: 在一起〔指夫妻或有恋爱关系或性关系的两个人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark and I have been together eight years now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克和我在一起已经八年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are those two together?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩是一对吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people live together before getting married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人先同居再结婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I don’t know what keeps us together .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时我都不知道是什么让我们在一起的。

Sense.DEF: if you keep, collect etc things together, you keep or collect them all in one place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She keeps all the important documents together in one file.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把所有重要的文件都一起保存在一个文件夹里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Embarrassed, she gathered her things together and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尴尬地收起东西离开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goods of a similar kind should be stored together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同类货物应存放在一起。

Sense.DEF: if people or objects are close together, packed together etc, they are placed very near to each other
Sense.TRAN: 紧挨在一起/塞在一起/挤在一起等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees had been planted a little too close together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些树种得有点太密了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The climbers were sitting huddled together for warmth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山者紧挨着坐在一起取暖。

Sense.DEF: if you rub or hit things together, you rub or hit them against each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Max was rubbing his hands together with glee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯高兴地搓着双手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knock the brushes together to clean them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把刷子相互拍一拍弄干净。

Sense.DEF: if people are together, come together etc, they are or become united, especially in order to try and achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 团结一致地﹐齐心协力地﹐合作地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Together we can win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 团结一致﹐我们就能取胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Conference called on all good men to come together to resist anarchism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议号召所有正义人士团结一致﹐抵制无政府主义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said that the main purpose of the Baha’i Faith was to bring people together .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说巴哈伊教的主要宗旨是把人们团结起来。

Sense.DEF: at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both letters should have arrived. I mailed them together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两封信都应该到了。我是一起寄的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh!’ they said together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “哦！”他们齐声说道。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell a group of people to all say or do something at the same time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Right men. All together now…Push!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的﹐伙计们。现在大家一起来——推！

Sense.DEF: when two amounts or quantities are added together, they are combined
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add these numbers together and then divide the total by 7.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些数字相加﹐然后把总数除以7。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Together they won only 21% of the votes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一共只获得21%的选票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The table and chairs are together worth about £200.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子和椅子合计约200英镑。

Subsense.DEF: in addition to something else
Subsense.TRAN: 和某物/某人一起﹐连同某物/某人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just bring it back to the store, together with your receipt.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它连同收据一起拿回店里来就行了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Becoming self-employed meant giving up a secure salary, together with sick leave and long vacation time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己单干意味着放弃稳定的工资﹐还有病假和长假。

Subsense.DEF: used to mention someone else who is also involved in an activity or situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He, together with Bill Dunn, decided to climb out of the canyon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和比尔•邓恩决定一起爬出峡谷。

Sense.DEF: someone who is together is confident, thinks clearly, and does things in a sensible organized way – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕思路清晰的﹐处事明智的﹐条理井然的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane is such a together person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简是个很有条理的人。

Sense.DEF: the practice of taking a holiday with many people from your family, such as grandparents, aunts etc, or with many of your friends
the pleasant feeling you have when you are part of a group of people who have a close relationship with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the togetherness we felt at college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在大学里感到的团结友爱

Sense.DEF: a small piece of wood or plastic that is used as a button on coats, bags etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用作外衣﹑背包等纽扣的〕栓扣﹐棒形纽扣

Sense.DEF: something on a computer that lets you change from one operation to another
a small part on a machine that is used to turn electricity on and off by moving it up or down
to work very hard for a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 长时间地苦干﹐辛苦劳作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been toiling away at this essay all weekend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整个周末都在埋头写这篇文章。

Sense.DEF: to move slowly and with great effort

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They toiled slowly up the hill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吃力地慢慢爬上了山。

Sense.DEF: hard unpleasant work done over a long period
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life of toil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛劳的一生

Sense.DEF: if you are caught in the toils of an unpleasant feeling or situation, you are trapped by it
a large bowl that you sit on to get rid of waste liquid or waste matter from your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He flushed the toilet pulled the handle so that water ran into the toilet to clean it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放水冲了马桶。

Sense.DEF: a room or building containing a toilet
Sense.EXAMPLE: public toilets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共厕所

Sense.DEF: to pass waste liquid or waste matter from your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mummy, I need to go to the toilet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐我要上厕所！

Sense.DEF: the act of washing and dressing yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: She finished her toilet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梳洗打扮已毕。

Sense.DEF:
a bag in which you keep things such as soap,
toothpaste
etc when travelling
Sense.TRAN: 〔旅行时带着的〕盥洗包﹐梳洗用具袋

Sense.DEF: soft thin paper used for cleaning yourself after you have used the toilet

things such as soap and
toothpaste
that are used for cleaning yourself
toilet paper that is wound around a small tube
when you teach a child to use a toilet

a kind of
perfume pleasant-smelling liquid
that does not have a very strong smell
movement backwards and forwards many times between two or more places
a lot of activity that does not help you to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: After much toing and froing, they finally reached a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几经折腾﹐他们终于作出了决定。

Sense.DEF:
to breathe in the smoke from a
marijuana
cigarette
a round piece of metal that you use instead of money in some machines
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某些机器上用来代替钱的〕金属代币

Sense.DEF: something that represents a feeling, fact, event etc

GramExa.PROPFORM: a token of your gratitude/respect/appreciation etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please accept this gift as a small token of our appreciation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 区区薄礼﹐略表谢意﹐还请笑纳。

Sense.DEF: a special piece of paper that you can exchange for a book, record etc in a shop
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店的〕购书礼券/唱片礼券/礼品券
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £10 book token
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张10英镑的购书券

Sense.DEF: a token action, change etc is small and not very important, and is usually only done so that someone can pretend that they are dealing with a problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑变化等〕装样子的﹐装模作样的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government thinks it can get away with token gestures on environmental issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府以为它在环境问题上做个样子就能敷衍过去。

Sense.DEF: someone who is included in a group to make everyone think that the group has all types of people in it, when this is not really true
Sense.TRAN: 〔吸收进某团体以示平等的〕象征性女性/黑人等

Sense.DEF: done as a first sign that an agreement, promise etc will be kept and that more will be done later
Sense.TRAN: 象征性的〔指为了表示守信而做﹐并将会做得更多〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small token payment will keep the bank happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 象征性地付点钱﹐银行就会满意了。

Sense.DEF: actions that are intended to make people think that an organization deals fairly with people or problems, when in fact it does not

the past tense and past participle of
tell
a situation that is tolerable is not very good, but you are able to accept it
Sense.TRAN: 〔状况〕可接受的﹐过得去的﹐尚好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The apartment is really too small, but it’s tolerable for the time being.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套公寓实在太小﹐不过暂时还能凑合。

Sense.DEF: unpleasant or painful and only just able to be accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat in this room is barely tolerable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间里热得让人要受不了了。

Sense.DEF: fairly, but not very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were tolerably happy at first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始我们还算比较幸福。

Sense.DEF: willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tolerance towards religious minorities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对宗教少数派的包容

Sense.DEF: the degree to which someone can suffer pain, difficulty etc without being harmed or damaged
Sense.TRAN: 〔痛苦﹑困难等的〕忍受程度﹐忍耐力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many old people have a very limited tolerance to cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老年人御寒能力很差。

Sense.DEF:
an area of a town or city where
prostitutes
are allowed to work legally
allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Luckily, my parents were tolerant of my choice of music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是﹐我的父母对我选择听什么音乐持宽容态度。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a tolerant society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽容的社会

Sense.DEF: plants that are tolerant of particular weather or soil conditions can exist in those conditions
Sense.TRAN: 〔植物〕能在…情况下生存的﹐能耐…的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能耐海风的树木

Sense.DEF: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

Sense.DEF: to be able to accept something unpleasant or difficult, even though you do not like it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t tolerate the long hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受不了这种长时间工作。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say stand rather than tolerate .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 stand﹐而不说tolerate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how she can stand working there.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白﹐她在这儿上班怎么受得了。

Sense.DEF: if a plant tolerates particular weather or soil conditions, it can exist in them
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants that tolerate drought
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耐旱的植物

Sense.DEF: if a person or their body can tolerate a food or other substance, it can use it without becoming ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women’s bodies can tolerate less alcohol than men’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性的体质对酒精的耐受力比男性要差一些。

Sense.DEF: willingness to allow people to believe what they want without being criticized or punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious toleration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教宽容

Sense.DEF: the number of people killed or injured in a particular accident, by a particular illness etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔事故﹑疾病等造成的〕死亡人数﹔伤亡人数
Sense.EXAMPLE: The death toll has risen to 83.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡人数已上升到83人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bombings took a heavy toll , killing hundreds of Londoners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸造成严重伤亡﹐有几百名伦敦人丧生。

Sense.DEF: a very bad effect that something has on something or someone over a long period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Years of smoking have taken their toll on his health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年的吸烟习惯已严重损害他的健康。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a heavy toll on the environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对环境的严重损害

Sense.DEF: the money you have to pay to use a particular road, bridge etc
the sound of a large bell ringing slowly
if a large bell tolls, or if you toll it, it keeps ringing slowly, especially to show that someone has died
a place where you pay to drive on a road, bridge etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔道路﹑桥梁等征收通行费的〕收费亭[处]

Sense.DEF: a bridge that you pay to drive across
if you telephone a particular number toll-free, you do not have to pay for the call
a gate across a road, at which you have to pay money before you can drive any further
Sense.TRAN: 〔公路上收通行费的〕收费站﹐收费处

Sense.DEF: a road that you pay to use
a large long road that you pay to use

a
tomcat

a light
axe
used by Native Americans
Sense.TRAN: 〔北美印第安人用的〕轻斧﹐战斧

Sense.DEF: a round soft red fruit eaten raw or cooked as a vegetable
a stone structure above or below the ground where a dead person is buried
Sense.EXAMPLE: the family tomb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家族坟墓

Sense.DEF: a game in which you buy a ticket with a number on it in order to try and win a prize that has the same number on it
a girl who likes playing the same games as boys
Sense.TRAN: 野丫头﹐假小子〔指喜欢玩男孩子游戏的女孩子〕

Sense.DEF:
a stone that is put on a
grave
and shows the dead person’s name, dates of birth and death etc

the activity of jumping from a high cliff or
pier
into water for fun
Sense.TRAN: 悬崖跳水﹐极限跳水〔指从很高的悬崖或码头跳入水中的活动〕

Sense.DEF: a male cat
a large heavy book
silly behaviour
a gun that can fire many bullets very quickly
on or during the day after today
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our class is going to London tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们班明天要去伦敦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Terry’s new job starts a week tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里的新工作从明天算起一个星期后开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re meeting tomorrow evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们明天晚上要见面。

Sense.DEF: the day after today
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you at tomorrow’s meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天会上见。

Sense.DEF: the future, especially the near future
Sense.TRAN: 来日﹐未来〔尤指不久的将来〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computers of tomorrow will be smaller and more powerful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未来的电脑体积更小﹐功能更强大。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth like there’s no tomorrow
Sense.DEF: do something very quickly and carelessly, without worrying about the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rita’s spending money like there’s no tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丽塔正在拼命花钱﹐就像过了今天没有明天似的。

Sense.DEF:
a character in a
fairy tale a story for children in which magical things happen
who was only as big as a person’s thumb
Sense.TRAN: 拇指汤姆〔童话故事中的一个人物﹐仅拇指大小〕

Sense.DEF: a tall narrow drum that you play with your hands
a unit for measuring weight, equal to 2,240 pounds or 1,016 kilograms in Britain, and 2,000 pounds or 907.2 kilograms in the US
a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got tons of work to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有很多工作要做。

Sense.DEF: to be very heavy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your bag weighs a ton!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的包好沉！

Sense.LEXUNIT: come down on sb like a ton of bricks
Sense.DEF: to get very angry with someone about something they have done

Sense.LEXUNIT: hit sb like a ton of bricks
Sense.DEF: to have a strong emotional effect on someone
relating to tones of colour or sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tonal range she uses is wide and varied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她使用的色调丰富多彩。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of music that is tonal is based on a particular
key

the character of a piece of music that depends on the
key
of the music and the way in which the tunes and
harmonies
are combined
the way your voice sounds, which shows how you are feeling or what you mean

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘You must be Annie,’ he said in a friendly tone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你一定是安妮。”他以友好的语气说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was urgency in his tone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气中透着急切。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her tone was sharp with anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很气愤﹐语气尖刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was obvious from her tone of voice that she didn’t like me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从她的语气明显听得出来她不喜欢我。

GramExa.PROPFORM: don’t take that tone with me
GramExa.GLOSS: do not speak to me in that rude or unpleasant way
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 别用那种语气跟我说话

Sense.DEF: the quality of a sound, especially the sound of a musical instrument or someone’s voice
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指乐器或某人说话的〕音调﹐音色﹐音质
Sense.EXAMPLE: the guitar’s clean tone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉他纯净的音色

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They talked in hushed tones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们压低声音交谈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No I didn’t,’ he said in a low tone quietly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不﹐我没有。”他轻声说。

GramExa.GLOSS: having a low, calm etc tone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 声音低沉的/声音平和的/声音很尖的等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an even-toned voice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 平和的声音

Sense.DEF: the general feeling or attitude expressed in a piece of writing, a speech, an activity etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔作品﹑演讲﹑活动等的〕基调﹐格调﹔气氛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tone of the report was radical.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告的基调十分激进。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The meetings were noted for their deeply religious tone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些聚会以其浓厚的宗教色彩著称。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The article was moderate in tone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那篇文章语气温和。

GramExa.GLOSS: establish the general attitude or feeling of an event, activity etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Opening remarks are important since they set the tone for the rest of the interview.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开场白很重要﹐因为它是为随后的访谈确定基调的。

Sense.DEF: one of the many types of a particular colour, each slightly darker, lighter, brighter etc than the next

GramExa.EXAMPLE: different tones of green
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 深浅不同的绿色

Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps a darker tone would be better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能再深一点的色调更好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: your skin tone the colour of your skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的肤色

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dried colour is slightly deeper in tone than it appears when first applied.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 颜色干了之后比刚涂上去时要略深一点。

Sense.DEF: a sound made by electronic equipment, such as a telephone
Sense.TRAN: 〔电话等电子设备发出的〕声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please leave a message after the tone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到提示音后请留言。

GramExa.GLOSS: the sound you hear when you pick up the telephone that lets you know that you can make a call
the sound you hear when you telephone someone but they are already talking to someone else

Sense.DEF: to make a place or event more or less socially acceptable, attractive etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: That horrible building lowers the whole tone of the neighborhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那栋丑陋的建筑物降低了周边的整体格调。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trust you to lower the tone of the conversation by making rude remarks etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就知道你会降低谈话的格调。

Sense.DEF: how firm and strong your muscles or skin are
Sense.TRAN: 〔肌肉﹑皮肤等的〕结实程度﹐强健
Sense.EXAMPLE: A regular brisk walk will improve muscle tone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常快走能使肌肉更加紧实。

Sense.DEF:
the difference in
pitch
between two musical notes that are separated by one
key
on the piano
how high or low your voice is when you produce different sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a falling tone on the first syllable and a rising tone on the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一个音节是降调﹐另一个音节是升调。

Sense.DEF: to improve the strength and firmness of your muscles, skin etc
Sense.TRAN: 使〔皮肤﹑肌肉等〕更强健﹐使更结实
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise can strengthen and tone muscles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼能使肌肉更强健结实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began to use weights in order to tone up his body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始举杠铃来健身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-toned body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健壮结实的身体

Sense.DEF: to reduce the effect of something such as a speech or piece of writing, so that people will not be offended
Sense.EXAMPLE: His advisers told him to tone down his speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的顾问叫他缓和演讲的语气。

Sense.DEF: to make a colour less bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blue can be used to tone down very sunny rooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以用蓝色使阳光十分充足的房间色彩变得柔和些。

Sense.DEF: if one colour or pattern tones in with another, they are similar and look good together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Choose candles that will tone in with your tablecloth and china.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要挑选与桌布和瓷器协调的蜡烛。

Sense.DEF: unable to hear the difference between different musical notes
Sense.TRAN: 不会辨别音调的﹐五音不全的

Sense.DEF: a language such as Chinese in which the way a sound goes up or down affects the meaning of the word
Sense.TRAN: 声调语言〔指声调不同会影响词义的语言﹐如汉语〕

Sense.DEF: a toneless voice does not express any feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m sorry,’ he said, in a flat toneless voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “对不起。”他以淡淡的声调说道。

Sense.DEF: a piece of music that has been written to represent an idea, place, or story
Sense.TRAN: 交响诗﹐音（乐）诗〔指表达思想﹑场所﹑故事的音乐作品〕

Sense.DEF: a type of ink that is used in machines that print or copy documents
Sense.TRAN: 〔打印机﹑复印机等用的〕墨粉﹐色粉

Sense.DEF: a liquid that you put on your face to make your skin feel soft and smooth
a tool that you use to lift up small objects. It has two bars joined at one end, that you press together to lift objects.
the soft part inside your mouth that you can move about and use for eating and speaking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe ran his tongue over his dry lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔舔了舔干燥的嘴唇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The taste of the chocolate was still on her tongue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力的余味依然留在她的舌尖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl scowled at me, then stuck out her tongue .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩怒视着我﹐然后吐了一下舌头。

Sense.DEF: to make a sharp noise with your tongue to show that you are annoyed or disappointed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She clicked her tongue and shook her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她咂了一下嘴﹐摇了摇头。

Sense.DEF: if you have a sharp tongue, you often talk in a way that shows you are angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gina’s sharp tongue will get her into trouble one day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉娜那张尖刻的嘴巴早晚会给她惹麻烦的。

Sense.DEF: if you have a silver tongue, you can talk in a way that makes people like you or persuades them that you are right
able to talk in a very angry or pleasant way
Sense.TRAN: 说话尖刻的/说话动听的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp-tongued young teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说话尖刻的年轻教师

Sense.DEF: if you say something with your tongue in your cheek, you say it as a joke, not seriously
a small mistake in something you say
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did I say $100? It must have been a slip of the tongue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说100美元吗？那一定是口误。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself saying something because you know it would not be sensible to say it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to argue, but I had to bite my tongue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想辩驳﹐但又不得不保持缄默。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone why they are not talking
Sense.TRAN: 怎么不说话了？怎么哑巴了？

Sense.DEF: to be able to say a difficult word or phrase
Sense.TRAN: 说出〔某个拗口的词或短语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t get my tongue around the names of the villages we’d visited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说不来我们去过的那些村庄的名字。

Sense.DEF: if a name or phrase trips or rolls off your tongue, it is easy or pleasant to say
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their names trip off the tongue very easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的名字很顺口。

Sense.DEF: if something such as alcohol loosens your tongue, it makes you talk a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔喝酒等〕使某人话多﹐使某人管不住嘴
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine had certainly loosened her tongue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喝了酒﹐话当然就变得多了起来。

Sense.DEF: to say something after you have been silent for a time because you were afraid or shy
Sense.TRAN: 〔因害怕或害羞而沉默之后〕终于开口说话
Sense.EXAMPLE: Polly found her tongue at last and told them about the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波莉终于开口说话﹐告诉了他们袭击的经过。

Sense.DEF: to do something that people will talk about in an unkind way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angela’s divorce will certainly set tongues wagging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安杰拉的离婚肯定会招来闲言碎语。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep a civil tongue in your head
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they should talk politely to people
to say things that are not true – used humorously
to talk using strange words as part of a religious experience
a language
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anton lapsed into his own tongue when he was excited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安东一激动就说家乡话。

GramExa.GLOSS: the language you learn as a child
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt more comfortable talking in her native tongue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说母语感觉更放松。

Sense.DEF: the tongue of a cow or sheep, cooked and eaten cold
Sense.TRAN: 口条〔牛羊等的舌头﹐可做凉菜〕

Sense.DEF: something that has a long thin shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Huge tongues of fire were licking the side of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的火舌吞卷着大楼的一侧。

Sense.DEF: the part of a shoe that lies on top of your foot, under the part where you tie it

Crossrefto.REFLEX: on the tip of your tongue

Sense.DEF: to use your tongue to make separate sounds when playing a musical instrument
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏管乐器时〕用运舌法吹奏（音符）

Sense.DEF: to touch something with your tongue
tongue and groove boards fit together by pushing a piece that sticks out along the edge of one board into a hollow area along the edge of another board
Sense.EXAMPLE: tongue and groove floorboards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企口地板

Sense.DEF: a small flat piece of wood that a doctor uses to hold down your tongue while examining your throat
Sense.TRAN: 〔医生检查病人喉咙时用的〕压舌板

Sense.DEF: a tongue-in-cheek remark is said as a joke, not seriously
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话﹑评论等〕开玩笑的﹐不可当真的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love that kind of tongue-in-cheek wit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢那种玩笑式的风趣。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I think he was talking tongue-in-cheek.

Sense.DEF: unable to talk in a relaxed way because you feel nervous or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 〔因感到紧张或难堪等而〕张口结舌的﹐说不出话的
Sense.EXAMPLE: When adults spoke to her, she became tongue-tied and shy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大人和她讲话时她会很害羞﹐说不出话来。

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase that is difficult to say quickly

a clear bitter-tasting drink that you can mix with alcoholic drinks such as
gin
or
vodka
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat and sipped a gin and tonic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐着﹐小口小口地喝着一杯加奎宁水的杜松子酒。

Sense.DEF: a drink that you have as a medicine to give you more energy or strength when you feel tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people need a tonic at the end of the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人冬末需要进补。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you feel happy and full of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: A weekend by the sea was the perfect tonic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在海边过一个周末绝对可以调整身心。

Sense.DEF: a liquid that you put on your hair or skin to improve it and make it more healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a herbal skin tonic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草本爽肤水

Sense.DEF:
the first note in a musical
scale
of eight notes
during the night of this day
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll go to bed early tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想今晚我会早点上床睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re meeting him at 9 o’clock tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今晚9点和他见面。

Sense.DEF: the night of this day
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really looking forward to tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常期待今晚的到来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tonight should be fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚应该会很有趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here is tonight’s news bulletin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以下是今晚的新闻简报。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that you lie on and that moves your arms and legs up and down, which is supposed to make your muscles firmer

the size of a ship or the amount of goods it can carry, shown in
tonnes

the total number of
tonnes
that something weighs
Sense.EXAMPLE: A huge tonnage of bombs has already been dropped on the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大吨数的炸弹已被投到该地区。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 1,000 kilograms
very much or very many
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel tons better after a rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休息之后﹐我感觉好多了。

Sense.DEF: your tonsils are the two small round pieces of flesh at the sides of your throat
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you keep getting throat infections you might have to have your tonsils out have them removed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果咽喉反复感染﹐就可能需要切除扁桃体。

Sense.DEF: an infection of the tonsils
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam’s got tonsillitis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆得了扁桃体炎。

Sense.DEF:
a small round area on the top of someone’s head where their hair has been removed because they are a priest or a
monk
Sense.TRAN: 〔教士或僧人的〕头顶剃光部分﹐光头

Sense.DEF: fashionable and expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: We met in a tony restaurant uptown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在市郊一家豪华的饭店见面。

Sense.DEF: a prize given to the best theatre actor, best actress, best play etc, shown in New York in a particular year
Sense.TRAN: 托尼奖〔纽约戏剧界年度大奖﹐包括最佳男演员﹑最佳女演员﹑最佳剧本等奖项〕

Sense.DEF: more than is acceptable or possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think the music’s too loud?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得音乐太响了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve put too much salt in the soup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你往汤里放盐太多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are too many cars on the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上车辆太多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Amanda is far too young to get married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿曼达太小了﹐还不能结婚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was getting too old for romantic relationships.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的年龄已经不适合谈情说爱了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My boots were three sizes too big for me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的靴子大了三码。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was too ill to travel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他病得太重﹐不能出行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The box was too heavy for me to lift.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 箱子太重﹐我提不起来。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use too after ‘a’ before an adjective and noun. Put too and the adjective before ‘a’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 当too与形容词修饰名词的结构连用时﹐不要把a放在too之前﹐而要把too和形容词放在a之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It is too high a price to pay.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use too much before an adjective. Just use too .
F2NBox.TRAN: 形容词之前不用too much﹐只用too
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The houses would be too expensive (NOT 不用 too much expensive) for local people.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房子对于当地人来说太贵了。

Sense.DEF: also
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were people from all over Europe, and America too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有来自欧洲各地的人﹐也有来自美国的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I come too?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也来行吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m feeling hungry.’ ‘Me too.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我觉得饿了。”“我也是。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a more efficient system and it’s cheaper too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统更有效﹐也更便宜。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Too is usually used at the end of a clause.
F2NBox.TRAN: too一般用于句子末尾
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He was a teacher too.
F2NBox.EXPL: In formal writing, too can be put after the subject, or after an adverb or prepositional phrase at the beginning of a clause.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在正式书面语中﹐too可放在主语之后﹐也可放在句子开头的副词或介词短语之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We too must play our part.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也必须尽自己的责任。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Here, too, matters are not so simple.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里也是﹐事情并不那么简单。

Sense.DEF: used with a negative to mean ‘not very’
Sense.TRAN: 〔与否定词连用﹐表示“不很”、“不是非常”〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t seem too upset about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对此好像不是很难过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What was the weather like?’ ‘Oh, not too bad.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “天气如何？” “不是太糟。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was none too pleased not at all pleased when I told her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉她时﹐她一点也不高兴。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a particular situation exists when you wish it did not exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beggars are becoming an all too familiar sight in our cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们的城市里﹐乞丐已经是见多不怪了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I regret to say that these rumours are only too true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遗憾地说﹐这些传言完全属实。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a remark that you are adding
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s been banned from driving.’ ‘A good thing too!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他被禁止驾驶了。”“这也是好事！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘A woman farmer?’ asked Gabriel. ‘Yes, and a rich one too.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一个女农场主？”加布里埃尔问道。“对﹐还是一个有钱的女农场主。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: I am/he is/you are etc too!
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you disagree with what someone has said about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 我/他/你等其实[一定]…！〔用于断然表示不同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re not smart enough to use a computer.’ ‘I am too!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你不够机灵﹐不会用电脑。”“我其实会！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is so difficult, tiring, upsetting etc that someone cannot do it or bear it
Sense.TRAN: 非某人能力所及﹔非某人所能忍受
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working full-time was too much for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全天上班她吃不消。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shock was too much for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个打击对他来说太大了。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you. You are too kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐你真好。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be only too glad/pleased to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be very willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d be only too pleased to assist you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很乐意帮助你。

Sense.DEF: used to complain that not enough is being done to solve a problem and that the action did not start early enough
Sense.TRAN: 太少也太晚〔用于抱怨解决某问题时做得不够﹐采取的行动不够及时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors have criticized the government’s response to the crisis as too little, too late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生批评政府对这次危机反应过于冷淡和迟缓。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
take
something that you hold in your hand and use to do a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have the right tools to start fiddling around with the engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有合适的工具来摆弄发动机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shop selling garden tools
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售园艺工具的商店

PIC.HEADING: TOOLS 工具
PIC.PICCONTENT: screwdrivers 螺丝刀；hammer 锤子；jigsaw 线锯；chainsaw 链锯；toolbox 工具箱；electric drill 电钻；hacksaw 钢锯；pliers 钳子；adjustable spanner BrE【英】/ monkey wrench AmE【美】活动扳手；spanner BrE【英】/ wrench AmE【美】扳手；file 锉刀；chisel 凿子；handsaw 手锯

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment or a skill that is useful for doing your job
Sense.TRAN: 工具〔指职业上有用的器具或技能〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Television is an important tool for the modern teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视是现代教师重要的工具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These books are the tools of my trade the things I need to do my job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些书是我工作中的必备工具。

Sense.DEF: someone who is used unfairly by another person and who has to do things they do not really want to do – used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The king was merely a tool of the military government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王只是军政府的工具。

Sense.DEF:
a man’s
penis sex organ
to drive along a street, especially for fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent the afternoon tooling around town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下午开着车在城里转悠。

Sense.DEF: to prepare a factory for producing goods by providing the necessary tools and machinery
Sense.TRAN: 〔以必要的工具和机器等〕装备〔工厂〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The factory was tooled up to produce light weapons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂配备了设备生产轻武器。

Sense.DEF: a row of small pictures at the top of a computer screen that allow you to do particular things in a document
a box for keeping tools in

a set of
commands
or
functions
which do various things in a computer program
Sense.EXAMPLE: The default toolbox contains tools for drawing lots of different shapes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统预设的工具箱里有可绘制各种图形的工具。

Sense.DEF: tooled leather has been decorated by having patterns cut into its surface
having or carrying a weapon
a set of tools
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realized I’d left my tool kit at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现我把工具箱落在家里了。

Sense.DEF: a small building in a garden, where you keep tools
if you toot your car horn, or if it toots, it makes a short high sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The taxi driver was angrily tooting his horn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个出租车司机在愤怒地按喇叭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A car tooted at us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆汽车冲着我们按喇叭。

Sense.DEF: a short high sound made by a car horn
one of the hard white objects in your mouth that you use to bite and eat food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sugar is bad for your teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖对牙齿不好。

Sense.DEF:
one of the sharp or pointed parts that sticks out from the edge of a comb or
saw
if a law or an organization has teeth, it has the power to force people to obey it
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律或组织〕具有效力﹐有力度
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need an Environment Agency that really has teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一个强有力的环境保护机构。

Sense.DEF: to try with a lot of effort or determination to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We fought tooth and nail to get these plans accepted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们全力争取让这些计划被接受。

Sense.DEF: to start to do something with a lot of energy and determination
Sense.TRAN: 全力以赴地开始处理某事﹔专注于做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t wait to get my teeth into the new course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迫不及待地想开始新课程。

Sense.DEF: in spite of opposition or danger from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Permission for the development was granted in the teeth of opposition from local shopkeepers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个开发项目在当地店主的一片反对声中获得了批准。

Sense.DEF: if a sound or taste sets your teeth on edge, it gives you an uncomfortable feeling in your mouth
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音﹑味道等〕使某人感到不舒服
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horrible scraping sound that set my teeth on edge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我浑身难受的刺耳刮擦声

Crossrefto.REFLEX: by the skin of your teeth
be a kick in the teeth
take the bit between your teeth

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I brush my teeth twice a day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一天刷两次牙。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have a tooth removed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s gone to the dentist to have a tooth out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去牙医那儿拔牙了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: no longer have it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many of the men had lost all their teeth by the age of 40.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中许多男子40岁时牙齿就掉光了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show them, especially in an angry or threatening way
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The dog bared its teeth and snarled.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗龇着牙狂吠。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: put them firmly together
move them against each other because you are angry
put your teeth into someone’s flesh, into food etc
hit together quickly because someone is cold or afraid

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of his front teeth were missing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的前牙掉了几颗。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His teeth were white and even.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的牙齿洁白整齐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fish has small but very sharp teeth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鱼牙齿细小﹐但是非常尖利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all of the same height

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Brushing regularly helps prevent tooth decay.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 按时刷牙有助于防止蛀牙。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘wash your teeth’. Say 而要说 brush your teeth or 或 clean your teeth .

Sense.DEF: a pain in a tooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got toothache .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我牙痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had terrible toothache all last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我一整夜牙疼得厉害。

Sense.DEF: a small brush that you use for cleaning your teeth

an imaginary person who children believe comes into their
bedroom
and leaves them money for teeth which have fallen out
Sense.TRAN: 牙仙〔儿童所相信的﹑到他们卧室用钱换走他们脱落的牙齿的仙子〕

Sense.DEF:
when someone uses a
mobile phone
with a
bluetooth
connection to send a message to another person near them who also has a Bluetooth mobile phone, arranging to have sex with them
Sense.TRAN: 牙约〔利用手机的蓝牙功能给附近使用蓝牙手机的人发短信﹐约其发生性关系〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is toothless has no teeth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a toothless old woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无牙老太太

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave us a toothless grin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他张开没牙的嘴朝我们一笑。

Sense.DEF: an organization that is toothless has no power to make people obey its rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构〕无效力的﹐无约束力的﹐不起作用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does the agency have the power to prosecute companies, or is it a toothless organization?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家机构有权起诉公司吗﹐抑或它只是个没有执行力的组织？

Sense.DEF: a thick substance that you use to clean your teeth
a very small pointed stick that you can use for removing bits of food that are stuck between your teeth
a special powder you can use to clean your teeth
tasting very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attractive and toothsome dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美味诱人的菜肴

Sense.DEF: a smile in which you show a lot of teeth
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grinned a wide, toothy grin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他嘴咧得老大﹐露出牙齿笑着。

Sense.DEF: to move slowly in a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent the afternoon tootling along the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下午开着车沿海边缓缓行驶。

Sense.DEF: to play an instrument that you blow
Sense.EXAMPLE: tootling away on a flute
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吹着笛子

Sense.DEF: a way of talking to a woman, sometimes considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 娘儿们〔对女性的称呼﹐有时被认为具有冒犯性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, toots! How’re you doing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐娘儿们！你们好吗？

Sense.DEF: toes – used especially by children or when you are talking to a child
the highest part of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tops of the mountains were still covered with snow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山顶依然为白雪覆盖。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could only just see over the tops of their heads.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从他们的头顶上望过去﹐勉强才能看到。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was standing at the top of the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在楼梯顶端。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll sit down once we’re at the top.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一到顶上就会坐下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Write your name at the top of the page.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在页面的上端写下你的名字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop and wait for us when you get to the top of the slope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到坡顶时停下来等等我们。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I filled the glass right to the top .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把玻璃杯倒得满满的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book I wanted was at the very top of the pile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要的书在这摞书的最上面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could just see the white cliff tops in the distance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处白色的崖顶依稀可见。

Sense.DEF: the flat upper surface of an object
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low wooden table with a glass top
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃桌面的矮木桌

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We walked along the top of the ancient city walls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在古城墙上行走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She put the papers down on the top of the piano.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把文件放在钢琴顶上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her fingers drummed on the table top .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手指叩击着桌面。

Sense.DEF: the best, most successful, or most important position in an organization, company, or profession
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构﹑公司﹑行业等中的〕最好位置﹐最重要的职位﹐最高位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has reached the top of his profession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经到达他那行业的顶峰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s the people at the top who make the decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作出决策的是高层的那些人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All young footballers dream of making it to the top.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有年轻的足球运动员都梦想能够出人头地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the groups that are currently at the top of the tree the highest position in a profession in the pop world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前流行乐坛最顶尖的组合

Sense.DEF: something that you put on or over an object to cover it, protect it, or prevent liquid coming out of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get the top off the jar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拧不开罐子的盖儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve left the top off the toothpaste again!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你又没有盖上牙膏的盖子！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you put the top back on the bottle when you’ve finished with it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用完以后把瓶盖盖回去好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Has anyone seen my pen top?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人看到我的钢笔帽了吗？

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing that you wear on the upper part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a stripy knitted top.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一件条纹针织上衣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skirt with a matching top
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条配有上装的裙子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bikini top
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比基尼上装
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t find my pyjama top.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到我的睡衣上装了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be (at the) top of the list/agenda
Sense.DEF: something that is at the top of a list will be dealt with or discussed first
Sense.TRAN: 是清单上/议事日程上首先要处理[讨论]的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe is once again at the top of the political agenda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲问题再一次成为政治议程上的头等大事。

Subsense.DEF: on the highest part or surface of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The cake was a bit burnt on top.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕最上面有点烤了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a high roof with a chimney on top
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶部有烟囱的高屋顶

Subsense.DEF: on the highest part of your head
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you cut it quite short on top, please.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把我头顶上的头发理短一点。

Subsense.DEF: winning in a game or competition
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在体育比赛等中〕处于领先地位
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After the first set, the Australian was comfortably on top.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一局后﹐这位澳大利亚选手轻松领先。

Subsense.DEF: on the highest surface of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There should be an envelope on top of the fridge.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱上面应该有一个信封。

Subsense.DEF: in complete control of a situation
Subsense.TRAN: 完全控制某事物﹔对某事物摸得一清二楚
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry; I’m back on top of things now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要担心﹐我现在又完全控制了局面。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I should be more on top of my work next week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周我应该会把工作做得更好。

Subsense.DEF: if something bad happens to you on top of something else, it happens when you have other problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: On top of everything else, I now have to go to work next Saturday!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了这些﹐我下周六还要上班！

Sense.LEXUNIT: one on top of the other
Sense.DEF: in a pile
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stacked the crates one on top of the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把板条箱一个个摞起来。

Sense.DEF: if something dangerous or threatening is on top of you, it is very near you
Sense.TRAN: 〔危险或威胁〕非常接近某人﹐逼近某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truck was almost on top of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆卡车差点撞到我们。

Sense.DEF: if your work or a problem gets on top of you, it begins to make you feel unhappy and upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things are starting to get on top of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情开始压得他招架不住。

Sense.DEF: to win a difficult struggle or argument, especially one that has continued for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过长期的艰苦斗争或争论后〕胜出﹐获胜
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to predict who will come out on top.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难预测谁会获胜。

Sense.DEF: extremely happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I heard she’d been released I felt on top of the world!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说她已被释放﹐我真是高兴坏了！

Sense.DEF: the part of a fruit or vegetable where it was attached to the plant, or the leaves of a plant whose root you can eat
Sense.TRAN: 〔植物的〕顶梢部分﹔〔根部可食用的植物的〕叶子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the tops off the tomatoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把番茄的茎叶削掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve found a recipe for beetroot tops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找到了一种烹饪甜菜叶的方法。

Sense.DEF: the part of the street or of a piece of land that is the furthest away from you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I waited at the top of East Street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在东街的尽头等候。

Sense.DEF: the cream that rises to the top of a bottle of milk
the part of a long dinner table where the most important people sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔长餐桌上地位最高者坐的〕餐桌首席﹐上席﹐上座

Sense.LEXUNIT: off the top of your head
Sense.DEF: if you say something off the top of your head, you say it immediately, without thinking carefully about it or checking the facts
Sense.TRAN: 立即﹐马上﹐不假思索地〔回答问题或提供信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just off the top of my head, I’d say there were about 50.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要马上说的话﹐我说大约有50个。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sing/shout at the top of your voice
Sense.DEF: to sing or shout as loudly as you can
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angela ran out of the house, shouting at the top of her voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安杰拉跑出房子﹐放开嗓子大喊。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at the top of your game

Variant.LEXVAR: be on top of your game

Sense.DEF: to be doing your job, especially playing a sport, very well
Sense.TRAN: 最佳发挥〔尤指体育运动〕
