Sense.DEF: an expression meaning from the beginning, used especially in the theatre
Sense.TRAN: 从头﹐从最开始〔尤为戏剧用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, let’s take it from the top once more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐让我们从头再来一遍。

Sense.DEF: if you clean or search somewhere from top to bottom, you do it very thoroughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole house needs cleaning from top to bottom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整座房子需要彻底打扫一遍。

Sense.DEF: if a person is dressed or covered in something from top to toe, they are completely dressed or covered in it
Sense.TRAN: 从头到脚﹐浑身上下〔指穿衣服或被覆盖〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were covered in mud from top to toe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从头到脚全是泥。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the top and bottom of it
Sense.DEF: the general result or meaning of a situation, expressed in a few words
Sense.TRAN: 〔用几句话概括的某情况的〕结果﹐实质
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s trying to embarrass you, that’s the top and bottom of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总之﹐他是想让你难堪。

Sense.DEF: to be not very intelligent
Sense.TRAN: 不怎么精明﹐没什么头脑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor Nigel, he doesn’t have very much up top.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的奈杰尔﹐他没什么头脑。

Sense.DEF: used after a number to say that it is the highest possible amount of money you will get
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll cost you £200, £250 tops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它将花掉你200英镑﹐顶多250英镑。

Sense.DEF: a child’s toy that spins around on its point when you twist it
to spin or turn round very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The impact of the blow sent me spinning like a top.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一击打得我直转圈。

Sense.DEF: nearest to the top of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have a flat on the top floor of the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在这座大楼的顶层有一套公寓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the top button of his shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他衬衫最上面的那颗纽扣
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to scrape off the top layer of paint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法刮掉了最外层的油漆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found the letter in the top drawer of his desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在他书桌最上面的抽屉里发现了那封信。

Sense.DEF: best or most successful
Sense.TRAN: 最佳的﹐最好的﹔最成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: our top tennis players
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最优秀的网球运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top New York salon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约的一家顶级美容院
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the world’s top engineering companies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球一流的工程公司之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: people in top jobs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作职位最高的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got top marks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得了最高分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The top score was 72.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高分为72分。

Sense.DEF: winning in a game or competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barcelona remain top of the league after beating Real Madrid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴塞罗那队击败皇家马德里队后继续位居联赛榜首。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite losing last night, Manchester United are still top the highest in a list of clubs in a competition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联队尽管昨晚比赛失利﹐但仍位居榜首。

Sense.DEF: expressions meaning the picture at the top of a page on the left or right or in the centre, used in magazines and newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 左上/右上/上图〔指报纸杂志等图片在页面上的位置〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Top right: silk blouse £195 from Harrods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 右上图: 哈罗德百货的女式丝绸衬衫﹐售价195英镑。

Sense.DEF: the fastest speed a vehicle can move at
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tore down the motorway at top speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在高速公路上全速行驶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sports car with a top speed of 140 miles per hour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高时速140英里的跑车

Sense.DEF: the thing that you think is most important
Sense.TRAN: 需要优先考虑的事﹐当务之急
Sense.EXAMPLE: Education is this government’s top priority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育是本届政府的头等大事。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clive’s a top bloke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫是个老好人。

Sense.DEF: a letter or document from which copies can be made
to be higher than a particular amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their profits have reportedly topped £1,000,000 this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据报道﹐他们今年的利润已超过100万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to be in the highest position in a list because you are the most successful
Sense.TRAN: 居于…之首﹐处于最高位置
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tower of London tops the list of London’s most popular tourist attractions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在伦敦最受欢迎的旅游景点中﹐伦敦塔名列第一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the team that has topped the Premiership for the last three seasons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在超级联赛最近三个赛季都高居榜首的球队
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1998 the group topped the charts with the song ‘Don’t Stop Loving Me’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1998年该演唱组合凭借一首《不要停止爱我》而高居排行榜榜首。

Sense.DEF: if you top something, you do something that is better than it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He topped his previous best performance, coming second in the 100 metres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刷新了个人最好成绩﹐在100米项目中获得第二名。

Sense.DEF: to offer more money than someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: A rival company topped our offer by $5 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的一家竞争对手比我们的报价高500万美元。

Sense.DEF: to have something on top
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roof was topped by a chimney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房顶上有一个烟囱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hill topped by pine trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶部被青松覆盖的小山

Sense.DEF: if food is topped with something, it has that thing on it or over the top of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strawberry tart topped with whipped cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上面浇了掼奶油的草莓馅饼
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cake can be topped off with fresh fruit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕上面可以放些新鲜水果。

Sense.DEF: in addition to other bad things that have happened to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: To top it all I lost my job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更糟糕的是﹐我还丢了工作。

Sense.DEF: used when you are asking someone if they have done something more exciting or successful than you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I’ve been asked to appear on a TV show later this year, so top that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被邀请今年晚些时候参加一个电视节目﹐你有这样的好事吗？

Sense.DEF: to cut the top and bottom off a piece of fruit or a vegetable
Sense.TRAN: 去掉〔水果或蔬菜〕的两头

Sense.DEF: to kill yourself deliberately
if you top a hill, you reach the top of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We topped the hill and looked down towards the valley below us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们登上山顶﹐俯瞰下面的山谷。

Sense.DEF: to complete something successfully by doing one last thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s top off the evening with a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咱们最后喝一杯﹐结束今晚的活动吧。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a price that is increasing tops out, it reaches its highest point and stops rising
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格等〕到达最高点﹐上升到顶点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think interest rates have topped out now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为利率现在已经到顶了吗？

Sense.DEF: to add more liquid to a container that is partly full
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just top up the coffee pot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把咖啡壶添满就好。

Sense.DEF: to put more drink in someone’s glass or cup after they have drunk some
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I top you up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你的杯子加满好吗？

Sense.DEF: to increase the level of something slightly so as to bring it back to the level you want
Sense.TRAN: 补足﹐将…增加到所需之量
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had to do extra jobs at the weekend to top up his income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不在周末另外打工来补贴收入。

Sense.DEF: a transparent yellow stone that is used as a jewel
people in positions of high rank in a company, or in the army, navy etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑军队等的〕最高负责人﹐要员﹐头目
Sense.EXAMPLE: The top brass are coming in from Washington to see how we do things here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华盛顿的高层领导要来视察我们这里的工作情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting was attended by top diplomats and military top brass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出席此次会议的有最高级别的外交官和军事要员。

Sense.DEF: of very good quality or a very high standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top-class athlete
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最优秀的运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top-class restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一流的餐馆

Sense.DEF: the last layer of paint that you put on a surface
a warm long coat
the person who has the most power in a group, especially after a struggle
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过争斗后〕最有权的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always wanted to be the one in control, the top dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是想执掌大权﹐成为第一把手。

Sense.DEF: if you pay top dollar for something, you pay a lot of money for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer customers are willing to pay top dollar for fast repair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑用户乐意花高价加急修理。

Sense.DEF: a top-down way of organizing a business is one in which the most important people make decisions and tell the people below them what they should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has a top-down management system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司实行自上而下的管理体制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top-down approach to decision-making
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自上而下的决策方式

Sense.DEF: a top-down way of understanding or explaining something starts with a general idea and adds details later
Sense.TRAN: 〔理解或解释的方式〕先总体后具体的

Sense.DEF: of the highest quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: England need to produce a top-drawer performance if they want to win this match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队如想赢得这场比赛﹐就需要有最出色的表现。

Sense.DEF:
a layer of
fertilizer
that is spread over land so that it will produce better crops
a light hard hat that you wear to protect your head from the sun in hot countries
very successful or skilful
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve hired a really top-flight sales team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们雇用了一支绝对一流的销售队伍。

Sense.DEF:
the highest
gear
of a car, bus etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car will cruise at 80 mph in top gear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款汽车可以以时速80英里的高速挡定速行驶。

Sense.DEF: to begin to work with as much effort as possible
Sense.TRAN: 开始进入最活跃的状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party’s election campaign is now moving into top gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党的选举活动现在正进入高潮。

Sense.DEF: a top-grossing film earns more money than any other film at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影在某段时间内〕票房收入最高的

Sense.DEF: a man’s tall black or grey hat, now worn only on formal occasions
Sense.TRAN: 〔现今仅在正式场合戴的〕男子高顶大礼帽

Sense.DEF: too heavy at the top and therefore likely to fall over
Sense.TRAN: 头重脚轻的﹐上重下轻的

Sense.DEF: an organization that is top-heavy has too many managers compared to the number of ordinary workers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company was burdened by a top-heavy bureaucracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司被将多兵少的官僚制度所累。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
topee
trees and bushes cut into the shapes of birds, animals etc, or the art of cutting them in this way
a subject that people talk or write about
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话或写作的〕话题﹐论题﹐题目
Sense.EXAMPLE: The environment is a popular topic these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今环境是一个热门话题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We shall return to the topic of education in Chapter 7.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在第7章再回到教育这个话题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wedding has been the only topic of conversation for weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼成了几个星期来唯一的话题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The main topic for discussion will be the proposed new supermarket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨论的主要议题是拟建中的超级市场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wide range of topics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广泛的话题

Sense.DEF: a subject that is topical is interesting because it is important at the present time
Sense.TRAN: 热门话题的﹔当前受到关注的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new TV comedy dealing with topical issues
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部反映热门问题的新电视喜剧

Sense.EXAMPLE: topical jokes jokes about topical subjects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时事笑话

Sense.DEF: hair that is tied together on top of your head
if a woman is topless, she is not wearing any clothes on the upper part of her body, so that her breasts are not covered
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性〕不穿上装的﹐上身裸露的
Sense.EXAMPLE: topless sunbathing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上身裸露的日光浴

GramExa.GLOSS: one in which the women serving or performing are topless

Sense.DEF: involving the most powerful people in a country, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: top-level meetings between EU leaders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟领导人最高级会议

Sense.DEF: the topmost part of something is its highest part
Sense.TRAN: 最高的﹔最上面的﹔顶端的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The topmost branches were still bathed in sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树梢的枝丫仍然沐浴在阳光下。

Sense.DEF: something that is top-notch is of the highest quality or standard
Sense.TRAN: 最高级的﹐顶呱呱的﹐第一流的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was lucky and got myself a job with a top-notch company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很幸运﹐在一家一流的公司找到了一份工作。

Sense.DEF: a product that is top-of-the-range is the best of its kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top-of-the-range electric guitar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好的电吉他

Sense.DEF: the science of describing an area of land, or making maps of it
the shape of an area of land, including its hills, valleys etc

a
top hat
something you put on top of food to make it look nicer or taste better
Sense.TRAN: 〔加在食品上面使之更好看或更好吃的〕配料﹐浇头
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pizza with extra toppings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶上多加一层配料的比萨饼

Sense.DEF: to become unsteady and then fall over, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A stack of plates swayed, and began to topple over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大摞盘子摇摇晃晃﹐接着就倒了下来。

Sense.DEF: to take power away from a leader or government, especially by force
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过暴力〕使倒台﹐颠覆﹐推翻
Sense.EXAMPLE: This scandal could topple the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一丑闻可能使政府倒台。

Sense.DEF: most powerful and important within an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: top-ranking diplomats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高级别的外交官

Sense.DEF: very popular with the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top-rated TV show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大受欢迎的电视节目

Sense.DEF:
high-quality
beef
cut from the upper leg of the cow
at the most
Sense.EXAMPLE: It should take two hours tops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该最多只要两个小时。

Sense.DEF: the best or most popular
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store was voted tops for its outstanding facilities for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该店因其出色的儿童设施而被评为最佳商店。

Sense.DEF: top-secret documents or information must be kept completely secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top-secret code
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝密的密码

Sense.DEF:
high quality
beef
cut from the upper leg of the cow

towards or onto the
deck upper surface
of a boat or ship
the upper level of soil in which most plants have their roots
the turning movement of a ball that has been hit or thrown in such a way that it spins forward
in a state of complete disorder or confusion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left his room all topsy-turvy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把房间弄得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: the table at a formal meal, for example at a wedding, where the most important people sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式宴会上最重要人物坐的〕主桌

Sense.DEF: an amount of liquid that you add to a glass, cup etc in order to make it full again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a top-up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您要加满吗？

Sense.DEF: an extra payment that brings an amount to the desired level
Sense.TRAN: 〔为达到所需水平而〕追加的钱款
Sense.EXAMPLE: top-up loans for students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为学生提供的追加贷款

Sense.DEF:
a card that you buy in order to be able to continue using a
pay-as-you-go
mobile phone
a rocky hill
a small electric lamp that you carry in your hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: We shone our torches around the cavern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用手电筒照着山洞。

Sense.DEF: a long stick with burning material at one end that produces light
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Olympic torch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运火炬

Sense.DEF: to secretly love and admire someone
to deliberately make a building, vehicle etc start to burn
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rioters torched several abandoned cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴徒纵火烧毁了几辆废弃的汽车。

Sense.DEF: the light produced by an electric torch
the light produced by burning torches
Sense.EXAMPLE: a torchlight procession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点着火炬的游行队伍

Sense.DEF: a sad song about love

the past tense of
tear

a person who fights
bulls
to entertain people in Spain
severe mental or physical suffering

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lay awake all night in torment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一晚上都醒着﹐在痛苦中煎熬。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that makes you suffer a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey must have been a torment for them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅途对他们来说一定十分痛苦。

Sense.DEF: to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指精神上〕折磨﹐使痛苦﹔使苦恼
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seth was tormented by feelings of guilt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞思被负罪感折磨着。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately treat someone cruelly by annoying them or hurting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The older boys would torment him whenever they had the chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些大点的男孩一有机会就骚扰他。

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
tear
an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage
a long narrow weapon that is fired under the surface of the sea and explodes when it hits something
to attack or destroy a ship with a torpedo
to stop something such as a plan from succeeding
Sense.EXAMPLE: New threats of violence have effectively torpedoed the peace talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的暴力威胁实际上已经破坏了和平谈判。

Sense.DEF: not active because you are lazy or sleepy
Sense.TRAN: 迟钝的﹐懒散的﹔昏昏欲睡的﹐有气无力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a torpid mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟钝的头脑

Sense.DEF: a state of being not active because you are lazy or sleepy
Sense.TRAN: 〔出于懒散或困倦的〕不活跃﹐呆钝
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to rouse him from the torpor into which he had sunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图把他从迷迷糊糊的状态中唤醒。

Sense.DEF: the force or power that makes something turn around a central point, especially in an engine
a large amount of water moving very quickly and strongly in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: After five days of heavy rain the Telle river was a raging torrent a very violent torrent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下了五天的大雨之后﹐泰勒河急流汹涌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rain came down in torrents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨如注。

Sense.DEF: a lot of words spoken quickly, especially in order to insult or criticize someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I asked him to move, he unleashed a torrent of abuse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我让他挪挪位置﹐他就破口大骂起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The woman poured out a torrent of Italian.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个女子冒出一连串意大利语。

Sense.DEF: very heavy rain
involving strong emotions, especially of sexual love
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指性爱〕热烈的﹐〔情欲〕炽烈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a torrid love affair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂热的风流韵事

Sense.DEF: torrid weather is very hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: the torrid desert sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠烈日

Sense.DEF: a torrid time is a very difficult one
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a torrid time out there on the racetrack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在跑道上经历了一场苦战。

Sense.DEF: the twisting of a piece of metal
your body, not including your head, arms, or legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: the torso of a woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名女性的躯干

Sense.DEF:
a
statue
of a torso

an action that is wrong but not criminal and can be dealt with in a
civil
court of law
Sense.TRAN: 〔不构成刑事罪的〕民事侵权行为

Sense.DEF: a type of thin flat Mexican bread made from corn or wheat flour
Sense.TRAN: 〔墨西哥的一种〕薄玉米饼﹐玉米粉圆饼

Sense.DEF:
a small hard flat piece of food made from corn, similar to a
crisp
a slow-moving land animal that can pull its head and legs into the hard round shell that covers its body
a hard shiny brown and white material made from the shell of a tortoise
a cat that has yellow, brown, and black marks on its fur

a
butterfly
that has brown and orange wings
a tortuous path, stream, road etc has a lot of bends in it and is therefore difficult to travel along
Sense.TRAN: 〔路﹑溪流等〕弯弯曲曲的﹐曲折的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tortuous path over the mountains to Kandahar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翻山越岭通往坎大哈的一条蜿蜒小径

Sense.DEF: complicated and long and therefore confusing
Sense.TRAN: 转弯抹角的﹐绕圈子的﹔复杂的﹔令人费解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book begins with a long, tortuous introduction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的开头是一篇冗长、晦涩的前言。

Sense.DEF: an act of deliberately hurting someone in order to force them to tell you something, to punish them, or to be cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died after five days of excruciating torture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭受了五天的严刑拷打之后﹐他死了。

Sense.DEF: severe physical or mental suffering
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waiting must be torture for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的等待对你来说肯定是一种煎熬。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately hurt someone in order to force them to give you information, to punish them, or to be cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: Political opponents of the regime may be tortured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个政权的政治异己可能会遭受酷刑。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or knowledge tortures you, it makes you suffer a lot mentally
Sense.TRAN: 使〔精神上〕受到折磨﹐使痛苦﹔使苦恼
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel sat alone for hours at home, tortured by jealousy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔独自在家里坐了好几个小时﹐备受嫉妒心的折磨。

Sense.DEF: very painful or unpleasant to experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: a torturous five days of fitness testing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五天痛苦的体能测试

Sense.DEF: a member of the British Conservative Party
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕保守党成员﹐托利党人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lifelong Tory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名终身的保守党党员

Sense.DEF: nonsense
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a load of old tosh!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又是这套废话！

Sense.DEF: to throw something, especially something light, with a quick gentle movement of your hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She crumpled the letter and tossed it into the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把信揉成一团﹐扔进了火里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Toss that book over, will you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那本书扔过来﹐好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Catch!’ said Sandra, tossing her bag to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “接着！”桑德拉边说边把她的包扔给他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Frank tossed her the newspaper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克把报纸扔给她。

Sense.DEF: to move about continuously in a violent or uncontrolled way, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The small boat was tossed about like a cork.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船像软木般被水流抛来抛去。

Sense.DEF: to keep changing your position in bed because you cannot sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been tossing and turning all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一晚上辗转反侧。

Sense.DEF: to throw a coin in the air, so that a decision will be made according to the side that faces upwards when it comes down
Sense.TRAN: 把（硬币）抛向空中〔以决定某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tossed a coin to decide who would go first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们抛硬币决定谁先走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We couldn’t make up our minds, so we decided to toss for it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们拿不定主意﹐所以决定抛硬币来定。

Sense.DEF: to throw something up into the air and let it fall to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd cheered, banging pots and tossing confetti into the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群欢呼起来﹐又是敲锅敲碗﹐又是往空中抛撒五彩纸屑。

Sense.DEF:
to throw a
pancake
upwards so that it turns over in the air and lands on the side that you want to cook
to move pieces of food about in a small amount of liquid so that they become covered with the liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Toss the carrots in some butter before serving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上桌前把胡萝卜放在黄油里搅拌一下。

Sense.DEF: to move your head or hair back suddenly, often with a shaking movement showing anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tossed his head angrily and left the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气愤地把头一甩﹐离开了房间。

Sense.DEF: to produce something quickly and without much effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of those painters who can toss off a couple of pictures before breakfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位早餐前就能信手画出两三幅画的那种画家

Sense.DEF: to drink something quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tossed off a few whiskies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一口气喝下几杯威士忌酒。

Sense.DEF:
to
masturbate
to get rid of something that you do not want
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tossed most of that stuff out when we moved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们搬家时﹐我把那些东西大部分都扔了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place, especially because of bad behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 撵走﹐赶出〔行为不端的人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kurt was tossed out of the club for trying to start a fight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 库尔特因企图寻衅打架被赶出俱乐部。

Sense.DEF: the act of throwing a coin in the air to decide something, especially who will do something first in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: The toss of a coin decided who would go first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抛硬币决定了谁先走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Malory won the toss and will serve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马洛里抛硬币赢了﹐将由他来开球。

Sense.DEF: a sudden backwards movement of your head, so that your hair moves, often showing anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll see,’ the nurse said, with an officious toss of her head .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士架子十足地一甩头﹐说:“我看看再说。”

Sense.DEF: a gentle throw
to not care about something at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really couldn’t give a toss what Sam thinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对萨姆怎么想真的一点都不在乎。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for someone who you think is stupid or unpleasant
used when you do not know which of two things will happen, or which of two things to choose
Sense.TRAN: 这事尚难预料﹐这事尚未定夺
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know who’ll get the job - it’s a toss-up between Carl and Steve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道谁会得到这份工作——卡尔和史蒂夫都有可能。

Sense.DEF: an act of tossing a coin in order to decide something
a very small child
a small amount of a strong alcoholic drink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tot of rum
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少量朗姆酒

Sense.DEF: to add together numbers or amounts of money in order to find the total
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waiter quickly totted up the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务生很快便把账单算好了。

Sense.DEF: complete, or as great as is possible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sales campaign was a total disaster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次促销活动彻底搞砸了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a total ban on cigarette advertising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟广告的全面禁止
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked at her with a total lack of comprehension.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一头雾水地望着她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sport that demands total commitment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要全身心投入的体育运动

Sense.DEF: the number, amount etc that is the total
Sense.EXAMPLE: total sales of 200,000 per year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年20万的销售总额
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her total income was £10,000 a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一年的总收入是1万英镑。

Sense.DEF: the final number or amount of things, people etc when everything has been counted
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s £7 and £3.50, so the total is £10.50.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7英镑加上3.50英镑﹐所以总数是10.50英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A total of thirteen meetings were held to discuss the issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总共举行了13次会议来讨论该议题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were probably about 40 people there in total.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总共可能有40人左右。

GramExa.GLOSS: the whole of an amount when everything is considered together

Subsense.DEF: the final total, including all the totals added together
used humorously when you think the final total is small
Subsense.TRAN: 〔自认为很小的〕总数〔幽默用法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I earned a grand total of $4.15.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总共才挣了4.15美元。

Sense.DEF: to reach a particular total
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group had losses totalling $3 million this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该集团今年总计亏损300万美元。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Total is used especially in journalism. In everyday English, people usually say that something makes or adds up to a particular total.
F2NBox.TRAN: total尤用于新闻报道。在日常英语中人们一般用make或add up to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Three and six make nine.

Sense.DEF: to damage a car so badly that it cannot be repaired
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chuck totaled his dad’s new Toyota.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查克把他爸爸那辆新丰田给毁了。

Sense.DEF: to find the total number or total amount of something by adding
Sense.TRAN: 计算…的总和﹐把…相加起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the end of the game, total up everyone’s score to see who has won.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏结束时把每个人的得分加起来﹐看看是谁赢了。

Sense.DEF: based on a political system in which ordinary people have no power and are completely controlled by the government
the whole of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s essential that we look at the problem in its totality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最重要的是﹐我们应整体看待这个问题。

Sense.DEF: a total amount
completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a totally different matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那完全是两码事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s like learning a totally new language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这像是在学一门全新的语言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Terrorism is totally unacceptable in a civilised world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖主义是文明社会绝不能容忍的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I totally agree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全同意。

Sense.DEF: to carry something, especially regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids have to tote heavy textbooks around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们不得不随身携带沉重的课本。

Sense.DEF:
a system in Britain in which a machine adds together the amounts of money
bet
on a horse race and divides the total among the people who bet on the winner
a large bag for carrying things

an animal, plant etc that is thought to have a special
spiritual
connection with a particular tribe, especially in North America, or a figure made to look like the animal etc
a tall wooden pole with one or more totems cut or painted on it, made by the Native Americans of northwest North America
Sense.TRAN: 〔北美西北部印第安人的〕图腾柱

Sense.LEXUNIT: low man on the totem pole
Sense.DEF: someone of low rank in an organization or business
Sense.TRAN: 〔在机构或公司中〕级别较低的人﹐小人物

Sense.DEF: to walk or move unsteadily from side to side as if you are going to fall over
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lorrimer swayed a little, tottered, and fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛里默身体微微摇晃﹐蹒跚几步后跌倒在地。

Sense.DEF: if a political system or organization totters, it becomes less strong and is likely to stop working
an offensive word used by men to refer to women who they think are sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 骚货﹐浪货〔男性所用的冒犯语〕

Sense.DEF: a tropical American bird with bright feathers and a very large beak
Sense.TRAN: 巨嘴鸟﹐〔美洲热带地区的一种鸟〕

Sense.DEF: to put your hand, finger etc on someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She reached out to touch his arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她伸手去碰他的胳膊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If your house has been burgled, you shouldn’t touch anything until the police arrive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果家中被盗﹐在警察赶到之前不要动任何物品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t touch me!’ she yelled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别碰我！”她大叫道。

GramExa.PROPFORM: touch sb on the arm/leg etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A hand touched her on the shoulder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一只手碰了一下她的肩膀。

Sense.DEF: if two things touch, or one thing touches another thing, they reach each other so that there is no space between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: As our glasses touched, he said ‘Cheers!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的酒杯相碰时﹐他说了声:“干杯！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dress was so long that it was touching the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的裙子很长﹐都拖到地上了。

Sense.DEF: to move something so that it reaches something else with no space between the two things
Sense.EXAMPLE: She touched the handkerchief to her nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手帕贴住鼻子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He touched his lips to her hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他亲吻着她的头发。

Sense.DEF: to affect someone’s emotions, especially by making them feel sympathy or sadness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her plight has touched the hearts of people around the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的困境触动了全世界人的心弦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could sense his concern and it tou-ched her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到了他的关心﹐心里很感动。

Sense.DEF: to have an effect on someone or something, especially by changing or influencing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has touched the lives of many people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他影响了很多人的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unemployment remains an evil that touches the whole community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业一直是影响整个社会的祸害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was often touched by doubt doubt affected him .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经常疑神疑鬼。

Sense.DEF: to use or handle something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law doesn’t allow him to touch any of the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律不允许他动用一分钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a long time since I’ve touched a piano.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已有很长时间没碰过钢琴了。

Subsense.DEF: to not eat or drink something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What’s wrong? You’ve hardly touched your food.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么了？你都没怎么碰你的食物。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My grandfather was an alcoholic but I never touch the stuff never drink alcohol .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖父是个酒鬼﹐但我滴酒不沾。

Subsense.DEF: to not deal with something that you should deal with
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I brought home loads of work, but I haven’t touched any of it yet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我带了一大堆工作回家﹐但到现在为止还一点也没碰。

Sense.DEF: to not hurt someone or not damage something
Sense.TRAN: 不伤害某人/不损坏某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The older boys swore they hadn’t touched the child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些大一点的男孩子发誓说没碰过那个小孩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parma had not been touched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕马没有受到伤害。

Sense.DEF: to become involved with or deal with a particular problem, situation, or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the only lawyer who would touch the case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是唯一愿意接手此案的律师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything he touches turns to disaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么事一经他的手就糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No school would touch a teacher who had been convicted of assault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有一所学校愿意雇用一个犯过人身侵犯罪的老师。

Sense.DEF: to reach a particular amount or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the time, the unemployment rate was touching 10 percent and rising.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时﹐失业率达到了10%﹐而且还在上升。

Sense.DEF: to gently hit or kick a ball – used especially in reports of sports games
Sense.TRAN: 轻触〔球〕﹐轻碰〔球﹔尤用于体育比赛的报道中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evans was just able to touch the ball away from Wilkinson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯刚好能够把球从威尔金森脚下踢开。

Variant.ORTHVAR: not touch sth/sb with a ten-foot pole

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think someone or something is bad and people should not be involved with them
Sense.TRAN: 决不与某事/某人有任何牵连﹔千万不要与某事/某人有瓜葛
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t touch him with a bargepole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想和他有任何牵连。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Financial analysts have warned investors not to touch these offers with a ten-foot pole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财经分析家告诫投资者千万不要理会这些提议。

Sense.DEF: to have a small amount of a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice was touched with the faintest of Italian accents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话略微带一点意大利口音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her nails had been manicured and lightly touched with colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的指甲修剪得整整齐齐﹐还涂了淡淡的颜色。

Sense.DEF: if an expression such as a smile touches your face, your face has that expression for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: A smile touched her lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的嘴边掠过一丝笑意。

Sense.DEF: to be about or to deal with a particular subject, situation, or problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Though the question touched a new vein, Nelson answered promptly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管这个问题涉及一个新的层面﹐纳尔逊还是迅速作了回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discourse touches many of the issues which are currently popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇论文涉及很多时下热门的话题。

Sense.DEF: if light touches something, it shines on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun was just touching the tops of the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳刚刚照到山顶。

Sense.DEF: used for saying that nothing or no one is as good as a particular person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 没有什么/没有人能比得上某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He describes the events with a passion that no other writer can touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以一种其他作家都无法比拟的热情描述了这些事件。

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone in order to find out how they are or what is happening
Sense.TRAN: （与某人）交谈〔以得知某人的状态或发生了什么事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just wanted to touch base and make sure you hadn’t changed your mind about seeing me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是想问问﹐确认你没有改变主意不想见我。

Subsense.DEF: to reach the ground at the bottom of a sea, river etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He swam down but could not touch bottom.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他潜下水﹐但是碰不到底。

Subsense.DEF: to reach the lowest level or worst condition
Subsense.TRAN: 达到最低点﹔落到最坏的地步
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The housing market has touched bottom.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住宅市场已到最低谷。

Exponent.DEF: to put your fingers or hand onto someone or something for a very short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t touch the iron – it’s hot!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要碰熨斗——很烫！

Exponent.DEF: to touch something with your fingers in order to find out about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Feel how soft this material is.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 摸摸看﹐这面料非常柔软。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt his forehead. It was cold.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我摸了一下他的额头﹐很凉。

Exponent.DEF: to touch something and pick it up and hold it in your hands
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children should always wash their hands before handling food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子一定要先洗手再拿食物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The glass was very fragile, and she handled it with great care.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这玻璃杯很容易碎﹐她小心翼翼地拿着。

Exponent.DEF: to touch or handle something with your fingers, especially while you are thinking of other things
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用手指〕触摸〔尤在想别的事情时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She fingered the heavy necklace around her neck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拨弄着脖子上沉甸甸的项链。

Exponent.DEF: to move your hand over a surface while pressing it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bob rubbed his eyes and yawned.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃揉揉眼睛﹐打了个哈欠。

Exponent.DEF: to rub part of your body with your nails, often because it itches
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog kept scratching its ear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗不停地搔耳朵。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bob scratched his head thoughtfully.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃若有所思地搔搔脑袋。

Exponent.DEF: to move your fingers lightly over someone’s body in order to make them laugh
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The baby giggled as I tickled him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挠小宝宝痒痒﹐他咯咯直笑。

Section.SECHEADING: TOUCH SB GENTLY OR LOVINGLY 轻轻地或充满爱意地触碰某人

Exponent.DEF: to move your hand gently over something, especially in a loving way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She stroked the child’s hair.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她捋了捋那个小孩的头发。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our cat won’t let people stroke him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家的猫不让人家摸它。

Exponent.DEF: to touch an animal or child lightly several times, with your hand flat
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He knelt down to pat the dog.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跪下来轻轻地拍拍那条狗。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She patted the little boy’s head.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻拍了拍小男孩的脑袋。

Exponent.DEF: to touch and move your hand gently over someone, especially an animal or child
Exponent.TRAN: 亲密接触﹐抚摸〔动物或小孩〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The goats, pigs, sheep, and cows here allow you to pet them.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的山羊﹑猪﹑绵羊和牛都可以让你亲密接触。

Exponent.DEF: to gently touch a part of someone’s body in a loving way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a mother caressing her child
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抚摸着自己孩子的母亲
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She caressed his cheek.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抚摸着他的脸颊。

Exponent.DEF: to touch a part of someone’s body in a loving or sexual way – use this especially about touching someone in a sexual way that is not wanted
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He tried to fondle her and she immediately pulled away from him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图摸她﹐她立即挣脱开来。

Sense.DEF: when an aircraft touches down, it lands on the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane finally touched down at Heathrow airport around midday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中午左右﹐飞机终于在希思罗机场降落。

Sense.DEF:
in the sport of
rugby
, to score by putting the ball on the ground behind the other team’s
goal line
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球运动中﹐在对方球门线后〕持球触地得分

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to give or lend you something, especially money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to touch me for the taxi fare home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图问我要回家的出租车费。

Sense.DEF: to cause a difficult situation or violent events to begin
Sense.TRAN: 使产生〔困境〕﹔引发〔暴力事件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was these national rivalries that eventually touched off the First World War.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正是国家之间的这些敌对行为最终引发了第一次世界大战。

Sense.DEF: to mention a particular subject when talking or writing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report touches on the relationship between poverty and poor health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告论及贫困和健康状况不良之间的关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These issues were touched on in Chapter 2.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题在第2章中谈到了。

Sense.DEF: to improve something by changing it slightly or adding a little more to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She quickly touched up her lipstick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快地补了补唇膏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photograph had obviously been touched up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张照片明显被修饰过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The speech he finally gave had been touched up by his staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最后所作的演讲经过了手下的润色。

Sense.DEF: to touch someone in a sexual way when they do not want you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of touching up one of his students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控猥亵他的一名学生。

Sense.DEF: the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt a gentle touch on her shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到有人轻轻碰了一下她的肩膀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He remembered the touch of her fingers on his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还记得她的手指抚摸他脸的感觉。

Sense.DEF: the sense that you use to discover what something feels like, by putting your hand or fingers on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sense of touch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 触觉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Visually impaired people orient themselves by touch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 视力受损的人通过触觉确定方位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bake the cake for 30 minutes until risen and firm to the touch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕要烤30分钟﹐直到膨起来并且摸上去变硬。

Sense.DEF: talking or writing to someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔谈话或写信〕（与某人）取得联系
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll get in touch start talking or writing to you as soon as we know the results of the test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一得知测试结果就和你联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I have your phone number in case I need to get in touch with you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我你的电话号码吗？万一我需要联系你呢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bye. I’ll be in touch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再见﹐我会和你联系的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you still in touch with John are you talking to him regularly ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和约翰还联系吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m in close touch with Anna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和安娜联系密切。

GramExa.GLOSS: keep writing or talking, even though you do not see each other often
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anyway, we must stay in touch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论如何﹐我们必须保持联系。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I met him when I worked in Madrid, and I’ve kept in touch with him ever since.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在马德里工作时认识他的﹐从那以后﹐我和他一直保持着联系。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I lost touch with stopped writing or talking to Julie after we moved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们搬家后﹐我就和朱莉失去了联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can put you in touch with a local photography club give you their address or phone number so you can talk to them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以让你联系当地的一家摄影俱乐部。

Sense.DEF: to have the latest information or knowledge about something
Sense.TRAN: 了解（某事物的）最新情况[知识]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A regular newsletter keeps people in touch with local events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定期新闻简讯可以让人们了解当地时事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The speech was good and you felt he was in touch with people’s needs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个演讲不错﹐能看出他了解人们的需求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rescuers were kept in touch through radio links.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过无线电和营救人员保持联络。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A head-teacher needs to remain in close touch with teachers’ everyday concerns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长应该及时了解教师们平时关心的问题。

Subsense.DEF: to not have the latest knowledge about a subject, situation, or the way people feel
Subsense.TRAN: 不了解（某事）﹐（对某事）很生疏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m out of touch with modern medicine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不懂现代医学。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party cannot afford to lose touch with political reality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政党不能不了解政治现实。

Subsense.DEF: to not know much about modern life
Subsense.TRAN: 不了解现代生活﹐脱离时代
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Judges are often accused of being out of touch.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官们经常被人指责脱离时代。

Sense.DEF: to realize and understand something such as your feelings and attitudes
Sense.TRAN: 认识到某事物﹐了解某事物〔如自己的情感﹑态度等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first stage is to get in touch with your perceptions and accept responsibility for your relationships.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先要搞清自己的想法﹐对你们的恋情承担起责任。

Sense.DEF: a small detail that improves or completes something

GramExa.PROPFORM: put the final/finishing touches to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emma was putting the finishing touches to the cake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛在对蛋糕进行最后的修饰。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a vase of flowers in the room, which was a nice touch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里有一瓶花﹐是个很好的点缀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brass pans added a decorative touch to the plain brick wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铜锅给单调的砖墙增加了些许装饰。

Sense.DEF: a particular way of doing something, or the ability to do it in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was decorated with a very artistic touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间装饰得很有艺术气息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our staff combine efficient service with a personal touch they do things in a friendly way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的员工既有高效的服务﹐又有亲切的态度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The feminine touch was evident throughout the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整座房子都透着女性气息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His sure touch confident way of doing things and attention to detail are just as evident now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在还是那样从容自信﹑一丝不苟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barbara has a magic touch in the garden she grows things very well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芭芭拉干园艺活的本领可谓神奇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: King obviously hasn’t lost his touch lost his ability – his latest book sold in the millions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金显然文才不减当年——他的新书销量数百万册。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our furniture is guaranteed to add a touch of class to your bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的家具肯定能为您的卧室增添一些品位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add a lace top for a touch of glamour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再穿上一件蕾丝上衣会更迷人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What?’ asked Hazel, with a touch of irritation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “什么？”黑兹尔语带怒气地问道。

Sense.DEF: slightly disappointed, faster etc
Sense.TRAN: 有点失望/加快/不耐烦等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sounded a touch upset when I spoke to him on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他通电话的时候﹐他听起来有点生气。

Sense.LEXUNIT: with/at the touch of a button/key
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something can be done very easily by pressing a button
Sense.EXAMPLE: This card allows you to access your money at the touch of a button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张卡可以让你轻触一个按钮就能取到钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can get all the latest information with the touch of a button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要按一下按钮﹐你就可以得到所有最新信息。

Sense.DEF: if someone is a soft or an easy touch, you can easily persuade them to do what you want, especially give you money
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在钱方面〕好说话的人﹐有求必应的人

Sense.DEF: the way that something feels and the effect it has on your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: the warm touch of his lips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他唇上温热的触感

Sense.DEF: the area outside the lines that mark the playing area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ball rolled into touch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球滚出了边线。

Sense.DEF: used about a situation in which there is a serious risk that something bad could happen
Sense.TRAN: 一触即发﹐危险﹔没有把握
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was touch-and-go whether the doctor would get there on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生能不能准时赶到那里很难说。

Sense.DEF: the moment at which a plane or spacecraft lands

an act of putting the ball down on the ground behind the opposing team’s
goal line
in
rugby
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球赛中越过对方球门线的〕持球触地得分

Sense.DEF:
an act of moving the ball across the opposing team’s
goal line
in American football
used to emphasize in a humorous way that someone has made a very good point during an argument
Sense.TRAN: 说得好﹐说到点子上了〔用于强调某人在辩论中论点有力﹐为幽默说法〕

Sense.DEF: feeling happy and grateful because of what someone has done
Sense.TRAN: 高兴的﹔感激的﹔受感动的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were deeply touched by their present.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的礼物让我们深受感动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cathryn was touched that Sarah had come to see her off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉来送行﹐凯瑟琳很感动。

Sense.DEF: slightly crazy

a type of American football in which you touch the person with the ball instead of
tackling
them
Sense.TRAN: 触身式橄榄球〔美式橄榄球的一种﹐比赛中用身体碰触持球球员﹐而不是擒抱〕

Sense.DEF: making you feel pity, sympathy, sadness etc
Sense.TRAN: 令人同情的﹔感人的﹐动人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a touching reunion of father and son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感人的父子团聚

Sense.DEF: concerning
Sense.EXAMPLE: matters touching the conduct of diplomacy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及处理外交关系的事务

Sense.DEF: one of the two lines that mark the longer sides of a sports playing area, especially in football

a small flat part on a computer which you touch with your finger in order to move the
cursor
on the screen

a piece of special paper that burns slowly, used in order to start a
firework
burning
Sense.TRAN: 〔引燃烟花爆竹用的〕导火纸﹐火硝纸
Sense.EXAMPLE: Light the blue touchpaper, then move to a safe distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点燃蓝色的导火纸﹐然后退到安全距离。

Sense.DEF: a type of computer screen that you touch in order to tell the computer what to do or to get information
something used as a test or standard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pupil behaviour was seen as ‘the touchstone of quality’ of the school system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生的行为被看作是学校制度的“质量试金石”。

Sense.DEF: a telephone that produces different sounds when different buttons are pushed

to use a
typewriter
or a computer
keyboard
without having to look at the letters while you are using it
Sense.TRAN: 盲打〔指打字时不看键盘上的字母〕

Sense.DEF: easily becoming offended or annoyed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is very touchy about her past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对她的过去十分敏感。

Sense.DEF: a subject etc that needs to be dealt with very carefully, especially because it may offend people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Asking about a reporter’s sources can be a touchy business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 询问一名记者的消息来源有时是个敏感问题。

Sense.DEF: too concerned with feelings and emotions, rather than with facts or actions
Sense.TRAN: 过分多愁善感的﹐情绪化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a touchy-feely drama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤感的戏剧

Sense.DEF: difficult to do or deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a tough race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛打得很艰难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s had a tough life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的生活十分艰辛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tough decisions will have to be made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须作出艰难的决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

GramExa.GLOSS: face a lot of difficult problems
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family has had a tough time of it these last few months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几个月这家人日子很难熬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s tough being married to a cop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫁给一个警察日子不好过。

GramExa.GLOSS: cause problems for someone or make their life difficult
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Having to stay indoors all day is tough on a kid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于小孩子来说﹐整天待在屋里不出门是很难熬的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a tough call a difficult decision , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管是一个艰难的决定﹐但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I find his books pretty tough going difficult to read .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现他的书很难读。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell something that is difficult to persuade someone about before Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

GramExa.PROPFORM: when the going gets tough (the tough get going)
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that when a situation becomes difficult, strong people take the necessary action to deal with it

Sense.DEF: physically or emotionally strong and able to deal with difficult situations
Sense.TRAN: 坚强的﹐顽强的﹔能吃苦耐劳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men who work on the oil rigs are a tough bunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在石油钻塔上工作的都是吃苦耐劳的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who is very determined to do what they want and not what other people want

GramExa.PROPFORM: as tough as nails/as tough as old boots
GramExa.GLOSS: very tough
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 非常坚强的﹔能吃大苦的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s as tough as nails – a good man to have on the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很坚韧的人——队里有他真好。

Sense.DEF: not easily broken or made weaker
Sense.TRAN: 结实的﹐不易破损的﹔坚固的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tough, durable plastic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚韧耐用的塑料
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very tough, hard-wearing cloth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常结实﹑耐磨的布料

Sense.DEF: very strict or firm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother was very tough on my sister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲对我姐姐十分严厉。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s time to get tough with drunk drivers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是该严厉处理酒后驾车的司机了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The EU is taking a tough line with the UK over this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一问题上﹐欧盟对英国的态度很强硬。

Sense.DEF: a tough part of a town has a lot of crime or violence
Sense.TRAN: 〔城区〕暴力犯罪多发的﹐治安很差的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tough area of Chicago
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥治安很差的一个地区

Sense.DEF: used when you do not have any sympathy with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m getting wet.’ ‘Tough! You should’ve brought your umbrella.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我淋湿了。”“活该！你应该带上雨伞的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t tell us she was coming, so if this screws up her plans that’s just tough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有告诉我们她要来﹐所以如果这打乱了她的计划﹐也是活该。

Subsense.DEF: used when you do not have any sympathy for someone’s problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, that’s just their tough luck! It was their mistake.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啊﹐活该他们倒霉！那是他们自己的错。

Subsense.DEF: used when you feel sympathy about something bad that has happened to someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You didn’t get the job? Oh, tough luck!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有得到那份工作？噢﹐真不走运！

Sense.DEF: used when you do not have any sympathy for someone’s problems
likely to behave violently and having no gentle qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of football’s most notorious tough guys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球界一个声名狼藉的恶棍
Sense.EXAMPLE: tough young thugs looking for trouble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到处滋事的年轻暴徒

Sense.DEF: difficult to cut or eat
Sense.TRAN: 切不下的﹔咬不动的﹔不嫩的﹐老的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meat was tough and hard to chew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这肉太老﹐很难嚼动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tough outer leaves of the cabbage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洋白菜外面那几层老菜叶

Sense.DEF: a way of helping someone to change their behaviour by treating them in a kind but strict way
Sense.TRAN: 〔为帮助某人改变行为而采取的〕严厉的爱

Sense.DEF: to deal with a difficult situation by being determined, rather than leaving or changing your decision
Sense.TRAN: 闯过〔难关〕﹐从〔困境中〕挺过来
Sense.EXAMPLE: She told herself to be brave and tough it out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她告诉自己要勇敢地挺过去。

Sense.DEF: someone who often behaves in a violent way
in a way that shows you are very determined
Sense.EXAMPLE: Washington played tough in the second half of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华盛顿队在比赛的下半场表现得十分顽强。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re talking tough now but you wait until you get into the interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在嘴硬﹐等到你面试时就知道了。

Sense.DEF: to become tougher, or to make someone or something tougher
Sense.EXAMPLE: toughened glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强化玻璃
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three years in the army toughened him up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在部队的三年使他更加坚强了。

Sense.DEF: a small artificial piece of hair that some men wear over a place on their heads where the hair no longer grows
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子用来遮盖秃发处的〕假发

Sense.DEF: a journey for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 10-day tour of China
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国十日游

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a cycling tour of Cornwall
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康沃尔骑车游

Sense.EXAMPLE: We met on a coach tour in Italy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是在意大利乘长途客车旅游时相识的。

Sense.DEF: a short trip through a place to see it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a guided tour around the Kennedy Space Center
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪航天中心的导游陪同参观

Sense.EXAMPLE: Kim worked as a tour guide in Cambridge last summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金去年夏天在剑桥当导游。

Sense.DEF: a planned journey made by musicians, a sports team etc in order to perform or play in several places

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the England cricket team’s tour of India
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰板球队在印度的巡回比赛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Moscow Symphony Orchestra is here on tour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫斯科交响乐团来这里进行巡回演出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the first leg of the band’s European tour the first part of it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队在欧洲巡回演出的第一站

Sense.DEF: a period during which you go to live somewhere, usually abroad, to do your job, especially military work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指军人在外地、通常是国外的〕服役期﹔任职期
Sense.EXAMPLE: his third tour in Northern Ireland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在北爱尔兰的第三个派驻期

Sense.DEF: an official visit to a place, institution, group etc in order to check its quality or performance
to visit several parts of a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re touring the Greek islands this summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今年夏天去希腊的海岛旅游。

Sense.DEF: to go round or be shown round a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister had been invited to tour the new factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长受邀到新工厂进行巡视。

Sense.DEF: something that is done very skilfully and successfully, and is very impressive
Sense.TRAN: 精湛的表演﹔拿手好戏﹔杰作
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech to the Democratic Convention was a tour de force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在民主党大会上的演说精彩极了。

Sense.DEF: a medical condition that causes someone to make sudden movements and sounds, sometimes including rude words
Sense.TRAN: 图雷特综合征﹐抽动秽语综合征

Sense.DEF: the business of providing things for people to do, places for them to stay etc while they are on holiday
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country depends on tourism for much of its income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的大部分收入依靠旅游业。

Sense.DEF: someone who is visiting a place for pleasure on holiday
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cambridge is always full of tourists in the summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剑桥在夏季总是挤满了游客。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Statue of Liberty is a major tourist attraction .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由女神像是主要的旅游景点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What effect will this have on the local tourist industry ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对当地的旅游业会有什么影响？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Durham, with its cathedral and castle, is a popular tourist centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达勒姆有大教堂和城堡﹐是个十分受欢迎的旅游中心。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is visiting a place for pleasure on holiday
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel is very popular with tourists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店很受游客欢迎。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a major tourist destination
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个主要的旅游目的地

Exponent.DEF: someone who travels somewhere
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a weary traveller returning home after a long journey
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 远游归来的疲惫游客
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The building’s luxurious interior will appeal to business travellers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的豪华内部设施将会吸引商务旅客。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The strike will affect air travellers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次罢工将会对航空旅客造成影响。

Exponent.DEF: someone who comes to visit a particular country, area, museum etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Times Square attracts more than 30 million visitors annually.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 时代广场每年吸引超过3,000万的游客。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is on holiday somewhere
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The beach was packed with holiday-makers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩上挤满了度假者。

Exponent.DEF: a tourist who is visiting a famous or interesting place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Crowds of sightseers come to London every year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年都有成群的观光客来到伦敦。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is travelling for pleasure, staying in cheap accommodation and carrying a backpack
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cheap hotel which is used mainly by backpackers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要为背包客入住的廉价旅馆

Sense.DEF: the cheapest standard of travelling conditions on a plane, ship etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑轮船等上面最廉价的〕旅游舱﹐经济舱

Sense.DEF: an office that gives information to tourists in an area
a place that many tourists visit, but where drinks, hotels etc are more expensive - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 游客陷阱〔指敲游客竹杠的地方﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a place that is touristy is full of tourists and the things that attract tourists - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 挤满游客的﹐旅游味道浓的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Benidorm is too touristy for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尼多姆在我看来旅游味太浓了。

Sense.DEF: a touristy activity is typical of the things that tourists do - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动〕和旅游有关的﹐旅游的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did all the usual touristy things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游该做的事我们都做了。

Sense.DEF: a competition in which players compete against each other in a series of games until there is one winner
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel I can win this tournament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我能打赢这次锦标赛。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 网球/国际象棋/羽毛球等锦标赛

Sense.DEF: a competition to show courage and fighting skill between soldiers in the Middle Ages

a
tournament
a band of cloth that is twisted tightly around an injured arm or leg to stop it bleeding
a period of time when you are working in a particular place or job, especially abroad while you are in the army etc
Sense.TRAN: 工作期﹔〔尤指军队中派驻海外的〕服役期

Sense.DEF: a company that arranges travel tours
to make someone’s hair look untidy
tousled hair or a tousled appearance looks untidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had just awakened, her eyes sleepy and her hair tousled .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚醒﹐睡眼惺忪﹐头发蓬乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small tousled head appeared in the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个头发蓬乱的小脑袋出现在门口。

Sense.DEF: to praise something or someone in order to persuade people that they are important or worth a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: his much touted musical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那出备受推崇的音乐剧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nell is being touted as the next big thing in Hollywood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内尔被誉为好莱坞的明日之星。

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade people to buy goods or services you are offering

GramExa.GLOSS: look for customers
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Minicab drivers are not allowed to tout for business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受电话预订的出租车司机不得私自拉生意。

Sense.DEF: to give someone information about a horse in a race
someone who buys tickets for a concert, sports match etc and sells them at a higher price, usually on the street near a sports ground, theatre etc
to pull a vehicle or ship along behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship had to be towed into the harbor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘轮船不得不被拖进港口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our car had been towed away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的车被拖走了。

Sense.DEF: an act of pulling a vehicle behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give us a tow to the garage?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能帮我们把车拖到修车厂吗？

Sense.DEF: following closely behind someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hannah arrived with her four kids in tow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜到了﹐后面跟着她的四个孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned up at my office with two lawyers in tow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出现在我的办公室﹐身后跟着两名律师。

Sense.DEF: to connect a rope or a chain to a vehicle or ship so that it can be towed
if a ship is under tow or a car is on tow, it is being pulled along by another vehicle
used to say that someone or something moves, looks, faces etc in the direction of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He noticed two policemen coming towards him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他注意到两名警察正朝他走来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the windows face toward the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的窗户都朝向河。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was standing with his back towards me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他背对我站着。

Sense.DEF: in a process that will produce a particular result
Sense.EXAMPLE: These negotiations are the first step toward reaching an agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些谈判是达成协议的第一步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crisis continued as Britain drifted towards war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危机还在继续﹐英国离战争越来越近。

Sense.DEF: your feeling, attitude, or behaviour towards someone or something is how you feel or think about them or how you treat them
Sense.TRAN: 对于﹐关于〔指对待某人或某事物的感觉﹑态度等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian’s attitude towards his work has always been very positive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩的工作态度向来非常积极主动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her parents had been more sympathetic towards her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母更支持她了。

Sense.DEF: money put, saved, or given towards something is used to pay for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money collected will be put towards repairing the church roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 募集到的钱款将用于修缮教堂屋顶。

Sense.DEF: just before a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Toward the end of the afternoon it began to rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快到傍晚时﹐天下起了雨。

Sense.DEF: near a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Uncle Dick and Aunt Mavis live at High Burnton out towards the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪克叔叔和梅维丝婶婶住在海本顿靠近海边的地方。

Sense.DEF: an area where cars are not allowed to park, and from which they can be taken away by the police
Sense.TRAN: 禁止停车区〔违章车有可能被警察拖走〕

Sense.DEF:
a metal bar on the back of a car for
towing
a
caravan
or boat
a piece of cloth that you use for drying your skin or for drying things such as dishes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got a clean towel I could use?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有干净毛巾给我用？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dried her hands on the kitchen towel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用厨房毛巾擦干手。

Sense.DEF: to dry yourself using a towel
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood in the doorway, towelling his hair dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在门口﹐用毛巾擦干头发。

Sense.DEF:
thick soft cloth, used especially for making towels or
bathrobes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a towelling robe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件毛巾布睡袍

Sense.DEF: a bar or frame on which towels can be hung, especially in a bathroom
a tall narrow building either built on its own or forming part of a castle, church etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Eiffel Tower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃菲尔铁塔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a castle with tall towers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有高高的塔楼的城堡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bell tower was added to the church in 1848.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂的钟楼是1848年增建的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the leaning tower of Pisa
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比萨斜塔

Sense.DEF: a tall structure, often made of metal, used for signalling, broadcasting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an air traffic control tower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空中交通管制塔

Sense.DEF: someone who gives you a lot of help, sympathy, and support when you are in trouble
Sense.TRAN: 〔在遇到麻烦时〕可依靠的人﹔力量的支柱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father was a tower of strength to her when her marriage broke up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她婚姻破裂的时候﹐父亲是她的支柱。

Sense.DEF: a tall piece of furniture that you use to store things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a CD tower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光唱片柜

Sense.DEF: to be much taller than the people or things around you
Sense.TRAN: 〔比周围的人或物体〕高出许多﹔高耸﹐屹立

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He towered over his mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比他的母亲高出很多。

Sense.DEF: to be much better than any other person or organization that does the same thing as you
Sense.TRAN: 胜过﹐超过〔从事同样工作的其他人或机构〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mozart towers over all other composers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特远远超过所有其他作曲家。

Sense.DEF: a tall building containing apartments or offices
Sense.TRAN: 〔有公寓套房或办公室的〕高层建筑

Sense.DEF: very tall
Sense.EXAMPLE: great towering cliffs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雄伟高耸的峭壁

Sense.DEF: much better than other people of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a towering genius of his time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那个时代的一名盖世英才

Sense.DEF: very angry

a
towrope
a large area with houses, shops, offices etc where people live and work, that is smaller than a city and larger than a village
Sense.EXAMPLE: an industrial town in the Midlands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰中部的一座工业城镇

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the town of Norwalk, Connecticut
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康涅狄格州诺沃克镇

Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked to the nearest town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走到最近的镇上。

Sense.DEF: the business or shopping centre of a town
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going into town tonight to see a film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今晚要去市中心看电影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have a small apartment in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在市中心有一套小公寓。

Sense.DEF: all the people who live in a particular town
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole town turned out to watch the procession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全镇的人都出来观看游行队伍。

Sense.DEF: the town or city where you live
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cam left town about an hour ago, so he should be out at the farm by now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡姆是大约一小时前离开城里的﹐他现在应该到农场了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be out of town for about a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要出城一星期左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guess who’s in town ? Jodie’s sister!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猜猜谁到城里来了？乔迪的妹妹！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know of a good place to eat? I’m from out of town from a different town .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能介绍个吃饭的好地方吗？我是外地人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re moving to another part of town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要搬到城里的另一个地方去。

Sense.DEF: several houses forming a small group around a church, shops etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔围绕某个教堂﹑商店等形成的〕小乡镇﹐集镇
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rowayton is a small town of around 4,000 people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗威顿是一个4,000人左右的小镇。

Sense.DEF: life in towns and cities in general
Sense.TRAN: 城镇生活﹐城市生活〔统称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which do you prefer, the town or the country?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市生活和乡村生活﹐你更喜欢哪一种？

Sense.DEF: to do something in a very eager or thorough way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angela really went to town on buying things for her new house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安杰拉疯狂地给她的新居购置物品。

Sense.DEF: going to restaurants, bars, theatres etc for entertainment in the evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank is taking me out for a night on the town .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克要带我出去玩一个晚上。

Sense.DEF: used to describe the situation in which the people living in a town and the students in a town seem to be separate and opposing groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔分成两派﹑相互对立的〕市民和学生

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I grew up in a small town in Iowa.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在艾奥瓦州的一个小镇上长大的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a pretty little town in the French Alps
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国阿尔卑斯山区一个美丽的小镇

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is one of the UK’s biggest retailers with shops in every major town.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是英国最大的零售商之一﹐其商店遍布每一个大型城镇。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The town was busy even in November.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至在11月﹐该镇也很繁忙。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The town is quiet in the summer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天﹐该镇静悄悄的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very quiet, with not much happening
one that is not near the capital
a town in Britain where there is a regular outdoor market
the town where someone was born

Collocate.COLLOC: the centre of town/the town centre

Variant.ORTHVAR: the center of town/the town center

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The hotel was right in the center of town.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店就在镇中心。

Sense.DEF: the main business area in the centre of a town
an official who keeps the records of a town
Sense.TRAN: 〔主管一镇档案工作的〕镇文书

Sense.DEF: an elected group of people who are responsible for public areas and services, such as roads, parks etc, in a particular town
Sense.TRAN: 〔负责管理某一城镇公共事务的〕镇政务委员会﹐镇议会

Sense.DEF: someone employed in the past to walk around the streets of a town, shouting news, warnings etc
Sense.TRAN: 街头公告员﹐公告传报人〔旧时受雇沿街大声宣读公告的人〕

Sense.DEF: a public building used for a town’s local government
Sense.TRAN: 镇公所﹐镇政府办公楼﹐市政厅

Sense.DEF: a house in a town or city, especially a fashionable one in a central area
Sense.TRAN: 市镇住宅〔尤指市镇中心区的新式住宅〕

Sense.DEF: a house in a town that belongs to someone who also owns a house in the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 〔在乡间拥有住所者的〕市内住宅
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Duke’s townhouse in Mayfair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公爵在梅费尔的市内住宅

Sense.DEF: a house in a group of houses that share one or more walls
someone who lives in a town or city and does not know anything about life in the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 〔对乡村生活一无所知的〕城里人

Sense.DEF: a meeting at which the people who live in a town discuss subjects or problems that affect their town
the study of the way towns work, so that roads, houses, services etc can be provided as effectively as possible
the way a town or large parts of a town look
Sense.EXAMPLE: industrial townscapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业化的城市面貌
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edinburgh’s historic townscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡的历史风貌

Sense.DEF: a town in Canada or the US that has some local government
Sense.TRAN: 〔加拿大或美国享有一定地方行政权的〕区﹐镇区

Sense.DEF: all the people who live in a particular town
Sense.EXAMPLE: the proud townspeople of Semer Water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞默－沃特城自豪的居民们

Sense.DEF:
a path along the side of a
canal
or river, used especially in the past by horses pulling boats
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时运河或河流两岸供马拉船的〕曳船道﹐纤路

Sense.DEF: a rope or chain used for pulling vehicles along
a strong vehicle that can pull cars behind it
a medical condition in which your blood contains poisons
containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances
Sense.TRAN: 有毒的﹔由有毒物质引起的
Sense.EXAMPLE: fumes from a toxic waste dump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Toxic chemicals were spilled into the river.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒化学品流入了河里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly toxic pesticide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒性很强的杀虫剂

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The metal has a relatively low toxicity to humans.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种金属对人类毒性相对较低。

Sense.DEF: the science and medical study of poisons and their effects

a serious illness that causes a high temperature and is thought to be connected with the use of
tampons
Sense.TRAN: 中毒性休克综合征〔一种严重疾病 会引发高烧﹐被认为与使用月经棉塞有关〕

Sense.DEF: waste products from industry that are harmful to people, animals, or the environment
Sense.EXAMPLE: a toxic waste dump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒工业垃圾堆
Sense.EXAMPLE: international agreements about the disposal of toxic waste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于有毒工业垃圾处理的国际协定

Sense.DEF:
a poisonous substance, especially one that is produced by
bacteria
and causes a particular disease
Sense.TRAN: 毒素〔尤指细菌产生的致病物质〕

Sense.DEF: an object for children to play with
Sense.EXAMPLE: some toys for the baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝玩的一些玩具

GramExa.GLOSS: a toy that looks like an animal and is covered in fur

Sense.EXAMPLE: Annie was playing happily with her toys .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮正高兴地玩着玩具。

Sense.DEF: an object that you buy because it gives you pleasure and enjoyment, especially one that you don’t really need
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food mixer is her latest toy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个食品搅拌器是她最近的“玩具”。

Sense.DEF: an object that adults use to obtain sexual pleasure
to think about an idea or possibility, usually for a short time and not very seriously
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常指短暂且不很认真地〕考虑

GramExa.PROPFORM: toy with the idea of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been toying with the idea of going to Japan to visit them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最近有个念头﹐想去日本看看他们。

Sense.DEF: to keep moving and touching an object or food
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke casually and toyed with his pen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一边漫不经心地说着﹐一边摆弄着他的钢笔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura was toying with her food and looking increasingly bored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉拨弄着自己的饭菜﹐显得越来越厌烦了。

Sense.DEF: to lie to someone or trick them, for example saying that you love them when you do not
a toy animal or dog is a type of dog that is specially bred to be very small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a toy poodle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小鬈毛狗

Sense.DEF: a young man who is having a sexual relationship with an older woman - used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔与年龄较大的女性有性关系的〕小男人﹐小情人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to find someone or something that has disappeared by searching for them carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had given up all hope of tracing her missing daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经完全放弃了寻找失踪女儿的希望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are trying to trace a young woman who was seen near the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在设法寻找被目击出现在事故现场附近的一名年轻女子。

Sense.DEF: to find the origins of when something began or where it came from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve traced their ancestry to Scotland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将自己的世系追溯到苏格兰。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The style of these paintings can be traced back to early medieval influences.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些绘画的风格可以追溯到中世纪早期的影响。

Sense.DEF: to study or describe the history, development, or progress of something
Sense.TRAN: 研究…的历史﹔探索…的发展﹔追寻…的轨迹
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sondheim’s book traces the changing nature of the relationship between men and women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德海姆的这本书研究了男女关系性质的变化。

Sense.DEF: to copy a drawing, map etc by putting a piece of transparent paper over it and then drawing the lines you can see through the paper
to draw real or imaginary lines on the surface of something, usually with your finger or toe
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手指或脚趾在物体表面〕画〔线〕﹔留下〔印迹〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rosie’s fingers traced a delicate pattern in the sand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗茜用手指在沙地上画出一幅精美的图案。

Sense.DEF: to find out where a telephone call is coming from by using special electronic equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔利用特殊的电子设备〕追踪电话
Sense.EXAMPLE: His call was traced and half an hour later police arrested him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的电话被追踪﹐半小时后警方就逮捕了他。

Sense.DEF: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

GramExa.GLOSS: disappear completely, without leaving any sign of what happened
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 消失/隐没/沉没得无影无踪
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane vanished without a trace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机消失得无影无踪。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of a quality, emotion, substance etc that is difficult to see or notice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: traces of poison
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 微量毒物

Sense.DEF: a search to find out where a telephone call came from, using special electronic equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔利用特殊电子设备对电话的〕追查﹐追踪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police put a trace on the call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方对电话进行了追踪。

Sense.DEF:
the mark or pattern made on a
screen
or on paper by a machine that is recording an electrical signal
Sense.TRAN: 〔记录电信号的机器在屏幕或纸上作的〕描记线﹐描记图
Sense.EXAMPLE: This trace shows the heartbeat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条描记线显示心跳。

Sense.DEF:
one of the two pieces of leather, rope etc by which a
cart
or carriage is fastened to an animal pulling it

a chemical
element
that your body needs a very small amount of to live
Sense.TRAN: 微量元素〔人体所需的微量化学物质〕

Sense.DEF:
a chemical
element
that only exists in small amounts on Earth
a bullet that leaves a line of smoke or flame behind it
the curving and crossing lines of stone in the upper parts of some church windows
Sense.TRAN: 〔一些教堂窗户上部的〕花色窗棂

Sense.DEF: an attractive pattern of lines that cross each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the delicate tracery of the bare branches against the sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光秃秃的枝丫映衬在天空下构成的美丽图案

Sense.DEF: the tube that takes air from your throat to your lungs
an operation to cut a hole in someone’s throat so that they can breathe

a copy of a map, drawing etc made by
tracing
it

strong transparent paper used for
tracing
a narrow path or road with a rough uneven surface, especially one made by people or animals frequently moving through the same place
Sense.TRAN: 〔路面起伏不平的﹐尤指踩踏出来的〕小道﹐小路﹐小径
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road leading to the farm was little more than a dirt track .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一条烂泥小路通往农场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The track led through dense forest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小径穿过茂密的森林。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steep mountain track
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡峭的山路

Sense.DEF: a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑兽等的〕足迹﹐痕迹﹔〔车辆的〕车辙
Sense.EXAMPLE: We followed the tyre tracks across a muddy field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们顺着车辙穿过一块泥泞的田地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tracks, which looked like a fox’s, led into the woods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些足迹看着像是狐狸留下的﹐一直通向树林里。

Sense.DEF: a circular course around which runners, cars etc race, which often has a specially prepared surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: To run a mile, you have to run four circuits of the track.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑一英里要绕跑道四圈。

Subsense.DEF: the two metal lines along which trains travel
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The track was damaged in several places.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁轨有几处毁损。

Subsense.DEF: the particular track that a train leaves from or arrives at
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The train for Boston is leaving from track 2.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开往波士顿的列车即将从2号站台发车。

Sense.DEF: to think in a way that is likely to lead to a correct or incorrect result
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had the initial test results and it looks as though we’re on the right track.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有了初步的试验结果﹐看起来我们的思路是正确的。

Sense.DEF: to pay attention to someone or something, so that you know where they are or what is happening to them, or to fail to do this
Sense.TRAN: 了解/不了解某人的情况/某事的动态
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to keep track of all the new discoveries in genetics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难做到随时了解遗传学的全部最新发现。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just lost all track of time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我根本不知道时间。

Sense.DEF:
one of the songs or pieces of music on a record,
cassette
, or
cd
Sense.TRAN: 〔唱片﹑录音带或激光唱片上的〕歌曲﹔曲子
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a great Miles Davis track on side two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在第二面有迈尔斯•戴维斯的一首名曲。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly stop, especially because something has frightened or surprised you
to be careful not to leave any signs that could let people know where you have been or what you have done because you want to keep it a secret, usually because it is illegal
Sense.TRAN: 掩盖[隐匿]自己的行踪﹐隐匿自己的活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to cover his tracks by burning all the documents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他烧毁了所有的文件﹐试图掩盖自己的所作所为。

Subsense.DEF: sport that involves running on a track
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The next year he didn’t run track or play football.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二年他没有参加径赛运动﹐也没有踢美式足球。

Subsense.DEF:
all the sports in an
athletics
competition such as running, jumping, or throwing the
javelin
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a famous track star
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田径明星
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She went out for track in the spring she joined the school’s track team .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在春季加入了学校的田径队。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to achieve the result you want
Sense.TRAN: 有可能获得〔想要的结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still on track for 10% growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍然有可能达到10%的增长率。

Sense.DEF: to begin to deal with a new subject rather than the main one which was being discussed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get off the track, we’re looking at this year’s figures not last year’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别离题﹐我们是在说今年的数字﹐而不是去年的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the track of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to hunt or search for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are on the track of the bank robbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在追踪银行劫匪。

Sense.DEF: used to say you must leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we started making tracks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该走了。

Sense.DEF: the direction or line taken by something as it moves
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体移动的〕方向﹐路径﹐所经路线

GramExa.EXAMPLE: islands that lie in the track of North Atlantic storms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于北大西洋风暴路径上的岛屿

Sense.DEF:
a continuous metal band that goes over the wheels of a vehicle such as a
bulldozer
, allowing it to move over uneven ground

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be from the wrong side of the tracks

Sense.DEF: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
Sense.TRAN: 追踪﹐〔循着踪迹﹑气味等〕找寻
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dogs tracked the wolf to its lair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那群狗循着狼的足迹一直追到它的巢穴。

Sense.DEF: to record or study the behaviour or development of someone or something over time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The progress of each student is tracked by computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个学生的进度都由电脑进行跟踪。

Sense.DEF:
to follow the movements of an aircraft or ship by using
radar
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tracking station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟踪站
