the particular sound that someone makes when they walk
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard the back door bang, and Rex’s tread in the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到后门重重关上﹐然后是雷克斯在门厅里走动的脚步声。

Sense.DEF: a flat piece of metal or wood that you move with your foot to turn a wheel in a machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔用脚踩踏使机器轮子转动的〕踏板

Sense.DEF: a piece of exercise equipment that has a large belt around a set of wheels, that you can walk or run on while staying in the same place
work or a way of life that seems very boring because you always have to do the same things
Sense.TRAN: 单调而枯燥的工作[生活]
Sense.EXAMPLE: the treadmill of working in the office
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单调枯燥的办公室工作

Sense.DEF:
a
mill
worked in the past by prisoners treading on steps fixed to a very large wheel
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去由犯人踩动踏板使大轮转动的〕踏车磨粉机

Sense.DEF: the crime of being disloyal to your country or its government, especially by helping its enemies or trying to remove the government using violence

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Richter is accused of committing treason against the state.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克特被控犯有叛国罪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The defendant was convicted of high treason treason of the worst kind and sentenced to death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告被判犯有严重叛国罪﹐并处以死刑。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a treasonable act against the head of state
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对国家元首的一次叛国行动

Sense.DEF: a group of valuable things such as gold, silver, jewels etc

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 埋在地下的/被藏起来的/沉在海底的财宝

Sense.DEF: a very valuable and important object such as a painting or ancient document
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Book of Kells is Trinity College’s greatest treasure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《凯尔经》是三一学院的镇院之宝。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very useful or important to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our housekeeper is a real treasure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的管家真是一个宝。

Sense.DEF: to keep and care for something that is very special, important, or valuable to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim treasured the gold pocket watch that his grandfather had given him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆十分珍爱祖父送给他的金怀表。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: A battered old guitar was his most treasured possession .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把破旧的老吉他是他最珍贵的财产。

Sense.DEF: a box that holds treasure
a game in which you have to find something that has been hidden by answering questions that are left in different places
Sense.TRAN: 寻宝游戏〔通过解答留在不同地点的问题来找到隐藏之物〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is officially responsible for the money for an organization, club, political party etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构﹑俱乐部﹑政党等的〕司库﹐财务主管

Sense.DEF: a group of valuable or interesting things or pieces of information, or the place where they are
Sense.TRAN: 有价值的物品[信息]﹔藏宝地﹐宝库

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our Science Shop is a treasure trove of curiosities and gadgets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的“科学商店”是一座新奇物品的宝库。

Sense.DEF: valuable objects, coins etc that are found where they have been hidden or buried, which are not claimed by anyone
Sense.TRAN: 〔在埋藏地被发掘出的〕无主财宝

Sense.DEF: a government department that controls the money that the country collects and spends

a place in a castle, church,
palace
etc where money or valuable objects are kept
Sense.TRAN: 〔城堡﹑教堂﹑宫殿等的〕金库﹐宝库

Sense.DEF: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She treats me like one of the family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把我当作家人看待。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Penny doesn’t think her co-workers treat her as an equal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彭妮认为她的同事没有平等地对待她。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He treated his automobiles almost as tenderly as he did his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对汽车几乎就像对妻子一样温柔。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were well treated by their guards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯受到看守很好的对待。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite her seniority, Margot was never treated with much respect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛戈尽管是前辈﹐但从未受到多少尊重。

GramExa.GLOSS: treat someone unkindly and without respect
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 把某人不当人看待/当狗看待
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know why he stays with her - she treats him like dirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道为什么他还跟她在一起——她就没把他当人看待。

Sense.DEF: to deal with, regard, or consider something in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please treat this information as completely confidential.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此信息请绝对保密。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She treats everything I say as a joke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说什么她都当是开玩笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any complaint about safety standards must be treated very seriously.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何有关安全标准的投诉都必须十分认真地对待。

Sense.DEF: to try to cure an illness or injury by using drugs, hospital care, operations etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was difficult to treat patients because of a shortage of medicine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于缺少药物﹐很难给病人治病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nowadays, malaria can be treated with drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐疟疾可以用药物医治。

Sense.DEF: to buy or do something special for someone that you know they will enjoy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We treated Mom to lunch at the Savoy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们请妈妈在萨沃伊酒店吃午饭。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I treated myself to a new dress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我犒劳自己一条新的连衣裙。

Sense.DEF: to put a special substance on something or use a chemical process in order to protect, clean, or preserve it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用特别的物质或某种化学方法〕处理
Sense.EXAMPLE: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

Sense.DEF: something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔给某人的〕特别待遇﹐款待﹐招待

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steven took his son to a cricket match as a birthday treat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文带儿子去看板球比赛﹐作为生日的特别待遇。

Sense.DEF: an event that gives you a lot of pleasure and is usually unexpected
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we were kids, a trip to the beach was a real treat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们小时候﹐到海滩去玩是件特别开心的事。

Sense.DEF: a special food that tastes good, especially one that you do not eat very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cafe serves an assortment of gourmet treats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家小餐馆供应各种美味佳肴。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you will pay for something such as a meal for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go out to lunch - my treat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出去吃午饭吧——我请客。

Sense.DEF: if something goes down a treat, people like it very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: That new vegetarian restaurant seems to be going down a treat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家新的素食餐馆似乎很受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to look very good or work very well
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sports ground looked a treat, with all the flags flying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动场上彩旗飘扬﹐很有气氛。

Sense.DEF: a treatable illness or injury can be helped with drugs or an operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Certain forms of cancer are treatable with drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些癌症可以用药物治疗。

Sense.DEF: a serious book or article about a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a treatise on medical ethics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部医学伦理专著

Sense.DEF: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There have been great advances in the treatment of cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症治疗有了很大的进展。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The best treatment for a cold is to rest and drink lots of fluids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗感冒的最佳方法是休息和多喝水。

Sense.DEF: a particular way of behaving towards someone or of dealing with them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Civil rights groups have complained about the harsh treatment of prisoners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民权组织抱怨犯人受到虐待。

GramExa.GLOSS: when one person is treated better than another
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two young princes were not singled out for special treatment at school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位小王子在学校里并没有享受特殊待遇。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Just lately, Kyra has been giving me the silent treatment refusing to speak to me because she is angry with me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在最近﹐凯拉一直对我不理不睬。

Sense.DEF: a particular way of dealing with or talking about a subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔针对某一主题的〕处理 讨论﹐论述
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think the film gave the issue serious treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为影片没有严肃对待这个问题。

Sense.DEF: a process by which something is cleaned, protected etc
Sense.TRAN: 处理〔指清理﹑保护等过程〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the treatment of polluted rivers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对污染河流的治理

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was given treatment at a local hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在当地医院接受治疗。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Two boys received treatment for gunshot wounds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男孩接受了枪伤治疗。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A few years earlier she’d undergone fertility treatment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 数年前﹐她接受过不孕症治疗。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become better when given treatment

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The drug may prove to be an effective treatment for brain tumours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该药对脑瘤或有积极疗效。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Every patient has a right to refuse medical treatment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个病人都有权拒绝治疗。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Several people needed hospital treatment for burns.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个人需入院治疗烧伤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: treatment to help someone who is unable to have children

Sense.DEF: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides have agreed to sign the treaty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都同意签署该条约。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The peace treaty ends nearly four years of violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该和平条约结束了将近四年的暴力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a treaty on political union
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治联合条约

Sense.DEF: three times as big, as much, or as many as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sold the house for treble the amount they paid for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以买进时三倍的价格卖掉了房子。

Sense.DEF: to become three times as big in amount, size, or number, or to make something increase in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their profits have trebled in the last two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的利润在最近两年里达到了之前的三倍。

Sense.DEF: the upper half of the whole range of musical notes
a boy’s high singing voice, or a boy with a voice like this
Sense.TRAN: 男童高音﹔唱高音的男童

Sense.DEF: the part of a musical work that is written for a treble voice or instrument
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐作品的〕高音声部﹐高音部

Sense.DEF: a treble voice or instrument produces high notes

a sign () at the beginning of a line of written music which shows that the note written on the bottom line of the
stave
is an E above
middle c
a very tall plant that has branches and leaves, and lives for many years
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a kid, I loved to climb trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小时候﹐我喜欢爬树。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We planted a peach tree in the backyard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在后院种了一棵桃树。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the trunk of an old oak tree the main central part, from which the branches grow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一棵老橡树的树干

PIC.HEADING: TREE 树
PIC.PICCONTENT: oak tree 橡树；acorn 橡实；sapling 树苗；trunk 树干；branch 树枝；roots 树根；bark 树皮；log 原木；bud 花苞；stalk 梗；blossom 花；leaf 叶；needles 松针；pine cone 松果；petal 花瓣；stem 茎；bulb 球茎；soil 土壤；seedling 幼苗；seed 种子

Sense.DEF: a drawing that connects things with lines to show how they are related to each other
a wooden structure built in the branches of a tree for children to play in
someone who wants to protect the environment, and who takes part in protests which some people think are silly – used showing disapproval
a treeless area has no trees in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a treeless landscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寸木不生的地貌

Sense.DEF:
the
timberline
a tree-lined road has trees on both sides
the treatment of damaged trees, especially by cutting off branches
Sense.TRAN: 树木整形（术）﹐树木修补（术）〔尤指修剪树枝〕

Sense.DEF: the branches at the top of a tree
a type of small plant that has leaves which divide into three parts
a pattern in the shape of these leaves
a long and difficult journey, made especially on foot as an adventure
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lonely trek through the forest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越森林的孤独跋涉

Sense.DEF: a distance that seems long when you walk it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid it’s a bit of a trek to the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到车站恐怕要走点路。

Sense.DEF: to make a long and difficult journey, especially on foot
Sense.TRAN: 长途跋涉〔尤指徒步旅行〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The elevator was broken, so we had to trek up six flights of stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电梯坏了﹐所以我们只好爬了六层楼梯。

Sense.DEF: to walk a long way, especially in the mountains, as an adventure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For five days he trekked across the mountains of central China.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在华中的山区跋涉了五天。

Sense.DEF: a frame made of long narrow pieces of wood that cross each other, used to support climbing plants
Sense.TRAN: 〔用细长木条搭成﹐用以支撑攀缘植物的〕棚﹐架

Sense.DEF: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因难受或受到惊吓而〕颤抖﹐发抖﹐战栗
Sense.EXAMPLE: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的嘴唇开始颤抖﹐接着就哭了起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greene was on his feet now, his body trembling with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林这会儿站了起来﹐气得全身直哆嗦。

Sense.DEF: to shake slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole house trembled as the train went by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车开过﹐整座房子都在震颤。

Sense.DEF: if your voice trembles, it sounds nervous and unsteady
to be worried or frightened about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tremble to think what will happen when she finds out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到她知道了会怎样﹐我就害怕。

Sense.DEF: very big, fast, powerful etc
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的﹔极快的﹔强有力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然一声巨响﹐整个车站都晃动了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年到目前为止﹐销售额十分惊人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: excellent
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got a tremendous voice, hasn’t she?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一副绝好的嗓子﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: musical notes which are repeated very quickly

a small
earthquake
in which the ground shakes slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: an earth tremor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小地震

Sense.DEF: a slight shaking movement in your body that you cannot control, especially because you are ill, weak, or upset
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因生病﹑虚弱或生气而不能控制的〕颤抖﹐发抖

Sense.DEF: shaking slightly, especially because you are nervous
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因紧张而〕颤抖的﹐微微发抖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tremulous voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颤抖的声音

Sense.DEF: a long narrow hole dug into the surface of the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers dug a trench for gas lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们挖了一条沟来铺设煤气管道。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow valley in the ground beneath the sea
a deep trench dug in the ground as a protection for soldiers
Sense.EXAMPLE: the trenches of World War I
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一次世界大战的堑壕

Sense.DEF: the place or situation where most of the work or action in an activity takes place
Sense.TRAN: 第一线〔指某一活动进行得最热烈的地方或场面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lane left teaching after 30 years in the trenches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一线工作30年后﹐莱恩离开了教学岗位。

Sense.DEF: expressed very strongly, effectively, and directly without worrying about offending people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stockman became one of the President’s most trenchant critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯托克曼成了总统最尖锐的批评者之一。

Sense.DEF:
a long
raincoat
with a belt
a plate used in the past for serving food
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时用来盛食物的〕木盘﹐大浅盘

Sense.DEF:
a method of fighting in which soldiers from opposing armies are in
trenches
facing each other
a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lately there has been a trend towards hiring younger, cheaper employees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来的趋势是雇用较年轻﹑薪酬较低的雇员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: recent trends in education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育的最新动向

Sense.EXAMPLE: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势
Sense.EXAMPLE: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个令人担心的趋势是﹐暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管如此﹐基本趋势仍是乐观的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: national and international economic trends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内和国际的经济趋势
Sense.EXAMPLE: the downward trend in the price of gold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金价格的下滑势头
Sense.EXAMPLE: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势﹐但均未成功。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something that other people copy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Larger corporations are setting the trend for better maternity benefits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 较大的公司在开创新风﹐提供更好的生育福利。

Sense.DEF: fashionable – used especially in magazines
Sense.EXAMPLE: This striped dress is bang on trend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此款条纹连衣裙正流行。

Sense.DEF: someone who starts a new fashion or makes it popular
Sense.TRAN: 开创新潮流的人﹐开创新风的人

Sense.DEF: someone who notices and reports on new fashions, activities that people are starting to do, or the way a situation is developing
Sense.TRAN: 善观新风者﹐善于预测新潮流的人

Sense.DEF: influenced by the most fashionable styles and ideas
Sense.TRAN: 时髦的﹔受新潮思想影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trendy Bay Area restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海湾地区一家时髦的餐馆

Sense.DEF: someone who tries hard to be fashionable and follows all the latest styles – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 时髦人物﹐追逐时尚的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: young trendies from art college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自艺术学院的赶时髦的年轻人

Sense.DEF: a feeling of anxiety or fear about something that is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: With some trepidation, I opened the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有些惴惴不安地打开了门。

Sense.DEF: to go onto some-one’s private land without their permission

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was arrested for trespassing on government property.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因擅闯政府属地而被逮捕。

Sense.DEF: to do something wrong
to unfairly use more than you should of someone else’s time, help etc for your own advantage
Sense.TRAN: 过多占用〔别人的时间〕﹔过多利用〔别人的帮助〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be trespassing on their hospitality to accept any more from them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再接受他们的给予就是滥用他们的好意了。

Sense.DEF: the offence of going onto someone’s land without their permission
Sense.EXAMPLE: He will be prosecuted for trespass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将因擅闯私地而被起诉。

Sense.DEF: something you have done that is morally wrong
a woman’s long hair
an A-shaped frame used as one of the two supports for a temporary table
Sense.TRAN: 〔支撑临时桌面的A字形的〕支架

Sense.DEF: a bridge with an A-shaped frame supporting it
a temporary table made of a long board supported on trestles
three

GramExa.GLOSS: speaking three languages
a shape with three sides

Sense.DEF: a Chinese secret criminal group
Sense.TRAN: 三合会〔华人黑社会组织〕

Sense.DEF: a group of three people or things that are related or similar to each other
Sense.TRAN: 三人组合﹔三种事物的组合

Sense.DEF: the method of deciding who receives medical treatment first, according to how seriously someone is injured
Sense.TRAN: 急救分类﹐伤员分类 〔按伤者的伤势决定治疗的次序〕

Sense.DEF:
a legal process in which a judge and often a
jury
in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trial is due to start next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审理定于下周开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brady was on trial for assault.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉迪因侵犯他人而受审。

Sense.DEF: a process of testing to find out whether something works effectively and is safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new drug that is undergoing clinical trials
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在接受临床试验的一种新药

Sense.DEF: a short period during which you use or do something or employ someone to find out whether they are satisfactory for a particular purpose or job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They let me have the computer on trial for thirty days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让我试用这台电脑30天。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The security system will be reviewed after a three-month trial period .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套安全系统在3个月试用期后将进行重新评估。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith was hired on a six-month trial basis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯的试用期是6个月。

GramExa.GLOSS: a period of time in which a husband and wife do not live together, to find out whether they want to stay married

Sense.DEF: if you do something by trial and error, you test many different methods of doing something in order to find the best
Sense.TRAN: 反复试验〔以得出最佳结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I learned most of what I know about gardening through trial and error.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的大部分园艺知识都是通过反复摸索得来的。

Sense.DEF: something that is difficult to deal with, and that is worrying or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 艰难困苦﹐令人伤脑筋的人［事］
Sense.EXAMPLE: the daily trials of living in a poor country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在贫穷国家的日常艰辛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My brothers and I were always a real trial to my parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和我的兄弟们总是让父母伤透脑筋。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the trials and tribulations of running a business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经营企业的艰辛与困苦

Sense.DEF: a special sports competition in which people who want to be on a team are tested, so that the best can be chosen

GramExa.GLOSS: a sporting competition in which horses or dogs compete

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be being judged in a court of law
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her son is on trial charged with murder.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她儿子因被控谋杀正在受审。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be judged in a court of law
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Doctors said he was unfit to stand trial.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说他不宜受审。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Taylor went on trial accused of fraud.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒因被控诈骗接受了审判。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Its managing director is awaiting trial on corruption charges.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 其总经理因贪污指控正在候审。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They should never have been put on trial, let alone convicted.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 根本就不应该把他们送上法庭受审,更别说给他们定罪了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially begins
it is officially stopped for several days, weeks, or months

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 谋杀案/欺诈案等的审判
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was a witness in a murder trial.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一宗谋杀案审判中做过证人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is entitled to a fair trial.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有权获得公正的审判。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for cases involving a crime
for cases dealing with the private affairs of citizens, rather than cases involving a crime

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If the case ever went to trial, he would probably lose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个案子如果提交法庭审理的话﹐他很可能会输。

Sense.DEF: to thoroughly test something to see if it works correctly or is effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: These techniques were trialled by teachers in 300 schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些方法经过了300所学校老师的试用。

Sense.DEF: something that you do or say in order to see whether other people will accept something or not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Senator Lott is floating trial balloons to test public opinion on the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛特参议员放出“试探性气球”﹐看看舆论对这项议案的反应。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you test a new method or system to see if it works well
Sense.TRAN: 〔新方法或新系统的〕试行﹐试验
Sense.EXAMPLE: This year is something of a trial run for the new service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年可以说是这个新服务项目的试行期。

Sense.DEF: a flat shape with three straight sides and three angles

PIC.HEADING: TRIANGLES 三角形
PIC.PICCONTENT: equilateral 等边的；scalene 不等边的；isosceles 等腰的；right-angled 直角的

Sense.DEF: something that is shaped like a triangle
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triangle of land
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块三角地

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument made of metal bent into the shape of a triangle. You hit it with a metal stick to make a ringing sound.
a flat plastic object with three sides that has one angle of 90˚ and is used for drawing angles
shaped like a triangle
involving three people or teams
Sense.TRAN: 涉及三人的﹔三方之间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triangular sporting competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项由三方参加的体育比赛

Sense.DEF: a method of finding your position by measuring the lines and angles of a triangle on a map

belonging or relating to the period between about 245 million and 202 million years ago, when life in the sea and on land changed and spread a lot, and
dinosaurs
first appeared
a sports competition in which competitors run, swim, and cycle long distances
Sense.TRAN: 铁人三项运动〔包括赛跑﹑游泳和骑自行车〕

Sense.DEF: relating to a tribe or tribes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tribal dance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部落舞蹈
Sense.EXAMPLE: tribal cultures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部落文化

Sense.DEF: behaviour and attitudes that are based on strong loyalty to your tribe
the state of being organized into tribes

a social group consisting of people of the same
race
who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tribe of Aborigines known as the Dolphin People
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个叫“海豚族”的澳大利亚土著部落

Sense.DEF: a group of people with the same interests – used especially to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔兴趣相同的〕一批（人）﹐一伙〔多含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: tribes of journalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者群体

Sense.DEF: a group of related animals or plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cat tribe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫族

Sense.DEF: a large family
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were only expecting Jack and his wife, but the whole tribe turned up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以为只是杰克和他的妻子会来﹐但结果他们一大家子都来了。

Sense.DEF: a man who is a member of a tribe
a woman who is a member of a tribe
serious trouble or a serious problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even close friends were unaware of the tribulations she faced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是亲近的朋友也不了解她所面对的种种艰辛。

Sense.DEF: a type of court that is given official authority to deal with a particular situation or problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case of your redundancy will be heard by an independent tribunal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你被裁员一案将由一个独立的审理委员会来审理。

Sense.DEF: an official in ancient Rome who was elected by the ordinary people to protect their rights
Sense.TRAN: 〔古罗马由平民选出的〕护民官﹐保民官

Sense.DEF: a stream or river that flows into a larger river
something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔向某人表示敬慕的〕致敬（行为）﹔颂词﹔礼品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to pay tribute to praise and admire publicly the party workers for all their hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬﹐感谢他们的辛苦努力。

Sense.DEF: to be a clear sign of the good qualities that someone or something has
Sense.TRAN: 是某人/某物优良品质的标志[证明]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a tribute to her teaching methods that so many children passed the test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么多孩子通过测验﹐这证明了她的教学方法很有效。

Sense.DEF: a payment of goods or money by one ruler or country to another more powerful one, especially in order to be protected
Sense.TRAN: 〔一国向强国交付的〕贡品﹐贡赋﹐贡金

Sense.DEF: flowers sent to a funeral
a group of musicians who play and sing the songs of a famous group, trying to sound and look like them
very quickly or soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should be here in a trice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他应该很快就到这儿了。

Sense.DEF: the large muscle at the back of your upper arm
something you do in order to deceive someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假装不记得是他的老花招了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t really lose his wallet - that’s just a trick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他并没有真的丢了钱包——这只是一个骗局。

Sense.DEF: something you do to surprise someone and to make other people laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m getting tired of your silly tricks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对你那些愚蠢的恶作剧感到厌烦了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls were playing tricks on their teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩子们正在捉弄她们的老师。

Sense.SIGNPOST: STH THAT MAKES THINGS APPEAR DIFFERENT
Sense.DEF: something that makes things appear to be different from the way they really are
Sense.TRAN: 引起错觉[记忆紊乱]的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: After walking for hours in the hot sun, his mind began playing tricks on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在火辣辣的太阳底下走了很久﹐他的头脑开始迷糊了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first he thought someone was coming towards him, but it was just a trick of the light .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始他以为有人朝他走来﹐原来只是光线引起的错觉。

Sense.DEF: an unkind or unfair thing to do
Sense.TRAN: 下流的/无耻的/卑鄙的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t turn up? What a dirty trick!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没来？真无耻！

Sense.DEF: if something does the trick, it solves a problem or provides what is needed to get a good result
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bit more flour should do the trick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再加一点面粉应该就可以了。

Sense.DEF: a skilful set of actions that seem like magic, done to entertain people
Sense.EXAMPLE: My uncle was always showing me card tricks when I was a kid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候﹐叔叔总是用纸牌变戏法给我看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magic trick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 魔术

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something that works very well but may not be easy to notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诀窍是接球时要屈膝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salesman who knew all the tricks of the trade clever methods used in a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谙熟行业门道的推销员

Sense.LEXUNIT: use/try every trick in the book
Sense.DEF: to use every method that you know, even dishonest ones, to achieve what you want
Sense.TRAN: 使出各种绝招﹐使出浑身解数

Sense.LEXUNIT: teach/show sb a trick or two
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone knows more than someone else or can do something better than them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Experienced teachers can show new teachers a trick or two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有经验的老师总有几招可以教教新老师。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb is up to their (old) tricks
Sense.DEF: to be doing the same dishonest things that you have often done before
the cards played or won in one part of a game of cards
Sense.TRAN: 〔纸牌游戏中出的或赢的〕一圈牌﹐一墩牌
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won the first three tricks easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻松地赢了头三圈牌。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a trick of doing sth
Sense.DEF: to have a habit of using a particular expression or of moving your face or body in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 有做某事的习惯〔指经常有某种表情或某种动作〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had this trick of raising her eyebrows at the end of a question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一个习惯﹐每次提问完了总要扬一下眉毛。

Sense.DEF: to always know exactly what is happening even if it does not concern you
Sense.TRAN: 对所发生的事无所不知［了如指掌］
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave’s found out. He never misses a trick, does he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫已经发现了﹐什么都瞒不过他﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: used to greet someone in a friendly way
Sense.TRAN: 你好吗？近来如何？〔用于寒暄〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello, Bill! How’s tricks?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好﹐比尔！近来怎么样？

Sense.DEF:
someone who pays a
prostitute
to have sex

GramExa.GLOSS: to have sex with someone for money

Crossrefto.REFLEX: you can’t teach an old dog new tricks

Sense.DEF: to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道自己被骗了﹐但为时已晚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He claimed he was tricked into carrying drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称他是被骗才携带毒品的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The corporation was tricked out of $20 million.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司被骗走2,000万美元。

GramExa.PROPFORM: trick your way into/past/onto etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tricked his way into her home by pretending to be a policeman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他假冒警察进入她家。

Sense.DEF: to be decorated with something
Sense.TRAN: 用某物装饰﹐以某物打扮
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hat tricked out with ribbons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顶用缎带装饰的帽子

Sense.DEF: when a photograph or picture has been changed so that it looks different from what was really there
a question which seems easy to answer but has a hidden difficulty
a joint that is weak and can suddenly cause you problems
Sense.TRAN: 有毛病的膝关节/脚踝/肩关节等

Sense.DEF: the use of tricks to deceive or cheat people
if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tears trickled down her cheeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪水顺着她的面颊流了下来。

Sense.DEF: if people, vehicles, goods etc trickle somewhere, they move there slowly in small groups or amounts
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑车辆﹑货物等〕缓慢而零星地移动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first few fans started to trickle into the stadium.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最 早到的一些球迷开始三三两两地走进体育场。

Sense.DEF: if money trickles down, it moves slowly from the richest people to the poorest people in a society, or from the richest countries to the poorest countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔财富向下渗透〔指富人、富国的财富逐渐惠及穷人、穷国〕

Sense.DEF: if money trickles up, it moves slowly from the poorest people to the richest people in a society, or from the poorest countries to the richest countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔财富向上渗透〔指穷人、穷国的钱逐渐转移到富人、富国手中〕

Sense.DEF: a thin slow flow of liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water in the stream had been reduced to a trickle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小溪里的水已只剩下一股细流。

Sense.DEF: a movement of people, vehicles, goods etc into a place in very small numbers or amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent legislation has reduced immigration to a trickle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近出台的法律已使移民数量减到很小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a trickle of cars on the highway
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路上稀疏的车流

Sense.DEF:
a belief that additional wealth gained by the richest people in society will have a good economic effect on the lives of everyone because the rich people will put the extra money into businesses,
investments
etc
Sense.TRAN: 涓滴效应﹐滴漏效应〔一种认为社会中最富有的人群获得的额外财富会对每一个人的生活产生良好经济效应的理论〕

Sense.DEF:
if children go trick or treating, they dress in
costumes
and go from house to house on
halloween
saying ‘trick or treat’ in order to get sweets
Sense.TRAN: 去讨糖〔指万圣节前夜小孩子穿上化装服挨家挨户去讨糖吃〕

Sense.DEF:
the words that children say when they go trick or treating, to say that they will play a trick on someone if they are not given a
treat sweet
Sense.TRAN: 不给糖就捣乱〔万圣节前夜小孩子上门讨糖吃时说的话〕

Sense.DEF: someone who deceives or cheats people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a slick, fast-talking confidence trickster
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名花言巧语﹑口若悬河的骗子

Sense.DEF: something that is difficult to deal with or do because it is complicated and full of problems
Sense.TRAN: 难对付的﹐棘手的﹔问题很多的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can get you tickets for the show but it’ll be tricky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能给你弄到演出的票﹐但会很费事。

Sense.DEF: a tricky person is clever and likely to deceive you
Sense.TRAN: 狡猾的﹔会耍花招的﹐诡计多端的

Sense.DEF: a flag with three equal bands of diffe-rent colours, especially the national flags of France or Ireland
Sense.TRAN: 三色旗〔有三条相同宽度色带的旗帜﹐尤指法国或爱尔兰国旗〕

Sense.DEF: a bicycle with three wheels, especially for young children
a weapon with three points that looks like a large fork

a type of
nuclear
weapon, or the
submarine
that shoots it

the past tense and past participle of
try
a tried and tested method has been used successfully many times
Sense.TRAN: 经实践反复证明的﹐屡试不爽的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tried and tested safety procedures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经实践反复验证的安全程序

Sense.DEF: happening every three years
someone who always makes a great effort, even if they do not often succeed
slightly

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 有点古怪/奇怪/出乎意料等

Sense.DEF: something unimportant or not valuable
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in arguing over trifles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为琐事争吵毫无意义。

Sense.DEF:
a cold British sweet dish made of layers of cake, fruit,
jelly
,
custard
, and cream
Sense.TRAN: 乳脂松糕〔一种由蛋糕﹑水果﹑果冻﹑牛奶蛋糊﹑奶油分层构成的英式冷甜点〕

Sense.DEF: to treat someone or something without respect or not in a serious way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not a man to be trifled with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这个人怠慢不得。
Sense.EXAMPLE: men who trifle with women’s affections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玩弄女性感情的男人

Sense.DEF: unimportant or of little value
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trifling sum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小笔钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: matters of trifling importance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微不足道的小事

Sense.DEF: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瞄准目标﹐扣动了扳机。

Sense.DEF: to be the thing that quickly causes a serious problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hijacking became a trigger point for military action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次劫持事件成了引发军事行动的导火线。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events
Sense.TRAN: 引发﹐激发〔尤指一系列事件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Certain forms of mental illness can be triggered by food allergies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些精神疾病可能由食物过敏引发。

GramExa.GLOSS: make you suddenly remember something

Sense.EXAMPLE: His action triggered a massive response from the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行动引发了政府的巨大反应。

Sense.DEF: to make something such as a bomb or electrical system start to operate
Sense.EXAMPLE: The burglars fled after triggering the alarm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入室窃贼触动警报器后就逃跑了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is trigger-happy is much too willing to use weapons, especially guns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trigger-happy cop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名动不动就开枪的警察

Sense.DEF: a person who shoots another person, especially when they do this for someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even if the trigger men are caught, those who ordered the killing escape punishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使枪手被抓住﹐幕后真凶还是能逃脱惩罚。

Sense.DEF:
the part of mathematics concerned with the relationship between the angles and sides of
triangles

a
tricycle
involving three groups, countries etc
Sense.TRAN: 涉及三方的﹐涉及三个国家的
Sense.EXAMPLE: trilateral peace talks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三边和平谈判

Sense.DEF:
a man’s soft
felt
hat
able to speak three languages
using three languages
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trilingual medieval inscription
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用三种语言写的一篇中世纪铭文

Sense.DEF: to make a short repeated high sound
Sense.TRAN: 发出短促重复的高音﹔发出（颤音）
Sense.EXAMPLE: birds trilling in the trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在树林里啼啭的鸟儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone trilled sharply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃丁零零地响着。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a high happy voice that sounds slightly false
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have a nice time, darling,’ she trilled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “玩得开心点﹐亲爱的。”她欢声说道。

Sense.DEF: a musical sound made by quickly moving between two notes
a short repeated high sound
Sense.TRAN: 短促重复的响声﹔〔鸟的〕啼啭﹐唧唧啾啾
Sense.EXAMPLE: the trill of blackbirds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌鸫的啼啭声

Sense.EXAMPLE: In a short time the number of cells is more than a trillion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久细胞的数量就超过了一万亿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: $5.3 trillion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 5.3万亿美元

Sense.EXAMPLE: Japan’s exports were worth $43 trillion last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年日本的出口商品价值43万亿美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the trillions of dollars in the bond markets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 债券市场中以万亿美元计的资金

Sense.DEF: an extremely large number of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shirt with a trillion holes in it
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 千疮百孔的衬衫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve made this mistake trillions of times before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个错误我们以前犯过无数次了。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
fossil
of a small sea creature
a series of three plays, books etc that are about the same people or subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: part 2 of a trilogy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三部曲的第二部

Sense.DEF: to make something look neater by cutting small pieces off it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pete was trimming the lawn around the roses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特在修剪玫瑰丛周围的草坪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have my hair trimmed every six weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每六周剪一次头发。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trim away any excess glue with a knife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用小刀修去多余的胶水。

Sense.DEF: to reduce a number, amount, or the size of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to trim costs by £500m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要削减5亿英镑的成本。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill would trim the number of immigrants to the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项议案将削减美国外来移民的人数。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company trimmed £46,000 from its advertising budget.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司把广告预算削减了4.6万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to decorate something, especially clothes, by adding things that look pretty

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dress trimmed with lace
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饰有花边的连衣裙

Sense.EXAMPLE: At Christmas, the whole family helps trim the tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节时﹐全家都帮忙装饰圣诞树。

Sense.DEF: to move the sails of a boat in order to go faster
to make something shorter or smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trim the stems back carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心地把茎剪短。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most airlines have trimmed back their operations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数航空公司都精简了业务。

Sense.DEF: to lose weight deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne has trimmed down from 22 stone to 18.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮的体重已经从22英石减到了18英石。

Sense.DEF: a person who is trim is thin in an attractive healthy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I play tennis to keep trim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打网球来保持体形。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trim figure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匀称的身材

Sense.DEF: neat and well cared for
Sense.EXAMPLE: trim suburban gardens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修剪齐整的郊区花园

Sense.DEF: when something is cut to make it look neater
Sense.EXAMPLE: My beard needs a trim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的胡子需要修剪了。

Sense.DEF: in good condition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you want to get in trim for summer, try aerobics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想保持良好状态迎接夏天﹐试试有氧运动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My job was to keep the garden in trim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作就是打理花园。

Sense.DEF: additional decoration on a car, piece of clothing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: suede sandals with gold trim
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶金边的绒面革凉鞋

Sense.DEF:
a type of sailing boat with three
hulls
one of three periods of equal length that the school year is divided into

one of the three-month periods of
pregnancy

a machine for cutting the sides of
hedges
,
lawns
etc
food that is served with all the trimmings is enjoyable because it is served with lots of extra types of food
Sense.EXAMPLE: a roast chicken platter with all the trimmings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 备有各种配菜的一大盘烤鸡

Sense.DEF: small pieces that are left after you have cut something larger
Sense.EXAMPLE: hedge trimmings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从树篱上修剪下来的细枝碎叶

Sense.DEF: pieces of material used to decorate clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hat with fur trimmings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有皮毛饰边的帽子

Sense.DEF: in the Christian religion, the union of Father, Son, and Holy Spirit in one God
Sense.TRAN: 三位一体〔基督教里指圣父﹑圣子﹑圣灵的合体〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of jewellery or a small pretty object that is not valuable
a group of three people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was met by a trio of smiling executives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迎接他的是三位面带笑容的主管。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a classical guitar trio three musicians playing together
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古典吉他三重奏组

Sense.DEF: a piece of music for three performers
a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you enjoy your trip to Disneyland?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去迪士尼乐园玩得开心吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Palace is only a short trip from here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇宫离这里只有很短的路程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a business trip to Japan
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去日本出差

Sense.EXAMPLE: Two lucky employees won a round-the-world trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名幸运的雇员赢得一次环游世界的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a boat trip up the Thames
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿泰晤士河而上的一次乘船旅行

GramExa.GLOSS: a pleasure trip done in one day

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an 80-mile round trip a journey to a place and back again to Exeter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到埃克塞特往返有80英里。

GramExa.GLOSS: when you are travelling back to where you started

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose . Mr Burgess has already left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕你是白来一趟了﹐伯吉斯先生已经走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re thinking of taking a trip to the mountains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正考虑去山里旅行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法前去领奖。

Sense.DEF:
the strange mental experiences someone has when they take a drug such as
lsd
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bad trip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵不舒服的迷幻感觉

Sense.DEF: a person or experience that is amusing and unusual
Sense.TRAN: 让人开心的奇人﹔奇妙有趣的经历
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie’s such a trip!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉真是个活宝！

Sense.DEF: an act of falling as a result of hitting something with your foot
Sense.EXAMPLE: accidents caused by trips or falls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由绊倒或摔倒引起的事故

Sense.DEF: to hit something with your foot by accident so that you fall or almost fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tripped and fell .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绊了一下﹐摔倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clary tripped over a cable and broke his foot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉里被一根电缆绊倒﹐摔伤了脚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tripped on the bottom step.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在最下面一级台阶上绊了一跤。

Sense.DEF: to make someone fall by putting your foot in front of them when they are moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Baggio was tripped inside the penalty area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴乔在禁区内被绊倒。

Sense.DEF: to switch on a piece of electrical equipment by accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: An intruder had tripped the alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名闯入者触动了警报器。

Sense.DEF: to walk, run, or dance with quick light steps
Sense.TRAN: 轻快地走﹔小跑﹔轻快地跳舞
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little girl tripping down the lane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻快地走在小巷中的小姑娘

Sense.DEF: to be easy to say or pronounce
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monofluorophosphate! It doesn’t exactly trip off the tongue, does it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单氟磷酸盐！说起来不怎么顺口﹐是吧？

Sense.DEF:
to experience the mental effects of a drug such as
lsd
Sense.TRAN: 〔服用迷幻药等毒品后〕产生幻觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: They must have been tripping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一定是吸过毒产生了幻觉。

Sense.DEF: to dance – used humorously
to make a mistake, or to force someone to make a mistake by tricking them
Sense.EXAMPLE: On his latest album, Kowalski trips up attempting more modern songs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最新的专辑中﹐科瓦尔斯基错误地尝试了更多的现代歌曲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to trip up the Prime Minister on policy issues
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诱使首相在政策问题上犯错的企图

Sense.DEF: to hit something with your foot so that you fall, or to make someone do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He chased the thief, tripped him up, and grabbed the camera.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他追上盗贼﹐把他绊倒后夺回了相机。

Sense.DEF: involving three parts, groups etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tripartite agreement between France, Britain, and Germany
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国﹑英国和德国之间的三方协定

Sense.DEF: the stomach of a cow or pig, used as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: tripe and onions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洋葱烧牛肚

Sense.DEF: something someone says or writes that is stupid or untrue
Sense.TRAN: 瞎说[瞎写]的东西﹔废话﹐蠢话
Sense.EXAMPLE: What Charles was saying was utter tripe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯的那些话完全是胡扯。

Sense.DEF: a type of dance music played with electronic instruments that has a slow beat
Sense.TRAN: 迷幻嘻哈乐〔一种用电子乐器演奏的慢节奏舞曲〕

Sense.DEF: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
Sense.TRAN: 有三部分的﹔涉及三方的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triple murder investigation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triple bill of horror movies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映
Sense.EXAMPLE: the triple world champion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三连冠世界冠军
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triple bypass heart operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三重心脏搭桥手术

Sense.DEF: three times more than a particular number
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rail system has triple the average number of accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路系统事故是事故平均数量的三倍。

Sense.DEF: to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has tripled in size .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的规模已扩大了两倍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We expect to triple our profits next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们期望明年利润增加两倍。

Sense.DEF:
a hit of the ball in baseball that allows the
batter
to get to the third
base

three turns of your body in a sport such as
ice skating
or
gymnastics
Sense.TRAN: 〔滑冰﹑体操中的〕转体三周﹔空翻三周

Sense.DEF: a title for winning all three of a set of important events in various sports

Subsense.DEF: in British horse-racing, the title for winning the St Leger, the Derby, and the Two Thousand Guineas
Subsense.TRAN: 三冠王〔英国给予在圣莱杰赛﹑德比赛和二千几尼赛上全部获胜的赛马的称号〕

Subsense.DEF: in American horse-racing, the title for winning the Kentucky Derby, the Preakness, and the Belmont Stakes
Subsense.TRAN: 三连冠〔美国给予在肯塔基德比赛﹑普瑞克尼斯大奖赛﹑贝尔蒙特大奖赛上全部获胜的赛马的称号〕

Subsense.DEF: in Rugby Union, the title for beating all three of the other home countries
Subsense.TRAN: 〔联合会橄榄球的〕三冠王〔击败其余三支球队〕

Sense.DEF:
a title given to the baseball player who is the best hitter in his
league
in three different categories (
category
)
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球的〕三冠王〔给予三项统计数据都排名第一的最佳击球手的称号〕

Sense.DEF:
an
athletics
event in which you jump with one foot, then with your other foot, and finally with both feet

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Triple jumper Edwards set a new world record.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 三级跳远运动员爱德华兹创造了新的世界纪录。

Sense.DEF: one of three children born at the same time to the same mother
a house containing three separate apartments
if a document is in triplicate, there are three copies of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it really necessary to complete the forms in triplicate?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些表格真有必要一式三份填写吗？

Sense.DEF: a support with three legs, used for a piece of equipment, camera etc

a
day tripper

strange, like something that someone experiences when they take a drug such as
lsd
Sense.EXAMPLE: trippy lighting effects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷幻的灯光效果

Sense.DEF:
a type of drug used to treat
migraines very bad pain in your head
Sense.TRAN: 曲普坦类药物〔治疗偏头痛的一种药物〕

Sense.DEF: a religious picture painted on three pieces of wood that are joined together
Sense.TRAN: 三联画〔画在三块相连木板上的宗教题材绘画〕

Sense.DEF: a wire stretched across the ground as part of a trap
Sense.TRAN: 〔陷阱在地面上绷紧的〕绊索﹐绊脚线

Sense.DEF: relating to a group of three states in the US
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s one of the best restaurants in the tristate area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是三州地区最好的餐馆之一。

Sense.DEF: a trite remark, idea etc is boring, not new, and insincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her remarks sounded trite and ill-informed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的话听起来没有新意﹐信息匮乏。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 司空见惯的老一套回答

Sense.DEF: an important victory or success after a difficult struggle
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指苦战后获得的〕胜利﹐成功﹐成就
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winning the championship is a great personal triumph .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赢得冠军是伟大的个人成就。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tremendous diplomatic triumph for France
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国的一次巨大的外交胜利

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the triumph over hardship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战胜困难

Sense.DEF: a feeling of pleasure and satisfaction that you get from victory or success
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shout of triumph
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜利的欢呼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rode in triumph to the Tsar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满怀胜利的喜悦骑着马去见沙皇。

Sense.DEF: a very successful example of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gallery is a triumph of design.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个画廊是设计的典范。

Sense.DEF: to gain a victory or success after a difficult struggle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the end, good shall triumph over evil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正义终将战胜邪恶。

Sense.DEF: done or made to celebrate a victory
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triumphal procession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庆祝胜利的游行
Sense.EXAMPLE: a triumphal arch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座凯旋门

Sense.DEF: behaviour which shows that someone is too proud of their success and too pleased about the defeat of their opponents – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔因胜利而〕耀武扬威﹐趾高气扬〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: charges of triumphalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对耀武扬威行为的指责

Sense.DEF: showing pleasure and pride because of a victory or success
Sense.TRAN: 〔因胜利或成功而〕扬扬得意的﹐耀武扬威的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel exhausted, but also triumphant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到很疲倦﹐但也很得意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a triumphant grin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 扬扬得意的咧嘴一笑

Sense.DEF: having gained a victory or success
Sense.EXAMPLE: the triumphant army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得胜的军队
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Nationalists emerged triumphant from the political crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民族主义政党成功地渡过政治危机。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve got a job,’ she announced triumphantly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “我找到工作了。”她得意扬扬地大声宣布道。

Sense.DEF: a group of three very powerful people
a metal support used to hold a hot dish
Sense.TRAN: 〔放置滚烫菜盘的〕金属隔热架

Sense.DEF: detailed facts about history, sport, famous people etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔有关历史﹑体育运动﹑名人等的〕详细知识﹐细节
Sense.EXAMPLE: a selection of golfing trivia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高尔夫知识集锦
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trivia quiz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知识问答比赛

Sense.DEF: unimportant or useless details
Sense.EXAMPLE: meaningless trivia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无意义的琐事

Sense.DEF: not serious, important, or valuable
Sense.TRAN: 微不足道的﹐没有什么价值的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were punished for the most trivial offences.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们稍有过错就会受到惩罚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a trivial sum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔极小的金额
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her feelings for Simon seemed trivial by comparison .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相比之下﹐她对西蒙的感情就显得微不足道了。

Sense.DEF: something that is not important at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t waste time on trivialities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把时间浪费在鸡毛蒜皮的小事上。

Sense.DEF: the fact of not being at all important or serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: the triviality of daytime TV
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日间电视节目的琐碎无聊

Sense.DEF: to make something seem less important or serious than it really is – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 使显得琐碎[平凡]﹐对…轻描淡写〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article trivializes the whole issue of equal rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章对平等权利这个大问题轻描淡写。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The debate has been trivialized by the media.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场辩论在媒体的报道中变得无关紧要。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
tread

the past participle of
tread

someone who lived in a
cave
in
prehistoric
times
a group of three people, countries etc
Sense.TRAN: 三人组﹔三头政治﹔三国集团
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ruling troika
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执政的三巨头

Sense.DEF: to work very hard
an imaginary creature in stories that looks like an ugly person
to try to remove something from a river, ocean etc by pulling a rope, line etc through the water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ships towing huge magnets trolled the ocean floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船只拖着巨大的磁石在海底进行拖捞作业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would troll for fish from the rowboat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会在划艇上拖钓。

Sense.DEF: to try to obtain something by searching, asking people etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stewart spent hours trolling the Web for information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特花了很长时间在网上搜索信息。

Sense.DEF: a large basket on wheels that you use for carrying bags, shopping etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a supermarket trolley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超市购物手推车

PIC.HEADING: TROLLEY 手推车
PIC.PICCONTENT: supermarket trolley BrE 【英】/shopping cart AmE 【美】超市购物手推车

Sense.DEF: a small table on wheels used for serving food
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drinks trolley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮料推车
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sweet trolley one for serving sweet dishes, cakes etc in a restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔餐馆中的〕甜点推车

Sense.DEF: an electric vehicle for carrying passengers which moves along the street on metal tracks

a
trolleybus
to be crazy
a bus that uses power from electric wires above the street
an offensive word for a sexually immoral woman
a large metal musical instrument that you play by blowing into it and sliding a long tube in and out to change the notes
Sense.TRAN: 长号﹐伸缩长号〔一种乐器〕

Sense.DEF: soldiers in an organized group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both countries agreed to withdraw their troops .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国都同意撤军。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Johnson took the popular step of sending in American troops .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊采取了通常的做法﹐即派遣美国军队。

Sense.EXAMPLE: troops stationed in Hawaii
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏威夷的驻军

Sense.DEF: movements etc of troops
Sense.EXAMPLE: increased troop deployment when troops are moved to places where they are needed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增调军队

Sense.DEF:
a group of soldiers, especially on horses or in
tanks
Sense.TRAN: 一支部队﹔〔尤指〕骑兵部队﹐坦克部队
Sense.EXAMPLE: the troop commander
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队的指挥官

Sense.DEF: a group of people or animals that do something together
Sense.TRAN: 〔集结在一起活动的〕一群人[动物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a troop of monkeys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群猴子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Scout troop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一队童子军

Sense.DEF: if a group of people troop somewhere, they walk there together in a way that shows they are tired or bored

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After rehearsals, we’d all troop off to the cafeteria.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 排练后﹐我们大家就会一起走着去食堂。

Sense.DEF: a ship, aircraft, or vehicle used for moving soldiers
Sense.TRAN: 运兵船﹔〔运送军人的〕运输机﹔运兵车

Sense.DEF:
a soldier of the lowest rank in the part of the army that uses
tanks
or horses
a member of a state police force in the US
to swear a lot

a traditional British ceremony held every year in London on the official birthday of the Queen or King. Many soldiers on horses or on foot march across Horse Guards Parade carrying their ‘colours’ flags , and they
salute
the Queen or King as they march past. It is a very colourful ceremony and is popular especially with tourists.
Sense.TRAN: 军旗敬礼分列式〔英国每年逢女王或国王生日在伦敦举行的一项传统典礼﹐士兵举着彩旗骑马或步行列队通过皇家骑兵衞队阅兵场﹐并向女王或国王敬礼〕

Sense.DEF: a ship used for moving soldiers
words, phrases, images etc that are used for an unusual or interesting effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: cinematic tropes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影中的比喻手法

Sense.DEF: a large object such as a silver cup or plate that someone receives as a prize for winning a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: walls lined with banners and athletic trophies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆满锦旗和运动奖杯的墙

GramExa.GLOSS: the name given to a particular competition for which the prize is a trophy
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 英格兰足球联赛锦标/大师杯/海斯曼杯等

Sense.DEF: something that you keep to prove your success in something, especially in war or hunting
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指战争或狩猎中的〕战利品﹔猎获物﹔胜利纪念品
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lion’s head was among the trophies of his African trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非洲之行的战利品之一是个狮头。

Sense.DEF: a young beautiful woman who is married to a rich successful man who is much older than her – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 花瓶妻子〔指嫁给比自己年长许多的有钱人的年轻漂亮女子﹔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
one of the two imaginary lines around the world, either the Tropic of Cancer which is 23.5˚ north of the
equator
, or the Tropic of Capricorn which is 23.5˚ south of the equator

the hottest part of the world, which is around the
equator
Sense.EXAMPLE: plant species found in the tropics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见于热带地区的植物物种

Sense.DEF: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world
Sense.TRAN: 来自热带的﹔产于热带的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tropical rain forests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带雨林
Sense.EXAMPLE: tropical fruit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带水果

GramExa.GLOSS: diseases that are common in hot countries or the study of these diseases

Sense.DEF: weather that is tropical is very hot and wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steamy tropical night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个闷热潮湿的夜晚

Sense.DEF: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg
if a person or animal trots, they run fairly slowly, taking short regular steps
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came trotting down the steps from the library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从图书馆出来﹐小跑着下台阶。

Sense.DEF: to walk or go somewhere, especially fairly quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He trotted off and came back a couple of minutes later, holding a parcel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跑掉了﹐几分钟以后又拿着一个包裹回来了。

Sense.DEF: to give opinions, excuses, reasons etc that you have used too many times and that do not seem sincere
Sense.TRAN: 重复﹐翻出〔老一套的观点﹑借 口﹑理由等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve trotted out the same old excuses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫又搬出那些老套的借口。

Subsense.DEF: the movement of a horse at trotting speed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Our horses slowed to a trot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的马减速慢跑。

Subsense.DEF: a ride on a horse at trotting speed
one directly following another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The class has been cancelled three weeks on the trot now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到现在﹐这门课程已连续三周被取消。

Subsense.DEF: busy doing something
Subsense.TRAN: 忙忙碌碌﹐马不停蹄地忙
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been on the trot all day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一整天都在忙个不停。

Sense.DEF: a fairly slow way of running in which you take short regular steps
Sense.EXAMPLE: She broke into a trot started running slowly and hurried on ahead of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然小跑起来﹐赶到我们前头。

Sense.DEF: a book of notes or answers used by students, especially to cheat in tests
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于学生作弊的〕笔记﹐答案

Sense.DEF: someone who believes in the political ideas of Leon Trotsky, especially that the working class should take control of the state
Sense.TRAN: 托洛茨基主义者﹐托派分子

Sense.DEF: a pig’s foot, especially when cooked and used as food

a type of singer and poet who travelled around the
palaces
and castles of Southern Europe in the 12th and 13th cen-turies
Sense.TRAN: 〔12、13世纪在南欧的宫殿和城堡间游走的〕游吟诗人

Sense.DEF: problems or difficulties

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re having a lot of trouble with the new computer system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们新的电脑系统有许多问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent stock market losses point to trouble ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近股市的下跌预示着未来将有麻烦。

Sense.DEF: used when saying what is bad about a person or situation or what causes problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trouble with you is that you don’t listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的问题是听不进别人的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trouble is there are too many people and not enough places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题是人太多﹐地方不够。
Sense.EXAMPLE: But no one ever remembers - that’s the trouble .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但是没有一个人记得——这是个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You never think, that’s your trouble .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从不动脑子﹐这就是你的问题。

Subsense.DEF: if someone or something is in trouble, they are in a situation with a lot of problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He admitted that their marriage was in trouble.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认他们的婚姻遇到了麻烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company ran into trouble when it tried to expand too quickly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司扩张太快﹐陷入了困境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The economy was in serious trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济陷入困顿。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: the dangers of trying to borrow your way out of trouble
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图通过举债摆脱困境的危险性

Subsense.DEF: if someone is in trouble, they have done something which someone will punish them for or be angry about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll be in big trouble if Mr Elliott finds out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果被埃利奥特先生发现﹐我们的麻烦就大了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think I’m in trouble with Dad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我爸要找我麻烦了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t say anything because I didn’t want to get into trouble .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我什么也没说﹐因为我不想惹麻烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope Tim stays out of trouble this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望蒂姆今年不会有麻烦。

Sense.DEF: fighting, violence, or violent behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the kids start to cause trouble , ask them to move on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是小孩子惹麻烦的话﹐叫他们走开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A handful of people came looking for trouble .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个人前来闹事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you start any trouble , you’ll regret it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你先动手﹐你会后悔的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was crowd trouble before the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛之前出现一阵骚乱。

Sense.DEF: problems in your life which you are worried about
Sense.EXAMPLE: He poured out all his troubles to me told me all about his problems .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向我倾诉了所有的苦恼。

Sense.DEF: an amount of effort and time that is needed to do something

GramExa.PROPFORM: take the trouble to do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: make a special effort to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher took the trouble to learn all our names on the first day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师在第一天就努力记住了我们所有人的名字。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve obviously gone to a lot of trouble to arrange everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们显然是费了好大的劲安排了这一切。

GramExa.PROPFORM: save sb the trouble (of doing sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you’d asked me first, I could have saved you the trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是先问问我﹐我就会让你省了这个麻烦。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I find that making my own clothes is more trouble than it’s worth takes too much time and effort .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己做衣服太费劲﹐不划算。

Sense.DEF: used to say politely that you are happy to do something for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sure you don’t mind?’ ‘It’s no trouble.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你真的不介意吗？”“一点不介意。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids were no trouble used to say you were happy to look after them because they were well-behaved .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们很乖﹐一点都没添麻烦。

Sense.DEF: a problem that you have with your health
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has trouble with his breathing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吸有问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suffers from back trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他患有背部疾病。

Sense.DEF: when something is wrong with a machine, vehicle, or system
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑车辆或系统的〕故障﹐毛病
Sense.EXAMPLE: engine trouble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机故障

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had to retire from the race because of trouble with the gearbox.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为变速箱故障不得不退出比赛。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Trouble is usually an uncountable noun. Never say ‘a trouble’. trouble
F2NBox.TRAN: 通常用作不可数名词﹐一定不要说a trouble
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Are you having trouble (NOT 不说 a trouble) with your car?

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is having trouble getting his message across to the voters.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他难以向选民传达自己的意思。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had no trouble finding her house.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们毫不费劲就找到了她家。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I hope the delay hasn’t caused you any trouble.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望事情延误没有给你造成麻烦。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was some trouble at her office, but she didn’t say what it was.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她办公室有些麻烦事﹐但她没说是什么。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: mean there will be trouble
be silly or dangerous

Collocate.EXAMPLE: High interest rates spell big troub-le for homeowners.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高利率给房屋业主带来大麻烦。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve been having terrible trouble sleeping.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最近睡眠很不好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of trouble
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They had endless trouble with the water supply.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的用水麻烦不断。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: small problems that you have when you first start doing a new job or using a new system
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 初期阶段遇到的小问题

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A couple of nurses rushed into the room to see what the trouble was.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名护士冲进屋内﹐看看出了什么问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: easily

Sense.DEF: if a problem troubles you, it makes you feel worried or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is one thing that’s been troubling me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一件事一直苦恼着我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have been deeply troubled by the allegations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对这些指控深感忧虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His conscience troubled him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的良知使他不安。

Sense.DEF: to say something or ask someone to do something which may use or waste their time or upset them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promise not to trouble you again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保证不再麻烦你了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to trouble the doctor with it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想为这事麻烦医生。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t trouble you with the details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就不麻烦你听那些细节了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: may I trouble you?/sorry to trouble you
Sense.DEF: used when politely asking someone to do something for you or give you something
Sense.TRAN: 我可以麻烦您一下吗？/对不起﹐麻烦您一下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to trouble you, but could you tell me the way to the station, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐麻烦您一下﹐请问到车站怎么走？
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I trouble you for the salt?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麻烦您把盐递给我好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to politely tell someone not to help you
Sense.TRAN: 不麻烦您了﹐不用麻烦您
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please don’t trouble yourself. I can manage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不麻烦您了﹐我自己能行。

Sense.DEF: to not do something because it needs too much effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: They never troubled to ask me what I would like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从不费心来问一下我喜欢什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luke didn’t trouble to hide his disgust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克懒得去掩饰自己的反感。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say not bother to do sth rather than not trouble to do sth .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说not bother to do sth﹐而不说not trouble to do sth
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They didn’t bother to ask me what I thought.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有费心问我怎么想。

Sense.DEF: if a medical problem troubles you, it causes you pain or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is still being troubled by an ankle injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他依然受脚踝伤病的困扰。

Sense.DEF: to cause someone problems or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: They look good enough to trouble most teams in the competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们看起来状态很好﹐足以使大多数的参赛队头疼。

Sense.DEF: worried or anxious
Sense.EXAMPLE: Benson looked troubled when he heard the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本森听到这消息时面露担忧。

Sense.DEF: having many problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are troubled times for the coal industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于煤炭工业来说﹐这是个多事之秋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the troubled electronics company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面临困境的电子公司

Sense.DEF: a difficult situation, especially where there is a lot of disagreement and problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t want to enter the troubled waters of race and religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想卷入种族和宗教的纷争。

GramExa.GLOSS: try to make an angry situation calmer

Sense.DEF: without any problems
Sense.TRAN: 没有困难的﹐没有问题的﹐没有忧虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ensure that you have a trouble-free and enjoyable holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确保让您度过一个称心如意的愉快假期。

Sense.DEF: someone who deliberately causes problems or arguments
Sense.EXAMPLE: a handful of troublemakers who are damaging the club’s reputation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在毁坏俱乐部名声的一小撮惹事者

Sense.DEF: an independent person who is employed to come into an organization to deal with serious problems
computer software which asks you a series of questions to try to find the cause of a computer problem, and suggests possible solutions
causing problems, in an annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 引起麻烦的﹔令人烦恼 [讨厌]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a troublesome child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烦人的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: troublesome itching
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难受的痒

Sense.DEF: a place where trouble often hap-pens, especially war or violence
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经常发生战争或暴力的〕麻烦地区﹐不安定地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s reported from many of the world’s trouble spots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在全世界许多动乱地区进行过新闻报道。

Sense.DEF: worrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: This incident raises troubling questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事引出了一些令人担忧的问题。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow open container that holds water or food for animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horse trough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马槽

Sense.DEF: a short period of low activity, low prices etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The graph showed peaks and troughs of activity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图表显示了活动的高峰和低谷。

Sense.DEF: the hollow area between two waves
a long area of fairly low pressure between two areas of high pressure

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your nose/snout in the trough
Sense.DEF: if people have their noses in the trough, they are involved in something which they hope will get them a lot of money or political power – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 插手某事以捞得好处〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were trounced 13-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以0比13惨败。

Sense.DEF: a group of singers, actors, dancers etc who work together
someone who has a lot of experience of work in the entertainment business
Sense.TRAN: 有经验的演员﹐老演员﹐老艺人﹔台柱子

Sense.DEF: someone who works hard and keeps trying, even when the situation is difficult
to get a large amount of money – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even though he has in effect been sacked, he will trouser a £150,000 bonus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管他实际上已经被解雇﹐但他仍能捞到15万英镑的一大笔奖金。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that you can keep your trousers in to keep them flat and smooth, often found in hotel rooms
Sense.TRAN: 〔使裤子保持平整不皱的〕压裤器

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing that covers the lower half of your body, with a separate part fitting over each leg
Sense.EXAMPLE: His trousers were slightly too short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的裤子有点短。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need a new pair of trousers for work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要一条上班穿的新裤子。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The tickets are in my trouser pocket.

Crossrefto.REFLEX: catch sb with their trousers down

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the nouns trousers and pants are in British and American English. 本图表显示名词trousers和pants在英国英语和美国英语中的使用频率。

In British English trousers is used to mean ‘a piece of clothing that covers the lower half of your body, with a separate part fitting over each leg’. In American English pants is generally used for this meaning. Pants is commonly used in British English to mean ‘underwear’, but Americans use the word underwear. 在英国英语中﹐trousers用来指裤子﹐美国英语中一般用pants指裤子。在英国英语中﹐pants常用来指内裤﹐而美国人则用underwear。

Sense.DEF: a woman’s suit consisting of a jacket and matching trousers
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子的上衣与配套裤子组成的〕衣裤套装

Sense.DEF: the clothes etc that a woman brings with her when she marries
a common river-fish, often used for food, or the flesh of this fish
Sense.TRAN: 鳟鱼〔一种常见河鱼〕﹔鳟鱼肉

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant or annoying old person, especially a woman
Sense.TRAN: 老家伙﹐老东西〔尤指老妇人〕

Sense.DEF:
a garden tool like a very small
spade
Sense.TRAN: 小泥铲﹐小铲子〔一种园艺工具〕

Sense.DEF:
a small tool with a flat blade, used for spreading
cement
on bricks etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔泥瓦匠使用的〕泥刀﹐镘刀﹐抹子

Sense.LEXUNIT: lay it on with a trowel
Sense.DEF: to say things that make something seem much better, worse etc than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 过分吹捧﹐言过其实﹔过分贬低
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I really don’t feel too good,’ I croaked, laying it on with a trowel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我真的觉得不太舒服。”我哑着嗓子夸张地说。

Sense.DEF: a system of measuring weights in Britain and the US, used especially for weighing gold, silver etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔英美两国称量金银等用的〕金衡制

Sense.DEF: when students deliberately stay away from school without permission
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school’s truancy rate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的旷课率

Sense.DEF: a student who stays away from school without permission
Sense.EXAMPLE: persistent truants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老是逃学的学生

Sense.DEF: to stay away from school without permission

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Nick was truant seven days this month.

Sense.DEF: an agreement between enemies to stop fighting or arguing for a short time, or the period for which this is arranged
Sense.TRAN: 休战﹐停战（协定）﹔停止争辩（协议）﹔停战期
Sense.EXAMPLE: They agreed to call a truce .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们同意宣布休战。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an uneasy truce between Alex and Dave over dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭时﹐亚历克斯和戴夫暂时休战。

Sense.DEF: a large road vehicle used to carry goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: a truck driver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车司机

GramExa.GLOSS: large vehicles used for particular purposes
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His car was taken away on the back of a breakdown truck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的车被装在牵引车后面运走了。

Sense.DEF: a railway vehicle that is part of a train and carries goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: coal trucks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运煤货车

Sense.DEF: a simple piece of equipment on wheels used to move heavy objects
to refuse to be involved with someone or to accept an idea
Sense.TRAN: 拒不与某人打交道/拒不接受某个观点

PIC.HEADING: TRUCKS 卡车
PIC.PICCONTENT: breakdown truck BrE 【英】/towtruck AmE 【美】牵引车；pick-up truck AmE 【美】小货车；fork-lift truck 叉车；fire engine/fire truck AmE 【美】消防车；truck/lorry BrE 【英】货车

Sense.DEF: to take something somewhere by truck
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ordered sand to be trucked in from the desert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们命人从沙漠运来沙子。

Sense.DEF: to go, move, or travel quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were trucking on down to Jack’s place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正往杰克家赶。

Sense.DEF: to leave
used to encourage someone to continue what they are doing, especially in the 1970s
Sense.TRAN: 继续干﹐加油〔鼓励某人继续做某事﹐尤用于20世纪70年代〕

Sense.DEF: a truck driver
an area for growing vegetables and fruit for sale
the business of taking goods from place to place by road
the amount that fills a truck

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a truckload of oranges
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一卡车橙子

Sense.DEF: a cheap place to eat on a main road, used mainly by truck drivers
Sense.TRAN: 〔主要为货车司机服务的〕路边廉价餐馆

Sense.DEF: bad-tempered and always willing to argue with people
Sense.TRAN: 脾气暴躁的﹔爱争吵的﹔寻衅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a truculent attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶狠的态度

Sense.DEF: to walk with slow heavy steps, especially because you are tired or it is difficult to walk
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因疲倦而〕艰难地走﹐步履沉重地走
Sense.EXAMPLE: We trudged home through the snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们艰难地穿过雪地走回了家。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the long trudge back up the hill

Sense.DEF: based on facts and not imagined or invented
Sense.TRAN: 符合事实的﹐真的﹐真实的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not true that I’m going to marry him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说我要嫁给他﹐这不是真的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: No, honestly, it’s a true story .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐真的﹐这是一个真实的故事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students decide if statements are true or false .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由学生来判断说法正确还是错误。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The same is true of all political parties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有政党都是这样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is especially true for old people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人尤其如此。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s generally true to say that fewer people are needed nowadays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说现在需要的人员少了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results appear to hold true still be correct for other countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些结果在其他国家似乎同样正确。

Sense.DEF: the true nature of something is its real nature, which may be hidden or not known

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was sold for only a fraction of its true value.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子的售出价格只是实际价值的一小部分。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to understand the true extent of the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要了解这个问题究竟有多严重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t aware of the true nature of their relationship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还没意识到他们之间关系的真正性质。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to conceal her true feelings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法掩饰了自己的真实感情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a couple of days she showed her true self real character .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了几天她就表现出她的真性情来了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are admitting that something is correct, but saying that something else, often opposite, is also correct
Sense.TRAN: 确实﹐的确〔用于承认某事的真实性﹐但同时指出另一个往往是反面的事实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s very hard-working.’ ‘True, but I still don’t think he’s the right man for the job.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他工作非常勤奋。”“的确如此﹐不过我还是认为他不适合做这个工作。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is true that there have been improvements in some areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些方面确实已有改进。

Sense.DEF: having all the qualities which a type of thing or person should have
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heroine finally finds true love .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女主人公最终找到了真爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been a true friend to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直是我真正的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an amateur sport in the true sense of the word with the exact meaning of this word .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是真正含义上的业余运动。

Sense.DEF: if wishes, dreams etc come true, they happen in the way that someone has said or hoped that they would
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prediction seems to have come true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预言似乎成真了。

Sense.DEF: faithful and loyal to someone, whatever happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Throughout the whole ordeal, she remained true to her husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在整场苦难中她一直对丈夫忠贞不渝。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is behaving in the bad way that you expect them to
Sense.EXAMPLE: True to form, Henry turned up late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利照例又迟到了。

Sense.DEF: behaving in the way you said you would or according to principles which you believe in
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was true to his word and said nothing about it to Lisa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话算话﹐对莉萨只字未提此事。

Sense.DEF: a book, play, description etc that is true to life seems very real and natural
Sense.TRAN: 〔书本﹑戏剧﹑描述等〕逼真的﹐活灵活现的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is frighteningly true-to-life and very funny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影拍得非常真实﹐而且十分有趣。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you know something is true, when you do not like it
Sense.TRAN: 千真万确的〔用来表示知道某事是真的﹐但并不喜欢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s not as easy as it looks.’ ‘Too true!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这不像看起来那么简单。”“千真万确！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is only too true that people are judged by their accents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们以口音来判断人﹐这绝对是事实。

Sense.DEF: fitted, placed, or formed in a way that is perfectly flat, straight, correct etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the door’s not true, it won’t close properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门如果装得不正﹐就关不严。

Sense.DEF: if your aim is true, you hit the thing that you were throwing or shooting at
if you show your true colours, you do something which shows what your real attitudes and qualities are, especially when they are bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was forced to reveal his true colours when asked how he would vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当被问到他会如何投票时﹐他就被迫现出了本来面目。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (there’s) many a true word spoken in jest
Sense.DEF: used to say that when people are joking they sometimes say things that are true and important

Exponent.DEF: based on real facts, and not imagined or invented
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film was based on a true story.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片根据真实故事改编。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you think the rumours are true?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为这些传闻是真的吗？

Exponent.DEF: based on facts and not containing any mistakes – used about descriptions, information, and numbers
Exponent.TRAN: 〔描述﹑信息和数字〕准确的,精确的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The measurements are accurate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尺寸精确无误。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His assessment of the current economic situation is accurate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对当前经济形势的估计很准确。

Exponent.DEF: definitely true, so that no one can argue or disagree about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is indisputable that the situation has got worse.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 局势已经恶化﹐这是无可争辩的。

Exponent.DEF: based on facts, or involving facts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The court makes its decision based on factual evidence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭根据事实证据作出判决。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is very little factual information about the incident.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于这一事件几乎没有真实的信息。

Exponent.DEF: able to be proven to be true or correct
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The data was verifiable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据可以核实。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that something is definitely true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is a fact that women live longer than men.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性寿命比男性长是事实。

Exponent.DEF: to be true – used when saying that someone is not lying
Exponent.TRAN: 是真实情况〔用于表示某人不是在撒谎〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What I told you was the truth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟你说的是实话。

Exponent.DEF: if a situation is the case, that is the way the situation truly is
