Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is certainly the case that crime rates are lower in Europe than in the US.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的犯罪率比美国低,这当然是真的。

Sense.DEF: in an exact straight line
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arrow flew straight and true to its target.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支箭不偏不倚地朝着目标飞去。

Sense.DEF: if a type of animal breeds true, the young animals are exactly like their parents
not completely straight, level, or balanced
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls are slightly out of true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙稍微有点斜。

Sense.DEF:
believing completely in the ideas of the British
conservative party
Sense.EXAMPLE: a true-blue Tory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠诚的保守党党员

Sense.DEF: completely loyal to a person or idea
Sense.TRAN: 非常忠诚的﹐忠心耿耿的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a true-blue friend
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠心耿耿的朋友

Sense.DEF: faithful
based on real facts and not invented
Sense.TRAN: 真人真事的﹔以事实为依据的 〔而不是虚构的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a true-life adventure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次真实的奇遇

Sense.DEF: the person that you love

north as it appears on maps, calculated as a line through the centre of the earth rather than by using the
magnetic pole
Sense.TRAN: 真北〔地图上的北方﹐即根据地球中轴线而不是磁极计算的正北方〕

Sense.DEF:
a black or light brown
fungus
that grows underground, and is a very expensive food
Sense.TRAN: 松露﹐块菌〔生长在地下的一种菌块﹐是非常昂贵的食物〕

Sense.DEF: a soft creamy sweet made with chocolate
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rum truffle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朗姆酒松露巧克力

Sense.DEF: an open wooden container with a handle, used by gardeners for carrying flowers, fruit, vegetables etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔园丁装花﹑水果﹑蔬菜等用的〕木条篮

Sense.DEF: a statement that is clearly true, so that there is no need to say it
Sense.TRAN: 自明之理﹐不言而喻的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech was just a collection of clichés and truisms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演说就是一堆陈词滥调和自明之理。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true
Sense.EXAMPLE: His work is truly original.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品确实十分独特。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fawcett was a truly remarkable man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福西特是一位真正不同凡响的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a truly great work of medieval literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部真正伟大的中世纪文学作品

Sense.DEF: sincerely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am truly sorry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的很抱歉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She truly believed he was innocent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她真心相信他是无辜的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can truly say I’ve never enjoyed myself so much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以真心地说我从未这样尽兴过。

Sense.DEF: in an exact or correct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it a truly representative sample?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个样本真的具有代表性吗？

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were well and truly beaten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被彻底击败了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was well and truly over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会彻底结束了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is definitely or completely true
Sense.TRAN: 的的确确地﹐千真万确地〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t believe we were really and truly going at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法相信我们终于真的要走了。

Subsense.DEF: used at the end of a letter, before the signature
Subsense.TRAN: 您忠实的〔用于书信结尾﹑签名之前〕

Subsense.DEF: used humorously to mean yourself
Subsense.EXAMPLE: So, yours truly was left to clean up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是﹐鄙人留下来收拾残局。

Sense.DEF:
the
suit one of the four types of cards in a set
chosen to have a higher value than the other suits in a particular card game
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hearts are trumps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红桃是王牌。

Sense.DEF:
a card from the
suit
that has been chosen to have a higher value than the other suits in a particular game
something that you can do or use in a situation, which gives you an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: But then he decided to play his trump card use his advantage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不过他决定使出他的杀手锏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hold all the trump cards have things which could give them an advantage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们掌握着所有的王牌。

Sense.DEF: to provide what is needed, especially unexpectedly and at the last moment
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在最后时刻意外地〕提供需要之物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul came up trumps and managed to borrow a car for us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗及时伸出援手﹐为我们借到了一辆汽车。

Sense.DEF: to play a trump that beats someone else’s card in a game
Sense.TRAN: 〔纸牌戏中〕打出王牌赢〔别人的牌〕

Sense.DEF: to do better than someone else in a situation when people are competing with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: By wearing a simple but stunning dress, she had trumped them all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿了一条简单却惊艳的裙子﹐力压群芳。

Sense.DEF: to use false information to make someone seem guilty of doing something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had trumped the whole thing up to get rid of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们捏造了整个事实以便除掉他。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Dissidents were routinely arrested on trumped-up charges .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 持不同政见者经常因莫须有的罪名而被捕。

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument that you blow into, which consists of a curved metal tube that is wide at the end, and three buttons you press to change the notes
to tell everyone about something that you are proud of, especially in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are proudly trumpeting the fact that they are creating more jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们得意地宣扬他们是在创造更多的工作岗位。

Sense.DEF:
if an
elephant
trumpets, it makes a loud noise
someone who plays a trumpet
to make something shorter
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the list is too long, it will be truncated by the computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果列表太长﹐电脑会将其截短。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report is also available in a truncated version.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报告还有简缩版。

Sense.DEF: a short thick stick that police officers carry as a weapon
to move slowly along on wheels, or to make something do this by pushing or pulling it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two large wagons trundled by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两辆大马车缓缓驶过。

Sense.DEF: the thick central woody stem of a tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left his bicycle leaning against a tree trunk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把他的自行车斜靠在树干上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the trunk of an old oak tree
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老橡树的树干

Sense.DEF: the part at the back of a car where you can put bags, tools etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put your suitcase in the trunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的手提箱放在后备箱里。

Sense.DEF:
the very long nose of an
elephant
a piece of clothing like very short trousers, worn by men for swimming
a very large box made of wood or metal, in which clothes, books etc are stored or packed for travel
the main part of your body, not including your head, arms, or legs
a telephone call between places that are a long distance apart
a main road used for travelling long distances
to tie someone’s arms, legs etc very firmly with rope so that they cannot move
Sense.TRAN: 捆﹐扎﹐绑〔人的手脚等﹐使人动弹不得〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They trussed up their victim and left him for dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把受害人捆绑起来﹐丢下他不管死活。

Sense.DEF: to prepare a chicken, duck etc for cooking by tying its legs and wings into position
Sense.TRAN: 捆扎〔鸡﹑鸭等的腿﹑翅以便烹煮〕

Sense.DEF:
a special belt worn to support a
hernia medical problem that affects the muscles below your stomach
a frame supporting a roof or bridge
Sense.TRAN: 〔支撑屋顶或桥梁的〕桁架﹐构架

Sense.DEF: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初﹐他们之间缺乏信任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust when people trust each other
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t put your trust in a man like that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该相信那样的男人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You betrayed your father’s trust did something bad even though he trusted you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

Sense.DEF: an organization or group that has control over money that will be used to help someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a charitable trust
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慈善信托机构

Sense.DEF:
an arrangement by which someone has legal control of your money or property, either until you are old enough to use it or to
invest
it for you
Sense.TRAN: 〔为未成年者代管金钱或财产的〕信托﹐托管
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

Sense.DEF: to believe that something is true without having any proof
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just had to take it on trust that he would deliver the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能相信他会把钱送来。

Sense.DEF: a job or position in which you have been given the responsibility of making important decisions
a group of companies that illegally work together to reduce competition and control prices
Sense.TRAN: 托拉斯〔企业为减少竞争﹑操纵价格而非法形成的组织〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-trust laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反托拉斯法﹐反垄断法

Sense.DEF: to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just don’t trust him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是不信任他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can they be trusted to look after the house?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能信任他们把房子托给他们照看吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t trust myself not to say something rude, so I just kept quiet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能保证自己不说无礼的话﹐于是就保持沉默。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was a good driver and I trusted him impli-citly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很好的驾驶员﹐我完全信任他。

GramExa.PROPFORM: not trust sb an inch/not trust sb as far as you can throw them
GramExa.GLOSS: not trust someone at all

Sense.DEF: to be sure that something is correct or right
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we trust these statistics?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以相信这些数据吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I trust his judgement completely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全相信他的判断。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trust your instincts do what you feel is the right thing !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相信你的直觉吧！

Sense.DEF: to be sure that something will work properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not trusting her voice, she shook her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的嗓子没有信心﹐于是摇了摇头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t trust the trains to run on time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能指望火车会准时运行。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sat down suddenly, as if he didn’t trust his legs to support him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然坐下来﹐好像信不过他的腿能支撑住自己似的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has behaved in a bad or stupid way that is typical of them
Sense.TRAN: 就知道你/他/他们等肯定（会做某事）！〔指不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trust you to write down the wrong number!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就知道你会写错号码！

Sense.DEF: used to say politely that you hope something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I trust that from now on you will take greater precautions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望从现在开始你会采取更好的预防措施。

Sense.DEF: to believe in someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We trust in God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们信仰上帝。

Sense.DEF: to hope that what you want to happen will happen, because there is nothing you can do about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just have to trust to luck that it works out okay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能靠运气﹐希望这事会有好的结果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope I may trust to your discretion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我可以指望你 保密。

Sense.DEF: to let someone have something or have control over something, believing that they will be careful with it
Sense.TRAN: 托付﹐放心地把〔某物〕交给〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t trust him with the keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不放心把钥匙交给他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d trust her with my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把性命交给她都放心。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has control of money or property that is in a
trust
for someone else
a member of a group that controls the money of a company, college, or other organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑学院或其他机构的〕理事﹐董事

Sense.DEF: the job of being a trustee
Sense.TRAN: 受托人的职位﹔理事[董事]职位

Sense.DEF: the responsibility for governing an area, which is given to a country or countries by the United Nations
Sense.TRAN: 托管〔联合国委托某国或某几国管理某地区〕

Sense.DEF: money belonging to someone that is controlled for them by a trustee
willing to believe that other people are good and honest
Sense.TRAN: 容易相信他人的﹐轻信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shy and trusting child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个害羞及轻信的孩子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s so trusting of people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她太容易相信别人。

Sense.DEF: involving trust
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loving and trusting relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 互爱互信的关系

Sense.DEF: able to be trusted and depended on
a trusty weapon, vehicle, animal etc is one that you have had for a long time and can depend on – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔武器﹑车辆﹑动物等〕忠实可靠的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had his trusty old penknife with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他随身带着他那把忠实的小折刀。

Sense.DEF: a prisoner who is given special jobs or rights, because they behave in a way that can be trusted
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于表现好而受到优待的〕模范囚犯

Sense.DEF: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hoped to find out the truth about her family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望弄清她的家世。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll never know the truth behind what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们永远不会知道所发生之事背后的真相。

Sense.DEF: the state or quality of being true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was some truth in the accusations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些指控也有一些真实性。

GramExa.GLOSS: small amount of truth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There wasn’t a grain of truth in what he said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话没有一点是真的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an element of truth in what he said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话中有些许真实的成分。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no truth in the rumour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传言毫无真实性。

Sense.DEF: an important fact or idea that is accepted as being true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The experience has taught us some basic truths .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次经历教会我们一些基本的道理。

GramExa.GLOSS: an unpleasant or disappointing fact
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is in his interest to hide unhappy truths about his agency’s performance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐瞒自己的代理机构业绩不佳这一真相对他 有利。

Sense.DEF: in fact
Sense.EXAMPLE: Early independence leaders were in truth little better than rebels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期的独立运动领导人其实不过是叛乱分子。

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone the real facts about a situation, or your real opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the truth be known, I felt a little left out at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐我感到在学校里有点受冷落。

Sense.DEF: used when giving your personal opinion or admitting something
Sense.EXAMPLE: To tell the truth, I was frightened to death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老实说﹐我怕得要死。

Sense.LEXUNIT: nothing could be further from the truth
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is definitely not true
used to say that even if you try to stop people from knowing something, they will find out in the end

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s better to tell the truth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好说实话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He always spoke the truth, whether it was popular or not.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向实话实说﹐不管人们爱不爱听。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: At last I knew the truth about my father’s death.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于知道了父亲死亡的真相。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was determined to find out the truth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决意弄清真相。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When she learns the truth, she may decide to help us.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要是知道实情的话﹐也许会决定帮我们。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: discover the truth

Collocate.COLLOC: get the truth out of sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone tell you the truth

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Investors should have been told the whole truth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者本应被告知全部真相。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the truth, with nothing added, left out, or hidden
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 纯粹的/明显的/赤裸裸的事实
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The simple truth is that there isn’t enough money to pay for it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实明摆着﹐不够钱买。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that is true but that you regret
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She still misses him, and that’s the sad truth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她依然思念他﹐这是件令人悲伤的事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to emphasize that you are telling the truth
the complete truth

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The truth of the matter is that we don’t know what really happened.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际情况是﹐我们不知道到底发生了什么。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘say the truth’. Say 而要说 tell the truth .

Sense.DEF: a drug that is supposed to make people tell the truth
Sense.TRAN: 吐真药〔一种据说能使人吐露真言的药〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is truthful does not usually tell lies
Sense.EXAMPLE: a truthful child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个诚实的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: You and I must be truthful with each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩一定要坦诚相待。

Sense.DEF: a truthful statement gives the true facts about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have only one question to ask you, and I want a truthful answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只有一个问题要问你﹐希望你如实回答。

Sense.DEF: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s have a rest and then we’ll try again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们休息一下﹐然后再试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tried to control his voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽量控制自己的声音。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was trying not to cry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她强忍住不哭出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try and take some form of daily exercise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试着做一些日常锻炼。

GramExa.GLOSS: make a lot of effort to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dabbed at her face and tried hard not to sniff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻拍了拍自己的脸﹐极力忍住不抽鼻子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried everything to lose weight with no success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试了各种方法减肥﹐但都没有成功。

GramExa.GLOSS: make as much effort as possible to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried my best to comfort her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽了最大努力去安慰她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried and tried kept making an effort and eventually I was offered a job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一次次地尝试﹐终于有人给了我一份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try as he might as hard as he could , he could not get the incident out of his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想尽办法﹐但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it wasn’t for lack/want of trying
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that if someone does not achieve something it is not because they have not tried
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They didn’t get any goals, but it wasn’t for the lack of trying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有进球﹐但并不是因为他们没有努力。

GramExa.PROPFORM: you couldn’t do sth if you tried
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that someone does not have the skill or ability to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t speak French if she tried.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她再努力也不会说法语。

Sense.DEF: to do or use something for a short while to discover if it is suitable, successful, enjoyable etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It works really well - you should try it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真的很管用——你应该试试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They decided they would try living in America for a while.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定在美国住一段时间试试。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try logging off and logging on again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 退出后再重新登录试试。

GramExa.GLOSS: do or use something that is different from what you usually do or use
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If I’m going out for a meal, I prefer to try something different.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我到外面吃饭﹐我喜欢尝试不一样的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We tried the machine on hardwood and soft wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在硬木和软木上都试过这台机器。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Petra’s trying the baby on solid foods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得拉试着让小宝宝吃些固体食品。

GramExa.GLOSS: put on a piece of clothing or test something to find out if it is the correct size or suitable
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Always try a sleeping bag for size before you buy it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 买睡袋之前一定要试试大小是否合适。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: If you try to do something , you attempt to succeed in doing it. try to do something
F2NBox.TRAN: 的意思是“设法做某事”
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We must try to prevent this happening.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须设法阻止此事发生。
F2NBox.EXPL: If you try doing something , you do it in order to find out if it is enjoyable or produces the result you want. try doing something
F2NBox.TRAN: 的意思是“尝试做某事”
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Try using margarine instead of butter.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 试试用人造黄油来替代动物黄油。

Sense.DEF: to taste food or drink to find out if you like it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like to try some crisps?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不要尝尝薯片？

Sense.DEF: to go to a place or person, or call them, in order to find something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 去〔某地〕找﹔问〔某人〕﹔试一试﹔找一找
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, he’s not in. Would you like to try again later?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐他不在。 您稍后再打来好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s try Mouncy Street. He could be there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到芒西大街去找找看吧﹐他可能会在那儿。

Sense.DEF: to attempt to open a door, window etc in order to see if it is locked
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried the door and it opened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她推了推﹐门开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried the handle but the door was locked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试着转动把手﹐但门锁着。

Sense.DEF: to examine and judge a legal case, or someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime in a court

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was tried for attempting to murder his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因企图谋杀妻子而受到审判。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The defence argued that a regional court was not competent to try their case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告辩称地方法院无权审理他们的案子。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel impatient
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programs take too long to load and try the patience of young pupils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些程序载入时间太长﹐会让小学生等得不耐烦。

Sense.DEF: to try a new activity in order to see whether it interests you or whether you are good at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried my hand at water-skiing for the first time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次尝试了滑水运动。

Sense.DEF: to try to achieve something or get something you want, usually by taking a risk
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war my father went to Canada to try his luck at farming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争结束后﹐我父亲去了加拿大经营农场想碰碰运气。

Subsense.DEF: to behave badly in order to find out how bad you can be before people become angry
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She is naughty, that one. She tries it on with me sometimes!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很调皮﹐就是那个。 她有时会故意跟我捣蛋试探我的耐性！

Subsense.DEF: to attempt to start a sexual relationship with someone
Subsense.TRAN: 想 （和某人）开始发生性关系
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When I came back in, one of the men was trying it on with my wife!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当我回到里面时﹐其中一个男人正想搞我的老婆！

Exponent.DEF: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tried to explain what was wrong.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图解释出了什么岔子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He tries hard in class, but he’s finding the work difficult.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在课堂上很努力﹐但觉得作业很难。

Exponent.DEF: to try to do something, especially something difficult. Attempt is more formal than try and is used especially in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 试图做〔尤指难事﹐比try更正式﹐尤用于书面英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Any prisoner who attempts to escape will be shot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡试图逃跑的囚犯都将被击毙。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was attempting to climb one of the world’s highest mountains.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在试图攀登世界最高的山峰之一。

Exponent.DEF: to try as hard as you can to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We will do our best to help them.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会尽全力帮助他们。

Exponent.EXP: make an effort to do sth
Exponent.DEF: to try to do something, when you find this difficult
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is worth making an effort to master these skills.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 花功夫去掌握这些技能是值得的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She made a big effort to be nice to him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很努力地对他好。

Exponent.DEF: to try very hard to do something that is very difficult, especially for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s still struggling to give up smoking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍在努力戒烟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many of these families are struggling to survive.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些家庭中有许多在勉强维持生计。

Exponent.DEF: to try very hard to achieve something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company must constantly strive for greater efficiency.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司必须不断力求更高的效率。

Exponent.DEF: to try hard to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Each employee shall endeavour to provide customers with the best service possible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一位员工都应尽力向顾客提供最好的服务。

Exponent.DEF: to try to do something, especially when you are not sure that you will succeed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m not very good at fixing taps, but I’ll have a go.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 修龙头我不太擅长﹐不过我会尝试一下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you want to have another try?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要再试一次吗？

Exponent.EXP: see if you can do sth
Exponent.DEF: to try to do something – used when offering to do something, or suggesting that someone should do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll see if I can get you a ticket.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看看是否能为你弄张票。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: See if you can persuade her to come.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你能不能劝她来。

Sense.DEF: to try and get something you really want, such as a job, a prize, or a chance to study somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided I must try for some paid work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我下决心一定要找份有薪酬的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have been trying for a baby trying to have a baby for nine years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 九年来我们一直在努力想要个孩子。

Sense.DEF: to put on a piece of clothing to see if it fits you or if it suits you, especially in a shop
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meg was trying on some red sandals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅格在试穿一双红色的凉鞋。

Sense.DEF: to test something such as a method or a piece of equipment to see if it is effective or works properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying out a new computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在试用一台新电脑。

Sense.DEF: to practise a skill in order to improve it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She enjoyed trying her French out on Jean-Pierre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢跟让•皮埃尔练习法语。

Sense.DEF: to try to be chosen as a member of a team, for a part in a play etc
Sense.TRAN: 参加选拔﹔争取成为〔团队的一员﹑戏剧的角色等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In high school, I tried out for all the female leads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上中学时﹐我试演过各种女主角。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t manage to break the record, but it was a good try.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没能打破纪录﹐但这是一次很好的尝试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You really think you can do that?’ ‘I’m going to have a try .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你真的认为你行吗？”“我想试试。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What are the chances for getting tickets now?’ ‘I guess I could give it a try .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “现在弄到票的希望有多大？”“我想我可以试一试。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It might sound a ludicrous excuse but he thought it was worth a try .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个借口也许听起来很荒唐﹐但他觉得可以试试看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only half the students passed the test on their first try.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一半的学生是第一次就通过测验的。

Sense.DEF: a test of something to see if it is suitable or successful or to find out if you like it
Sense.TRAN: 尝试〔以决定是否合适或喜欢等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to give modelling a try .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定试试当模特。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wines from Apulia’s ancient vineyards are well worth a try .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产自阿普利亚古老葡萄园的葡萄酒很值得一尝。

Sense.DEF:
four points won by putting the ball on the ground behind the opponents’
goal line
in
rugby
Sense.TRAN: 〔橄榄球赛中的〕达阵 〔在对方球门线后带球触地得四分〕

Sense.DEF: annoying or difficult in a way that makes you feel worried, tired etc
Sense.TRAN: 令人难受的﹔恼人的﹔困难的
Sense.EXAMPLE: That child is very trying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个孩子非常难缠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beginning of the show is often a trying time because of latecomers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出刚开始常常是最难熬的时期﹐因为总会有人迟到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They do the best they can in trying circumstances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在艰难的环境下尽自己最大的努力。

Sense.DEF: a period of time spent trying a new method, tool, machine etc to see if it is useful
Sense.TRAN: 〔新方法﹑工具﹑机器等的〕试用期﹐试验期

Sense.DEF: a time when people who want to be in a sports team, activity etc are tested, so that the best can be chosen
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育队﹑活动等成员的〕挑选﹐选拔
Sense.EXAMPLE: baseball tryouts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棒球队员的选拔

Sense.DEF: a period of time during which a play, television show etc is shown to find out if people like it
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑电视节目等的〕试演﹐试播

Sense.DEF: a meeting between lovers in a secret place or at a secret time – often used humorously
a male ruler of Russia before
a female ruler of Russia before 1917, or the wife of a tsar
Sense.TRAN: 〔1917年以前统治俄国的〕女沙皇﹔沙皇皇后

Sense.DEF: a system of government controlled by a tsar, especially the system in Russia before
Sense.TRAN: 1917〔尤指1917年以前俄国的〕沙皇制度﹐沙皇统治

Sense.DEF: an African fly that sucks the blood of people and animals and spreads serious diseases
Sense.TRAN: 舌蝇﹐采采蝇〔非洲一种吮吸人和动物血液并传播严重疾病的苍蝇〕

Sense.DEF:
a soft shirt with short
sleeves
and no collar
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing jeans and a T-shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着牛仔裤和T恤衫。

Sense.DEF: a way of writing a sound that is made to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 啧啧〔用于书写﹐表示不赞成﹑不满等〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=teaspoon or 或 teaspoons 一茶匙之量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add 2 tsp salt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加两茶匙盐。

Sense.DEF: a large T-shaped piece of wood or plastic used to draw exact plans or pictures

a very large wave, caused by extreme conditions such as an
earthquake
, which can cause a lot of damage when it reaches land

Subsense.DEF: a small container made of paper or plastic with a lid, in which food is bought or stored

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tub of ice cream
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒冰激凌

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a margarine tub
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛人造黄油的盒

Subsense.DEF: an open container that is usually round, used for washing, storing things in etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: trees growing in tubs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盆栽树

Sense.DEF: the amount of liquid, food etc that a tub can contain
Sense.TRAN: 一盒的容量﹔一盆的容量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We ate a tub of ice cream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们吃了一盒冰激凌。

Sense.DEF: a large container in which you sit to wash yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a long soak in the tub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在浴缸里泡了很久。

Sense.DEF: an old boat that travels slowly
Sense.TRAN: 行驶缓慢的旧船﹐老爷船

Sense.DEF: someone who is short and fat
a large metal musical instrument that consists of a curved tube with a wide opening that points straight up. It produces very low sounds when you blow into it.
short and slightly fat, with a round stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tubby little man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矮矮胖胖的男人

Sense.DEF: a round pipe made of metal, glass, rubber etc, especially for liquids or gases to go through
Sense.TRAN: 〔输送液体或气体的〕圆管﹐管子

Sense.DEF: a long hollow object that is usually round
Sense.EXAMPLE: pasta tubes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通心粉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a toilet roll tube
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手纸卷筒

Sense.DEF: a narrow container made of plastic or soft metal and closed at one end, that you press between your fingers in order to push out the soft substance that is inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tube of toothpaste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一管牙膏

Sense.DEF: a tube-shaped part inside your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bronchial tubes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支气管

Sense.DEF: the system of trains that run under the ground in London

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take the tube to Acton.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘地铁到阿克顿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a tube station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地铁站

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s best to travel by tube.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好是乘地铁。

Sense.DEF: if a situation goes down the tubes, it quickly becomes ruined or spoiled
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Moira turned up, Tess could see all her good work going down the tubes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫伊拉一出现﹐特丝就觉得她所有的心血都白费了。

Sense.DEF: the television
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s on the tube tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚有什么电视节目？

Sense.DEF: the part of a television that produces the picture on the screen
Sense.TRAN: 电视显像管﹔阴极射线管

Sense.DEF:
to float on a river on a large
inner tube
for fun
a round swollen part on the stem of some plants, such as the potato, that grows below the ground and from which new plants grow
a serious infectious disease that affects many parts of your body, especially your lungs
a sock that is long and straight and has no special place for your heel
a piece of women’s clothing that goes around your chest and back to cover your breasts but does not cover your shoulders or stomach
tubes in general, especially when connected together into a system
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指连成一个系统的〕管道﹐管子
Sense.EXAMPLE: rubber tubing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡皮管

Sense.DEF:
the activity of floating on a river on a large
inner tube
for fun
trying to persuade people about your opinions in a loud and forceful way
Sense.TRAN: 〔试图说服人时〕大喊大叫的﹐气焰逼人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is still addressing rallies in his usual tub-thumping, arrogant way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在集会上讲话还是那样慷慨激昂﹐不可一世。

Sense.DEF: made of tubes or in the form of a tube
Sense.EXAMPLE: tubular metal furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属管家具

Sense.DEF: to push something, especially the edge of a piece of cloth or paper, into or behind something so that it looks tidier or stays in place
Sense.TRAN: 把〔布或纸张的边缘〕塞进〔某处〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack tucked his shirt in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克把衬衫掖进裤腰里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tucked an unruly lock of hair behind her ear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把一缕不听话的头发撩到耳后。

Sense.DEF: to put something into a small space, especially in order to protect, hide, carry, or hold it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Giles was tucking his pile of books under his arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾尔斯腋下夹着他的那摞书。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took the glasses off and tucked them in his pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摘下眼镜﹐塞到口袋里。

Sense.DEF:
to put a
tuck special fold
in a piece of clothing
Sense.TRAN: 在〔衣服上〕缝褶子﹐给…打裥

Subsense.DEF: if a place is tucked away, it is in a quiet area
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The village of Eyam is tucked away behind the hills.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊姆村静静地坐落在山后。

Subsense.DEF: if someone or something is tucked away, they are hidden or difficult to find
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The envelope was tucked away in her jewel box.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只信封藏在她的首饰盒里。

Sense.DEF: to store something, especially money, in a safe place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every member of the family can now tuck away either £9 or £18 a month in one of these savings plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照其中一项储蓄计划﹐现在家里的每个成员每月都可以存下9英镑或18英镑的钱。

Sense.DEF: to eat a lot of food, usually quickly and with enjoyment
Sense.TRAN: 大吃〔常指狼吞虎咽﹐吃得很香〕

Sense.DEF: to make a child comfortable in bed by arranging the sheets around them
Sense.TRAN: 帮助〔孩子〕盖好被子﹐给…掖好被子

Sense.DEF: to move a part of your body inwards so that it does not stick out so much
Sense.TRAN: 使〔身体的某一部分〕收紧
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stand up straight and tuck in your tummy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 站直﹐收腹。

Sense.DEF: to eat something eagerly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ice creams came and we tucked in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰激凌来了﹐我们开始大吃起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tucked into a hearty breakfast of eggs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吃了一顿丰盛的鸡蛋早餐。

Sense.DEF: to make someone comfortable in bed by arranging the sheets around them
Sense.TRAN: 帮助…盖好被子﹐给…掖好被子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad tucked me up in his and Carrie’s bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸把我安顿在他和卡丽的床上。

Sense.DEF: to be lying or sitting in bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ought to be tucked up in bed now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在该到床上去了。

Sense.DEF: a narrow flat fold of cloth sewn into a piece of clothing for decoration or to give it a special shape
a small medical operation done to make your face or stomach look flatter and younger
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tummy tuck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腹部塑形手术

Sense.DEF: cakes, sweets etc – used especially by schoolchildren
Sense.TRAN: 糖果糕点〔尤为学童使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school tuck shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校糖果食品店

Sense.DEF: to make someone very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of the day, we were all pretty tuckered out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天下来﹐我们都累得筋疲力尽。

Sense.DEF: food
a style, type of behaviour etc that shows that you have the confidence to do unusual and exciting things without caring what other people think – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 我行我素的态度〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the trend of restaurants serving nasty ’tude with their food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐馆服务态度日渐恶劣的趋势

Sense.DEF: relating to the period in British history between 1485 and 1603
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国历史上1485年至1603年〕都铎王朝的

GramExa.GLOSS: built in the style used in the Tudor period
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 都铎式房子/楼房/建筑等

Sense.DEF: the day between Monday and Wednesday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sale starts on Tuesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周二开始大减价。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期二见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He first heard the news on Tuesday evening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是周二晚上第一次听到这个消息的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was my birthday last Tuesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周二是我生日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry I can’t make it this Tuesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我本周二不行。

GramExa.GLOSS: Tuesday of next week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall we meet next Tuesday?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下星期二见面好吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the Tuesdays in the year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We left Miami on a Tuesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是在一个星期二离开迈阿密的。

Sense.DEF: a bunch of hair, feathers, grass etc growing or held closely together at their base

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tufts of grass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一簇簇的草

Sense.DEF: with a tuft or tufts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tufted duck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只凤头鸭

Sense.DEF: to pull with one or more short, quick pulls
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman gently tugged his arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人轻轻拽了拽他的胳膊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe was tugging at her sleeve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔在拽她的袖子。

Sense.DEF: to pull a piece of clothing quickly onto your body

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alice was tugging on a sweater.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯正在穿毛衣。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel sympathy for someone or something
a small strong boat used for pulling or guiding ships into a port, up a river etc
a sudden strong pull
Sense.EXAMPLE: She removed the bandage with a sharp tug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她猛地一拉﹐扯下绷带。

Sense.DEF: a strong and sudden feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate felt a tug of jealousy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特感到一阵妒忌。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which parents who have separated from each other fight over who is going to have the children – used especially in newspaper reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔分居父母对孩子的〕监护权争夺〔尤用于报纸报道〕

Sense.DEF: a test of strength in which two teams pull opposite ends of a rope against each other
a situation in which two people or groups try very hard to get or keep the same thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a constant tug-of-war between the military and the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军方和总统之间的竞争无时不在。

Sense.DEF: teaching, especially in small groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to have extra tuition in maths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不得不上数学补习课。

Sense.DEF: the money you pay for being taught
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I started college, tuition was $350 a quarter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始念大学的时候﹐学费是每学季350美元。

Sense.DEF:
a brightly coloured flower that is shaped like a cup and grows from a
bulb
in spring

a thin soft silk or
nylon
material like a net
stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve lost another two inches from my tum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的腰围又小了两英寸。

Sense.DEF: to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lost her balance and tumbled backwards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她失去了平衡﹐身体朝后倒去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A few stones came tumbling down the cliff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几块石头从悬崖上滚落下来。

Sense.DEF: to move in an uncontrolled way
Sense.TRAN: 莽莽撞撞地行动﹔胡乱地走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We tumbled out into the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们跌跌撞撞地出来﹐到了大街上。

Sense.DEF: if prices or figures tumble, they go down suddenly and by a large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil prices have tumbled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油价格猛跌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mortgage rates tumbled to their lowest level for 25 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按揭贷款利率一下子跌到了25年来的最低水平。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s hair tumbles down, it is long, thick, and curly
Sense.TRAN: 〔长而卷曲的浓密头发〕垂下﹐垂落
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her long dark hair tumbled over her shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那深色的长发垂落在肩头。

Sense.DEF: if words tumble out of someone’s mouth, they speak very quickly because they are excited or upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The words tumbled out as if he hardly knew what to say first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他语无伦次﹐好像不知道先说什么才好。

Sense.DEF: if water tumbles somewhere, it flows there quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A narrow stream tumbled over the rocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条狭窄的小溪在岩石间奔流。

Subsense.DEF: if something comes tumbling down, it falls suddenly to the ground
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Removing the debris could cause the rest of the building to come tumbling down.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清除瓦砾可能会导致建筑物其他部分出现坍塌。

Subsense.DEF: if a system, problem etc comes tumbling down, it suddenly stops working or existing
Subsense.TRAN: 〔制度〕不起作用﹔〔问题〕不复存在
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In the last year, barriers have come tumbling down.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 壁垒已在过去一年里土崩瓦解。

Sense.DEF:
to do
tumbling
a fall, especially from a high place or level
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指从高处的〕倒下﹐跌倒﹐摔倒﹔〔水平的〕下降
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s possible that stocks could take a tumble next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明年股票有可能会大跌。

Sense.DEF: a tumbledown building is old and beginning to fall down
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tumbledown cottage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摇摇欲坠的村舍

Sense.DEF: a machine that uses hot air to dry clothes after they have been washed
a glass with a flat bottom and no handle
the amount of liquid that this type of glass can contain

someone who performs special movements such as doing
somersaults a jump in which you turn over completely in the air
a plant that grows in the desert areas of North America and is blown from place to place by the wind

a sport similar to
gymnastics
but with all the exercises done on the floor
Sense.TRAN: 翻腾运动〔与体操相似的运动﹐但所有动作在地面上完成〕

Sense.DEF: swollen or swelling

stomach
– used especially by or to children
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was up all night with tummy ache .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肚子疼﹐整晚都睡不着觉。

GramExa.GLOSS: an illness of the stomach that makes you vomit

Sense.DEF: a mass of diseased cells in your body that have divided and increased too quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brain tumour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑瘤

GramExa.GLOSS: caused by or not caused by cancer

Sense.DEF: a confused, noisy, and excited situation, often caused by a large crowd
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常由一大群人引起的〕混乱﹐骚乱﹔吵闹﹐喧哗
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could simply not be heard in the tumult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片嘈杂声中别人根本听不到我说话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole country is in tumult.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国一片混乱。

Sense.DEF: a state of mental confusion caused by strong emotions such as anger, sadness etc
full of activity, confusion, or violence
Sense.TRAN: 混乱的﹐骚乱的﹐乱哄哄的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tumultuous years of the Civil War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内战的动荡年代

Sense.DEF: very loud because people are happy and excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received a tumultuous welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受到了热烈欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: tumultuous applause
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热烈的掌声

Sense.DEF:
a very large pile of earth put over a
grave
by people in the past
a large sea fish caught for food
Sense.TRAN: 金枪鱼〔一种大型食用海鱼〕

Sense.DEF:
the flesh of this fish, usually sold cooked in
tins
Sense.TRAN: 金枪鱼肉〔通常以罐装熟食出售〕

Sense.DEF: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees
a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a nice tune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那曲调很美。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sang some old classics and a few new tunes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

GramExa.GLOSS: using the same tune as another song
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The song was sung to the tune of “Amazing Grace”.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌是用《奇异恩典》的曲调唱的。

Sense.DEF: playing or singing the correct musical note
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sang perfectly in tune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们唱得十分合调。

Sense.DEF: playing or singing higher or lower than the correct musical note
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greg’s bass guitar was out of tune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格的低音吉他走音了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in tune with sb/sth,out of tune with sb/sth
Sense.DEF: able or unable to realize, understand, or agree with what someone else thinks or wants
Sense.TRAN: 与某人/某事协调[一致]/不协调[不一致]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The industry is changing in tune with changing demand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个行业正随着需求的不断变化作出相应的调整。

Sense.LEXUNIT: to the tune of $1,000/£2 million etc
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how large an amount or number is
Sense.TRAN: 高达1,000美元/200万英镑等〔强调数量或数目大〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Canada is funding the programme to the tune of $30 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大给该计划拨款高达3,000万美元。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He played a tune on the piano.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用钢琴弹奏了一曲。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was humming a little tune to herself.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一个人哼着小曲。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is easy to remember
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His songs have simple words and catchy tunes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的歌曲歌词简单﹐曲调顺口。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the tune at the beginning or end of a television programme etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the theme tune from the movie ‘Titanic’
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影《泰坦尼克号》的主题曲

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a tune from a musical

Sense.DEF:
to make a musical instrument play at the right
pitch
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

Sense.DEF: to make small changes to an engine so that it works as well as possible
Sense.TRAN: 调整﹐调节〔发动机﹐使达到最佳状态〕

Sense.DEF: to make a radio or television receive broadcasts from a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 调节﹐调〔收音机或电视频道〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The radio was tuned to a classical station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 收音机调到了一个古典音乐台。

Sense.DEF: finely tuned feelings, senses, or systems are extremely sensitive and able to react quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情﹑感觉或系统〕非常敏感的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a species finely tuned to life in the desert
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分适应沙漠生活的一个物种

Sense.DEF: to watch or listen to a broadcast on radio or television

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People get their information by tuning in to foreign radio stations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们通过收听外国电台来获得信息。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: More than 150 million Americans tuned in to watch the final episode.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 超过1.5亿的美国人收看了这最后的一集。

Sense.DEF: to realize or understand what is happening or what other people are thinking
Sense.TRAN: 了解﹐熟悉〔情况﹑别人的想法等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to tune in to your partner’s needs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量去了解伴侣的需求。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company aims to be more tuned in to customer needs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司力求更多地了解客户的需求。

Sense.DEF: to ignore or stop listening to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bored child may simply tune out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子感到无聊可能就会走神。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I learned to tune out the background noise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我学着不去理会背景杂音。

Sense.DEF:
when musicians tune up, they prepare their instruments to play at the right
pitch

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band were tuning up their guitars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队在给吉他调音。

Sense.DEF: to make small changes to an engine so that it works as well as possible
pleasant to listen to
Sense.TRAN: 悦耳动听的﹐曲调优美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tuneful melodies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优美的旋律

Sense.DEF: not having a pleasant tune
Sense.EXAMPLE: tuneless humming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不成调的乱哼哼

Sense.DEF: the part of a radio or television that you can change to receive different TV or radio stations
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视机或收音机上的〕调谐器

Sense.DEF: a person who tunes pianos

an electronic machine that helps you to tune a musical instrument such as a
guitar
the process of making small changes to an engine so that it works as well as possible
an occasion that someone uses as preparation for a more important occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is treating the semi-finals as a tune-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把半决赛当成一场热身赛。

Sense.DEF:
a hard metal that is used to make steel and in the thin wires in electric light
bulbs
. It is a chemical
element
: symbol W
Sense.TRAN: 钨〔一种化学元素﹐符号为W〕

Sense.DEF: a long loose piece of clothing, usually without sleeves, worn in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时穿的一种通常无袖的〕长袍

Sense.DEF: a long loose women’s shirt, usually worn with trousers
a specially shaped short coat worn by soldiers, police officers etc as part of a uniform
a small U-shaped steel instrument that makes a particular musical note when you hit it

a screw used for making the strings on a
guitar
etc tighter or looser
Sense.TRAN: 〔吉他等乐器上面的〕弦钮，琴栓

Sense.DEF: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through
Sense.EXAMPLE: a railway tunnel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路隧道
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Channel Tunnel between England and France
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔英吉利〕海峡隧道

Sense.DEF: a passage under the ground that animals have dug to live in
to dig a long passage under the ground

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were tunnelling into the mountainside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在山腰上挖隧道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prisoners tunneled their way under the fence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人们在围栏下面挖地道通向外面。

Sense.DEF: if insects tunnel into something, they make holes in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The grubs tunnel into the wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛆虫在木头里钻洞。

Sense.DEF: the tendency to only think about one part of something such as a problem or plan, instead of considering all the parts of it
Sense.TRAN: 狭隘的眼光﹐一孔之见﹐井蛙之见
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got tunnel vision when it comes to what I want to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到我的打算﹐我的目光很短浅。

Sense.DEF: a condition in which someone’s eyes are damaged so that they can only see things that are straight ahead
Sense.TRAN: 管状视〔视力受损而只能直视前方的物体〕

Sense.DEF:
a British word for
tuna
an amount of money worth two pence
to not care at all about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 对…毫不在乎﹐认为…无关紧要

Sense.DEF: costing two pence
a type of plastic container that closes very tightly and is used to store food
Sense.TRAN: 特百惠塑料容器〔一种用来存放食物的密封容器〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion on which people get together at someone’s house in order to buy Tupperware
Sense.TRAN: 特百惠聚会〔聚在某人家里购买特百惠产品的聚会〕

Sense.DEF: a long piece of cloth that you wind tightly round your head, worn by men in parts of North Africa and Southern Asia and sometimes by women as a fashion
Sense.TRAN: 〔北非﹑南亚地区男性缠在头上的〕头巾﹔女用头巾

Sense.DEF: turbid water or liquid is dirty and muddy
an engine or motor in which the pressure of a liquid or gas moves a special wheel around
a car with a turbocharged engine
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Audi turbo diesel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆奥迪涡轮增压柴油车

Sense.DEF: a turbocharged engine or vehicle has a turbocharger
Sense.TRAN: 〔引擎或车辆〕有涡轮增压器的

Sense.DEF: a system that makes a vehicle more powerful by using a turbine to force air and petrol into the engine under increased pressure
a powerful engine that makes something, especially an aircraft, move forwards, by forcing out hot air and gases at the back
an aircraft that gets power from this type of engine

a
turbine
engine that drives a
propeller
an aircraft that gets power from this type of engine
a large flat European fish
Sense.TRAN: 大菱鲆〔欧洲产的一种扁平大鱼〕

Sense.DEF: irregular and violent movements of air or water that are caused by the wind
Sense.TRAN: 〔由风造成的空气或水的〕湍流﹐紊流﹔不稳定的强气流

Sense.DEF: a political or emotional situation that is very confused
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治上的〕骚乱﹐骚动﹔〔情感上的〕波动
Sense.EXAMPLE: A period of political turbulence followed the civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内战结束之后紧接着的是一段政治动荡时期。

Sense.DEF: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国大革命的动荡时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has had a turbulent political career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

Sense.DEF: turbulent air or water moves around a lot
Sense.TRAN: 风大浪高的﹔狂风大作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dark turbulent waters of the river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰暗汹涌的江水

Sense.DEF: a piece of the solid brown waste material you pass from your body
an insulting word for an unpleasant person. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 非常讨厌的人〔勿用此词〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You stupid little turd!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个白痴！

Sense.DEF: a large dish with a lid, used for serving soup or vegetables
a surface that consists of soil with grass on top, or an artificial surface that looks like this
Sense.EXAMPLE: soft green turf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔软的绿色草皮

Sense.DEF: a square piece of turf cut out of the ground
the sport of horse racing, or the track on which horses race
an area that you think of as being your own
Sense.EXAMPLE: How vigorously will the local companies defend their turf?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地公司会以怎样的力度保衞他们的地盘？

GramExa.GLOSS: the place that someone comes from or lives in
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We beat Canada on their home turf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在加拿大队的主场将其打败。

GramExa.GLOSS: a fight or argument over the areas or things you think belong to you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: turf wars among government bureaucracies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府官僚之间的地盘之争

Sense.DEF: to cover an area of land with turf
to make someone leave a place or organization, usually suddenly or roughly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The families claim they are being turfed out of their homes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些家庭声称他们正被赶出家门。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has a business where people can
bet
on the results of horse races, football games etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔经营赛马﹑足球比赛等赌博的〕庄家

Sense.DEF: turgid writing or speech is boring and difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章或讲话〕枯燥乏味的﹐很难理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a turgid Social Science textbook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本枯燥乏味的社会科学教科书

Sense.DEF: full and swollen with liquid or air
Sense.TRAN: 〔因有液体或空气〕鼓得满满的﹐肿胀的

Sense.DEF: someone from Turkey
a bird that looks like a large chicken and is often eaten at Christmas and at Thanksgiving
the meat from a turkey eaten as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast turkey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤火鸡

Sense.DEF: an unsuccessful film or play
to talk seriously about details, especially in business
Sense.TRAN: 认真地谈论〔细节﹐尤指商务谈判〕

Sense.DEF: relating to Turkey, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 土耳其的﹔土耳其人的﹔土耳其语的

Sense.DEF: the language used in Turkey

a type of bath in which you sit in a very hot steamy room, have a
massage
, then take a cold
shower
or bath
very strong black coffee that you drink in small cups with sugar
Sense.TRAN: 土耳其咖啡〔一种加糖的浓烈咖啡〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of sweet made from firm
jelly
that is cut into pieces and covered in sugar or chocolate
Sense.TRAN: 〔外包糖粉或巧克力的〕土耳其软糖

Sense.DEF:
a yellow powder used to give a special colour or taste to food, especially
curry
Sense.TRAN: 姜黄根粉〔用作食品调色或调味之用﹐尤用于咖喱〕

Sense.DEF: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prospect of another week of political turmoil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治动乱还要持续一周的可能

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ashley gazed at him, her thoughts in turmoil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿什利注视着他﹐思绪起伏。

Sense.DEF: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ricky turned and walked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里基转身走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned her head in surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊讶地转过头来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dan turned away, hiding the fear in his eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹扭过头去﹐掩饰着眼中的恐惧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned around to look at Kim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转过身看着金。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘No,’ she said, turning her head to see David’s reaction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “不。”她说着﹐转过头来看看戴维的反应。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Brigitte glared at him, turned on her heel turned away suddenly because of anger , and stomped out of the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布丽吉特瞪了他一眼﹐猛地一转身﹐噔噔噔地走出了房间。

Sense.DEF: to move something so that it is pointing or aiming in a different direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You may turn over your exam papers now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在你们可以把考卷翻过来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firemen turned their hoses on the blaze.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防队员把水龙带对准熊熊烈火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you turn your chairs to face this way ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们把椅子转过来朝着这边好吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: move a page in a book over so that you can read the next page

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned down the corner of the sheet to peep at the baby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他折起被角以便看一眼婴儿。

Subsense.DEF: to go in a new direction when you are walking, driving etc, or to make the vehicle you are using do this
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I watched until he turned the corner .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着他﹐直到他转过街角。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turn left at the church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了教堂向左拐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She cycled up the street and turned into Long Road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她沿街向前骑去﹐拐进了朗路。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Turning the car around, we headed home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把车掉了个头﹐朝家的方向开去。

Subsense.DEF: if a road, river etc turns, it curves and starts to go in a new direction
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Further on, the river turns east.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再往前﹐这条河就折向东流。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The road turns sharply at the top of the hill.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了山顶道路急转。

Sense.DEF: to move around a central or fixed point, or to make something move in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wheels turned slowly, then picked up speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮子慢慢转动﹐然后开始加速。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some reason, the key wouldn’t turn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知为什么﹐钥匙转不动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gently turned the handle of the bedroom door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻转动卧室门上的把手。

Sense.DEF: to start to have a different quality, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rose’s hair was already turning grey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗丝的头发已经开始花白了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In October the leaves turn orange and yellow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了10月份﹐树叶有的变成了橘红色﹐有的变成了黄色。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sun had turned the sky a glowing pink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳把天空染得一片绯红。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Then it turned cold and started to rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后天气变冷﹐开始下雨。

GramExa.GLOSS: suddenly become angry, violent etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are worried that the situation could turn violent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方担心这一局势可能会演变成暴力。

Sense.DEF: to start to think about, deal with, look at etc a particular person, thing, or subject, instead of what you were thinking about etc before
Sense.TRAN: 转移〔思考﹑处理﹑观察等的对象〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: turn your attention/thoughts/efforts etc to sth/sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many investors have turned their attention to opportunities abroad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多投资者把注意力转向了国外的机会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil turned his gaze towards the older man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔把目光转向那个较年长的男子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As usual, the conversation turned back to her children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 同往常一样﹐谈话的内容又回到她的孩子身上了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Now is the time of year when thoughts turn in the direction of summer holidays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在又到大家考虑夏季度假的时候了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next the Senator turned to education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接着参议员谈起了教育。

Subsense.DEF: to refuse to help, support, or be involved with someone or something
Subsense.TRAN: 对（某人/某事）置之不理﹐对（某人/某事）撒手不管
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How can you turn your back on your own mother?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么可以对自己的母亲不闻不问呢？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In his twenties he turned his back on his Catholic faith.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他二十几岁时背弃了天主教的信仰。

Subsense.DEF: to turn so that your back is pointing towards someone or something, and you are not looking at them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Angrily, she turned her back on him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生气地转过身背对着他。

Sense.DEF: to become a particular age, or to reach a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My son’s just turned 18.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的儿子刚满18岁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s just turned three.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在刚到3点。

Subsense.DEF: to pull a piece of clothing, bag etc so that the inside is facing out
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Turn the sweater inside out before you wash it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把毛衣翻过面来洗。

Subsense.DEF: to search everywhere for something, in a way that makes a place very untidy
Subsense.TRAN: 到处寻找某物﹐把某物翻个底朝天
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Thieves had turned the house upside down.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷把房子翻了个底朝天。

Variant.LEXVAR: turn sth upside down, turn sth on its head

Subsense.DEF: to completely change the way that something is done, organized, thought about etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: New approaches to marketing turn old practices upside down.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的营销方式彻底改变了以前的做法。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her opinion of him had been turned on its head.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他的看法彻底改变了。

Sense.DEF: to start to improve after going through a difficult period or experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manager of the hotel chain claims that they have turned the corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家连锁酒店的经理声称他们已渡过了难关。

Sense.DEF: to make or let someone or something go out from where they are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把面团拿出来﹐放在撒过薄薄一层面粉的板上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are some criminals who cannot be turned loose onto the streets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些罪犯是不能放任街头不管的。

Sense.DEF:
if the
tide
turns, the sea starts to come in or go out again
if something such as a war, situation, game of sport etc turns, or someone turns it, something happens to change the way it is developing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mills turned the game by scoring twice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米尔斯两度进球﹐扭转了比赛的局势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The victory turned the tide of the war in North Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场胜利扭转了北非的战局。

Sense.DEF: to be disloyal to a person, group, or idea that you have strongly supported before

to twist your
ankle
in a way that injures it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wright turned his ankle in the first minutes of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖特在比赛开始几分钟里就扭伤了脚踝。

Sense.LEXUNIT: an actor turned politician/a housewife turned author etc
Sense.DEF: someone who has done one job and then does something completely different
Sense.TRAN: 演员出身的政治家/家庭主妇变身的作家等

Sense.DEF: to be attractive in a romantic or sexual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned heads whenever she walked into a room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要她走进一个房间﹐就能吸引很多目光。

Sense.DEF: if something turns people’s heads, they are surprised by it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It did turn some heads when he moved back to the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他搬回到村里居住﹐确实让有些人很吃惊。

Sense.DEF: to make a profit
to say something in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cohen knows how to turn a phrase in his lyrics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科恩作词时知道如何措辞。

Sense.DEF: to break up soil so that it is ready for growing crops
Sense.EXAMPLE: a distant tractor turning the soil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处正在翻土的拖拉机

Sense.DEF: to shape a wooden or metal object using a special tool
if milk turns, it becomes sour

Crossrefto.REFLEX: sb would turn in their grave

Sense.DEF: to stop liking or supporting someone or something, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people had turned against the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人转而反对那场战争。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave felt she was deliberately turning the kids against him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫感觉她是故意让孩子们与他作对。

Sense.DEF: if a business, department etc that is not successful turns around, or if someone turns it around, it starts to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company turned around from losses of £1.4 million last year to profits of £26,800.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司由去年的亏损140万英镑扭转为赢利2.68万英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At Rockwell International he had turned around a badly performing division.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在洛克威尔国际有限公司﹐他使一个业绩糟糕的部门有了起色。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, game etc turns around, or if someone turns it around, it changes and starts to develop in the way you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: After I met him, my whole life turned around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遇见他后﹐我的整个人生都发生了改变。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fender’s batting could turn matches around in half an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬德的击球能让比赛在半小时内扭转局势。

Sense.LEXUNIT: turn around and say/do etc sth
Sense.DEF: to say or do something that is unexpected or that seems unfair or unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 反过来说〔出人意料或不公正﹑不合理的话〕﹔反过来做〔出人意料或不公正﹑不合理的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t just turn around and say that it was all my fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能反过来说这全是我的错。

Sense.DEF: to consider an idea, question etc in a different way, or change the words of something so that it has a different meaning
Sense.TRAN: 换个角度考虑〔某个观点﹑问题等〕﹔改变…的用词
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s turn the whole idea around and look at it from another angle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们换个角度来考虑这个观点。

Sense.DEF: to complete the process of making a product or providing a service
Sense.TRAN: 完成﹐生产出〔某产品〕﹔提供〔某服务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can turn around 500 units by next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到下周我们能完成500台。

Sense.DEF: very often or all the time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every time I turn around he seems to be checking up on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每次回头他都好像是在监督我。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to let someone enter a place or join an organization, for example because it is full
Sense.TRAN: 〔因满员等〕不让某人进入﹔不让某人加入〔组织〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show was so popular police had to turn people away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出过于火爆﹐警察只能把人们打发走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of applicants are turned away each year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年都有几千名申请者被拒。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to give someone sympathy, help, or support
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone who comes to us will not be turned away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管谁来找我们﹐都不会遭到拒绝的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The insurance company has promised not to turn away its existing customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险公司承诺说不会对其现有的客户置之不理。

Sense.DEF: to stop supporting someone, or stop using or being interested in something, or to make someone do this
Sense.TRAN: （使某人）停止支持某人﹔（使某人）停止使用某物﹐（使某人）不再对某人/某物感兴趣
Sense.EXAMPLE: Consumers are turning away from credit cards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者对信用卡逐渐失去了兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: events that turned Henry away from his family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使亨利疏远家人的一些事

Sense.DEF: to go back in the direction you came from, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s getting late – maybe we should turn back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天晚了﹐也许我们该返回了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The UN convoy was turned back at the border.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国车队在边境被拦了回来。

Sense.DEF: to return to doing something in the way it was done before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The people are turning back to natural resources to survive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们又在回归于依靠自然资源生存。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve promised to help, and there’s no turning back you cannot change this !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经答应要帮忙﹐不能反悔！

Sense.DEF:
to turn the switch on a machine such as an
oven
, radio etc so that it produces less heat, sound etc
Sense.TRAN: 调低〔烤箱的温度﹑收音机的音量等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you turn the TV down? I’m trying to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把电视的声音关小一点吗？ 我要工作。

Sense.DEF: to refuse an offer, request, or invitation
Sense.EXAMPLE: They offered her the job but she turned it down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要给她那份工作﹐但她拒绝了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to turn down an invitation to go to New York!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会拒绝去纽约的邀请！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Josie’s already turned him down refused his offer of marriage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔茜已经拒绝了他的求婚。

Sense.DEF: to give something to a person in authority, especially an illegal weapon or something lost or stolen
Sense.TRAN: 上交某物〔尤指非法武器﹑失物或被盗物品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels were told to turn in their weapons and ammunition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子被要求交出武器和弹药。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My wallet was turned in to the police two days later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两天后我的钱包被人交到了警察那里。

Sense.DEF: to give back something you have borrowed or rented
Sense.EXAMPLE: When do the library books have to be turned in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆的还书期限是什么时候？

Sense.DEF: to produce a particular profit, result etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bimec turned in net profits of £2.4 million. Bimec
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司创造了240万英镑的净利润。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last night the team turned in another dazzling performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚这支球队又奉献了一场令人目眩的精彩表演。

Sense.DEF: to tell the police who or where a criminal is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margrove’s wife finally turned him in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马格洛夫的妻子最终告发了他。

Sense.DEF: to go to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll turn in early tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想今晚我要早点睡觉。

Sense.DEF: to give a piece of work you have done to a teacher, your employer etc
Sense.TRAN: 上交〔作业﹑完成的工作等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you all turned in your homework assignments?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们的家庭作业都交了没有？

Sense.DEF: to become something different, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sofa turns into a bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这沙发可以变成一张床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few weeks later, winter had turned into spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几周过后﹐冬去春来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hollywood discovered her and turned her into a star.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞发掘了她﹐把她变成了明星。

Sense.DEF: to change by magic from one thing into another, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a flash, the prince turned into a frog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 转眼之间﹐王子变成了青蛙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The witch had turned them all into stone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女巫把他们都变成了石头。

Sense.LEXUNIT: days turned into weeks/months turned into years etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that time passed slowly while you waited for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 几天之后又是几周/几个月之后又是几年等〔用于表示等待某事发生时时间过得很慢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Weeks turned into months, and still there was no letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个星期过去了﹐几个月过去了﹐还是没有信来。

Sense.DEF: to make a machine or piece of electrical equipment such as a television, engine, light etc stop operating by pushing a button, turning a key etc
Sense.TRAN: 关闭〔电视机﹑引擎﹑电灯等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to turn the lights off when you leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走时别忘了关灯。

Sense.DEF: to stop the supply of water, gas etc from flowing by turning a handle
Sense.TRAN: 关掉﹐截断〔自来水﹑煤气等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve turned the gas off for a couple of hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已把煤气切断几个小时了。

Sense.DEF: to leave the road you are travelling on and start travelling on another road

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think we should have turned off at the last exit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们在上一个出口就应该出去的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark turned off the highway and into Provincetown.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克驶离公路﹐进入了普罗温斯敦镇。

Sense.DEF: to make someone decide they do not like something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any prospective buyer will be turned off by the sight of rotting wood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何潜在的买主看到腐朽的木头﹐都会失去兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel that they are not attracted to you in a sexual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men who stink of beer really turn me off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满身啤酒味道的男人实在让我没那兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to make a machine or piece of electrical equipment such as a television, engine, light etc start operating by pushing a button, turning a key etc
Sense.TRAN: 启动〔机器〕﹐打开〔电视机﹑引擎﹑电灯等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jake turned on his computer and checked his mail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克打开电脑查看电子邮件。

Sense.DEF: to make the supply of water, gas etc start flowing from something by turning a handle
Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned on the gas and lit the stove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开煤气﹐点燃炉子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m thirsty,’ she said, turning on the tap .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我渴了。”她说着﹐打开了水龙头。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly attack someone, using physical violence or unpleasant words
Sense.TRAN: 〔用暴力或恶毒语言〕突然攻击某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter turned on Rae and screamed, ‘Get out of my sight!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得突然冲着雷尖叫起来:“从我面前滚开！”

Sense.DEF: if a situation, event, argument etc turns on a particular thing or idea, it depends on that thing
Sense.TRAN: 取决于某事物﹐依某事物而定
Sense.EXAMPLE: As usual, everything turned on how much money was available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照例﹐一切都取决于有多少钱可以用。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel sexually excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way he looked at her really turned her on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那样地看着她﹐把她的性趣大大地逗了起来。

Sense.DEF: to interest someone, or to make someone become interested in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Science fiction just doesn’t turn me on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科幻小说根本提不起我的兴趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was Walter who turned me on to vegetarian food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是沃尔特让我喜欢上素食的。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start to be very nice, amusing, and interesting, especially in a way that is not sincere
Sense.TRAN: 施展魅力〔尤指并非出于真心〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon was good at turning on the charm at parties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙很会在聚会上施展魅力。

Sense.DEF: to happen in a particular way, or to have a particular result, especially one that you did not expect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a difficult time, but eventually things turned out all right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那段时期很困难﹐不过最后还是好起来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: To my surprise, it turned out that I was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我吃惊的是﹐结果竟是我错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As it turned out used to say what happened in the end , he passed the exam quite easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐他轻而易举地通过了考试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That guy turned out to be Maria’s second cousin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家伙原来是玛丽亚的远房表兄。

Sense.DEF: to stop the flow of electricity to a light by pressing a switch, pulling a string etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to turn out the lights when you go!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走时别忘了关灯！

Sense.DEF: if a lot of people turn out for an event, they go to watch it or take part in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: About 70% of the population turned out for the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约有70%的人口参加了选举投票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thousands turned out to watch yesterday’s match against Ireland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万的人前去观看了昨天对爱尔兰队的比赛。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave a place permanently, especially their home
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can’t pay the rent, they turn you out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是付不出房租﹐他们就会把你赶出去。

Sense.DEF: to produce or make something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory turns out 300 units a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂一天生产300台。

Sense.DEF: dressed in good, beautiful etc clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: elegantly turned-out young ladies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣着雅致的年轻女士们

Subsense.DEF: to empty something completely by taking out the contents
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The policeman made him turn out his pockets.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察让他把口袋里的东西都掏出来。

Subsense.DEF: to take out everything in a room, drawer etc and clean the room etc thoroughly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Lea decided to turn out the attic.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利决定把阁楼彻底清理一下。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the right to own something, or to make someone responsible for dealing with something
Sense.TRAN: 把所有权交给某人﹔交托某人负责某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll turn the shop over to his son when he retires.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他退休后将把商店交给儿子经营。

GramExa.PROPFORM: turn the matter/problem/responsibility etc over to sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m turning the project over to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要把项目交给你负责。

Sense.DEF: to use land, a building etc for a different purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a new plan to turn the land over to wind farming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个新的计划﹐要把这块土地进行改造用于风力发电。

Sense.DEF: to take a criminal to the police or another official organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suspected terrorists are immediately turned over to the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子疑犯会被立即送交法办。

Sense.DEF: if a business turns over a particular amount of money, it earns that amount in a particular period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within ten years the theme park was turning over £20 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 10年里﹐这座主题公园的营业额达到了2,000万英镑。

Sense.DEF: if an engine turns over, or if someone turns it over, it starts to work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine turned over twice and then stopped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎发动了两次﹐然后熄火了。

Sense.DEF: to turn a page in a book or a sheet of paper to the opposite side
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn over and look at the next page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翻过去看下一页。

Sense.DEF:
to change to another
channel
on a television
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we turn over? There’s a film I want to see.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们换个频道好吗？ 有一部电影我想看。

Sense.DEF: to search a place thoroughly or steal things from it, making it very untidy
Sense.TRAN: 彻底搜查某处﹔〔为偷东西〕翻箱倒柜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Burglars had been in and turned the whole house over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盗贼进来过﹐把整座房子翻了个底朝天。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: turn sth over in your mind

Sense.DEF: to try to get help, advice, or sympathy from someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know who to turn to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道向谁求助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Namibian government turned to South Africa for help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳米比亚政府向南非求援。

Sense.DEF: to start to do or use something new, especially as a way of solving a problem
Sense.TRAN: 改用﹐开始使用〔新的东西﹐尤指作为一种解决问题的方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people here are turning to solar power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这儿的很多人都开始使用太阳能了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: addicts who turn to crime to finance their habit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为筹毒资而走上犯罪道路的吸毒者

Sense.DEF: to become a different quality, attitude, form of a substance etc, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our laughter turned to horror as we rea-lized that Jody was really hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当意识到乔迪是真的受伤时﹐我们由笑变成了害怕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When water turns to steam, it expands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水变成水蒸气时体积会膨胀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sudden storm turned the earth to mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场突如其来的暴风雨把泥土变成了泥浆。

Sense.DEF: to look at a particular page in a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn to page 655 for more information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翻到第655页了解更多信息。

Sense.DEF:
to turn a switch on a machine such as an
oven
, radio etc so that it produces more heat, sound etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn the oven up to 220.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把烤箱调高到220度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn up the radio!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把收音机开大声一点！

Sense.DEF: to be found, especially by chance, after having been lost or searched for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually my watch turned up in a coat pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终我的手表在一件大衣的口袋里找到了。

Sense.DEF: to arrive at a place, especially in a way that is unexpected
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t just turn up and expect a meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能来了就想有饭吃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steve turned up late, as usual.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫照例又来晚了。

Sense.DEF: if an opportunity or situation turns up, it happens, especially when you are not expecting it
Sense.TRAN: 〔机会或情况〕突然出现﹐不期而至
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, I’m sure a job will turn up soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我相信工作不久就会有的。

Sense.DEF: to find something by searching for it thoroughly
Sense.TRAN: 〔经过彻底搜寻〕发现某物﹐发掘出某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police investigation hasn’t turned up any new evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的调查还没有发现任何新的证据。

Sense.DEF: to shorten a skirt, trousers etc by folding up the bottom and sewing it
to suddenly attack someone, using physical violence or unpleasant words
Sense.TRAN: 〔用暴力或恶毒言语〕突然攻击

Sense.DEF: if a situation, event, argument etc turns upon a particular thing or idea, it depends on that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court case turned upon a technicality of company law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起诉讼案件取决于公司法的一个细则。

Sense.DEF: the time when it is your chance, duty, or right to do something that each person in a group is doing one after the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whose turn is it to set the table?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮到谁摆放餐具了？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your turn . Roll the dice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮到你了﹐掷骰子吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it’s our turn to drive the kids to school this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想这周该轮到我们开车送孩子们上学了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that it is someone’s go in a game rather than turn .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐游戏轮到某人时人们常说it is someone’s go﹐而不用 turn
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Whose go is it now?
Wait until it’s your go .

Sense.DEF: if two or more people take turns doing work, using something etc, they do it one after the other, for example in order to share the work or play fairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to take turns on the swing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们得轮流荡秋千。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The students were taking turns reading aloud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生正在轮流朗读。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We took turns in pushing the bike along.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们轮流推自行车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dan and I usually take turns to cook.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和丹通常轮流做饭。

Subsense.DEF: as a result of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Interest rates were cut and, in turn, share prices rose.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率下调﹐股价就相应地上涨了。

Subsense.DEF: one after the other, especially in a particular order
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Each of us in turn had to describe how alcohol had affected our lives.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都得挨个说一说喝酒如何影响了我们的生活。

Subsense.DEF: a place where one road goes in a different direction from the one you are on
Subsense.EXAMPLE: According to the map we missed our turn back there.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从地图上来看﹐我们已经开过了前面那个应该转弯的地方。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take the first/a wrong etc turn
GramExa.GLOSS: go along the first etc road
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在第一个交叉处转弯/拐错弯等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think we took a wrong turn coming out of town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我们出城时拐错弯了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take the second turn on the left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在第二个交叉处左拐。

Subsense.DEF: a curve in a road, path etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s a sharp turn coming up ahead.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前方有一个急转弯。

Sense.DEF: a change in the direction you are moving

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make a left turn at the station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了车站向左拐。

Sense.DEF: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way
Sense.TRAN: 〔突如其来或意外的〕变化﹐转变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From then on, our fortunes took a downward turn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从那以后﹐我们的际遇每况愈下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My career had already taken a new turn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的事业已经有了新的转机。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The President was stunned by the sudden turn of events .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统对事态发生突变感到非常震惊。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take a turn for the worse/better
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two days after the operation, Dad took a turn for the worse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸在手术两天后病情开始恶化。

Sense.DEF: the beginning of a new century or year
Sense.EXAMPLE: the short period from the turn of the century until World War One
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从世纪之交到一战之前的短暂时期

Sense.DEF: happening again and again, especially in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: problems that presented themselves at every turn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处处存在的问题

Sense.DEF: the act of turning something completely around a fixed point
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave the screw another two or three turns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又把螺丝拧了两三圈。

Sense.DEF: changing from one quality, feeling etc to another
Sense.TRAN: 轮流地﹐交替地〔表现某些特质或情感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: By turns, a 14 year old is affectionate then aggressive, silent then outspoken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个14岁的孩子﹐有时会跟你很亲热﹐有时又会犯浑﹐有时一言不发﹐有时又什么话都说。

Subsense.DEF: the ability to say things in a clever or funny way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kate has a colourful turn of phrase.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特说话很有趣。

Subsense.DEF: a particular way of saying something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What a strange turn of phrase!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种说法真奇怪！
