Sense.DEF: to say something you should not say in a particular situation, especially because you do not have enough authority to say it
Sense.TRAN: 说不该说的话﹐说话出格 〔尤指超越本分说话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry if I spoke out of turn, Major Karr.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我说了不该说的话﹐我很抱歉﹐卡尔少校。

Sense.DEF: to do something that is helpful or unhelpful for someone
Sense.TRAN: 做有利于/有损于某人的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: You did me a good turn by driving Max home last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你昨晚开车送马克斯回家﹐真是帮了我大忙。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if someone does something nice for you, you should do something nice for them
Sense.TRAN: 好心应该得到好报﹔以德报德

Sense.DEF: the particular way that someone usually thinks or feels

GramExa.PROPFORM: an academic/practical etc turn of mind
GramExa.EXAMPLE: youngsters with an independent turn of mind
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 思想独立的青少年

Subsense.DEF:
if the
tide
is on the turn, the sea is starting to come in or go out
starting to change, or in the process of changing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hopefully my luck was on the turn.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的运气有望好转了。

Subsense.DEF: if milk, fish, or other food is on the turn, it is no longer fresh
Subsense.TRAN: 〔牛奶﹑鱼或其他食品〕开始变酸﹐变质

Sense.DEF: a sudden increase in your speed, or the ability to increase your speed suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a top goalkicker with a surprising turn of speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个顶尖射手﹐瞬间加速能力十分惊人。

Sense.DEF: to be perfectly cooked

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a turn in/on etc sth
Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere for pleasure
to frighten someone
to feel slightly ill
a complete change in someone’s opinions, ideas, or methods
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点﹑思想或方法的〕彻底改变﹐转变
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extraordinarily rapid turnabout in attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 态度上异常迅速的改变

Sense.DEF: used to say that because someone else has done something to you, you can do it to them too
Sense.TRAN: 一人一遭﹐天公地道﹔以其人之道还治其人之身乃是公道

Sense.DEF: the time it takes to receive something, deal with it and send it back, especially on a plane, ship etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔处理某物的〕所需时间〔包括递送时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average turnaround for a passport application is six working days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护照办理周期一般为六个工作日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must reduce costs and shorten turnaround times .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须削减成本﹐缩短周期。

Sense.DEF: a complete change from a bad situation to a good one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the remarkable turnaround in our economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我国经济的显著好转

Sense.DEF:
a
turnabout
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点﹑思想或方法的〕彻底改变﹐转变

Sense.DEF: someone who stops supporting a political party or group and joins the opposing side
Sense.EXAMPLE: Casson was publicly criticized as a turncoat and a traitor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡森被公开指责为叛党分子和叛徒。

Sense.DEF:
someone who uses a
lathe special tool
to make shapes out of wood or metal
a road that connects with the one you are on
Sense.EXAMPLE: He must have taken a wrong turning in the dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他准是在黑暗中拐错弯了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the first turning on the left .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到第一个拐弯处就向左拐。

Sense.DEF: the smallest space in which a vehicle can drive around in a circle
Sense.TRAN: 回转圆〔汽车能转弯的最小空间〕

Sense.DEF: the time when an important change starts, especially one that improves the situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meeting her was the turning point in my life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇到她是我人生的转折点。

Sense.DEF: a large round pale yellow vegetable that grows under the ground, or the plant that produces it
ready to be used immediately
Sense.TRAN: 立即可以使用的﹐“交钥匙”的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the development and sale of turnkey systems for telecommunications customers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电信客户“交钥匙”系统的开发和销售

Sense.DEF: a smaller road that leads off a main road
Sense.EXAMPLE: I missed the turn-off to the farm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我错过了去农场的岔道。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you lose interest in something, especially sex
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在性方面〕使人失去兴趣的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pornographic pictures are a real turn-off to most women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色情图片对大多数女性来说是大倒胃口的东西。

Sense.DEF: existing or happening around the beginning of a century, especially the beginning of the 20th century
Sense.TRAN: 世纪之交的〔尤指20世纪的开始〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: narrow turn-of-the-century streets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪初建成的狭窄街道

Sense.DEF: something that makes you feel excited, especially sexually
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在性方面〕使人感到兴奋的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a turn-on to be the centre of attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为别人注意的焦点令人兴奋。

Sense.DEF: the number of people who vote in an election

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the low turn-out of 54 percent in the March elections
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 3月份选举中54%的低投票率

Sense.DEF: the number of people who go to a party, meeting, or other organized event
Sense.TRAN: 〔聚会﹑会议等的〕出席人数﹐到场人数
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was disappointed by the turn-out for our home match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对我们主场比赛的观众到场人数感到失望。

Sense.DEF: a place at the side of a narrow road where cars can wait to let others pass
the amount of business done during a particular period

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The illicit drugs industry has an annual turnover of some £200 billion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法毒品行业有2,000亿英镑左右的年交易额。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turnover rose 9%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 营业额提高了9%。

Sense.DEF: the rate at which a particular kind of goods is sold

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tri-Star’s fast turnover of stock
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三星公司快速的库存周转

Sense.DEF: the rate at which people leave an organization and are replaced by others
Sense.TRAN: 人事变动率﹐人员流动率

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Low pay accounts for the high turnover .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低薪是人员流动大的原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a high degree of labour turnover among women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女工的高流动率

Sense.DEF:
a small fruit
pie
Sense.EXAMPLE: an apple turnover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果馅饼

Sense.DEF: a large road for fast traffic that drivers have to pay to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: the New Jersey Turnpike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新泽西付费高速公路

Sense.DEF:
a
turnaround
Sense.TRAN: 〔处理某物的〕所需时间﹔好转﹔〔观点﹑思想或方法的〕彻底改变

Sense.DEF: one of the lights on a car that flash to show which way the car is turning
a small gate that spins around and only lets one person at a time go through an entrance
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had 600,000 admissions through the turnstiles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经旋转栅门入场的人数已达60万人次。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a
stereo
on which the record turns round
a large flat round surface on which railway engines are turned around
Sense.TRAN: 〔铁路机车掉转方向的〕转车台

Sense.DEF:
a
dj
who plays recorded music at parties or dances, and who mixes together parts of different records to form new music
Sense.TRAN: 唱盘艺术家〔指聚会或舞会上混合播放音乐唱片使之成为新音乐的唱片播放师〕

Sense.DEF: the bottom of a trouser leg that is folded up for decoration or to make it shorter
an unexpected and surprising event
Sense.TRAN: 意想不到的事﹐突发事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fancy you being in New York too. What a turn-up for the books!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你竟然也在纽约﹐真没想到啊！

Sense.DEF: a type of oil used for making paint more liquid or removing it from clothes, brushes etc
very immoral behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: laziness and moral turpitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 懒惰和道德败坏

Sense.DEF: turpentine
a valuable greenish-blue stone or a jewel that is made from this
Sense.EXAMPLE: turquoise earrings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿松石耳环

Sense.DEF: a greenish-blue colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was painted in turquoise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间被刷成青绿色。

Sense.DEF:
a small tower on a large building, especially a
castle

the place on a
tank
from which guns are fired

a
reptile
that lives mainly in water and has a soft body covered by a hard shell

any
reptile
that has a hard shell covering its body, for example a
tortoise

a type of bird that makes a pleasant soft sound and is sometimes used to represent love

a type of
sweater
with a high, close-fitting collar that covers most of your neck

the plural of
turf 1 2
the part of your body that you sit on

one of a pair of very long pointed teeth, that stick out of the mouth of animals such as
elephants
a fight using a lot of energy, in which two people get hold of each other and struggle
Sense.EXAMPLE: After quite a tussle, I finally wrenched the letter from him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扭打了好一会儿﹐我终于从他手里夺过了信。

Sense.DEF: a struggle or argument in which people try to beat each other to get something

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在领导权争夺中的失败

Sense.DEF: to fight or struggle without using any weapons, by pulling or pushing someone rather than hitting them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was tussling with the other boys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正和其他男孩揪揪扯扯。

Sense.DEF: to try to beat someone in order to get something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They tussled for first place in the race.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们争夺比赛的第一名。

Sense.DEF: a small thick mass of grass
the sound that you make by touching the top of your mouth with your tongue in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 啧啧〔表示不赞同的声音〕

Sense.DEF: to express disapproval by making a tut sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse rushed in, tutting with irritation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士急匆匆地进来﹐不高兴地咂着嘴。

Sense.DEF: when you are taught or looked after by someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can attend embroidery classes under the tutelage of Jocelyn James.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以参加乔斯林•詹姆斯执教的刺绣班。

Sense.DEF: responsibility for someone’s education, actions, or property

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母的监护

Sense.DEF: someone who gives private lessons to one student or a small group, and is paid directly by them

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子在家接受教育﹐连续请过几任家庭教师。

Sense.DEF: a teacher in a British university or college
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学或学院中的〕助教﹐导师
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was my tutor at Durham.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是我在达勒姆大学时的导师。

Sense.DEF: to teach someone as a tutor

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是由家庭教师教的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young men were tutored in the art of handling horses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻男子被教授驭马之术。

Sense.DEF: a period of teaching and discussion with a tutor, especially in a British university
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指英国大学里的〕导师辅导（时间）

Sense.DEF: a computer program that is designed to teach you how to use another program

Sense.TRAN: 家庭教师的﹔助教的﹔大学导师的﹔辅导的﹐指导的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tutorial staff

Sense.EXAMPLE: tutorial supervision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师的教授指导

Sense.DEF:
a type of
ice cream
that has very small pieces of fruit and nuts in it

a short skirt made of many folds of stiff material, worn by
ballet
dancers

a man’s
jacket
that is usually black, worn on formal occasions
Sense.TRAN: 〔在正式场合穿的〕男式无尾礼服上衣

Sense.DEF:
a man’s suit that includes this type of
jacket
television

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a TV series based on the novel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据这部小说改编的电视连续剧

Sense.EXAMPLE: a new TV set

Sense.DEF: a meal that is sold already prepared, so that you just need to heat it before eating
Sense.TRAN: 〔只需加热即可食用的〕电视便餐
the abbreviation of 缩写=textured vegetable protein 结构性植物蛋白

Sense.DEF: something that someone has said or written that you think is stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔说的或写的〕无聊话﹐废话﹐蠢话
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t believe in all that twaddle about fate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不相信那些关于命运的鬼话。

Sense.DEF: two
used to say that two things are so different that they can never exist together
a quality in the way someone speaks, produced when the air used to speak passes through their nose as well as their mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nasal twang
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼻音
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice had a slight Australian twang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话带点澳大利亚味儿。

Sense.DEF: a quick ringing sound like the one made by pulling a very tight wire and then suddenly letting it go
if you twang something or if it twangs, it makes a quick ringing sound by being pulled and then suddenly let go
Sense.TRAN: （使）发出拨弦声﹔（使）发出嘣的一声
Sense.EXAMPLE: She twanged the guitar strings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拨弄吉他弦﹐发出嘣嘣声。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a stupid or unpleasant person. Do not use this word.
a very offensive word for the female sex organ. Do not use this word.
to suddenly pull or twist something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She leant forward and tweaked both ends of his moustache.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她俯身向前﹐扯住他的两撇胡子。

Sense.DEF: to make small changes to a machine, vehicle, or system in order to improve the way it works
Sense.TRAN: 对〔机器﹑汽车或系统〕作小小的改进
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe you should tweak a few sentences before you send in the report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告交上去之前﹐有几个句子你也许应该修改一下。

Sense.DEF: very pretty or perfect, in a way that you find silly or unpleasant

Sense.EXAMPLE: She produced twee little flower paintings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她画的是过于艳丽的花卉小作品。

Sense.DEF:
rough
woollen
cloth woven from threads of different colours, used mostly to make
jackets
, suits, and coats
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thick tweed suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚厚的粗花呢套装

Sense.DEF: a suit of clothes made from this type of cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore casual country tweeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着休闲的乡村粗花呢套装。

Sense.DEF: two people or groups who are almost exactly the same as each other, especially when they both seem to be bad. The names come from two characters in the book Through The Looking-Glass by Lewis Carroll. They are fat little men, who are both dressed in school uniform and look exactly like each other
Sense.TRAN: 特老大和特老二﹔几乎一样的两个人[团体]〔尤指两个都不好。 这两个名字出自刘易斯•卡罗尔小说《镜中世界》里两个都穿校服﹑长得一模一样的小胖子兄弟〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some voters felt there was little real difference between the two party leaders – a case of choosing between Tweedledum and Tweedledee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些选民觉得这两个政党领袖之间并无实质的区别——歪果子烂桃子﹐选来选去就这么回事。

Sense.DEF: wearing tweed clothes in a way that is thought to be typical of the British upper class
Sense.TRAN: 爱穿粗花呢服装的﹔典型英国上层阶级的

Sense.DEF: made of tweed or like tweed
between
to make the short high sound of a small bird

a
speaker piece of equipment
through which the high sounds from a
stereo
etc are made louder
a small tool that has two narrow pieces of metal joined at one end, used to pull or move very small objects
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was plucking her eyebrows with a pair of tweezers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正拿着一把小镊子在拔眉毛。

Sense.DEF: one of twelve equal parts of something
the number 12

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获刑12个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come at twelve 12 o’clock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 12点来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their son Dylan is twelve 12 years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的儿子迪伦12岁。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the twelfth the 12th day of the month.

Sense.DEF: the number 20
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small village twenty miles from Nairobi
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 距内罗毕20英里的一个小村庄
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m nearly twenty 20 years old .

Sense.EXAMPLE: In the twenties the business expanded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20年代时﹐业务扩展了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The photograph was taken in the late twenties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片是在20年代晚期照的。

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 20 and
Sense.TRAN: 29在二十到二十九岁之间﹐是二十多岁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was in her early twenties when I met her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遇到她时﹐她20岁出头。

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the twenties, it is between 20 degrees and 29 degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a warm day, with temperatures in the low twenties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 温暖的一天﹐气温20度多一点

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money that is worth £20 or $20
Sense.TRAN: 二十英镑钞票﹔二十美元钞票
Sense.EXAMPLE: I offered the driver a twenty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给了司机一张20元的钞票。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the twentieth the 20th day of the month.

Sense.DEF:
your twenty-first
birthday
or the celebration you have for it
Sense.TRAN: 二十一岁生日﹔二十一岁生日庆祝会

Sense.DEF: if something happens twenty-four seven, it happens all the time, every day
Sense.TRAN: 一天二十四小时一周七天﹐每时每刻﹐不间断地

Sense.DEF: a card game, usually played for money
Sense.TRAN: 二十一点牌戏〔一种赌博游戏〕

Sense.DEF: a game in which one person thinks of an object and others have to guess what it is by asking questions about it which can only be answered with ‘Yes’ or ‘No’. You sometimes mention the game when you think that someone is asking or making you ask too many questions
Sense.TRAN: 二十问﹐问答式猜谜〔一种游戏﹐其中一人想出一个物品﹐其他人必须通过提问来猜﹐而问题只能以“是”或“不是”来回答。当有人问了太多问题或让人问太多问题时﹐有时会提到这个游戏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just tell me straight, don’t make me play twenty questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就直接告诉我吧﹐别让我猜谜语了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is between the ages of 20 and 29
Sense.TRAN: 二十至二十九岁之间的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd of twentysomethings were gathered outside the club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群二十几岁的人聚集在俱乐部外面。

Sense.DEF: the ability to see things normally, without needing glasses

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员必须具有极好的视力。

a type of

competition in England in which
county
teams play against each other in short matches of only twenty
overs
for each side
a person who you think is stupid or annoying
two times

GramExa.GLOSS: two times in the same day, week etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Letters were delivered twice a week only.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信件一周只送两次。

Sense.EXAMPLE: None of our dinner menus are exactly the same twice over .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的晚餐菜单从没有完全重样的。

Sense.DEF: two times more, bigger, better etc than something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They employ 90 people, twice as many as last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们雇用了90人﹐是去年的两倍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Interest rates are twice as high as those of our competitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率是我们竞争对手的两倍高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an area twice the size of Britain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有英国两倍大的一个地区

Sense.DEF: to do nothing while you are waiting for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go – there’s no point in sitting here twiddling our thumbs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走吧——坐在这儿干等没有用。

Sense.DEF: to move or turn something around with your fingers many times, especially because you are nervous or bored
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因紧张或无聊用手指〕捻弄﹐摆弄

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was twiddling with her earrings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在摆弄她的耳环。

Sense.DEF: a small very thin stem of wood that grows from a branch on a tree
to suddenly realize something about a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took ages before he twigged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了好长时间他才突然明白过来。

Sense.DEF: the small amount of light in the sky as the day ends

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The end of the cigarette glowed in the twilight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟头在暮色中发着幽幽的红光。

Sense.DEF: the time when day is just starting to become night

GramExa.EXAMPLE: romantic walks along the beach at twilight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄昏时分浪漫的海边漫步

Sense.DEF: the period just before the end of the most active part of someone’s life

GramExa.EXAMPLE: in the twilight of her acting career
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她演艺生涯的晚期

Sense.EXAMPLE: Depression in the twilight years the last years of your life is usually related to illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚年的精神抑郁通常与疾病有关。

Sense.DEF: a strange situation involving mystery, dishonesty etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the twilight world of espionage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 神秘的间谍世界

Sense.DEF: lit by twilight
strong cloth woven to produce parallel sloping lines across its surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: grey twill trousers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰色的斜纹裤子

Sense.DEF: one of two children born at the same time to the same mother
Sense.EXAMPLE: The twins are now eight months old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对双胞胎现在已经八个月大了。

Sense.DEF: used to describe one of two children who are twins

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meet my twin sister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 见见我的双胞胎姐姐。

Sense.DEF: used to describe two things that happen at the same time and are related to each other
Sense.TRAN: 同时出现的﹐密切相关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the twin problems of poverty and unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫穷和失业这对孪生问题

Sense.DEF: a room that contains two single beds
Sense.TRAN: 〔有两张单人床的〕双人房间/卧室
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the twin rooms have private bathrooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的双人房间都配有独立卫生间。

Sense.DEF: to form a relationship between two similar towns in different countries in order to encourage visits between them
Sense.TRAN: 使〔不同国家的两个类似城市〕结为姐妹城市

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chichester in England is twinned with Chartres in France.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰的奇切斯特和法国的沙特尔结成了姐妹城市。

Sense.DEF: to form a relationship between two places, people, or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 使〔两地﹑两人或两种思想〕紧密结合﹐使相连

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dole has been twinned in the history books with his old rival Bush.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在历史书里﹐多尔和他的老对手布什紧密联系在一起。

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of single beds in a room for two people
a bed that is just big enough for one person
strong string made by twisting together two or more threads or strings
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bundle of papers tied up with twine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用双股线捆扎起来的一摞文件

Sense.DEF: to wind or twist around something else, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She twined her arms round him and kissed his cheek.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她两手环抱着他﹐亲吻他的脸颊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A dark green ivy plant twined around the pole.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一株深绿色的常春藤缠绕着柱子。

Sense.DEF: a twin-engined aircraft has two engines
a sudden feeling of slight pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a twinge of pain in my back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得背上一阵刺痛。

Sense.DEF: a sudden slight feeling of guilt etc
Sense.TRAN: 一阵内疚/羡慕/悲伤/嫉妒等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt a sharp twinge of guilt for not taking the trouble to visit her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因没有想办法去看望她而感到一阵强烈的内疚。

Sense.DEF: if a star or light twinkles, it shines in the dark with an unsteady light
Sense.EXAMPLE: stars twinkling in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空中闪烁的星星
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw lights twinkling in the little town below us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到我们下面的小镇灯火闪烁。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s eyes twinkle, they have a happy expression

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her eyes twinkled with amusement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双眼闪耀着愉悦的光芒。

Sense.DEF: an expression in your eyes that shows you are happy or amused
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kindly, white-haired old gentleman with a twinkle in his eye
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位慈祥可亲﹑目光炯炯有神的白发老先生

Sense.DEF: a small bright shining light that becomes brighter and then fainter

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the twinkling of an eye
Sense.DEF: very quickly

a woman’s
sweater
and
cardigan
that are meant to be worn together
Sense.TRAN: 两件套毛衣〔由套头毛衣和开襟衫组成的女装〕

Sense.DEF: a town that has formed a relationship with a similar town in another country in order to encourage visits between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oxford’s twin town is Bonn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛津的姐妹城是波恩。

Sense.DEF: to turn around and around or make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Couples were twirling around the dance floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对对舞伴在舞池里旋转。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She twirled the liquid around in her glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她晃动着杯子里的液体。

Subsense.DEF: to turn a part of your body around or change your position by turning
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He twisted his head slightly, and looked up at her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他微微扭过头﹐抬眼看着她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She twisted round, so that she could see the dog better.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过身子﹐以便更清楚地看到那条狗。

Subsense.DEF: if you twist your mouth or features, you smile in an unpleasant way or look angry, disapproving etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔不愉快地﹑生气地或不赞同地〕歪起嘴苦笑﹐扭歪着脸笑
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His mouth twisted in a humourless smile.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他歪起嘴干巴巴地笑着。

Sense.DEF: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She twisted her handkerchief into a knot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把手帕绕成一个结。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Twist the two ends of the wire together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把电线的两端拧在一起。

Sense.DEF: to wind something around or through an object

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She twisted a silk scarf round her neck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把一条真丝围巾围在脖子上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ann twisted some daisies through Katherine’s thick brown hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安把几朵雏菊缠绕在凯瑟琳浓密的棕色头发上。

Sense.DEF: to turn something in a circle using your hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack twisted the cap off the bottle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克旋开了瓶盖。

Sense.DEF: if a road, river etc twists, it changes direction in a series of curves
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road twisted between spectacular mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路盘旋在壮丽的群山之间。

Sense.DEF: to change the true or intended meaning of a statement, especially in order to get some advantage for yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always trying to twist my words and make me look bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是要曲解我的话﹐丑化我的形象。

Sense.DEF: to hurt your wrist etc by pulling or turning it too suddenly while you are moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harriet slipped on the stairs and twisted her ankle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈丽雅特在楼梯上滑倒﹐扭伤了脚踝。

Subsense.DEF: if a path, road, stream etc twists and turns, it has a lot of bends in it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The river twists and turns through the green fields.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河流弯弯曲曲穿过绿色的田野。

Subsense.DEF: if a person or animal twists and turns, they make twisting movements
to persuade someone to do something they do not want to do
Subsense.TRAN: 强迫某人做某事﹐向某人施加压力
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No one twisted my arm about coming to see you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人强迫我来看你。

Subsense.DEF: to bend someone’s arm upwards behind their back in order to hurt them
Subsense.TRAN: 把某人的手臂反扭到背后
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The policeman twisted my arm behind me and arrested me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察把我的手臂反扭到背后﹐逮捕了我。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: twist/wrap sb around your little finger

Sense.DEF: an unexpected feature or change in a situation or series of events

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The robbery took a deadly new twist as the robber pulled out a gun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢劫事件出现了关乎生死的新变数——劫匪掏出了枪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an unexpected twist in the plot
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 故事情节意想不到的转折

Sense.EXAMPLE: By an amazing twist of fate , we met again in Madrid five years later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 命运的安排让人惊奇﹐五年后我们在马德里又相遇了。

Sense.DEF: a twisting action or movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smiled, a slow cynical twist of his lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑了﹐嘴巴慢慢一歪﹐带着嘲笑的意味。

Sense.DEF: a bend in a river or road
Sense.TRAN: 〔河流或道路的〕曲折处﹐弯子﹐转弯处

Sense.DEF: a small piece of something that is twisted into a particular shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a twist of lemon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片螺旋状柠檬

Sense.DEF: a popular fast dance from the 1960s in which you twist your body from side to side
Sense.TRAN: 扭摆舞〔盛行于20世纪60年代〕

Subsense.DEF: crazy
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘The woman’s mad,’ she told herself. ‘She’s round the twist.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那女人疯了。”她对自己说﹐“她真是疯了。”

Subsense.DEF: very angry

Crossrefto.REFLEX: (don’t) get your knickers in a twist

Sense.DEF: something twisted has been bent in many directions or turned many times, so that it has lost its original shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: the plane’s twisted wreckage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机扭曲变形的残骸

Sense.DEF: seeming to enjoy things that are cruel or shocking, in a way that is not normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whoever sent those letters has a twisted mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寄那些信的人心理不正常。

Sense.DEF: someone who cheats other people

a
tornado
a person who you think is stupid or silly
if a part of someone’s body twitches, or if they twitch it, it makes a small sudden movement
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔身体的某个部分〕颤动﹐抽动﹐抽搐
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mouth twitched slightly, and then he smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘴轻轻动了一下后﹐他笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He twitched his eyebrows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他皱了皱眉。

Sense.DEF: to move something quickly and suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah twitched the reins, and we moved off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉猛地一拉缰绳﹐我们出发了。

Sense.DEF: a quick movement of a muscle, especially one that you cannot control
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nervous twitch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经性抽搐

Sense.DEF: a sudden quick movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no movement in the house, not even a twitch of the curtains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里没有一丝动静﹐连窗帘都没有掀动一下。

Sense.DEF:
a keen
bird-watcher
Sense.TRAN: 着迷的野鸟观察者﹐狂热的野鸟生态研究者

Sense.DEF: behaving in a nervous way because you are anxious about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was very twitchy about the way things would turn out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常担心事情会怎样发展。

Sense.DEF: if a bird twitters, it makes a lot of short high sounds
to talk about unimportant and silly things, usually very quickly and nervously in a high voice
the short high sounds that birds make
to be excited and nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been all of a twitter since her daughter’s engagement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从女儿订婚以来﹐她一直很兴奋。

Sense.DEF:
a
social networking
service on the Internet which allows
mini-blogging sending short text messages to other users
Sense.TRAN: 推特〔一个供人们写微博的社交网〕

Sense.DEF: between
the number 2
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be away for almost two weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要离开差不多两周时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to be there by two two o’clock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得在两点之前到那里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His family moved to Australia when he was two two years old .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他两岁时﹐全家搬到了澳大利亚。

Sense.DEF: in groups of two people or things
Sense.TRAN: 两人一组地﹐两个事物一组地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like you to line up in twos, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你们两个一组排好队。

Sense.DEF: to guess the meaning of something you have heard or seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw him leaving her house and I put two and two together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见他离开她家﹐心里便有了推测。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are in the same situation and feel the same way
Sense.TRAN: 我们两人的情况一样﹔我跟你有同感
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But I don’t know anything about children!’ ‘Well, that makes two of us.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可是我对小孩子的事一点都不懂！” 是呀﹐我和你一样。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: two can play at that game
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they will not have an advantage over you by doing something because you can do it too

Sense.LEXUNIT: a year/a week/a moment/an hour etc or two
Sense.DEF: one or a few years, weeks etc
Sense.TRAN: 一两年/一两周/一会儿/一两个小时等

Sense.LEXUNIT: two sides of the same coin
Sense.DEF: used to talk about two ways of looking at the same situation

Sense.LEXUNIT: two heads are better than one
Sense.DEF: used to say that two people are more likely to solve a problem or think of an idea than one person working alone
to be unable to decide what to do, or what you think about something
Sense.TRAN: （对于某事）犹豫不决﹐举棋不定
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was in two minds about whether to go with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很犹豫要不要和他一起去。

Sense.DEF: your opinion or what you want to say about a subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone had to put in their two cents worth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都必须说说自己的意见。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to leave two people alone to spend time with each other

Crossrefto.REFLEX: kill two birds with one stone

Sense.DEF: not at all good or important
Sense.TRAN: 差劲的﹔微不足道的﹐不重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just a two-bit movie star.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是一名二流的电影明星。

Sense.DEF: flat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-dimensional shape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平面形状

Sense.DEF: a two-dimensional character in a book, play etc does not seem like a real person
Sense.TRAN: 〔书本﹑剧中等的人物〕描写没有深度的﹐没有真实感的

Sense.DEF: having two effects or meanings, one good and one bad
Sense.TRAN: 有利有弊的﹐有好有坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-edged comment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一番亦褒亦贬的评论

GramExa.GLOSS: something that has as many bad results as good ones
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Strong leadership is a two-edged sword.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强势的领导是一把双刃剑。

Sense.DEF: having two edges that can cut
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-edged blade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双刃刀片

Sense.DEF: changing what you say according to who you are talking to, in a way that is insincere and unpleasant - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 两面派的﹐虚伪圆滑的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a two-faced liar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个虚伪圆滑的骗子。

Sense.DEF: two times as much or as many of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a twofold increase in cases of TB
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结核病例两倍的增加

Sense.DEF: having two important parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The benefits of the scheme are twofold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划有双重好处。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Student numbers have expanded twofold in ten years.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 十年间学生的人数增加了一倍。

Sense.DEF: using or needing both hands to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-handed catch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双手接球
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-handed sword
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双手剑

Sense.DEF: a two-handed tool is used by two people together
designed to be used by two people
Sense.TRAN: 为两人设计的﹔限于两人使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-man tent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双人帐篷

Sense.DEF:
another word for
tuppence
costing two pence
worth almost nothing
Sense.TRAN: 几乎没有价值的﹐一文不值的

Sense.DEF: milk that has had about half the fat removed
consisting of two people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-person household
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两口之家

Sense.DEF: designed to be used by two people
Sense.TRAN: 专为两个人设计的﹐两个人使用的

Sense.DEF:
a two-piece suit consists of a matching
jacket
and trousers
a vehicle or a piece of furniture with seats for two people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-seater sofa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双人沙发

Sense.DEF: having two different parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-sided problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个双重问题

Sense.DEF: two people who work together or spend a lot of time together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-known comedy twosome
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对著名的喜剧搭档

Sense.DEF:
a two-star hotel, restaurant etc has been judged to be of a
medium
standard
a dance with long sliding steps, or the music for this type of dance

a two-stroke engine is one in which there is a single up-and-down movement of a
piston
to have a secret relationship with someone who is not your regular partner
Sense.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t know Claire’s been two-timing him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不知道克莱尔一直对自己不忠。

Sense.DEF: having two different colours or sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: two-tone shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双色鞋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-tone alarm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双音警报器

Sense.DEF:
the lower of two levels of a
second-class
university degree in Britain
a small house with two rooms upstairs and two rooms downstairs
Sense.TRAN: 两上两下的房屋〔指楼上和楼下各有两个房间〕

Sense.DEF: moving or allowing movement in both directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: two-way traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双向交通
Sense.EXAMPLE: two-way trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双向贸易

Sense.DEF: used to describe a relationship which needs effort from both the people or groups involved
Sense.TRAN: 相互的﹐彼此的﹐有来有往的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corruption is a two-way process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腐败是双向的过程。

Sense.DEF: a two-way radio both sends and receives messages
glass that is a mirror from one side, but that you can see through from the other
Sense.TRAN: 单向透明玻璃镜〔从一面看是镜子﹐另一面看是透明的玻璃〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation depends on two people working well together
Sense.TRAN: 某事物依靠两人和睦相处的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marriage has to be a two-way street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻中夫妻双方应互谅互让。

Sense.DEF:
another form of
-ity
Sense.EXAMPLE: certainty being certain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确定性

Sense.DEF: someone who is successful in business or industry and has a lot of money and power

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a multimillionaire property tycoon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有数百万家财的房地产大亨

Sense.DEF:
the present participle of
tie
a child who is behaving badly
a small child
someone from Yorkshire

an
eardrum
one member of a group of people or things that have similar features or qualities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve already seen a few movies of this type.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经看过几部这种类型的影片了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What type of music do you like?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢什么类型的音乐？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are two main types of sleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡眠主要有两种类型。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: type, kind, sort
F2NBox.EXPL: Type , kind , and sort are countable nouns, and they should be plural after plural determiners.
F2NBox.TRAN: type﹐kind和sort为可数名词﹐在复数限定词之后用复数形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Many sorts of jobs (NOT 不说 Many sort of jobs) require computing skills.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多工种要求会使用电脑。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular or uncountable noun with no determiner after type/kind/sort of .
F2NBox.TRAN: type/kind/sort of之后接不加限定词的单数或不可数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: children who attend the same type of school
This sort of behaviour is totally unacceptable.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种行为完全不能接受。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular, plural, or uncountable noun with no determiner after types/kinds/sorts of .
F2NBox.TRAN: types/kinds/sorts of之后接不加限定词的单数﹑复数或不可数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: How common are these types of illness OR illnesses?
F2NBox.EXPL: In informal speech, people sometimes use these/those type of before a plural noun, but do not use this in writing.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在非正式讲话中﹐人们有时在复数名词之前用these/those type of﹐但在书面语中不要这样用。

Sense.DEF: a person who has, or seems to have, a particular character
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo’s not really the sporty type.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔可不是那种喜欢运动的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beth is not the type to make a fuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝不是那种小题大做的人。

Sense.DEF: to be the kind of person someone is sexually attracted to
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t my type really.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他并不是我所喜欢的那种人。

Sense.DEF: printed letters
Sense.EXAMPLE: italic type
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斜体字

Sense.DEF: a small block with a raised letter on it that is used to print with, or a set of these

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is not suited to this type of work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不适合这种工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you flown this particular type of aircraft before?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你以前开过这种特别的飞机吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They use the same type of axe as a tool and a weapon.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用同一种斧子作工具和武器。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve learned to work with different types of people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我学会了与不同类型的人打交道。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These architects felt the time had come for a new type of public building.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建筑师认为一种新型公共建筑的时代到来了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Methane is the main type of gas produced.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 甲烷是产生的主要气体。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The best cleanser for you depends on your skin type.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪种洁肤产品最适合你取决于你皮肤的类型。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one of the classes into which human blood can be separated
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mother and child had the same blood type.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲和孩子血型相同。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a particular type of character
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Find out your personality type by answering our simple questionnaire.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 回答简单的问卷﹐了解自己的个性类型。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for example, sandy soil or clay soil

Sense.DEF:
to write something using a computer or a
typewriter
Sense.EXAMPLE: He types with two fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用两个手指打字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Type your password, then press ‘Return’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 输入密码﹐然后按“回车”键。

GramExa.GLOSS: type a copy of something written by hand, in note form, or recorded
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went home to type up the report.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回家把报告打出来。

GramExa.GLOSS: write information on a computer
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please wait while I type in your details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请稍候﹐我来输入你的个人信息。

Sense.DEF: to find out what group something such as blood, cells, or a disease belong to
Sense.TRAN: 找出〔血液﹑细胞或疾病〕的类型﹐把…分类
Sense.EXAMPLE: DNA typing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱氧核糖核酸分类

Sense.DEF: to always give an actor the same type of character to play
Sense.TRAN: 总是给〔演员〕分配同一类型的角色
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always gets typecast as the villain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是分到演坏蛋的角色。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a particular type of job, activity etc to do, because you think it suits their character
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某人〕分派〔合乎其性格的工作﹑活动等〕

Sense.DEF: a group of letters, numbers etc of the same style and size, used in printing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new logo features a more modern typeface.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新标识的特点是采用了更加现代的字体。

Sense.DEF: a copy of a document that has been typed
Sense.TRAN: 〔用计算机或打字机打出的〕文件﹐文本﹔打字稿

Sense.DEF:
the job or activity of arranging
type 1 5
for printing
Sense.EXAMPLE: computerized typesetting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机排字工作

Sense.DEF: a machine with keys that you press in order to print letters of the alphabet onto paper

written using a computer or a
typewriter
Sense.TRAN: 用计算机打的﹔用打字机打出的
Sense.EXAMPLE: typewritten notes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用打字机打出的笔记

Sense.DEF: a serious infectious disease that is caused by dirty food or drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sudden outbreak of typhoid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤寒的突然爆发

Sense.DEF: a very violent tropical storm
a serious infectious disease carried by insects that live on the bodies of people and animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a typhus epidemic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斑疹伤寒的流行

Sense.DEF: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: typical British weather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型的英国天气

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This painting is typical of his work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画是他的典型作品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

Sense.DEF: happening in the usual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: On a typical day , our students go to classes from 7.30 am to 1 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平时我们学生的上课时间是上午7点30分到下午1点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try calculating your budget for a typical week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 算算看你平时一周的预算是多少。

Sense.DEF: behaving in the way that you expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bennett accepted the award with typical modesty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝内特以他一贯的谦虚接受了奖品。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is typical of sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not typical of Gill to be so critical.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔一般不会这么挑剔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Stevens’ appointment was a typical case of promoting a man beyond his level of competence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对史蒂文斯先生的任命是典型的小材大用。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are annoyed when something bad happens again, or when someone does something bad again
Sense.TRAN: 老是这样！又来了！〔表示气愤〕

Exponent.DEF: a typical person or thing is a good example of that type of person or thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: With his camera around his neck, he looked like a typical tourist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脖子上挂着相机﹐一副典型的游客样子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The windows are typical of houses built during this period.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种窗户是这一时期所建房屋典型的窗户。

Exponent.DEF: used to describe a very typical and very good example of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a classic case of the cure being worse than the disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是治疗反而比疾病本身更糟糕的典型例子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a classic mistake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型错误

Exponent.DEF: the archetypal person or thing is the most typical example of that kind of person or thing, and has all their most important qualities
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the archetypal English village
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型的英国村庄
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Indiana Jones is the archetypal adventure hero.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 印第安纳•琼斯是典型的冒险英雄。

Exponent.DEF: used when you want to emphasize that someone or something is the very best example of something – used especially when you admire them very much
Exponent.TRAN: 典范的﹐精华的〔尤指十分推崇的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the quintessential guide to New York
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经典的纽约指南
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Robert Plant is the quintessential rock ’n’ roll singer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特•普兰特是典型的摇滚歌手。

Exponent.DEF: having the characteristics that many people believe a particular type of person or thing has – used when you think these beliefs are not true
Exponent.TRAN: 典型的〔指对人﹑事物等的固有观念,用于表示不认同〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hollywood films are full of stereotypical images of women as wives and mothers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞影片充斥着女性为人妇为人母的典型形象。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He challenges stereotypical ideas about people with disabilities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他质疑人们对残障人士模式化的看法。

Exponent.DEF: containing the most common types of people or things that are found in something, and showing what it is usually like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a representative sample of college students
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学生的典型

Exponent.DEF: very typical of a particular type of thing, or of someone’s character or usual behaviour
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Each species of bird has its own characteristic song.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一种鸟都有其独特的叫声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What gives Paris its characteristic charm?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么赋予巴黎独有的魅力？

Exponent.DEF: to be the best possible example of a particular type of person or thing or of a particular quality
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His house was thought to be the epitome of good taste.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的家被认为是品位高雅的典范。

Sense.DEF: in a way that a person or group is generally believed to behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Typically, he didn’t even bother to tell anyone he was going.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还是那样﹐甚至都没有告诉任何人他要走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Al was his typically cheerful self again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尔又是平时那个快快乐乐的他了。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows the usual or expected features of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delightful, typically Dutch hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舒适的﹑典型荷兰风格的酒店
Sense.EXAMPLE: The male of the species is typically smaller than the female.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一物种的雄性一般要比雌性小一些。

Sense.DEF: in the way that a particular type of thing usually happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women in developing countries typically have their first child when they are very young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展中国家的女性通常都很早生育。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I typically get around 30 emails a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一般每天收到大约30封电子邮件。

Sense.DEF: to be a typical example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the features which typify a Scottish Highland landscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰高地典型的地貌特征
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-violent protest, typified by Gandhi
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以甘地为典型代表的非暴力抗议

Sense.DEF: to be a typical part or feature of something
Sense.TRAN: 是…的典型部分﹔是…的典型特征
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long complicated sentences that typify legal documents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律文件中典型的﹑冗长复杂的句子

Sense.DEF:
the activity of using a computer or a
typewriter
to write something
Sense.EXAMPLE: typing errors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打字错误
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m no good at typing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打字不行。

Sense.DEF: a group of typists in a large office who type letters for other people

a secretary whose main job is to
type
letters

someone who uses a computer
keyboard
or a
typewriter
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a slow typist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打字很慢。

Sense.DEF:
a small mistake in the way something has been
typed
or printed

someone who designs
typefaces

a
compositor
the work of preparing written material for printing
the arrangement, style, and appearance of printed words
a system or the study of dividing a group of things into smaller groups according to the similar qualities they have
behaving in a cruel and unfair way towards someone you have power over
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tyrannical parent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位专横的家长
Sense.EXAMPLE: tyrannical laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专制的法令

Sense.DEF: to use power over someone cruelly or unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were tyrannized by their father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们受到父亲专横的对待。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: armed groups tyrannizing over civilians
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欺压平民的武装组织

Sense.DEF:
a very large flesh-eating
dinosaur
Sense.TRAN: 霸王龙〔一种大型食肉恐龙〕

Sense.DEF: cruel or unfair control over other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gorky was often the victim of his grandfather’s tyranny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高尔基经常是他祖父专横管制的受害者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fight against tyranny
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对专制的斗争

Sense.DEF: cruel and unfair government
Sense.EXAMPLE: organizations which have criticized the tyrannies of the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批判政府暴政的组织

Sense.DEF: the idea that if everyone has the right to vote, they will make decisions which will harm the country
something in your life that limits your freedom to do things the way you want to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the tyranny of the nine-to-five working day
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝九晚五工作日的限制

Sense.DEF: a ruler who has complete power and uses it in a cruel and unfair way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country had long been ruled by tyrants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家长期受暴君统治。

Sense.DEF: someone who has power over other people, and uses it cruelly or unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: My headmaster was a real tyrant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的校长真是个暴君。

Sense.DEF: a thick rubber ring that fits around the wheel of a car, bicycle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a flat tyre all the air went out of it on the way home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家的路上我的轮胎瘪了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spare tyre ’s in the boot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 备用轮胎在行李箱里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a punctured front tyre
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被扎破的前轮胎

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
tsar

another spelling of
tsarina

another spelling of
tsarism

another spelling of
tsetse fly
